description_web: Are you a fool or a fool wannabe? Come to Fools' School to share and learn. Fools/performers of all types and experience levels are welcome. Jugglers, magicians, singers, freaks and geeks. Get help creating or honing a skit of no more than 5 minutes to perform in the Amphitheater, Wednesday, 8/8, 6-7 pm. You might even become a “Licensed Fool.” Performing is not mandatory.

name: No Hassle Tassles
description_book: A talk on the known items which were embellished by tassels. Make a tassel or more. Children welcome.
description_web: A talk on the known items which were embellished by tassels. Make a tassel or more. Children welcome. Will be using wool, cotton and, if time available, silk. Scissors, yarn needles and other tools will be available on loan.

name: Care and Feeding of Sewing Machines
description_book: A sewing machine is designed to last twenty to eighty years. Why they don't, how they can, and what to do with a machine you've never seen before.

name: 16th-Century Dances from Caroso
description_book: 16th-century Italians are fun once you get to know them! Let me introduce you to *Bella Gioiosa, Candida Luna*, and *Fedelta*.
description_web: Everyone can learn 16th-century Italian dances, and they're worth the effort! We'll review a few of my favorites. *Fedelta* and *Candida Luna* are short and sweet, and *Bella Gioiosa* has lots of delightful figures. We'll review the Italian steps -- both the fancy way and the easy way to do them.

location: Herald's Point ( Intersection of the Low Road with the Great Eastern Highway, next to Family Point)
name: Topics in Basic Heraldry
description_book: These classes will teach basic name and/or armory skills for consulting at Pennsic Herald's Point. Dates and topics will be posted at Herald's Point.
description_web: These classes will teach basic name and/or armory submission skills necessary to consult at Pennsic Herald's Point. Exact dates and topics will be posted at Herald's Point at the beginning of the War. All newer heralds are strongly encouraged to attend at least one of these classes prior to volunteering at Herald's Point.

name: Japanese Stab Binding: Make a Book in Under 1 Hour
description_book: Make 2 books in 1 hour using the stab binding method. No handout; we will focus on the craft rather than the history. Under 16 yrs old need adult rep!
description_web: Come make two books in no time at all using the ancient stab binding method of Japan. There is no handout as we will focus on the craft rather than the history, but a card with reference sites will be available. This class and its humble instructor is not set up for youth teaching; any patrons under 16 need adult supervision. Keep in mind we will be using sharp tools, fine motor functions and working be in a blacksmith's shop where children can find injury. Thanks for your understanding!
fee_itemization: Beeswax, Paper for book pages, decorative paper for book covers and linen binding thread and colored cotton pearl.

name: Storytelling Academy
description_book: Explore genres, tools, styles, and uses of storytelling. Cultural and medieval approaches, applications, performance coaching. New topics each day.
description_web: During this nine-day academy, students will gain knowledge about the history and techniques for storytelling both in the SCA and the modern world. Students may attend individual sessions or all of the academy. There will be guest teachers and time for students to practice and receive feedback. The academy will culminate in a student performance. No classes are repeated. The focus is on developing comfort, nurturing, and honing skills within the students’ capabilities. All levels are welcome. Students may view a class outline at the academy space, Minerva’s Spindle 158, where classes will also be listed on the message board. Seating is limited; feel free to bring your own chair. Student Performance, Thursday 8/9, 5pm in the performance pavilion.

name: Here. Play This. Now.
description_book: Recorder music-reading session with the Directors of the Known World Recorder Ensemble. Intermediate level.
description_web: Join the Directors of the Known World Recorder Ensemble in an Intermediate-level Music Reading Session. You may like it so much, you will want to check out the Ensemble which meets M-W of War Week with a concert on Thursday. Bring your own recorder or borrow one of ours. (Yes, we have SATB to lend!) Bring your music stand if possible. Co-teacher: Lady Siri Toivosdotter.
fee_itemization: Alys: Lower case recorder. Made words in parentheses a sentence.

name: Weed Walk
description_book: Wild plant identification. Wear walking shoes and hat; leave from Univ. Point. Different teachers on different days; walk with us more than once!
description_web: Cooper's Lake abounds with medicinal and food plants that were used by various primitive and medieval cultures. Learn to identify them during a walk around the campsite. The walk will take place rain or shine. Please wear sturdy shoes and a hat. Meet at University Point for the start of the class. We have multiple teachers, so if you attend more than one walk you will likely learn different things!

name: Shading for Dummies: Illumination
description_book: Learn to render basic illuminated shapes through shading.
description_web: Are you a beginner who has no idea how to create believable shape to figures in your illumination? Come and experience how light creates shape. Work in charcoal or Conté crayon on pastel paper.

name: Basic Hand-Sewing
description_book: Learn period methods of seaming and hemming, fabric traits, and how to reduce thread wear and tangling. Fabric, thread, needles supplied.
description_web: Learn period methods of seaming and hemming, fabric traits, and how to reduce thread wear and tangling. Fabric, thread, and needles will be supplied. Please bring needles and scissors if you have them. This course is appropriate for adults and for children the parents consider old enough to handle the needles safely. For children under 10, the parent must be present.
fee_itemization:
5 pages @ .10 page
materials include fabric, needles, and thread

name: How to Tie a Turban
description_book: Instruction on how to tie a turban, along with some, but not much, information on period turbans.

name: Assembling Lamellar Armor
description_book: Discuss lamellar plate types, develop a template for your body, learn assembly tips when using paracord, learn how to space straps and buckles.
description_web: Lamellar armor is easy to assemble, fits different body sizes and shapes, and is adaptable to body changes. We will discuss plate types and patterning. I will give you suggestions how to develop a template for your body. Though traditionally laced with leather, learn assembly tips when using paracord. There will also be details on leather edging and how to space straps and buckles.

name: Basic Baby Beginning Bookbinding
description_book: We'll be making a simple long-stitch blank book using period techniques and modern materials.
description_web: We'll be making a simple link-stitch blank book. Modern materials (such as heavy paper for the cover) will be substituted for period ones in order to keep costs down and help more people give bookbinding a try.
fee_itemization: cover material, paper, and thread to make a small (about 2.75" x 4.25") blank book.

name: Wire Wrapping for Teens
description_book: [YouthU] Learn how to wire wrap a stone cabochon to make a necklace. If you have a particular stone you wish to wrap, bring it with you.
fee_itemization:
$2-3 each for the stone cabochons
$6 for gold and silver wire shared across the class.
$3 for cord to hang the finished pieces on, shared across the class.

name: The Rule
description_book: The Rule of St. Benedict was both strict and humane, demonstrating an understanding of human weakness. After 1500 years it still influences us today.

name: Disability During the Middle Ages
description_book: A look at how society perspective and laws affected those who were disabled during the Middle Ages.
description_web: A look at how society perspective and laws affected those who were disabled during the Middle Ages.

name: Glass Cutting "Sheet to Shiny" STS2
description_book: This class is **required** for (and only open to) the "Sheet to Shiny" folks. We'll be cutting out your projects! Wear closed-toed shoes.
description_web: This class is **required** for (and only open to) the "Sheet to Shiny" folks. We'll be cutting out your projects. Observers are welcome.

name: Let's Get Cynical: Malory's *Le Morte d'Arthur*
description_book: Discussion: the fall of Camelot in the 15th-C romance, *Le Morte d'Arthur*, in the context of the Wars of the Roses and changing ideas of chivalry.
description_web: An overview and discussion of Book 8 (Books 20-21 in Caxton's printing) of Sir Thomas Malory's *Le Morte d'Arthur*, which details the fall of Camelot and the death of Arthur. One of the first books printed in English, the 15th-century *Morte* was written while Malory was imprisoned and awaiting execution. In this class, we'll look at some passages from the work and talk about historical contexts (such as the Wars of the Roses) that can help us make sense of both the work and its unlikely author.

name: Feasts Are More Than Cooking
description_book: A discussion of the many things needed for a successful feast that have nothing to do with the cooking.

name: Healthy Hair Care Then and Now
description_book: We'll be reviewing how people kept their hair clean in the past. Then we'll cover healthy natural hair care in the modern age without shampoo.
fee_itemization: $1 is for a sample hair wash. $2 is for a handout that includes several wash recipes

name: What Is Stumpwork Embroidery
description_book: Description of stumpwork, its history and how a regular embroidery pattern can be changed to 3-D embroidery.
description_web: Description of stumpwork, its history and how a regular embroidery pattern can be changed to 3-D embroidery. Students should have a basic knowledge of embroidery stitches.

name: Exit Stage Left
description_book: Join us for some comedic, dramatic and possibly just plain silly theatre games! We will cover basic stage directions and movement! All ages welcome!
description_web: Baroness Aliyah and The Honorable Lady Silly invite you to join them for some comedic, dramatic and possibly just plain silly theatre games! We will cover basic stage directions and movement! All ages welcome!

name: Archery Practice
description_book: Warm up, practice shoot, and have fun on the Archery Range.

name: Archery Marshal Meeting
description_book: All Archery Marshals are required to attend one meeting.

name: Hey! English-Style Dance
description_book: Want to master the hey? Here's your chance. Dances may include *Grimstock, Picking up Sticks, Hit and Miss*, or others.

name: Morris Games
description_book: We will teach *Nine Man's Morris* and other games of that family (which include the modern *tic tac toe*).
description_web: We will teach *Nine Man's Morris* and other games of that family (which include the modern *tic tac toe*).

name: Recorder Jam Session
description_book: Did you learn to play the recorder in school? Don't know what to do with it? Let's figure that out.
description_web: Did you learn to play the recorder in school? Don't know what to do with it now? Is it collecting dust under your bed? We welcome children of "recorder class age" and above to learn tunes that they can play in camp and with others.
fee_itemization: There will be soprano recorders available at $6.00 each IF NEEDED

name: Stick Weaving
description_book: Stick weaving is a simple, weft-based weaving method.
description_web: Stick weaving is a simple, weft-based weaving method. Great for making belts and straps. Upgradable to make everything from shawls to rugs. Sticks and string provided; take your work home with you.

name: Open Scribal Time
description_book: Take advantage of our clean, well-lit space to work on existing projects or to try your hand at calligraphy and/or illumination.

name: Shading Drapery in Illumination
description_book: Creating highlights and shadows in illumination from sample drapery.
description_web: For intermediate or advanced scribes who sometimes feel their draped fabric doesn't look real. Work with charcoal or Conté crayon on pastel paper.

name: Æthelmearc-Sponsored Novelty Shoot
description_book: Daily novelty shoots hosted by the Kingdom of Æthelmearc. These shoots will be simple fun shoots for any skill level.

name: Beginning Bobbin Lace
description_book: Three-day class for a total of 9 hours. Learn the basic movements and make three basic projects. Start a period pattern.
description_web: This is a three-day class for a total of 9 hours of bobbin lace! First Day: Students will learn the basic movements of bobbin lace and begin a project. Second Day: Students will finish the project and learn some simple grounds. Third Day: Students will begin a period pattern from the *Nüw Modelbuch*.
fee_itemization: $30 – One-time fee for all three days. Includes pillow with cover, bobbin holder, 10 pair of bobbins, pins, handout, patterns

name: Being Your Persona
description_book: How to maintain the illusion at an event that you are a period person interacting with other period people.
description_web: How to maintain the illusion at an event that you are a period person interacting with other period people.

name: Roman Roundtable
description_book: Come talk about all things Roman with other Romans from around the Known World. Share your research on food, clothing, daily life, armor, and more.
description_web: Come talk about all things Roman with other Romans from around the Known World. Share your research on food, clothing, daily life, armor, and more.

name: Public Speaking for Youth and Teens
description_book: [Youth U] Good public speaking is not just about what you say, but how you say it. Come learn basic skills, including posture, voice, and eye contact

name: You Are What You Eat: Humoral Doctrine
description_book: An overview of the theory of balancing the human condition through food.
description_web: An overview of the theory of balancing the human condition through food.

name: 14th-Century Cloth and Thread Buttons
description_book: Hands-on making cloth buttons and starting on thread-covered buttons.
description_web: We will make self-stuffed cloth buttons and then move on to thread-wrapped buttons which you will finish on your own. Metal buttons are spiffy, but not everyone can afford them.
fee_itemization: cloth, thread, needle, wooden blank and embroidery floss

name: Basic In Persona Storytelling
description_book: Telling stories as your persona is not only cool and fun but surprisingly easy.
description_web: Storytelling is one of the easiest bardic arts to do "in persona." No need to worry about whether your instrument existed or if that poetic form would be one your persona would know. It also turns out to be surprisingly easy. Come learn how to impress your audience with a tale that makes them feel genuinely transported to the Current Middle Ages.

name: Make Your Own Medallion Cord
description_book: Why wear a plain white string? Learn *Slung*, cord-making described as juggling with strings! Children welcome with adult. OK to be late.
description_web: Why wear a plain white string? Learn *Slung*, a method for cord-making that can best be described as juggling with strings! Children welcome with adult. *Slung* is also known as Viking whip-cording. It is not only useful but a lot of fun for all ages. Can be done as a children's activity or at demos. Bring a friend! People will be taking turns on a limited number of set-ups. Showing up late is perfectly fine.

name: Stuffed Eggs, Mushroom Recipes, Capons and Gourds
description_book: Stuffed hard-boiled eggs, fresh and salted mushrooms, and a young fowl with gourds from the 16th-century cookbook, the *Banchetti*.

name: *Romani*: An Introduction to Gypsy Personas
description_book: Want a Gypsy persona, but don't know how/where to start? Learn about the Rom, their history, common pitfalls, and the fun of this fascinating persona.
description_web: Want a Gypsy persona, but don't know how/where to start? Learn about the Rom, their history, common pitfalls, and the fun of this fascinating persona.

name: No-Hassle Tassel and Speedy Whipcording
description_book: Make a super-easy tassel and enough whipcording for purse drawstrings. Purse pattern included.
description_web: Make a super-easy tassel and enough whipcording for purse drawstrings. Purse pattern included. One skein of pearl cotton makes 2 tassels, and the second skein makes 2 yards of whipcording. Not recommended for youth.

name: Speaking Shakespeare
description_book: Students review the basics of iambic pentameter and do readings which illustrate how the Bard varies the verse to give stage directions to the actor.
description_web: After reviewing the basics of iambic pentameter (the form Shakespeare used most often), students will do readings which illustrate how the Bard varies the verse to give "stage directions" to the actor.

name: Medieval Folk Dance
description_book: Come learn a variety of pre-1600 folk dances including set dances and line dances! No experience necessary; left feet welcome!
description_web: Come learn a variety of pre-1600 dances that would be considered "folk dance" by modern definitions of the term, including set dances and line dances! No experience necessary; left feet welcome!

name: Early Period Arts and Sciences Day in Preachain
description_book: Early Period A&S Day is a celebration of the arts and traditions of the cultures of Europe and the Mediterranean that existed prior to 1000 AD.
description_web: Clanne Preachain's 26th Early Period Arts and Sciences Day is a celebration of the arts and traditions of the cultures of Europe and the Mediterranean that existed prior to 1000 AD. Come join us for classes and demonstrations, or just bring a project to work on.

name: Tinsmithing
description_book: A basic but complete course in the fundamentals of tinsmithing. Students will make a glass-globed hurricane lamp with hand tools.
description_web: A basic but complete course in the fundamentals of tinsmithing. Students will make a glass-globed hurricane lamp with hand tools.

name: Known World Choir
description_book: Do you like to sing? Come learn period music in a period style. Rehearsals are daily from 12-2 in the PARC.
description_web: Do you like to sing? Come learn period music in a period style. Rehearsals are daily from 12-2 in the PARC. Concert is Thursday 8/9 at 6:00 pm. Music is available on the Known World Choir Website. Pre-registration is requested although **not** required. All voice parts are welcome. This choir is adults only; however, there are other choirs for teens and children. The music for this year is all about battles and war!! While reading music is helpful it's not necessary. Practice tracks will be available on the choir's website in May. Please bring a 1" black folder for your music and a pencil.

name: Beginning Double-Faced Tablet Weaving
description_book: This hands-on class will cover setup, weaving, finishing, and pattern design. A simple design will be woven in class.
description_web: This simple period technique was used to create bands with complex designs and beautiful patterns. This hands-on class will cover setup, weaving, finishing, and pattern design. A simple design will be woven in class (no card flipping unless there is time). If you can inkle weave, you can tablet weave. Suitable for beginners. If you have your own loom and cards, feel free to drop in.

name: Are You Wearing a Tablecloth? Greek Clothing!
description_book: Learn how to create Greek garb easily, accurately, and with style! Meet Greek style, form, and ideals for the easiest garb ever!
description_web: We all deal with hot weather in the summer. Learn how to do so easily, accurately, and with style! We will cover basic Greek style, form, and ideals, then go into fabrics, colors, trims, and accessories to create a great classical and cool look.

name: Putting it Together STS3
description_book: Assemble your cut pieces into a shiny! This class is **required** for the "Sheet to Shiny" track. Bring something to work on; tools are limited.
description_web: Assemble your cut piece into a shiny! This class is **required** for the "Sheet to Shiny" track. Bring something to work on; tools are limited, and there will be wait time in between steps for some people. **Also**, if you took this class last year, we had **overwhelming response**, so you will not be allowed to take it again if we have more attendees than anticipated.

instructor: Lady Angharad verch Glyndwr O Llang
name: Basic Bookbinding
description_book: Basic binding of books, history, hands-on, practical application. Learn different stitches and page attachment; leave with a small bound book.
description_web: Basic binding of books, a bit of history, hands-on, and practical application. Participants will learn different types of stitching and page attachment, plus covers, and will leave with a small bound book and/or a girdlebook cover.

name: Make a Skjold Harbor Viking Hood
description_book: [YouthU] We'll make a Viking hood. It's simple to make, authentic, and it looks great! Put it on over a tunic, and you're ready to go a-Viking.
description_web: We'll make a hood, from the 10th century, found in Skjold Harbor in Norway. It's a simple hood to make, authentic, and it looks great! Put it on over a tunic and you're ready to go a-Viking.

name: Ships in the SCA Period: A Chronological Overview
description_book: A comprehensive overview of the development of ships in western Europe between 600 and 1600.
description_web: A comprehensive overview of the development of ships in western Europe between 600 and 1600.

instructor: Rav Daud Ibn Dob Ibn Yusif
name: *Convivencia* to Alhambra: Jews in Medieval Iberia
description_book: An overview of the Jewish experience in medieval Iberia starting with Visigothic Spain and concluding with the Expulsion and its aftermath.

name: Introduction to Hand-Building Pottery: Pinch Pots
description_book: Beginner's class. We will create small pinch pots from earthenware clay. One pot per class participant. Make-and-take.
description_web: Beginner's class. We will create small pinch pots from earthenware clay. One pot per class participant. Make-and-take.

name: Basic Silk Painting Fun!
description_book: We'll learn the basics of silk painting. Work with silk hoops with exciting images and water color paints!
description_web:
Here in this class, we'll learn the basics of silk painting where we will be working with silk hoops with exciting images and water color paints! 
Everyone is welcome and supplies will be provided so the fun of painting can start right away!

name: Fingerloop Medallion Cords
description_book: Many awards come with medallions, and I have a couple of different designs of cords that are small enough to be useful.
description_web: I'll teach you three-bowe round and four-bowe spiral cords. When made with fine enough yarns, they are handy award medallion, or Pennsic medallion cords. Or book marks, or largesse, or tokens. I'll have some yarn available, but feel free to bring along your own yarn, in your own colors. I find that 10/2 weaving cotton yarn is perfect for the application. You'd want three two-yard lengths in any colors for the first cord, and four two-yard lengths (two strands of two colors). There are several merchants on site that carry weaving cottons.

name: Medieval Dances for Everyone
description_book: Let's dance! Need I say more? All ages & abilities welcome. No fancy footwork, just an hour of moving to the music, from a variety of European styles.
description_web: Let's dance! Need I say more? All ages and abilities welcome. No fancy footwork, just an hour of moving to the music, from a variety of European styles.

name: Early Period Construction and Embellishment
description_book: Learn how to make flattering, durable, early period garb.
description_web: We will discuss working with wool, linen, and silk fabrics as well as embroidery threads to make flattering, durable, early period garb. Lanea will discuss fabric preparation, options for seam finishing, reinforcing weak points, repairs, embroidery, period trims, and laundering, plus care for finished garments.

name: Beginner Bassadanza: *Lauro*
description_book: A slow, flirtatious *bassadanza* of the 15th century composed by Lorenzo de' Medici. Aimed at beginners; footwork to be taught.
description_web: This Queen of the Dance, this slow, flirtatious *bassadanza* of the 15th century was composed by Lorenzo de' Medici. Aimed at beginners; footwork to be taught.

name: *Alquerques*
description_book: Period game from the Middle East in the family of checkers-style games. We will teach the rules and the play.
description_web: Period game from the Middle East in the family of checkers-style games. We will review what is known, the rules, and the play through some games to learn the basic strategies.

name: Lucet Basics
description_book: Make a square cord and a two-color cord.
description_web: Make a square cord and a two-color cord. Classroom loaner lucets available or bring your own. String provided as part of the class fee.

name: Story Reading
description_book: I will read children's stories of various lengths with a medieval setting. Each individual story will be 3-37 pages. I wrote these. They are new.
description_web: I will read children's stories of various lengths with a medieval setting. Each story will be 3-37 pages. They are new and fiction, not retelling of sagas already known.

name: Shading with Color for Scribes
description_book: Shading in color using medieval items.
description_web: This class is for scribes with some experience in mixing color who want to create shape with the use of shading in their work. Supplies include warercolor, gouache, and pastels on appropriate paper for the mediums mentioned.

name: Beginning Engraving
description_book: Hands-on class. Intro to tools, first cuts, graver control, hammer use.
description_web: Hands-on class. Intro to tools, first cuts, graver control. Student will learn both hand-held and hammer-struck engraving.

name: Parchment-Making Workshop(s)
description_book: This workshop covers all of the major preparatory steps for making parchment over many days.
description_web: This workshop covers all of the major preparatory steps of making usable parchment over the span of 10 days. This will include repeated steps of most of the processes in order to try and render up to 12 hides during the entire War. Day 1 instruction will have us prepping hides for lime bath, starting lime baths, and stretching four prepared hides on the stretcher frames (to include scraping).

name: Confused by the Sicilian Vespers? Good! Me too!
description_book: The "Sicilian Vespers" was a long-running, maritime as well as land-based, crazy period of power imposition. Your persona may benefit. Come learn!
description_web: All of us are confused by the “Sicilian Vespers.” If you have a mediterranian persona, or are considering one, the wars of the Sicilian Vespers offer you a huge place to play. Come learn about naval and land campaigns, grand strategy, political dealings that won’t be repeated until the 21st century, and why this may be fertile ground for your persona.

name: Reading "Sir Orfeo," or, Faeries are Sociopaths
description_book: We'll discuss the Middle English lay "Sir Orfeo," and how it highlights a very different idea of faeries than we often have today.
description_web:
This class provides an overview and some contexts for the Middle English Breton lay "Sir Orfeo," a medieval reworking of the Orpheus myth with a happy ending. The poem replaces the classical underworld with a faerie court that is, perhaps, more disturbing. We'll discuss the poem as a whole, paying particular attention to the faeries in the text and contextualizing their representation here with some medieval ideas about them. A free handout will be provided, and there will be time for questions and general discussion.  

I will bring some copies, but students should ideally have read the poem before class.  A free translation can be found at:  https://allpoetry.com/Sir-Orfeo

name: The Art and Science of Firing Pottery
description_book: Turning clay into useful and durable items is an art. Lecture will cover what happens to clay when it is fired in a kiln, and firing methods.
description_web: Turning clay into useful and durable items is an art that has been passed down from teacher to student through the ages. In this class we will discuss what happens to clay when it is fired in a kiln, types of kilns used in our period, the kiln built each year at Pennsic, and how the technology has evolved. Secrets will be revealed and methods discussed.

name: Individualized Nalbinding
description_book: Come take a one-hour introductory class. At the end of class I will give students the chance to sign up for individual lessons.
description_web: Come take a one-hour introductory class. At the end of class I will give students the chance to sign up for individual lessons which will be available at various times throughout both weeks. Already know a stitch? Come to the class and sign up for a time to learn a new stitch or technique.

name: Sketch Comedy
description_book: Come join The Hanging Jesters to learn to write and perform sketch comedy! We will be preparing for Pennsic Night Live!! Class is open to all!
description_web: Learn how to develop, write and perform scripts for sketch comedy. Learn how to make a lineup for performance, rehearsal, staging, and much more!

name: *Bransles*
description_book: Let's get down and dirty with some *bransles*. Learn the basics of these circle dances and a few tricks on how to keep them all straight in your head.

name: Recorder Consort: 15th- and 16th-Century Music
description_book: Come make beautiful music in good company! Session for intermediate and above recorder players comfortable with sight-reading. Sheet music provided.
description_web: Come play an assortment of Renaissance pieces in good company! This group playing session is geared for intermediate and above recorder players who are comfortable with their instruments and with sight-reading. Bring your recorders and a stand. Sheet music will be provided; feel free to bring your own favorites (in multiple copies, please).

name: Beginner Thrown Weapons
description_book: Learn axe throwing, basic care of your weapons, and basic rules. A hands-on session is included. Limit of 25 participants; no experience necessary.
description_web: Learn axe throwing, basic care of your weapons, and basic rules. A hands-on session is included. Limit of 25 participants; no experience necessary.

instructor: Mistress Arwen Evaine ferch Rhys ap Gwy
name: Traditional Norse Medical Practices
description_book: Collection, storage, and preparation techniques of herbs and other medicinals, some dating back to saga times.
description_web: Medicine in Norway was surprisingly sophisticated back into saga times, compared with the Continent. We will look at the herbs/roots/barks/berries/fungi, etc., used in traditional healing, including preparation and administration of salves, syrups, teas and washes, poultices, and lots more. Magical healing will also be presented, as well as diseases and other health problems as known at the time.

name: Help Me, Tempus, You’re My Only Hope!
description_book: Two hours with Tempus, anything sewing. Trouble-shooting, problem-solving, garb problems diagnosed and solutions proffered. Maybe learn to sew...
description_web:
(Garb Troubleshooting/Q&A Workshop)
This is a trouble-shooting and problem-solving class; garb problems diagnosed and solutions proffered. Bring to the class garb that went “wrong” or garb that didn’t “work” for you. We'll talk; it can be fixed. If you don’t have the garb here, bring your questions; we’ll do our best to solve your garb troubles. We’ll talk about gussets and how to use your seam ripper, too. This class can go on longer if needed. Also, this class will be offered next year.

name: Improve Pennsic for Teens!
description_book: [TeenU] 12-17. Join next year's mayor to help us brainstorm ways to make Pennsic better for youth and teens. Bring your ideas and questions.
description_web: [TeenU] Recommended for ages 12-17. Join Dagmar, next year's mayor, and Leonete, the YouthU coordinator, to discuss ways to improve the teen experience at Pennsic. We want to hear your ideas on what services, activities, and resources Pennsic can provide for your age group.

name: SCA Documentation: It's Not as Scary as You Think!
description_book: View and discuss different types of documentation and reasons for documenting. Bring your questions and any current documentation for feedback.
description_web: Interested in entering a regional fair for the first time? Looking to improve your research and documentation? Just want to try a bean count competition? Wondering what info to add to your class handouts? In this class we will look at (and discuss) different types of documentation and reasons for documenting. Bring your questions and any current documentation for tips and feedback.

name: Brewing and Experimental Archaeology
description_book: Lessons learned from experimental archaeology with wine and beer will be discussed and tasted. Brave adults (over 21) only.
description_web: Lessons learned from experimental archaeology with wine and beer will be discussed and tasted. The discovery and excavation of a monastic winery at the archaeological site of Tell Tuneinir will be discussed including artifacts and inscriptions. Brewing examples with include a variety of herbed beers as well as wines (quince, herbed red wine, and mead). Brave adults (over 21) only.

name: Brewing an Herbed Beer
description_book: A recipe and brewing steps will be shared so that attendees can brew an ale with herbs instead of hops. Age 21+.
description_web: A recipe and brewing steps will be shared so that attendees can brew an ale with herbs instead of hops. If the Growing Gods are kind, the instructor will have sufficient herbs to share; if not, a source to obtain them will be shared. Instructor will have a sample of the brew to share for those "of Age." Age 21+; ID will be required.

name: Improv: Beginning to Play
description_book: Start learning improvisation with some simple vocal & physical warm-ups!
description_web: Start your path for learning improvisation theatre with some simple vocal and physical warm-up exercises!

name: Make Your Own Medallion Cord
description_book: Why wear a plain white string? Learn *Slung*, cord-making described as juggling with strings! Children welcome with adult. OK to be late.
description_web: Why wear a plain white string? Learn *Slung*, a method for cord-making that can best be described as juggling with strings! Children welcome with adult. *Slung* is also known as Viking whip-cording. It is not only useful but a lot of fun for all ages. Can be done as a children's activity or at demos. Bring a friend! People will be taking turns on a limited number of set-ups. Showing up late is perfectly fine.

name: Period Portable Furniture You Can Make
description_book: Chairs, tables, and a bed, all based on period designs.
description_web: Chairs, tables, and a bed, all based on period designs. At least one chair, one table, and the bed are simple enough so that someone with only basic tools and no expertise should be able to make them.

name: Anglo-Saxon Children
description_book: Ann overview of childhood in Anglo-Saxon England including clothing, food, toys, education, activities, etc.
description_web: An overview of childhood in Anglo-Saxon England including clothing, food, toys, education, activities, etc. If you have an Anglo-Saxon persona, and want your children to "match" and enjoy the SCA, I'll try to give you some ideas both from history and my experience.

name: *Chiara Stella*
description_book: Come learn *Chiara Stella*, a lovely *cascarda* from *Il Ballarino*! Dancers of all ages welcome. This is an advanced class.

name: *Tarot* the Card Game
description_book: The game of *tarot*, the trick-taking game. We will play it.
description_web: We will go over the rules of *tarot*, the card game, and play it.

name: Family Stick Weaving
description_book: Family-oriented stick weaving. Youth welcome with parent or guardian.
description_web: Family-oriented stick weaving. Youth welcome with parent or guardian. Stick weaving is a simple, weft-based weaving method. Great for making belts and straps. Upgradable to make everything from shawls to rugs. Fee covers sticks and string; take your work home with you.

name: The "I Can’t Cook Guide" to Medieval Eating
description_book: If you can’t (or don’t) cook, how can you bring medieval-ish food to events for breakfast, lunch, or potlucks? It’s easier than you think!

name: Trumpeting at Pennsic
description_book: Using the trumpet as a medieval radio and signalling device, with emphasis on the battlefield.
description_web: The trumpet was an instrument for long distance communication before it was considered a musical instrument. Includes how to use it to convey useful information with emphasis on the battlefield.

name: *Skjoldehamn* Hood of Awesome
description_book: [Teen U] The Skjoldehamn Hood: Keeping the head covered since 1050.
description_web:
A thousand years ago, near the Harbor of Skjold (Skjoldehamn), on the Norwegian island of Andøya, an individual fell into a bog. This would have been unfortunate event at the time, but very lucky for us as the woolen clothing they wore was preserved and discovered in 1936. They subsequently dated the find from 1050 to 1090 CE, or the late 11th century. One of these items that was preserved was a hood that is commonly seen in today's Norse personas. Do not be fooled, however, as the same pattern can be used to create many other European hoods used throughout the SCA. 

The five page handout is free if you purchase the pre-washed and pre-cut materials for this class. The material used for this class is 3/4 yard of linen, silk thread and floss (for piecing and finishing), and needle.
fee_itemization: The five page handout is free if you purchase the pre-washed and pre-cut materials for this class.  The material used for this class is 3/4 yard of linen, silk thread and floss (for piecing and finishing), and needle.

name: Pennsic Homes, Part 2: Tour
description_book: A tour of just a few of the different types of Pennsic homes and other mobile structures. Lots of walking.
description_web: A tour of just a few of the different types of Pennsic homes and other mobile structures. There are many different ways to make your life easier, from adapting a Pennsic storage trailer to a shower/bath (cuts set-up and take-down time!) to living in it. From wagons that you can easily take from event to event. Focus on ones that will be very expensive, or hard to tow vs. easy, to wagons that are really Pennsic homes, and are just going to live at Pennsic. Lots of walking.

location: Denys The Decadent (Denys the Decadent's Camp  EO8)
name: 12-Step Meetings
description_book: Daily meetings for those in any 12-step program such as AA, NA, OA, SA, Alanon, etc.
description_web: We welcome all in AA, NA, OA, SA, Alanon, etc., who are in any 12-step program to the 4:00 pm daily meeting at EO8 Denys The Decadent's Camp.

name: Intro to Glass Bead-Making with a Modern Torch
description_book: Learn the basics of glass bead-making using ancient principles, glass rod, and a modern hot torch. Basic history of glass included.
fee_itemization: Various colors of Glass rods, multiple mapp gas tanks, and bead release.

name: *Keum-Boo*: Hot Metal Gilding
description_book: *Keum-Boo*, or hot metal gilding, is gilding on silver, copper or iron with 24-karat gold foil, while the base metal is at 500 degrees Fahrenheit.
description_web: *Keum-Boo*, or hot metal gilding, is a Korean method of gilding on silver, copper or iron with 24-karat gold foil, while the base metal is at 500 degrees Fahrenheit.

name: Yoga for Relaxation and Refreshment
description_book: A gentle yoga practice offered before the dinner hour. Repeating dates in Atlantian Royal; bring your mat and dress to flex.
description_web: A gentle yoga practice offered for those who aren't up early and prefer a before-dinner option. Repeating dates under the big tent in Atlantian Royal encampment, facilitated by a combination of teachers. Bring your yoga mat and wear comfortable clothing that allows flexibility. M,W,F Peace week, M, F War Week.

name: SCA Singles Gathering
description_book: A gathering of those who are single and would like to find that special someone. Let's get together, talk and get to know each other.

name: Juggling Practice
description_book: Come together to meet with other performers and swap tricks, including ball, club, ring, *diablo*, flower sticks, and more. Part of the Fool's School.
description_web: Come together to meet with other performers and swap tricks, including ball, club, ring, *diablo*, flower sticks, and more. Part of the Fool's School.

name: Learning to Play the Big Drum (*Tupan/Davul*)
description_book: This class will cover basic and intermediate technique on the *davul*, as well as brief notes about buying or building one. Some loaners available.

name: Witch Hunts in SCA period
description_book: Current perspective on that part of the witch hysteria that happened within SCA period, with influences, participants, and outcome
description_web: The major period of witch hunts was post-SCA but the the peak period of the trials built up during the 16th century, and witches (and accusations of witchcraft) were present throughout our period. I'll try to cover as many of the factors that led to this dark stain on our history, including economic and class differences, gender inequality, politics, the Protestant Reformation, and more. From *The Canon Episcopi* through the *Mallus Mallifactorum* to James I and his Witchcraft Act, I'll cover as much of the subject as possible.

name: Medieval Glass Painting with Vitreous Enamel
description_book: Learn the history and techniques of the medieval glass painters' guild and try your hand at making a small piece. Work fired on-site.
description_web: Learn the history and techniques of the medieval stained glass painters' guild and try your hand at making a small piece. Students will use vitreous enamels and watch their work being fired in a kiln.

name: Period Shoes for Armored Combat
description_book: Covers period footwear suitable for SCA armored combat, along with some modifications to complement their use in this function.
fee_itemization: The fee is to cover the cost of printing for the handout.

name: Bedtime Stories for Children
description_book: Nightly telling of stories for children.
description_web: 7 pm nightly: Stories and fables for children. All are welcome to attend; must have adult escort.

name: Evening with Bill W
description_book: Open AA meeting. All are welcome come join us around a fire for open discussion. All addictions welcome.
description_web: Open AA meeting. All are welcome come join us around a fire for open discussion. All addictions welcome.

name: Night Sky Over Pennsic
description_book: Family-friendly viewing of the night sky over Pennsic. Bring a camp chair or blanket if desired. A small telescope will be set up for viewing.
description_web:
Family-friendly viewing of the night sky over Pennsic. Bring a camp chair or blanket if desired. A small telescope will be set up for viewing.
As the battlefield is parking during the first week, the open area in front of Pennsic University Point will be used.

name: Yoga For Dancers, Fighters or Pretty Much Anyone
description_book: Yoga to help us through the rigors of War, regardless of our activities. Please bring a mat/towel and dress for modesty. Kids must bring guardian.
description_web: Yoga to help us through the rigors of War, regardless of our activities. Please bring a mat or towel and dress for modesty. Children may attend with parent/guardian present.

name: Coffee with Friends of Bill and Dr Bob
description_book: Morning recovery meetings in agnostic format.
description_web: Morning recovery meetings in agnostic format.

name: *Étude* 1 and 2 for Single Sword (Fencing)
description_book: These drill sequences will focus on form, balance, movement, and coordination. For beginners, intermediates, and teachers alike.
description_web: For beginner and intermediate fencers and those who teach them. These drills will focus on form, balance, movement and coordination. *Étude* 1 (first week) is more linear; *Étude* 2 (second week) adds off-line/lateral movement. Emphasis will be on learning the *études* for home drill, as well as taking elements out of the drill for more focused work in groups.

name: Youth Combat Morning Session
description_book: Lists open.
description_web: Youth Fighting lists open.

name: Amulets for Everyone (Even You Christians!)
description_book: A survey of the amulets used by Romans, Vikings, Christians, and more. As always, we will be passing around examples. Please come with an open mind.
description_web: A survey of the amulets used by Romans, Vikings, Christians, and more. As always, we will be passing around examples of reproduction amulets. Please come with an open mind; there will be body parts!

name: *Opus Anglicanum*: Underside Couching
description_book: *Opus Anglicanum* embroidery has several defining characteristics. This class concentrates on teaching the underside couching portion of this style.
description_web: There are two defining stitches used in *Opus Anglicanum*: the split stitch which creates the figures and colors of each piece, and the underside couching. Underside couching is a special form of couching with gold that creates a flexible surface. The technique produces a wonderful textural effect in the background. We will learn the technique and investigate some of the designs that can be created.

name: Street Smarts
description_book: What's in a name? A folkloric history of Pennsic geography: how the streets and areas of Pennsic came by their distinctive designations.
description_web: What's in a name? A folkloric history of Pennsic geography: how the streets and areas of Pennsic came by their distinctive designations.

name: Meaningful Steps: Creating Your Own Pilgrimage
description_book: Love to walk/hike? Love to wear your SCA kit? Learn to combine these things for a meaningful trip there and back again in your own area.
description_web: Love to walk/hike? Love to wear your SCA kit? Learn to combine these things for a meaningful trip there and back again in your own area. Topics include what to wear, what to eat, what to bring and how to bring it with you. Discussion of how you might pick a route, mapping, and preparation. Some discussion of Pilgrimage in period, but this class focuses on the physical activity, not the religious aspects of the journey. This class was born from a year-long study project by the teacher who is far from being a "perfect physical specimen". If I could lug my 300 pounds of size 24 over 70 miles in 8 days, perhaps you can too!

name: Embroidery: How Do I Do That!?!
description_book: Embroidery for the absolute beginner. Come out and learn a few easy stitches!
description_web: Embroidery for the absolute beginner. Do you want to decorate your garb or projects but aren't sure where to start? Come learn a few easy stitches. See some examples of basic embroidery projects. Sample fabric, needle and thread provided. Please bring scissors and a small embroidery hoop if you have them. Strict limit of 10 students! Handouts will be given to everyone but kits and hands-on teaching will be limited to 10.
fee_itemization:
Embroidery floss
Needles
Hoops
Sample fabric

name: SCA Slang for Teens
description_book: [TeenU] An introduction to the basic jargon of the SCA.
description_web: [TeenU] YKYITSCA: You know you're in the SCA when..... There's a weird name or acronym for everything: Chatelaine, Gold Key, MoL, MiC..... It's enough to make your head spin. Let's chat about some of the words and terms you'll hear in the SCA, what they mean or who they are. For extra credit, we'll even throw in some Monty Python quotes.

name: Bidding the Bedes: Introduction to Paternosters
description_book: The history and development of western European Christian prayer beads as well as information on making your own replica.
description_web: In the 13th-16th centuries in western Europe, prayer beads were a ubiquitous accessory. This class discusses the history and development of the paternoster, as well as information on making your own replica. Kits will be available to make a glass paternoster.
fee_itemization: Beads, silk thread, needle, terminal pendant, bead tip

name: STIs & Treatments in Pre-1600 Italy
description_book: An overview of sexually-transmitted infections and their treatments in 600-1600 Italy. Age 18+.
description_web: An overview of sexually-transmitted infections and treatments in 600-1600 Italy. Presentation will cover known STIs, transmission, t̶o̶r̶t̶u̶r̶e̶s̶- er.. treatments for these medical issues, as well as historical attitudes toward both the infections and those infected. Age 18+.

name: Vinegaroon: Never Dye Leather Again!
description_book: Learn to make deep black leather using this ancient mixture of iron scrap and vinegar!
description_web: Long before Fiebings or Eco-Flo leather dyes, people made deep black leather using this ancient mixture of iron scrap and vinegar. It works instantly, never rubs off, and never fades! Come see how it works, try it for yourself, and learn to make your own! Class will consist of a short talk about the historical plausibility of this method, a discussion of the chemical properties that make it work, a demonstration, and hands-on make-and-take of a simple key fob.

name: Leprosy
description_book: The strangest disease on the planet, medieval people alternately kissed and avoided lepers, but seldom were they shunned.
description_web: The strangest disease on the planet, medieval people alternately kissed and avoided lepers, but seldom were they shunned.

name: Decorative and Functional Edges and Seams
description_book: Learn to create decorative edges and seams using needle lace and fingerloop braids; based on the Lengberg finds.
description_web: Learn to use a 15th-century technique for making decorative edges and seams using needle lace and fingerloop braids based on the Lengberg finds.  Students will learn a basic needle lace stitch and create a common 5-loop fingerloop braid, and will learn and practice creating decorative edges and/or seams that can be used on headwear and undergarments.
fee_itemization:
Kits include a needle, linen thread, beeswax, linen fabric swatches, safety pin.
Handouts include instructions and extant garment images.

name: Lucet: Beyond Square Cord
description_book: You can make good square cord; what's next? Flat and multi-strand cords. Bring your lucet. (We can slip a cord off and put it back on after class.)
description_web: You’re comfortable making square cord; what's next? We'll work on flat and multi-strand cord variations. Please bring your lucet. We'll also demonstrate how to slip a cord off and put it back on after class.
fee_itemization: (4) colors of floss on bobbins, and handout.

name: Beginning Tatting, Part 2
description_book: Tatting is a type of lacemaking. Supplies can be found at craft stores. Learn a craft that fits in a Ziploc bag. Do it in the car or at court!
description_web: Part 2 will review the double stitch. You'll learn how to use the picot as decorative element and as a way to join rings. Time and energy permitting, we'll advance on to making chains between rings. Attendees from previous years are always welcome to come and refresh their memory.
fee_itemization: I provide a prewound shuttle, a handout with directions & projects.

name: Growing Your Newcomers
description_book: Remember the exact moment you decided the SCA was for you? Learn how to make that first crucial impression that will inspire our future generations.
description_web: How many of you remember your first event? Do you remember the exact moment you decided the SCA was for you? Or, even identified with a specific group in the SCA? What sticks out in your mind with any of these special moments? Was it a person or was it an action they took that made the impact? We will discuss how important it is to make that first crucial impression that will inspire our next generations to keep coming back to live the Dream.
fee_itemization: .50 to cover copy costs for handout

name: Period Card Games: *Tarot*
description_book: Do you like to play cards? Come learn to play this late-period card game which uses a 78-card deck.
description_web: Looking for something to pass the time at events? Do you like to play cards? Come learn to play this late-period card game which uses a 78-card tarot deck

name: Woodwork Shop Time
description_book: Bring your wood and your tools! I'll be around to help and to talk and to pass out advice.
description_web: When learning, we all need some time to try doing things while someone who has been there before is watching. This class makes some time at Pennsic for just that! Whether or not you have taken my classes, you are welcome to come in and use my bench(es) and ask for advice. This will overlap with a discussion on early work-holding methods. All day both Thursdays!

name: Stick Weaving
description_book: Stick weaving is a simple, weft-based weaving method.
description_web: Stick weaving is a simple, weft-based weaving method. Great for making belts and straps. Upgradable to make everything from shawls to rugs. Sticks and string provided; take your work home with you.

name: *RúnValdr*
description_book: In period, runes were very rarely used for divination, but there are many examples of runes being used for magic. A modern system for rune magic.
description_web: In period, runes were very rarely used for divination, but there are many examples of runes being used for magic. This is a system that shows, for example, how to use Norse or Anglo-Saxon runes to hear even at distance, or to awaken inanimate objects. This is a system of energy manipulation using runes and another set of symbols. This workshop introduces the symbols and what each of them is used for, and includes the attunement. It does *not* include introduction to runes. You may take this workshop without knowing the runes, but you will need to learn them to be able to use this system. You will be able to use this technique immediately.

name: Youth Rapier Activities
description_book: There will be a variety of youth rapier activities each day including drills, games and one-on-one instruction. Some loaner gear will be available.
description_web: There will be a variety of youth rapier activities each day including drills, games and one-on-one instruction. Some days may include special additional activities. Some loaner gear will be available. Participants do not have to be authorized. Children age 6 and up may participate. Please bring your parent/guardian the first day you attend to learn more about the youth rapier program.

name: *Qigong* Flow: Five Animal Frolics
description_book: This is a series of exercises that dates back to the Han Dynasty of China (140-240 AD). Come and wake up with the animals.
description_web: This class will cover the Five Animal Frolics or *wu qin xi*. This is a series of exercises that dates back to the Han Dynasty of China (140-240 AD). These moves were created by Hua Tuo, who is often referred to as the Father of Chinese Medicine. They were developed to get people moving so they stay healthy and in shape, like wild animals. No experience or special abilities required; just come and wake up with the animals. This is part 2 of a 3-part series on *qigong*.

name: Concerning Mohammed and the Well-Guided Caliphs
description_book: A history of the early years of Islam, taught in persona from the standpoint of a later Muslim.
description_web: Concerning Our Lord the Prophet Mohammed (Blessings upon Him, his Kindred and his Companion Train) and the Well-Guided Caliphs. A history of the early years of Islam, taught in persona from the standpoint of a 12th-century North African Muslim.

name: Gildas, Cranky Old Romans, and No British Dark Age
description_book: Rome certainly left Britain, but Roman values remained. Don't be a chump; realize that Roman values remained and your persona needs to know them.
description_web: Rome certainly pulled its legions out of Britain, but it left behind an aristocratic culture that kept on writing and functioning for perhaps 100 years. If you are an early Briton persona, or one who lives in Britain during the transition, you need to know that there was never a “dark age” in Britain. There were chroniclers and senatorial-level interpreters who translated Britain for many.

name: Where's Lord Waldo?
description_book: A look at the history and trivia of SCA geography.
description_web: A look at the history and trivia of SCA geography.

name: Organizing an SCA Brewing Competition
description_book: It's not the AHA, and it's not basic A&S. Learn the ins and outs of organizing and running a brewing competition in the SCA.
description_web: Whether you are putting together a brewing competition from scratch, or simply including brewing in a broader A&S competition, brewing has a number of considerations above and beyond other A&S entries. This class discusses those considerations, and walks you through the process from conception through feedback.

name: HS Summer Math Help and Challenge Problems
description_book: [TeenU 13-17] Teenagers (and others)! Do you have summer math work? Algebra through APCalc. Get some help, help one another, or try the challenges.
description_web: [TeenU] Teenagers (and others)! Do you have summer math work? Algebra through AP calculus. Get some help, help one another, or try the challenge problems. Don't make your parents have to remind you to open the book you carried to Pennsic. ;-)

name: Natural Hair Dye: Henna and Beyond
description_book: Learn how to use period dye techniques and materials to make your hair red, black, brown, or just shinier, healthier, and longer than ever.
description_web: Learn how to use period dye techniques and materials to make your hair red, black, brown, or just shinier, healthier, and longer than ever. We'll focus on henna but explore other herbs to color and protect hair naturally without dangerous chemicals. Some supplies will be available at the class.

name: Beginning Japanese Embroidery
description_book: Stitch a simple grass motif using flat silk thread in the Japanese manner.
description_web: Stitch a simple grass motif using flat silk thread in the Japanese manner. The stitches are similar to European embroidery - it's the handling of the silk threads that is special. Will include a brief overview of the history and Japanese aesthetic as well.
fee_itemization: Silk fabric mounted to a wooden frame, flat silk thread

name: Building A Break-Down Slat Bed
description_book: Build a break-down slat bed that can be put up or taken down in 5 minutes or less. Includes 3 sizes with or without canopy.
description_web: Learn to build a break-down slat bed that can be used with an air mattress or futon. Variations are shown for a headboard and canopy. Plans, parts list and source are available in the class handout.

name: Simple Tunic and Pants Pattern
description_book: We will make a simple pattern for a tunic and pants using your measurements.
description_web: We will make a simple tunic and pants pattern using your measurements. We will draw out a very basic pattern for pants and a simple tunic which you will be able to take with you and use at home. Please bring a tape measure for body measurements, a pair of scissors, pen and paper to write down your measurements before making your pattern.
fee_itemization:
1.00 for handout
2.00 for non-paper pattern pieces

name: Fools' School
description_book: Are you a fool or a fool wannabe? Come to Fools' School to share and learn. Prepare a 5-minute skit to perform. All ages/experience levels welcome.
description_web: Are you a fool or a fool wannabe? Come to Fools' School to share and learn. Fools/performers of all types and experience levels are welcome. Jugglers, magicians, singers, freaks and geeks. Get help creating or honing a skit of no more than 5 minutes to perform in the Amphitheater, Wednesday, 8/8, 6-7 pm. You might even become a “Licensed Fool.” Performing is not mandatory.

name: Gluten-Free Medieval Desserts for Modern Campers
description_book: Learn how to make period and period-inspired gluten-free desserts that are easily made in camp with common camping equipment. Taste test our results!
description_web: Learn how to make period and period-inspired gluten-free desserts that you can easily make in your own camp with common camping equipment. I will demonstrate how to make a no-fail gluten-free pastry and how you can use it in a camping situation to make pastry-filled treats. I will also demonstrate how to make an ancient Roman-inspired honey-steamed pudding that will wow campers of all periods as well as a 15th-century egg custard to go with it that will have your guests begging for more. Recipes will be provided at the end of class. We will also taste test everything so bring your own feast gear! (Cold water available during class) *This class is meant for those who have a basic knowledge of gluten-free cooking with intermediate cooking skills. Adults only please.* Pre-registration is strongly recommended by e-mailing Isolda Fairamay at Christine.colin@ns.sympatico.ca

name: Medieval Archery Equipment
description_book: The making of crossbows and longbows along with their ammunition was a necessity; artisans will demonstrate how to do this.

name: SCA Combat Archery
description_book: Demonstration and discussion of the tools needed for SCA combat archery.

name: Spin like a Viking
description_book: Learn use of Viking and Anglo Norse-recreated spindle sticks, whorls and hand distaffs. Lecture/hands-on.
description_web:
Lecture (2/3rds of class time) on various archaeological finds  include a selection of re-created Anglo Norse spindle sticks from Coppergate, and Viking spindles from Norse settlements of the 10th-13th centuries (including North Atlantic Saga type). Instructor will teach 'tuning' whorls to spindle sticks and is particularly interested in the spinability of surviving spindle sticks with the 'belly bump' on the shaft. Balancing whorls to tapered spindle sticks will be explored. Students may be able to spin wool (limited amount provided) on these re-creations in class. Students in hands-on section of class can either purchase a distaff, spindle and wool kit, bring their own spindles and distaves, or ask for a loaner kit. **Note**: Students **do not** have to participate in kit purchases, and are welcome to simply observe. Also note that kits are "student grade'".
I have some YouTube videos on Viking and medieval spinning that you might enjoy before coming to Pennsic, but it is not required! https://bit.ly/2EMVhKD, or just search YouTube for "missingspindle". And a blog on Viking /medieval spinning here: missingspindle.blogspot.com.

name: Italian Dance: Two Cs
description_book: Learn *Chirintana* and *Colonnese* which are examples of the country and courtly traditions in 15th-century Italy.

name: Thumb Ring Archery
description_book: Learn how to shoot like a Mongol. Requires a horse bow and arrows at least 4" longer than your finger draw.
description_web: Learn to shoot the way Mongols and other steppes and horse archers did. Lord Naran Numuchi, Bow Khan of the Great Dark Horde, Companion of the Order of the Yew Bow (Atlantia), Ponte Alto Baronial Marshal, and many times Archery Champion, has been shooting thumb ring since 1998, and has focused on the use and history of static-eared recurve bows the whole time.

location: Herald's Point ( Intersection of the Low Road with the Great Eastern Highway, next to Family Point)
name: Topics in Basic Heraldry
description_book: These classes will teach basic name and/or armory skills for consulting at Pennsic Herald's Point. Dates and topics will be posted at Herald's Point.
description_web: These classes will teach basic name and/or armory submission skills necessary to consult at Pennsic Herald's Point. Exact dates and topics will be posted at Herald's Point at the beginning of the War. All newer heralds are strongly encouraged to attend at least one of these classes prior to volunteering at Herald's Point.

name: Japanese Stab Binding: Make a Book in Under 1 Hour
description_book: Make 2 books in 1 hour using the stab binding method. No handout; we will focus on the craft rather than the history. Under 16 yrs old need adult rep!
description_web: Come make two books in no time at all using the ancient stab binding method of Japan. There is no handout as we will focus on the craft rather than the history, but a card with reference sites will be available. This class and its humble instructor is not set up for youth teaching; any patrons under 16 need adult supervision. Keep in mind we will be using sharp tools, fine motor functions and working be in a blacksmith's shop where children can find injury. Thanks for your understanding!
fee_itemization: Beeswax, Paper for book pages, decorative paper for book covers and linen binding thread and colored cotton pearl.

name: SCAbominations
description_book: The things the SCA taught you about the Middle Ages that just aren't true. Parents' note: Includes brief, graphic discussion of prostitution.
description_web:
The things the SCA taught you about the Dark Ages, Middle Ages, and Renaissance that just aren't true. Were peasants "nasty, brutish and short"? Did the rich over-use spices? 
Parents' note: Includes a brief, graphic discussion of prostitution.

instructor: Lady Nina Amaya of Bright Hills
name: Middle Eastern Dance with Nina Amaya
description_book: Posture, moves and steps, but also performance technique, social dance, cultural tips. A multi-level class.

name: Storytelling Academy
description_book: Explore genres, tools, styles, and uses of storytelling. Cultural and medieval approaches, applications, performance coaching. New topics each day.
description_web: During this nine-day academy, students will gain knowledge about the history and techniques for storytelling both in the SCA and the modern world. Students may attend individual sessions or all of the academy. There will be guest teachers and time for students to practice and receive feedback. The academy will culminate in a student performance. No classes are repeated. The focus is on developing comfort, nurturing, and honing skills within the students’ capabilities. All levels are welcome. Students may view a class outline at the academy space, Minerva’s Spindle 158, where classes will also be listed on the message board. Seating is limited; feel free to bring your own chair. Student Performance, Thursday 8/9, 5pm in the performance pavilion.

name: Medieval Music Notation: Introduction
description_book: Read lots of examples in facsimile, discussing problems as they arise. Bring melody instruments you play fluently, e.g., recorder, fiddle, voice.
description_web:
Reading medieval music in modern notation imposes modern notions of measure, phrasing, and tonality. Reading it in the original notation allows us to get closer to the composer's intentions and the head-space of a medieval performer, which can help achieve those elusive, magical “medieval moments”. We'll spend most of the class reading examples, discussing problems as they arise. F, G, and C clefs in various places, long note values, unbarred music, C.O.P. ligatures, *musica ficta*, and perhaps “minor coloration". Returning students welcome, as we'll read a different repertoire each time.

Bring melody instruments you play fluently, such as recorder, gamba, fiddle, voice (if you have good pitch memory), etc. If you have multiple sizes of your instrument, please bring them (e.g., SATB recorders).

Each session of the class will use different examples, so feel free to attend both.

name: PPF: Developing Your Japanese Persona
description_book: Designed to take an individual through the process of building and fully developing any Japanese persona.
description_web: Designed to take an individual through the process of building and fully developing any Japanese persona. Focuses on thinking through back story to add realism to one's SCA identity. Good for newcomers and old hands alike or for those interested in the Perfectly Period Feast.

name: *Oya* Needle Lace (Knotted Lace)
description_book: Using an embroidery needle and thread with a simple knot stitch, one can create beautiful edgings and hairnets.
description_web: Using an embroidery needle and thread with a simple knot stitch, one can create beautiful edgings and hairnets. Very few extant pieces exist to determine the exact origin of this form of needlework, but it is generally believed to have originated from netting around the 15th century.  *Oya* can make the net - and yet make it beautiful as well. Students should bring their needles and scissors to the class. Materials will be provided to learn the knot stitch which is the foundation of this lace.

name: Early Bird Tournament 14
description_book: Pick fights, take names and get acquainted.
description_web: Pick fights, take names and get acquainted. The purpose of this tourney isn't to win the most bouts, but to find the most interesting facts about your opponents. **"More talk! Less fighting!"** Who will the MIC give the bird to this year?

location: Speckulian (W10 - Roman Road - Next to the large ROME Camp.)
name: Meditation, Emotional Freedom and Self Empowerment
description_book: Learn simple, proven, meditation techniques for emotional freedom, joy, and self empowerment.
description_web:
Learn simple, proven, meditation techniques for emotional freedom, joy, and self empowerment. Practical breathing, mindset, and self-actualization methods will be presented, along with a group practice and energy session.

It is best to come on an empty stomach, 4 hours from a big meal, or 2 hours from a light snack (like a piece of fruit)

name: Beginner Thrown Weapons
description_book: Learn axe throwing, basic care of your weapons, and basic rules. A hands-on session is included. Limit of 25 participants; no experience necessary.
description_web: Learn axe throwing, basic care of your weapons, and basic rules. A hands-on session is included. Limit of 25 participants; no experience necessary.

name: Weed Walk
description_book: Wild plant identification. Wear walking shoes and hat; leave from Univ. Point. Different teachers on different days; walk with us more than once!
description_web: Cooper's Lake abounds with medicinal and food plants that were used by various primitive and medieval cultures. Learn to identify them during a walk around the campsite. The walk will take place rain or shine. Please wear sturdy shoes and a hat. Meet at University Point for the start of the class. We have multiple teachers, so if you attend more than one walk you will likely learn different things!

name: *Mehteran*: Ottoman Janissary Band
description_book: *Osmanlı Mehter Takımı* (Ottoman Janissary Band) studies music and history of the Ottoman *Mehter* military marching band from the 14th-17th century.
description_web: The *Osmanlı Mehter Takımı* (Ottoman Janissary Band) studies music and history of the Ottoman *Mehter* military marching band from the 14th-17th century. The Mehteran will learn the historic Ottoman song, *Ceddin Deden*, played on *zurna, davul,* horns, cymbals, and kettledrums, and sung by a choir, and will learn the historic Janissary march for performance at Pennsic. Further details on the Mehteran Facebook Group: https://www.facebook.com/groups/134233213955988/

name: I Spy: Calligraphy
description_book: Want your calligraphy look more “medieval"? Letters don't look quite right? Learn how to analyze calligraphy and take your letters to the next level.
description_web: Searching for ways to make your calligraphy look more “medieval"? Not sure why your letters don't look quite right? This class will show you how to analyze calligraphy and take your letters to the next level. Some calligraphy experience is helpful. This year, we will analyze the "traced" Rotunda letters found in the first folio of the late-period manuscript, *Mira Calligraphiae Monumenta*.

name: Law in the Lands of Peace
description_book: A class on *Fiqh*, Muslim law, taught in persona from the point of view of the Maliki school.
description_web: A class on *Fiqh*, Muslim law, taught in persona from the point of view of the Maliki school.

name: Make a Simple, Appliquéd 14th-Century-Style Pouch
description_book: Appliqué and sew your own 14th-century-style purse during this four-hour class.
description_web:
We will go through a quick survey of 14th-century pouches/purses. We will also briefly discuss the late 14th-century appliquéd wall hanging of "Tristan and Iseult". Using this wall hanging as source material, you will appliqué and sew your own 14th-century-style pouch. 

There will be limited kits available: wool appliqué on wool purse (or linen appliqué on linen purse), pre-made DMC tassels, fingerlooped purse strings, small embroidery hoop, small scissors, needles and thread, including gold couching thread.
fee_itemization: Kit will include: pre-cut applique pieces in wool or linen, pre-cut piece of wool or linen to make the purse, small embroidery hoop, small embroidery scissors, DMC thread, pre-made DMC tassels, pre-made fingerloop braid purse strings (3 per kit), needles, sewing thread, gold couching thread, hand-out.

name: *Meigaku*: Design and Document Japanese Names
description_book: Learn how to design, document, and register with the College of Arms a Japanese name which is appropriate for a particular time and social role.
description_web: Do you want to design a Japanese personal name which is appropriate for a particular time and social role? Do you want to design a Japanese group name for your war band or theater troupe? Are you a herald who wants to increase your repertoire of culture-specific naming practices? Would you like to know how rank, title, and office relate to all of this and how to include them in people's names? Would you like to learn how to pronounce Japanese names and summon people into court? Then this class is for you! Learn how the structure of Japanese personal and group names varied by time, period, and social status. Learn to design pre-modern names and attach titles.
fee_itemization: There will be a multi-page handout.

name: Coming of Age in the Middle Ages
description_book: This class looks at how the transition from childhood to adulthood was recognized during the Middle Ages.
description_web: Today a Sweet 16 Party or the legal age of drinking marks the coming of age and the transition from childhood. This class looks at how adulthood was recognized in the Middle Ages.

name: Translating Your SCA Experience into Applications
description_book: [TeenU] Job applications don't ask about boffers; your persona doesn't apply to college. Learn how to re-frame the SCA for applications.
description_web: [TeenU] Job applications aren’t interested in your skill with a boffer, but they do want to know about your self-discipline and focus. College applications don’t ask about your persona, but welcome students with research skills. Learn how to re-frame your SCA experience as skills and experiences that employers and college admissions officers are looking for.

name: Button Up!
description_book: Learn to make self-stuffed cloth buttons and hand-stitched buttonholes.
description_web: This class will cover the techniques used to make self-stuffed cloth buttons appropriate for clothing from the 14th century onward. We will also use the buttonhole stitch to make hand-sewn buttonholes. Note: Bring your reading/crafting glasses if you need them, and small thread scissors are always useful.
fee_itemization: Kit contains materials to make several sample buttons (fabric, thread, and needle) as well as practice making buttonholes.

name: Roses, Part 1: Then and Now
description_book: A survey of roses that were available and/or cultivated during our period and how they compare to roses commonly grown today.
fee_itemization: Handouts are in color so fee to cover that expense

name: My Guitar's Persona Is a Lute
description_book: Learn how to tune and play your guitar as if it were a lute, how to find and read lute tablature. Guitar not required; all experience levels.
description_web: How do you play authentic lute music if your instrument is a modern guitar? The good news is the instruments are very closely related. Learn how to tune and play your guitar as if it were a lute, how to interpret lute tablature, how to find authentic period composers, songs, and arrangements. The skills are highly transferable, and, while lute music has a different feel and sound, the rewards for your investment of time and effort are great. This is a one-hour lecture class. You are welcome to bring your guitar to experiment on, but because this is not a music lesson, it is not required. Suitable for all experience levels.

name: Intro to Safavid Women's Clothing and Accessories
description_book: Learn the basics of Safavid Persian (16th C) dress and accessories, as well as the difference between Persian and Ottoman clothing.
description_web: Learn the basics of Safavid Persian (16th century) dress and accessories, as well as the difference between Persian and Ottoman clothing.

name: Mythbusting Period Piracy
description_book: The differences between period and non-period piratical portrayals will be outlined.
description_web: The differences between period and non-period piratical portrayals will be outlined. Common myths and mistakes about piracy in the SCA period will be highlighted.

name: V&A Study Room: See the Embroideries
description_book: See photos of over 100 period embroideries from the Victoria and Albert Textile Study Room.
description_web: See photos of over 100 period embroideries from the Victoria and Albert Textile Study Room. Due to low light conditions, color values are not always great, but the stitches can be seen in many of the close-ups. The handout lists each, with access codes and background information, for easy internet access back home.

name: Vocal Techniques for Singers and Storytellers
description_book: Give your voice greater strength, better control, expanded range and color, and more energy. Tips and tricks to improve your entertaining voice!
fee_itemization: $1.00 contribution to keep the handout will be greatfuly accepted

name: Archery Practice
description_book: Warm up, practice shoot, and have fun on the Archery Range.

name: Beginning *Atlatl*
description_book: Learn the basics of *atlatl* safety: how to hold the *atlatl*, load a dart, and throw the dart.
description_web: Learn the basics of *atlatl* safety: how to hold the *atlatl*, load a dart, and throw the dart.

name: How to Start a Fire in a Bog
description_book: Formerly entitled “How to Start a Fire like a Moderately Intelligent Saxon”.
