description_web: Formerly entitled “How to Start a Fire Like a Moderately Intelligent Saxon”. Yes, you too can start a fire like a Saxon, Roman, Viking, or any other civilized culture in the Middle Ages by using flint and steel. Even in a bog. We will explore the history of fire and the mechanics of starting a fire with flint and steel. This is a hands-on class. You will start a fire. You must be at least 14 years old and have your parent's or wife’s permission.
fee_itemization: Instructor is not charging for the materials

name: Making Clay Glass Bead Kilns
description_book: This class will make both volcano- and beehive-style clay kilns to make beads in the style of the Viking era. Come for the whole time or part.

location: Clan Yama Kaminari (E03 one block south and one block east of troll on Low Road look for the Red and black sheet walls)
name: Viking Penannular Brooches
description_book: A brief history of the Viking penannular brooch. Construction based on historical finds using hand tools and fixtures.
description_web: Construct a simple copper penannular brooch using basic using hand tools. Class may run over.

name: *Gracca Amorosa*
description_book: Sixteenth-century Italian dance for two, *Gracca Amorosa* is bouncy, athletic, and tons of fun. Bring friend or find partner there. All steps taught.

name: Making Friends with Your Drop Spindle
description_book: Come learn how to use your drop spindle to make your fiber dreams come true!
description_web: The objective of this course is to give participants the basic fundamentals of hand-spinning fibers using a drop spindle. I will have a few drop spindle kits available to purchase, but, if you have a drop spindle, please bring it. We will have several different fibers for students to practice on, as well as several different styles of drop spindles. There will be a small number of drop spindles kits available for students at cost to me; however, if you have a spindle, please bring it.

name: Period Backgammon Games
description_book: *Tables, Nard*, and other ancestors of modern backgammon go back centuries.  Period rules will be shared with a chance to play afterwards.
description_web: *Tables, Nard*, and other ancestors of modern backgammon go back centuries.  Period rules will be shared with a chance to play afterwards.

name: Sprang Basics
description_book: Using the twisted warp-based weaving of sprang, create a useful pouch
description_web: Using the twisted warp-based weaving of sprang, create a useful pouch.

name: Hounds Abound!
description_book: Interested in how dogs were kept? What were the different types of dogs? What were they used for? Come learn about all things canine!
description_web: Come learn about dogs in the Middle Ages! We'll be looking at different types of dogs, how they were cared for, what were they used for and how they fit into everyday life.

name: Open Scribal Time
description_book: Take advantage of our clean, well-lit space to work on existing projects or to try your hand at calligraphy and/or illumination.

name: Æthelmearc-Sponsored Novelty Shoot
description_book: Daily novelty shoots hosted by the Kingdom of Æthelmearc. These shoots will be simple fun shoots for any skill level.

name: Bead Embroidery 101
description_book: Learn the proper bead embroidery and couch method on a velvet pouch using pearls, crystals and seed bead while designing a lovely pouch.
description_web: Learn the Bead Embroidery stitch technique and couching while composing a lovely velvet pouch with pearls, crystals and seed beads. The instructions will include how to make a leaf and stems, how to place your pearls for flowers, and use 3 mm crystals to represent leaves. This pouch will look like a small garden. You will have instructions on how to hang the bag from your belt with ties or to make a lovely belt loop with the addition of tassels.
fee_itemization: Velvet pouch, 3mm and 4mm Swarovski pearls, 3mm firepolish crystals - Size 0 Nymo thread - either size 11 or size 15 seed beads ( depending on beading experience ), needles.

name: *Kamon*: Designing and Documenting Japanese Armory
description_book: Make "Individually Attested Patterns" work for you! Learn to use online resources to design, document, and register a pre-modern Japanese *kamon*.
description_web: Do you want to design and register real Japanese heraldic designs called *kamon*? Are you a herald who wants to increase your repertoire of culturally specific heraldic design resources? Then this class is for you. Learn how to use online resources to design, document, and register a pre-modern Japanese *kamon*.
fee_itemization: There will be a multipage handout.

name: Myths and Legends of The SCA
description_book: We've all heard stories about the SCA of long, long ago. Come and hear some new ones, or share your own.
description_web: We've all heard stories about the SCA of long, long ago. Come and hear some new ones, or share your own. Stories may include "The SCA vs. The Motorcycle Gang", "Why You Should Never Try to Mug a Knight", "The Russian Spies Learn about The SCA", and others. After last year's sessions I've added several new myths to the class.

name: Persona Show-and-Tell
description_book: [YouthU 12+] Currently just dressing like your parents? Learn about different personas and garb options in the SCA.
description_web: [YouthU 12+] Currently just dressing like your parents? Learn about different personas and garb options in the SCA. Gentles with different personas will discuss their persona choices and clothing.

name: The Medievalist Abroad: What to See in Italy
description_book: A tourist itinerary of medieval attractions, based on extensive personal experience, starting with Venice, Florence, and Rome, and going on.
description_web: Medieval Italy is sadly neglected by tourism bureaus that emphasize classical and Renaissance attractions. This class will highlight some of Italy's many medieval glories, financed by a golden age of profiteering from the crusades and crusaders. The class will take the Big Three of Venice, Florence, and Rome, and go on to more obscure gems.

name: Roses, Part 2: How to Grow Period Roses
description_book: How to plant and grow varieties of period roses; where to find period varieties, what to do about pests (both insect and diseases).
description_web: We will discuss how to plant and grow varieties of period roses. I will cover where to find period varieties, how to plant and care for them, what to do about pests (both insect and diseases), and, if there is time, propagating rose plants.

name: KWP Pennsic Readers' Theater: Open Youth Rehearsal
description_book: Youth Readers' Theatre gives youth (ages 8-14) an opportunity of being in a low-stress theatre production, *The Marvelous Misadventures of Baba Yaga*.
description_web: Known World Players, Youth Readers' Theatre, will give the youth (ages 8-14) an opportunity to experience a low-stress theatre experience by creating a staged reading of *The Marvelous Misadventures of Baba Yaga* by Patrick Dorn. A staged reading means that the actors will be performing the play with the script in hand. No audition necessary; attend both rehearsals. To be performed Friday, 8/4, in the Performing Arts Tent at 6:00 pm. Children under 12, please bring a parent or guardian.

name: Introduction to Modes
description_book: Can't tell your Dorian from your Mixolydian? This class will use modern modes as an introduction to the concept and their use in scales and melodies.
description_web: Can't tell your Dorian from your Mixolydian? This class will use modern modes as an introduction to the concept and their use in scales and melodies.

name: Blood from the Clouds: Marvelous Rains
description_book: The Ancients observed rains of blood, frogs, and fish. Such rains need not terrify us but can be understood using the tools of natural philosophy.
description_web: The Ancients observed rains of blood, of frogs, of fish, which continue even unto the present day under Elizabeth, Regina. Once a cause for superstitious terror, these rains are now understood as part of the Prime Mover’s ineffable plan, a necessary part of the World Machine. We will calm your fears and explain these phenomena with the tools of natural philosophy.

name: Queen Emma of Normandy: The Untold Tale
description_book: Queen Emma lived an intriguing life, one that shaped the history and culture of England forever. Who was she and why do we know so little about her?
description_web: Queen Emma lived an intriguing life, one that shaped the history and culture of England forever. Who was she and why do we know so little about her?

name: Newcomers and Disabilty Q&A
description_book: Will discuss ways to assist newcomers find resources and how to overcome obstacles they may face.
description_web: Will use a Q&A format to talk about accessibility in the SCA, the obstacles I have faced during my time in the SCA and how I dealt with them. Will also share some stories from other accessibility-challenged individuals, and share online and Pennsic resources for accessibility.

name: Intro to Theatre/Acting
description_book: Interacting with others to develop your acting skills. History, staging, character development and theatre etiquette will be covered.
description_web: For those who have never acted before or want to improve their acting skills. History, staging, character development and theatre etiquette will be covered.

name: Embroidery: How Do I Do That!?!
description_book: Embroidery for the absolute beginner. Come out and learn a few easy stitches!
description_web: Embroidery for the absolute beginner. Do you want to decorate your garb or projects but aren't sure where to start? Come learn a few easy stitches. See some examples of basic embroidery projects. Sample fabric, needle and thread provided. Please bring scissors and a small embroidery hoop if you have them. Strict limit of 10 students! Handouts will be given to everyone but kits and hands-on teaching will be limited to 10.
fee_itemization:
Embroidery floss
Needles
Hoops
Sample fabric

name: Beginner Dance: English Measures
description_book: Never danced before? No problem! Start with basic steps and patterns. Then learn some of the basic dances done in the English revels.
description_web: Never danced before? No problem! Start with basic steps and patterns. Then learn some of the basic dance repertoire of Elizabethan England.

name: Beginning *Repoussé* and Chasing
description_book: Hands-on class; we will make a copper foil rose.
description_web: Hands-on class; we will make a copper foil rose.

name: Known World Choir
description_book: Do you like to sing? Come learn period music in a period style. Rehearsals are daily from 12-2 in the PARC.
description_web: Do you like to sing? Come learn period music in a period style. Rehearsals are daily from 12-2 in the PARC. Concert is Thursday 8/9 at 6:00 pm. Music is available on the Known World Choir Website. Pre-registration is requested although **not** required. All voice parts are welcome. This choir is adults only; however, there are other choirs for teens and children. The music for this year is all about battles and war!! While reading music is helpful it's not necessary. Practice tracks will be available on the choir's website in May. Please bring a 1" black folder for your music and a pencil.

location: The Little Dragon's Hoard (Plunder Lane, Merchant area)
name: Metal Cooking Equipment and Tools in Period
description_book: A discussion about the metal (iron) cooking equipment that was available from the Viking period on. Some examples will be available for viewing.

name: French *Bâton*: A Living Stickfighting Tradition
description_book: Learn the fundamentals of the living tradition of two-handed stick in this non-contact class. Bring fencing mask, padded gloves.
description_web: *Bâton* is the living descendant of the longsword. Come learn the fundamentals of a European martial tradition in this non-contact class. Bring a fencing mask and padded gloves.

name: A Hand a Day: "Traced" Rotunda à la Bocskay
description_book: Using a special nib, write the “hollow” letters found in *Mira Calligraphiae Monumenta*. Prior use of dip pens helpful. Fee includes nib.
description_web: Students will use a specialty nib (a scroll nib) to recreate the Rotunda letters found in the first folio of the late-period manuscript, *Mira Calligraphiae Monumenta* (86.MV.527.1). The nib is split, creating letters that are "hollow" in the center. (View the manuscript online at http://www.getty.edu/art/collection/objects/2282/joris-hoefnagel-and-georg-bocskay-periwinkle-apple-and-lizard-flemish-and-hungarian-1561-1562-illumination-added-1591-1596/ ) Students should be familiar with using a dip pen. All supplies provided; students will keep their nib.
fee_itemization: Fee includes color handout, nib, paper, and ink.  Students will keep the nib.

name: Binding the Heavens: The Lunar *Volvelle*
description_book: We'll discuss the history, construction and functions of the lunar *volvelle*, a type of simple paper calculating device with rotating parts.
description_web: We'll discuss the history, construction and functions of the lunar *volvelle*, a type of simple paper calculating device with rotating parts, often inserted into technical books of the period. Primarily dealing with astronomy, but of possible interest to illuminators and bookbinders.
fee_itemization: To partly defray printing cost for large handout.

name: Jewelry Demonstration: Etching Copper Alloys
description_book: Demo and lecture class. Intro to tools and techniques to etch copper, brass and nickel silver with ferric chloride. Various resists will be discussed.
description_web:
In this demonstration and lecture class you will be introduced to the tools and techniques used to etch copper, brass, and nickel silver with ferric chloride. Various resists will be discussed with an emphasis on heat transfer resists: PnP Blue and Toner Transfer Paper (TTP). You will be able to adapt these techniques to etch a wide variety of jewelry items, favors, largesse, coronets, belt elements that can be riveted on, armor decorations, etc. 

The discussed techniques can be used to etch fine silver and sterling silver using ferric nitrate.

The hand-out will be available on my website at http://ga.crimsonkraken.com/ClassHandouts.html.
fee_itemization: This is a demonstration class with a handout ($2) or you can download it at no charge.

name: Favors and Tokens
description_book: A discussion on the meaning of favors and tokens and their uses within the SCA.
description_web: A discussion on the meaning of favors and tokens and their uses within the SCA.

name: Dressing Your Persona
description_book: [YouthU 12+] Building your first outfit? Learn what clothing items your persona would have had, brainstorm, and create a shopping or sewing list.
description_web: [YouthU 12+] Intended for those building a kit from scratch. Learn what exact clothing items you'll want for your persona, and how many they might have had. Includes under and outer garments, and basic accessories to round out your look.

name: 16th-Century Loose Gowns
description_book: A discussion of "loose gowns": how they were constructed, who wore them, what materials were used, and how to make one for yourself.

name: Yorkshire Manor Life in the Year 1200
description_book: An interactive and descriptive tour of the manor where I am a freeman in the second year of King John. Come visit to learn our ways and customs.
description_web: An interactive, descriptive tour of the manor where I am a freeman in the second year of King John. Come visit to learn our ways and customs in order to find your rightful place in the social order.

name: Adult Doll Meet
description_book: This class is geared towards adults that collect or want to collect dolls. Please bring your favorite doll to the meet.
description_web: This class is geared towards adults that collect or want to collect dolls. Please bring your favorite doll, as we will be making something special for them. Adults only because doll hobbies can be expensive.

name: *Nalbinding* Hats! Mittens! Socks!
description_book: So you know how to do at least one *nalbinding* stitch? Learn how to make hats, mittens or socks; then sign up for individual 1 hour lesson.
description_web: So you know how to do at least one *nalbinding* stitch? Take the next step and learn how to make hats, mittens or socks. Bring a *nalbinding* needle if you have one, and some yarn you are willing to waste. I will have some materials available for those who do not have needles or yarn. At the end of class the teacher will have a sign-up sheet for 1 hour individualized lessons.

name: Period Greek Make-and-Take
description_book: Bring 4-6 yards of linen and 4-6 yards of cord, matching thread, needle, and scissors and learn to hem, drape, and tie it into accurate Greek garb!
description_web: Bring 4-6 yards of linen and 4-6 yards of cord, matching thread, needle, and scissors and learn to hem, drape, and tie it into accurate Greek garb! This make-and-take will create a perfect wardrobe staple for Pennsic. We will discuss other variations that are accurate, affordable, and beautiful. Perfect to pair with the "Are You Wearing a Tablecloth?" class.

name: The Pilgrimage Project
description_book: Brief history of pilgrimage in period, then learn the songs of our Pennsic Pilgrimage! Open to all! Take up your staff and join us. Music provided.
description_web: For the past four years at Pennsic we have gone on Pilgrimage one afternoon of War Week, singing songs from the *Llibre Vermell de Montserrat* and the *Cantigas de Santa Maria*. Come learn these songs and consider joining us this year! All are welcome! Music provided. Pilgrimage will happen on the Tuesday of War Week, meeting at University Point, time TBD. Will start with a brief overview of pilgrimage in period.

name: Empty Tent Place Holder - 2 hrs
description_book: Some loud classes need an empty tent next to them. This is that tent.

name: How to Enter Your First A&S Competition
description_book: Did you wish to enter an Arts and Sciences Competition? This class is for you.
description_web: We will go over the fine points of entering your first Arts and Sciences competition. The creative ideas put to paper, the research, the forms (oh, my) and enjoying the review of your feedback. How to enjoy being an artisan in the Society of Creative Anachronism.

name: Juggling 101: Beginner
description_book: Learn to juggle three balls in the simplest pattern. Equipment available for use or purchase.
description_web: The most basic 3-ball cascade juggling. Juggling balls will be made available for use by the class and may be bought afterward from the instructor.

name: Picardy Spinning Wheel: Flyer Mechanics
description_book: Picardy spinning wheels used in 1500s Netherlands had a clever but simple mechanical flyer design derived from spindle (walking) wheels.
description_web: Picardy spinning wheels appeared in the Netherlands in the early 1500s and remained in use in the Brittany and Normandy areas of France and subsequently the Maritime Provinces of Canada up until the 1800s. The mechanical design will be discussed using an actual antique French Canadian wheel. Master Bedwyr will discuss making the screw-less flyers with simple hand tools. Students will have an opportunity for brief hands-on spinning with the wheel itself using wool. This early invention of a spinning wheel flyer evolved from the simple spindle wheel and adds automatic yarn wind-on to the twisting of the singles yarn itself. Brilliantly simple in design, it was used with both flax and wool, often mounted on a distaff, and was either waist-held or wheel-mounted. No treadle; hand-cranked wheel.

name: Beginner Dance: *The Inns of Court (Old Measures)*
description_book: Never danced before? No problem! If Elizabethan lawyers could do these dances so can you!
description_web: Never danced before? No problem! If Elizabethan lawyers could do these dances so can you!

name: Recipes of Ancient Rome for Youth and Teens
description_book: [Youth/TeenU 12+] Learn about Roman food while creating and trying tasty dishes from Apicius.

name: Multiplayer Period Chess
description_book: Chess games for four players. We will review rules and variations, then provide time to play.
description_web: Chess games for four players. We will review rules and variations, then provide time to play.

name: OTS/Orientale Tribal Style Group Improv
description_book: Combines Tribal improv group fun and the joyful freedom of cabaret, this is some of the most fun you and your dance friends can have!
description_web:
The world reknowned, yet newest, of the Group Improv formats! Combining the improvisational group fun of tribal and the joyful freedom of cabaret, this is some of the most fun you and your dance friends can have! OTS is a creation of Ziah and the Awalim Dance Company of Atlanta, GA. It is a group improvisational format based on American Tribal Style (ATS) by Carolena Nericcio and Fat Chance Belly Dance. This Improv dialect format has over 100 moves that span across ATS, modern Egyptian, classic Egyptian, American cabaret, Lebanese cabaret, Turkish, and many more! 
The label “Tribal” indicates that the dancers create and perform as a group or tribe. **Each day will cover different moves which can be taken together or separately.**

name: Inkle Weaving Basics
description_book: Using the continuous warping method, you will warp the loom and weave an inkle strip.
description_web: Using the continuous warping method, you will warp the loom and weave an inkle strip. Classroom loaner looms available or bring your own; class limited to 10 looms.

name: Byzantine Chainmail
description_book: This style of chainmail was prevalent for several centuries, across multiple cultures, throughout our period in the Mediterranean and European worlds.
description_web: Learn the Byzantine chainmail weave that was prevalent throughout our period across multiple cultures. All hand-prepared materials necessary to complete class project are provided. For those who don't have them, tools are available on a first-come, first-served basis.
fee_itemization: Sufficient hand-turned & cut rings, 12ga 5/8 in diameter, to complete class project.

name: PTSD, Sound-Triggered Anxiety, and the SCA
description_book: Discussion on PTSD, Sound-Triggered Anxiety, some of the ramifications within the SCA, and ways in which some of us are helping the community.
description_web: Discussion on PTSD, Sound-Triggered Anxiety, some of the ramifications within the SCA, and ways in which some of us are helping the community. Discussion will include some of the history and definitions of PTS, PTSD, and STA; the issues people face within the Society when suffering from these ailments; and a discussion of the Canon Advanced Warning System (CAWS). This is **not** a therapy counseling session, nor lecture on treatment options, classifications, or diagnoses. This is solely a non-medical, non-professional discourse provided by the designer of the CAWS program and someone with personal experience with STA/PTS.

name: Using Scribal Arts for Largesse
description_book: Use your scribal talents for more than just scrolls! Largesse is a great way to practice or get started. Learn what to make in this class.
description_web: All skill levels welcome! If you're new to the scribal arts, largesse is a wonderful place to start, and, if you're experienced, largesse is a great place to play and have fun! I'll explain how to choose projects, select images, what type of items are best gifted when, as well as some inexpensive packaging ideas that will make your gift one to remember. Optional and assorted make-and-take kits will be available for those that want to work while we talk. Kits will be illumination-based; calligraphy ideas will be discussed.
fee_itemization:
Material fee is optional.
$2 fee provides a largess item of choice to paint
$5 fee includes paint palette, paints, paint brushes and largess item of choice

name: Beginning Engraving
description_book: Hands-on class. Intro to tools, first cuts, graver control, hammer use.
description_web: Hands-on class. Intro to tools, first cuts, graver control. Student will learn both hand-held and hammer-struck engraving.

name: Throw Away Your Wristwatch
description_book: Learn period methods of timekeeping to tell time day and night at Pennsic. Discussion of scientific principles so you can tell time anywhere, anytime.
fee_itemization: 30 page color booklet. Cardboard nocturnal. A stick.

name: Necklines, Cuffs, and Hems for 14th-C. Garments
description_book: Learn to sew necklines, cuffs, and hems for 14th-C. dresses and tunics based on extant garments. Stitches are simple; beginners welcome.
description_web: Learn to sew necklines, cuffs, and hems for 14th-century dresses and tunics based on extant garments. The stitches are simple. This class is accessible both to the beginning sewer and to the more advanced sewer who wants to make their garments more authentic. Demos of the stitches in various states of progress as well as finished garments will be passed around. There is a handout; contributions toward handout costs are gratefully accepted but not required.
fee_itemization: Contributions toward the handout are gratefully accepted but not required

name: Learn to Knit!
description_book: [YouthU] Want to learn to knit? In this class, we will learn to cast on, garter stitch, and how to bind off. Geared for youth participants.
description_web: [YouthU] Want to learn to knit? In this class, we will learn to cast on, garter stitch, and how to bind off. Geared for youth participants.
fee_itemization: Practice needles and practice yarn the students can take home. Material fee only if you want to take the yarn and needles home.

name: With These Knots I Bind My Camp
description_book: You will learn to master a very few knots that will meet almost every need you may have in camp - or double your money back!
description_web: Before cordless drills and screws, before plentiful cheap nails, even before glue, there was knotted cord holding our lives together. Sadly, most of us barely know how to tie even two or three knots. My guarantee: You will learn to master a small handful of knots that will meet almost every need you may have in camp - or double your money back!

name: Norse and Rus Women's Head Coverings
description_book: What did Norse and/or Rus Women do with their hair? What about temple rings? Bring a scarf or fabric to learn how to wrap/adorn your hair.
description_web: Explore possible hair knots, braids, wraps and coverings derived from extant images of Scandinavian Norse (Viking) and Rus/Slavic tribal women. Bring a scarf or a long piece of material to learn how to wrap your hair. (This class will not cover the British Isles caps or Western Scandinavia.)

name: KWP Pennsic Readers' Theater: Open Adult Rehearsal
description_book: Join a low-stress theatre experience by KWP Readers' Theatre, creating a staged reading of the script Ben Johnson's *Volpone (The Fox)*
description_web: Known World Players Readers' Theatre provides a low-stress opportunity and theater experience creating a staged reading of the script Ben Johnson's *Volpone (The Fox)*. A staged reading is a performance where the actors perform with the script in their hand and there are no props, costumes, scenery, or special lighting. No audition is necessary; attend both rehearsals. To be performed on Friday 8/3 in the Performing Arts Tent at 6 pm. Sponsored by Known World Players.

name: Sketch Comedy
description_book: Come join The Hanging Jesters to learn to write and perform sketch comedy! We will be preparing for Pennsic Night Live!! Class is open to all!
description_web: Learn how to develop, write and perform scripts for sketch comedy. Learn how to make a lineup for performance, rehearsal, staging, and much more!

name: *Contentezza D'Amore*
description_book: Come learn *Contentezza D'Amore*, a beautiful 16th-century *ballo* from *Nobiltà*! Dancers of all ages welcome. This is an advanced class.
description_web: Come learn *Contentezza D'Amore*, one of the most beautiful of the 16th-century *balli*! I will be teaching the version from *Nobiltà di Dame*, Master Caroso's second book, wherein he corrects all the errors of his first; if you think you already know it, be warned! Dancers of all ages welcome. This is an advanced class.

name: Eat Like a Roman for Youth
description_book: [YouthU/TeenU 12+] Learn about Roman dining etiquette and traditions while sampling a Roman dish (or 2!).

name: Ottoman Singing Class
description_book: Rehearsal of past songs for performance, and learning a new Ottoman song, "*Ceddin Deden*."
description_web: We will be rehearsing past songs for performance this year, and teaching the Ottoman martial composition "*Ceddin Deden*," that was/is commonly performed in the Mehteran Janissary Band. This piece of music is typically performed with singing. As such, we will be teaching a singing class to learn this song in the original Ottoman Turkish language. What will you learn and experience: an Ottoman song "*Ceddin Deden*" and its history; the musical modality *Makam Huseyni*; pronunciation of Ottoman Turkish along with a brief history and etymology. The 3 classes will be progressive; however, students may join in when they wish, although attendance at all the classes is strongly encouraged. Students may join the class's Facebook page in advance to orient themselves to the song and class: https://www.facebook.com/groups/398762226986519/

name: Recorder Jam with Siri! Part 2
description_book: Read through Renaissance 4 pt. recorder literature. Loaner SATB recorders available. Soprano recorders available for purchase, $4
description_web: Play recorders with others in a group setting and read through Renaissance literature in four parts. Bring a music stand (some loaners available) and your instrument or use a loaner (Soprano, Alto, Tenor or Bass). You might wish to try a different instrument. New (Harmony brand) Soprano recorders will be available for $4.

name: *Chen Tai Chi* Basics
description_book: Come learn the fundamental movements of *Chen Tai Chi*, the traditional martial art of Chenjiagou.
description_web: Come learn the fundamental movements of *Chen Tai Chi*, the traditional martial art of Chenjiagou. *Chen Tai Chi* is the original martial art form that all modern day schools of *tai chi* were derived from. Started by Chen Bu in the 14th century and codified by Chen Wangting in the 17th century, *Chen Tai Chi* has a long lineage that is alive and thriving in the present day. Come experience the basics of this rich martial art form with Hilary!

name: Hounds Abound!
description_book: Interested in how dogs were kept? What were the different types of dogs? What were they used for? Come learn about all things canine!
description_web: Come learn about dogs in the Middle Ages! We'll be looking at different types of dogs, how they were cared for, what were they used for and how they fit into everyday life.

name: Making a Glastonbury "Lite" Chair
description_book: Learn the tips and techniques behind a folding chair with Glastonbury-style arms. CD may be available.
description_web: Tired of the look and limited life span of Coleman chairs? Learn the tips and techniques you need to make a wooden folding chair with Glastonbury-style arms. It folds to 6" thick, holds up to 300 lbs, (my wife and I tested it), and can be decorated. CD may be available.

instructor: Mistress Arwen Evaine ferch Rhys ap Gwy
name: Conception, Pregnancy and Birth in the Norse World
description_book: Traditional Norse childbearing, including hygiene, magic, religion, nutrition, midwifery, and protection of the fetus until after it's born.
description_web: Back in sagas through medieval times, pregnancy was not easy to undergo; childbirth without anesthesia was worse. One had to ward the mother from bears, the *Underjordiske* (Under-Earth Ones), malignant curses, and more. Learn what amulets to carry, what actions would shoo away dangers to the pregnant woman, as well as during childbirth and after the baby was born. The role of the midwife (*hjelpekone*) was critical in the actual birthing process. Some of these practices were logical and medically sound; others were pure fantasy. Please note that this class is for educational information only, and is not meant as medical advice.

name: Basic *Ka-Kha-Ga-Gha*
description_book: Written forms, pronunciations, and usage of *Devanagari* script used by Hindi, Sanskrit and other Indic languages.
description_web:
Written forms, pronunciations, and usage of *Devanagari* script used by Hindi and other North Indian languages. While the focus of this class is on Hindi usage, the characters and pronunciation are nearly identical for others. There will be examples in Hindi and basic documentation.
1st hour: Basic characters and pronunciation.
2nd hour: Vowels and half-letters; more if time and student interest allow.

name: Getting Involved at Events & with Your Local Group
description_book: You've been to a few events, but are looking to become more than a spectator. Here are some tips and tricks to getting more involved and staying busy.
description_web: You've been to a few events, but are looking to become more than a spectator. Here are some tips and tricks to getting more involved and staying busy.

name: Improving Your Improv: Choosing to Know
description_book: Improv exercises and games to make decisions on the fly as your character. Learn to react as your character and keep a scene going no matter what!
description_web: Take “yes, and...” a step further in this class by focusing on making decisions about the scene by “choosing to know.” In improv, your character always knows what is going on, even if you do not. This class will focus on exercises and games to make decisions on the fly as your character. Learn to react as your character and keep a scene going no matter what is thrown at you.

name: Beginning *Atlatl*
description_book: Learn the basics of *atlatl* safety: how to hold the *atlatl*, load a dart, and throw the dart.
description_web: Learn the basics of *atlatl* safety: how to hold the *atlatl*, load a dart, and throw the dart.

name: Beyond the Baba Yaga
description_book: Come and learn about fascinating creatures and critters of Russian folklore.
fee_itemization: Photocopies of handouts, black and white some color

name: New Italianate Dances for Teaching Beginners
description_book: *Scadiana Nuova* and *Luna Amorosa*, two new dances designed to orient beginners to steps and figures of dances in the Caroso tradition.

name: Board Games
description_book: A review of board games previously taught and opportunities to practice with a knowledgeable instructor's assistance.

name: Beyond the Cloth: Glassware for Your Persona Pt. 1
description_book: Discussion of glassware from early period through the Middle Ages, and including Europe, the Middle East, and parts of Asia.
description_web: Have you ever walked around an event with a glass in your hand? People will notice it long before they even think about looking at your shoes. Make a statement by having the right kind of vessel for your persona! Discussion of glassware from early period through the Middle Ages, and including Europe, the Middle East, and parts of Asia. A list of reference books will be available.

name: Advanced *Repoussé* and Chasing
description_book: Intro to pitch block-working and forming, plus tool and hammer use. Produce a copper amulet.
description_web: Intro to pitch block-working and forming, plus tool and hammer use. Produce a copper amulet.

name: Lucet Basics
description_book: Make a square cord and a two-color cord.
description_web: Make a square cord and a two-color cord. Classroom loaner lucets available or bring your own. String provided as part of the class fee.

name: Youth Combat Afternoon Session
description_book: Youth Combat Lists open.
description_web: Youth Combat Lists open.

name: Beginning Illumination
description_book: Learn the basics for making an illuminated scroll with leaf border.
description_web: A beginner class to provide knowledge and materials to complete a scroll with a leaf border.
fee_itemization: You will get paint and brush, scroll paper, ruler, pencil and eraser, and simple directions

name: Book Heraldry for Non-Heralds
description_book: Thinking of submitting a name or device? Come get a quick and dirty overview of what to expect and how to understand what a herald is saying.
description_web: Thinking of submitting a name or device? Come get a quick and dirty overview of what to expect and how to understand what a herald is saying. There will be time for private consultations if desired.

name: Chainmaille for Beginners
description_book: [TeenU 13-17] Will show basic 4-in-1 and Byzantine chain making. Will have some supplies. Bring 2 pairs of pliers if you can; I will have spares.

name: Introduction to Whisky
description_book: For those interested in learning about whisky. The class covers history, production, and free tastings. Age 21 and over.
description_web: For those interested in learning about whisky. The class covers history, laws governing spirits, and production and includes a "how to taste and appreciate". Samples for 20 people. Some cups will be provided, but it's suggested you bring your own glass. Age 21 and over.

name: Melodic Music Realizations on *Basse Danse* Tenors
description_book: Melodic Realizations is a lecture and applied class on the methods to write melodic divisions above a 15th-century *basse danse* tenor line.
description_web: Melodic Realizations is a lecture and applied class on the methods to write melodic divisions above a 15th-century *basse danse* tenor line. A solid knowledge of basic theory is required. Bring instruments as we will play some of the monstrosities we come up with.

location: Denys The Decadent (Denys the Decadent's Camp  EO8)
name: 12-Step Meetings
description_book: Daily meetings for those in any 12-step program such as AA, NA, OA, SA, Alanon, etc.
description_web: We welcome all in AA, NA, OA, SA, Alanon, etc., who are in any 12-step program to the 4:00 pm daily meeting at EO8 Denys The Decadent's Camp.

name: Beyond the Cloth: Glassware for Your Persona Pt. 2
description_book: Discussion of glassware from the Late Middle Ages to late period, and including Europe, the Middle East, and parts of Asia.
description_web: Have you ever walked around an event with a glass in your hand? People will notice it long before they even think about looking at your shoes. Make a statement by having the right kind of vessel for your persona! Discussion of glassware from the Late Middle Ages to late period, and including Europe, the Middle East, and parts of Asia. A list of reference books will be available.

name: Recounting History in Song
description_book: Demonstration of period examples, then instruction how to reduce your chosen subject into to a concise, entertaining piece. Then, we will write!
description_web: We will look at some period examples of history told in song format, and then I will teach how to reduce your chosen historical subject into to a concise, entertaining piece (with a singalong hook, if you like). I have written a number of pieces this way, and will perform at least a couple of them and explain how I wrote them. Then, we will write! I will have sources to choose from, or you can bring your own. You can write alone or in a group, but the idea is that we all at least start our own pieces and share our progress, workshop-style. Bring paper and something to write with if you can!
fee_itemization: Just a copy fee, for handouts and printed articles the students can choose from. $1 will likely not even cover the cost completely.

name: Making Your Own Rune Stave Set
description_book: Rune tines or staves (sticks) make for a more complex reading; we'll make a set. You may bring your own knife and/or wood.
description_web: Rather than just laying out tiles or tossing stones in a pattern, if you make tines or staves (sticks) and toss them, you get greater depth in a reading. How to either split, cut, carve, and color your own tines. I will bring wood; bringing your own knife or wood would be helpful, but not required. How to use them will be discussed.

name: Belt Pouch Make-and-Take
description_book: [YouthU] Make a basic belt pouch from a historic pattern to carry all your things!
description_web: Make a belt pouch to wear at events from a provided kit. If you have your own scissors, please bring them.

name: *Faience*/Egyptian Paste
description_book: Described as the first engineered material, *faience* is a non-clay ceramic that is said to be a precursor technology to glass-making.
description_web: Described as the first engineered material, *faience* is a non-clay ceramic that is said to be a precursor technology to glass-making. Learn about the history, composition, production, and social meaning of this technology. A particular focus will be given to its relationship with glass-making. The instructor hopes to have samples of small fired-*faience*  items and *faience* paste available for attendees to see.

name: *Chorale du Lac* (Bog Choir)
description_book: Choir class for all levels of singers, no exp. necessary, all voices welcome. Simple period partsongs, rounds, catches.
description_web:
We will warm up, discuss and practice new vocal, music theory, and choral skills each day, and then sing a selection of rounds, catches, and simple part songs from period sources. Each day will be a different class. This is a good choir class for beginning singers who want to sing together in a group for fun, and for experienced singers to take a refresher in choral singing and work on technique and tuning. No experiences necessary, all voices welcome. Instead of rehearsing for a performance, we will practice for learning's sake and go caroling in the Bog at the end of the series. 
Visit https://www.facebook.com/groups/1470354713287848/, the "Bog University" FaceBook group for more info.

name: Medieval Glass Painting with Vitreous Enamel
description_book: Learn the history and techniques of the medieval glass painters' guild and try your hand at making a small piece. Work fired on-site.
description_web: Learn the history and techniques of the medieval stained glass painters' guild and try your hand at making a small piece. Students will use vitreous enamels and watch their work being fired in a kiln.

name: Bedtime Stories for Children
description_book: Nightly telling of stories for children.
description_web: 7 pm nightly: Stories and fables for children. All are welcome to attend; must have adult escort.

location: Courtesan College (Strawberry Fields B06 on Ankara - look for signs!)
name: Raunch & Romance: Oral Recitations
description_book: Come listen to period and period-inspired pieces. To sign up to do a reading, please contact cianascholari@gmail.com. 18+
description_web: Come listen to period and period-inspired pieces in the lush surrounds of the Courtesan College. To sign up to do a reading, please contact cianascholari@gmail.com. Age 18+.

name: Tool Making for Engraving; Chasing and Repoussé
description_book: Learning to make gravers and punches used in engraving and repoussé work. Students will produce their own engravers and punches.
description_web: Learning to make gravers and punches used in engraving and repoussé work. Students will produce their own engravers and punches.

name: Evening with Bill W
description_book: Open AA meeting. All are welcome come join us around a fire for open discussion. All addictions welcome.
description_web: Open AA meeting. All are welcome come join us around a fire for open discussion. All addictions welcome.

name: Card-Weaving Basics
description_book: Using the continuous warping method, you will warp the loom and, using cards, you will weave a narrow strip.
description_web: Warp a loom and weave a small strap or trim piece. Using the continuous warping method, you will warp the loom and weave a narrow strip. Classroom loaner looms available or bring your own. Class limited to 5 looms. Fee covers string and cards; take your work home with you.

name: Family Stories in the Bog
description_book: Stories and fables for children. All are welcome to attend; youth must have adult escort.
description_web: Stories and fables for children. All are welcome to attend; youth must have adult escort.

name: English Revels
description_book: Come one and all to the solemn revel and post-revel (and a little banquet too) at which we shall dance the *Old Measures* and other English dances.
description_web: Come one and all to the solemn revel and post-revel (and a little banquet too) at which we shall dance the *Old Measures* and other English dances. For those who do not know all of the *Old Measures*, printed memoranda shall be available.

name: Open and Period Flight Shoot
description_book: Flight Shoot hosted by Lord Naran Numuchi, Bow Khan of the Great Dark Horde. Open handbow, period handbow, crossbow. Farthest of 6 arrows.

name: Yoga For Dancers, Fighters or Pretty Much Anyone
description_book: Yoga to help us through the rigors of War, regardless of our activities. Please bring a mat/towel and dress for modesty. Kids must bring guardian.
description_web: Yoga to help us through the rigors of War, regardless of our activities. Please bring a mat or towel and dress for modesty. Children may attend with parent/guardian present.

name: Coffee with Friends of Bill and Dr Bob
description_book: Morning recovery meetings in agnostic format.
description_web: Morning recovery meetings in agnostic format.

name: *Étude* 1 and 2 for Single Sword (Fencing)
description_book: These drill sequences will focus on form, balance, movement, and coordination. For beginners, intermediates, and teachers alike.
description_web: For beginner and intermediate fencers and those who teach them. These drills will focus on form, balance, movement and coordination. *Étude* 1 (first week) is more linear; *Étude* 2 (second week) adds off-line/lateral movement. Emphasis will be on learning the *études* for home drill, as well as taking elements out of the drill for more focused work in groups.

name: Youth Combat Morning Session
description_book: Lists open.
description_web: Youth Fighting lists open.

name: Making Russian Spun Cording
description_book: Ever needed a specific size or color of cording and couldn’t find it? I ll show you how cheap and easy it is to make your own.
description_web: Ever needed a specific size or color of cording and couldn’t find it? I'll show you how cheap and easy it is to make your own. As time allows, students will have a chance to make and take a piece of metallic cording called "Waste of Time" in Russian. Examples of my Russian embroidery will be on display.

name: Beginning Bobbin Lace
description_book: Three-day class for a total of 9 hours. Learn the basic movements and make three basic projects. Start a period pattern.
description_web: This is a three-day class for a total of 9 hours of bobbin lace! First Day: Students will learn the basic movements of bobbin lace and begin a project. Second Day: Students will finish the project and learn some simple grounds. Third Day: Students will begin a period pattern from the *Nüw Modelbuch*.
fee_itemization: $30 – One-time fee for all three days. Includes pillow with cover, bobbin holder, 10 pair of bobbins, pins, handout, patterns

name: Hammer of the Witches: Witch Hunts and Trials
description_book: Examines the various texts, tactics, and histories of witch-hunters, along with information on the enemies they believed they fought.

name: *Pysanky* Make-and-Take
description_book: Come learn to write beautiful Ukrainian-style resist-dyed eggs! We will talk about the history of *pysanky* while we write on eggs.
description_web: Using modern dyes to create intricate designs, we will learn about the history of *pysanky* while writing on eggs. This is a fun social project, suitable for all ages, though small children will need an adult with them, as we do use candles and hot wax.

name: You Too Can Warp and Weave on a Warp-Weighted Loom
description_book: The class is in 2 parts. The first hour is a demo, the second hour hands-on. You will learn how to warp a warp-weighted loom, knit heddles and weave.
description_web: You will learn how to warp a warp-weighted loom, knit heddles and weave. I will have a card-weaving demo for the header band and two tabletop looms to show and practice the different stages of the entire process. The class is in 2 parts. The first hour is a demo where I will go over each step. The second hour is hands-on, where you can try it out yourself.
fee_itemization: $1 for a hard copy of the handout.

name: HS Summer Math Help and Challenge Problems
description_book: [TeenU 13-17] Teenagers (and others)! Do you have summer math work? Algebra through APCalc. Get some help, help one another, or try the challenges.
description_web: [TeenU] Teenagers (and others)! Do you have summer math work? Algebra through AP calculus. Get some help, help one another, or try the challenge problems. Don't make your parents have to remind you to open the book you carried to Pennsic. ;-)

name: Modern Media & the SCA: Making Them Work Together
description_book: How to connect with modern media to share the SCA on a larger scale and provide a good story for the news.
description_web: Reaching people who are interested in the SCA can be difficult; reaching a large number at once even more so. In this class, Æthelmearc Media Liaison and broadcast journalist THL Arias Beltran del Valle discusses how to reach out to modern media and share activities and events with them, while also adhering to Society media policies. Includes what to do (and not to do!) when the media arrives at an event. Included in the discussion will be suggestions on how to make an event more interesting to news outlets. We'll touch on rights given to the reporters and to participants. We'll also discuss who should be involved in preparations for meeting the media at an event, and how to present the best face for your group!

name: House Haunters
description_book: Take a close look into dark corners and under the bed to find out the truth about boggarts, brownies, bugbears and other long-legged beasties.
description_web: Just what are the things that go bump in the night? Take a close look into dark corners and under the bed, if you dare, to find out the truth about boggarts, brownies, bugbears and other long-legged beasties!

name: Medieval Wool Buttons
description_book: This is a hands-on class teaching how to make wool buttons: those tiny little round pea-sized buttons seen on so many of the finer medieval garments.
description_web: This is a hands-on class teaching how to make wool buttons: those tiny little round pea-sized buttons seen on so many of the finer medieval garments. We will follow the pattern suggested by the Museum of London, but the steps are made easier for those who have never made buttons before.
fee_itemization: $1 for wool and thread to make the buttons

name: Survey of Rapier Hangers and Sword Belts
description_book: A look at different styles of later period sword belts, go over design, layout and construction, material options, hardware, and how to wear the belt.
description_web: Looking to dress up your kit, or maybe just find a place for your sword when not stabbing an opponent? We will take a look at different styles of later period sword belts, go over design, layout and construction, material options, where to find hardware, and how to wear the belt.

name: Beginning Netting
description_book: Create that final piece of 14th-century bling, a netted hairnet. Learn how to cast on a circular net, use a gauge stick, and tie the netting knot.
description_web: Create that final piece of 14th-century bling, a netted hairnet. I'll teach how to cast on a circular net, use a gauge stick, and tie the netting knot. Netting can be scaled down to make hairnets of silk, or scaled up to make fish nets or tote bags using a sheet bend knot.
fee_itemization: The material fee covers the cost of the prewound netting shuttle, the gauge stick, and the base rod.

name: Easy Quilted "No Sew" Ornament
description_book: We will make a quilted "No Sew" ornament using rectangular fabric pieces and straight pins. Kits will be available or you can bring your own fabric.
description_web: We will make a quilted "No Sew" ornament using rectangular fabric pieces and straight pins. Kits will be available or you can bring your own fabric. If you use your own fabric, bring 16 pre-cut pieces (2" x 3") of cotton or linen in two different colors. Patterned material can be used but the pattern must be small. Find a picture (printed on fabric) for the center (picture itself should be no bigger than 1.5" square). The overall center piece needs to be 3" square and you'll 2 of them. You'll need a box of #17 straight pins, 3/4" wide ribbon 12" long (so it corresponds to the fabric you've chosen), 1/4" wide ribbon, 60" long (can be 2 different colors, each 30" long), and 1/8" wide ribbon (8" long). 12 years and older please.

name: Beginning Inkle Weaving
description_book: Learn to read inkle patterns, loom setup, weaves. Bring loom and shuttle, or borrow both. Bring 2 colors #10 crochet cotton, scissors, paper/pencil.
description_web: Learn to create beautiful trim for your garb. We will cover how to read an inkle pattern, how to set up and weave efficiently on the inkle loom. Bring your own loom and shuttle, or borrow one/both. Supplies needed: #10 cotton crochet thread/equivalent, in two colors; scissors; paper and pencil for notes.
fee_itemization:
handout, 4 pages
thread, 2 colors.  approximately 70 yards total per student

name: Easy Dances for Children and Parents
description_book: Early morning dancing to joyfully start the day for toddlers and up. Please bring a parent with you.
description_web: Early morning dancing to joyfully start the day for toddlers and up. Dances will be taught with simplified steps at times. Children can dance with their parents and friends. Free movement to music is encouraged in between dances. Please bring a parent with you even if dancing with a friend.

name: Period Card Games: *Losing Loadem*
description_book: Do you like to play cards? Come learn to play this late-period, trick-avoidance card game.
description_web: Looking for something to pass the time at events? Do you like to play cards? Come learn to play this late-period card game based on a reconstruction from Francis Willughby’s *A Volume of Plaies* (~1665).

location: Hunters Home (M 01 We are on top of the hill above the castle.  )
name: Viking Age Glass Bead-Making
description_book: Learn how to make a glass bead over a fire. We will be using the bellows to heat a charcoal fire to heat glass and form beads.
description_web: Learn how to make a glass bead over a fire. We will be using the bellows to heat a charcoal fire to heat glass and form beads. Be prepared to take a turn at the bellows. We are playing with fire, so please dress appropriately.
fee_itemization:
bag of hardwood charcoal $10, shared across the class
glass rods $1-2 each, depending on color.

name: Viking Age Clay Pot Cooking
description_book: Learn how to cook lunch in a clay pot. There will be a selection of ingredients, a fire, and information.
description_web: Learn how to cook lunch in a clay pot. There will be a selection of ingredients, a fire, and information. I will have a class set of specially-priced small Viking-age pots available at Irontree Works merchant booth, and there will be a class fee for supplies. We will talk about what ingredients were available where during the Viking Age, sources, and cooking methods. Ten students will leave class with a pot of cooked lunch.
fee_itemization: Fee will pay for charcoal and food ingredients. Students will also need to purchase or have a small Viking Age pot, which are available for a special class price at the booth.

name: Knot Tying Basics
description_book: Ten knots for camp and everyday life. Class limited to 10 kits.

name: Intro to *Euclid's Elements*
description_book: Introduction to the primary geometry text for pre-1600 Europe, including structure and logic of the text in general and of the first several proofs.

name: Rob Peter to Feed Paul: More Feast for Less
description_book: Twice the feast - both in servings and in historical accuracy - for half the money and less work.
description_web: How to plan and produce a fabulous, reasonably historic feast on the cheap. A king's dinner on village headman's budget is not only possible, it's fun! Learn how to waste less and serve more without going crazy.

name: Youth Rapier Activities
description_book: There will be a variety of youth rapier activities each day including drills, games and one-on-one instruction. Some loaner gear will be available.
description_web: There will be a variety of youth rapier activities each day including drills, games and one-on-one instruction. Some days may include special additional activities. Some loaner gear will be available. Participants do not have to be authorized. Children age 6 and up may participate. Please bring your parent/guardian the first day you attend to learn more about the youth rapier program.

name: Feltmaking for Kids
description_book: Wrap a bar of soap in wool and felt the wool using water and a lot of elbow grease. **You will get wet; bring a towel!** Soap and wool provided.
description_web: [YouthU] We will wrap a bar of soap in wool and felt the wool using water and a lot of elbow grease. **You will get wet; bring a towel!** Soap and wool provided. I will bring a variety of soap types, including some hypo-allergenic bars. If you want a specific kind of soap, bring it with you.
fee_itemization:
bar of soap- $1 each
Wool roving $1-1.50 each person

name: Make it Fit!
description_book: How to create scroll texts that will fit the space you've been given.

name: *Qigong* and *Taiji* Flow
description_book: These exercises have been used for health and well-being in China for many centuries. Come and wake up with some morning *qigong*.
description_web: *Qigong* and *taiji* exercises have been used for health and well-being in China for many centuries. This class will include many ancient moves that will help you get ready for your day at Pennsic, whether it’s going to war, battling the vendors, or just relaxing in camp. This is a follow along *qigong*-style set to music. No experience or special abilities required; just come and enjoy the movement. This is part 3 of a 3-part series on *qigong*.

name: Cooking Fires Are Not Bonfires
description_book: Learn how to manage a fire for different types of food and cooking techniques from two experienced ‘over the fire’ cooks.  No real fire involved.
description_web: “Sure, I can help you with your cooking fire! I make excellent bonfires! Fire is fire, right?” Wrong. It’s not as easy as just being able to make a good fire. Learn how to manage a fire for different types of food and cooking techniques from two experienced "over the fire" cooks. No real fire involved in this class.

name: Stitching *Temari*: Wrapped and Woven Patterns
description_book: *Temari* balls are wrapped, stitched, and woven into beautiful, colorful patterns that are impressive out of all proportion with how easy they are.
description_web: *Temari* balls are wrapped, stitched, and woven into beautiful, colorful patterns that are impressive out of all proportion with how easy they are. In this class, we'll create a simple wrapped and woven design. Kit includes three colors of floss, marking thread, ball base, and needles, or you're welcome to bring your own materials.
fee_itemization: materials to complete one ball, plus enough to begin several more, and a handout

name: Medieval Herbed Ale: *Gruit* Demystified.
description_book: The history of Low Country *gruit* ale, as found in contemporary sources. Includes detailed information on ingredients and likely brewing techniques.
description_web: The history of Low Country *gruit* ale, as found in contemporary sources. Includes detailed information on ingredients and possible brewing techniques. Historic *gruit* ale is quite a different beer from modern herbal *gruit* ale. This class will explore the factual history of this exciting beer, and the dangers in research of assuming interpretations are fact.

name: Structure of Elizabethan Tragedy
description_book: We will analyze the five-act structure of 16th-century English drama and its relationship to the movement of the plot.
description_web: We will analyze the five-act structure of 16th-century English drama and consider how it relates to the movement of the plots of several plays by Shakespeare and his contemporaries.

name: Fools' School
description_book: Are you a fool or a fool wannabe? Come to Fools' School to share and learn. Prepare a 5-minute skit to perform. All ages/experience levels welcome.
description_web: Are you a fool or a fool wannabe? Come to Fools' School to share and learn. Fools/performers of all types and experience levels are welcome. Jugglers, magicians, singers, freaks and geeks. Get help creating or honing a skit of no more than 5 minutes to perform in the Amphitheater, Wednesday, 8/8, 6-7 pm. You might even become a “Licensed Fool.” Performing is not mandatory.

name: Textile Creation
description_book: Linen, flax, silk and wool all require multiple arts to create fabric. These will be displayed.

name: Embellishing  Textiles
description_book: Embroidery, applique, bobbin lace and needlework are ways of embellishing. These will be demonstrated.

name: Hand and Foot Massage for Lovers and Others
description_book: Become popular by learning simple massage techniques for hands and feet! Bring a mat, comfy clothes, easily removable shoes.
description_web: Be the most popular gentle in your camp and maybe even all of Pennsic! Learn simple techniques to relax friends and loved ones. Pennsic is hard on the body, particularly the feet. This is the perfect opportunity to hone your innate massage skills. Bring a partner, but if you don't have one, you will be paired up with a fellow classmate. Wear comfortable clothing and easy-to-remove footwear. Also, bring a towel or mat to lie on the floor. If you have difficulty being on the floor, we will arrange to have you work seated.

name: *RúnValdr*
description_book: In period, runes were very rarely used for divination, but there are many examples of runes being used for magic. A modern system for rune magic.
description_web: In period, runes were very rarely used for divination, but there are many examples of runes being used for magic. This is a system that shows, for example, how to use Norse or Anglo-Saxon runes to hear even at distance, or to awaken inanimate objects. This is a system of energy manipulation using runes and another set of symbols. This workshop introduces the symbols and what each of them is used for, and includes the attunement. It does *not* include introduction to runes. You may take this workshop without knowing the runes, but you will need to learn them to be able to use this system. You will be able to use this technique immediately.
fee_itemization: There's a free handout, and a bigger optional "manual" available.

name: PPF *Reigi*: Japanese Etiquette and Formal Dining
description_book: A workshop on Japanese social and dining customs. Avoid embarrassment. Learn rituals and taboos found in a 1380 etiquette manual and later writings.
description_web:
How Not to Embarrass Yourself in  Japan. Learn the basic rules of polite society for pre-modern Japan. We all have social rules and rituals. However, these rules and rituals are often very different for different cultures. Learn (and practice) the basic rules of polite society for pre-modern Japan. 

Topics covered will include walking, standing and sitting, bowing, opening and closing doors, formal dining, and giving and receiving gifts. This class draws upon a 1380 Japanese etiquette instructional manual, later Japanese writings on correct dining, a sixteenth-century Portuguese account of proper behavior in Japan, and the contemporary teachings of Urasenke and Ogasawara-ryu.

Shoes will be removed for the workshop. Please bring a fan with you if you have one.

name: Cecil Sharp Dances Reconsidered
description_book: What can we learn from another look at dances that came from Cecil Sharp versions? Includes *Picking of Sticks, Rufty Tufty, Lady Cullen, Newcastle*.

location: Herald's Point ( Intersection of the Low Road with the Great Eastern Highway, next to Family Point)
name: Topics in Basic Heraldry
description_book: These classes will teach basic name and/or armory skills for consulting at Pennsic Herald's Point. Dates and topics will be posted at Herald's Point.
description_web: These classes will teach basic name and/or armory submission skills necessary to consult at Pennsic Herald's Point. Exact dates and topics will be posted at Herald's Point at the beginning of the War. All newer heralds are strongly encouraged to attend at least one of these classes prior to volunteering at Herald's Point.

name: Japanese Stab Binding: Make a Book in Under 1 Hour
description_book: Make 2 books in 1 hour using the stab binding method. No handout; we will focus on the craft rather than the history. Under 16 yrs old need adult rep!
description_web: Come make two books in no time at all using the ancient stab binding method of Japan. There is no handout as we will focus on the craft rather than the history, but a card with reference sites will be available. This class and its humble instructor is not set up for youth teaching; any patrons under 16 need adult supervision. Keep in mind we will be using sharp tools, fine motor functions and working be in a blacksmith's shop where children can find injury. Thanks for your understanding!
fee_itemization: Beeswax, Paper for book pages, decorative paper for book covers and linen binding thread and colored cotton pearl.

name: Storytelling Academy
description_book: Explore genres, tools, styles, and uses of storytelling. Cultural and medieval approaches, applications, performance coaching. New topics each day.
description_web: During this nine-day academy, students will gain knowledge about the history and techniques for storytelling both in the SCA and the modern world. Students may attend individual sessions or all of the academy. There will be guest teachers and time for students to practice and receive feedback. The academy will culminate in a student performance. No classes are repeated. The focus is on developing comfort, nurturing, and honing skills within the students’ capabilities. All levels are welcome. Students may view a class outline at the academy space, Minerva’s Spindle 158, where classes will also be listed on the message board. Seating is limited; feel free to bring your own chair. Student Performance, Thursday 8/9, 5pm in the performance pavilion.

name: Beginning Recorder
description_book: Learn how to play a soprano, alto, or tenor recorder. Music reading not required. Bring your own.
description_web: The Renaissance recorder is a handy, lightweight, and versatile musical instrument. Learn how to play a soprano, alto, or tenor recorder. You don't even need to know how to read music! Please bring your own recorder. Fingering charts will be provided. Sheet music will also be provided if you wish, and you can record the teacher to remember how the songs go so you can practice at home. We will learn dance tunes so you can play for dances at events!

name: KWP Pennsic Readers' Theater: Open Adult Rehearsal
description_book: Join a low-stress theatre experience by KWP Readers' Theatre, creating a staged reading of the script Ben Johnson's *Volpone (The Fox)*
description_web: Known World Players Readers' Theatre provides a low-stress opportunity and theater experience creating a staged reading of the script Ben Johnson's *Volpone (The Fox)*. A staged reading is a performance where the actors perform with the script in their hand and there are no props, costumes, scenery, or special lighting. No audition is necessary; attend both rehearsals. To be performed on Friday 8/3 in the Performing Arts Tent at 6 pm. Sponsored by Known World Players.

name: 8th Annual Poker Card Tournament
description_book: Bear pit format: The loser stays to fight up to a max of three bouts before going back in line. Collect poker cards to make your best hand.
description_web: This is a bear pit-style format where the loser of the bout stays to fight the next fencer. Fencers stay until they have won or have 3 deaths. Double kills count towards the number of deaths. Fencers leaving the field, whether they won or lost, shall receive a poker card and shall keep up to 7 cards. The winner of the tournament shall be determined by the best poker hand of 5 cards. This format will be run twice to determine two winners. There will also be a volunteer winner chosen at random from the marshals that help assist in running the tournament. You could win by playing or by volunteering!

name: Weed Walk
description_book: Wild plant identification. Wear walking shoes and hat; leave from Univ. Point. Different teachers on different days; walk with us more than once!
description_web: Cooper's Lake abounds with medicinal and food plants that were used by various primitive and medieval cultures. Learn to identify them during a walk around the campsite. The walk will take place rain or shine. Please wear sturdy shoes and a hat. Meet at University Point for the start of the class. We have multiple teachers, so if you attend more than one walk you will likely learn different things!

name: *Mehteran*: Ottoman Janissary Band
description_book: *Osmanlı Mehter Takımı* (Ottoman Janissary Band) studies music and history of the Ottoman *Mehter* military marching band from the 14th-17th century.
description_web: The *Osmanlı Mehter Takımı* (Ottoman Janissary Band) studies music and history of the Ottoman *Mehter* military marching band from the 14th-17th century. The Mehteran will learn the historic Ottoman song, *Ceddin Deden*, played on *zurna, davul,* horns, cymbals, and kettledrums, and sung by a choir, and will learn the historic Janissary march for performance at Pennsic. Further details on the Mehteran Facebook Group: https://www.facebook.com/groups/134233213955988/

name: Left-Handed Calligraphy
description_book: A hands-on introduction to the tools, techniques, and challenges for any left-handed calligrapher. Materials provided.

name: Stabbing Fabric for Fun and Clothing (Youth Class)
description_book: [YouthU 11-17] Learn the basics of hand-sewing, core stitches, techniques for quality sewing, and an overview of tricks and tools.
description_web: [YouthU 11-17] Learn the basics of hand-sewing, core stitches, techniques for quality sewing, and an overview of tricks and tools. This is a hands-on class teaching how to mend garb and/or sew it completely by hand. This class is meant for young people ages 11-17. No experience is necessary.
fee_itemization: Kits will include linen fabric swatch, linen thread, wax and a sewing needle.

name: SCA 101
description_book: Getting started in the SCA: history; geography; titles & regalia; what to do in your first year; you've been called into Court - now what?
description_web: Getting started in the SCA: history; geography; titles & regalia; what to do in your first year; you've been called into Court - now what?

name: Embroider Your Heraldry!
description_book: Learn two quick and easy stitches for embroidering heraldry.
description_web: Learn two quick and easy stitches for embroidering heraldry. You will be shown examples of Long Arm Cross Stitch and Kloster Stitch, and then you will learn both stitches. These are perfect for filling areas of heraldry quickly. Bring embroidery supplies or use mine. There will be free handouts for both stitches.

name: Intro to Old Norse Poetry: Poetic Language
description_book: Learn how mythology, kennings, heiti and specialized word orders were used in writing Old Norse poetry, and the terms that described Old Norse Poetry.
description_web: Learn poetic language used in writing Old Norse Poetry such as *kennings* and *heiti* (which were frequently based on mythology and legends) and unusual word orders. Additionally, you will learn the terminology used to describe characteristics of Old Norse poetry. This class will help you understand all other Old Norse poetry classes that I teach.
fee_itemization: $1.00 for paper handout.  Electronic handout is free.

name: Assembling Lamellar Armor
description_book: Discuss lamellar plate types, develop a template for your body, learn assembly tips when using paracord, learn how to space straps and buckles.
description_web: Lamellar armor is easy to assemble, fits different body sizes and shapes, and is adaptable to body changes. We will discuss plate types and patterning. I will give you suggestions how to develop a template for your body. Though traditionally laced with leather, learn assembly tips when using paracord. There will also be details on leather edging and how to space straps and buckles.

name: Eight Essential Knots for the SCA Camper
description_book: Hands-on class on how to tie eight basic and important knots that can make your camping life easier and safer.
description_web: Hands-on class on how to tie eight basic and important knots that can make your camping life easier and safer.

name: Basic Hand-Embroidery
description_book: Using simple embroidery stitches, create a small sampler of period embroidery.
description_web: Using simple embroidery stitches, students will create a small sampler of period embroidery which can be turned into a small bag suitable for concealing a mobile device. Small hoops (3-4") are available to borrow, or bring your own. Your own scissors will be helpful but are not essential.

name: Mending the Air
description_book: A discussion of how scent is used to "mend" qualities of "bad air", how "bad air" brings on the plague and melancholy.
description_web: A discussion of how scent is used to "mend" qualities of "bad air", how "bad air" can cause plague and melancholy. This is the original aromatherapy. Some scents may be sampled.

name: Telling Stories as Your Persona
description_book: How to tell stories in a way that creates the illusion of a period story being told to a period audience, along with a discussion of sources.
description_web: How to tell stories in a way that creates the illusion of a period story being told to a period audience, along with a discussion of sources.

name: *Iznik* Art and Tile Work
description_book: This class will survey prevalent designs found in traditional Ottoman tile work to include symbolism. Sample designs included.
description_web: This class will survey the prevalent design concepts within the Ottoman empire to include any symbolism attached to the icons. Finally, tiles will be provided for students to try their hand at painting an *Iznik* design.
fee_itemization: paint, brushes, plastic stencils, individual 4x4" tile

name: Espionage and Covert Action In the Elizabethan Age
description_book: A survey of Elizabeth's intelligence service, spymasters, codes, and night's black agents, as well as the litany of conspiracies and plots they faced!

name: Powering Medical Devices at Pennsic
description_book: How to power your CPAP machine or other medical device in the middle of camp at Pennsic without an extension cord.

name: Introduction to *Commedia*
description_book: Are you curious about "those *commedia* performers?" Join Lady Avelina del Dolce for the an introductory *commedia* class!
description_web: You may see us perform at the Performing Arts Amphitheater and Pavilion at Pennsic, SCA events, feasts and parties. So are you curious about "those *commedia* performers?" This class will cover the basics of *commedia dell'arte* and include information from Lady Sophia the Orange's "Intro to *Commedia*" handout along with assistant instructors, Andres Reed and Emma Barfoot, *commedia* fools from troupe Vagando Stoliti! You don't want to miss the foolish fun!

name: Archery Practice
description_book: Warm up, practice shoot, and have fun on the Archery Range.

name: Beginning *Atlatl*
description_book: Learn the basics of *atlatl* safety: how to hold the *atlatl*, load a dart, and throw the dart.
description_web: Learn the basics of *atlatl* safety: how to hold the *atlatl*, load a dart, and throw the dart.

name: Making Glass Beads Using Clay Kiln
description_book: How to make beads in the style of the Vikings using a beehive or volcano-style clay kiln. Class participation encouraged. Come for all or part.
description_web: How to make beads in the style of the Vikings using a beehive or volcano-style clay kiln. Both styles of kilns are expected to be available. Class participation encouraged. Come for all or part of the class.

name: *Game of the Goose*
description_book: Period game in the style of *Chutes and Ladders*. We will review the rules and then play through a game, dice willing.
description_web: Period game in the style of *Chutes and Ladders*. The game is purely deterministic (dice-based) so it is suitable for children, but for adults it is often played with stakes to make repeated play more interesting. We will review the rules and then play through a game, dice willing.

name: Zill Like a Dancer: Think like a Musician
description_book: Learn to play zills (finger cymbals) for dance, but with a musician's understanding of the rhythms and patterns.
description_web: Learn to play zills (finger cymbals) with a musician's ear. With a background in both music and dance, your instructor has found a way to bridge the gap for more successful understanding of rhythmic patterns, timing, and ultimately playing alongside musicians successfully. We will start with a zilling warm-up to increase speed and evenness between the right and left hand, moving on to basic zill patterns used in Middle Eastern dance. Finally, we will play with ways to spice them up with musical understanding. Limited loaner sets of zills will be available, however, it is recommended to come with your own set that fit your fingers. This class will have quite a bit of seated time so bring whatever will make you comfortable.

name: Pennsic Pile Practice
description_book: Bring your Pile, stand, and instruments to play obscure tunes from the Pile. All instruments and skill levels welcome.
description_web:
Do you have a copy of the Pennsic Pile of Music and want to play with other musicians? Bring your Pennsic Pile, music stand, and instruments and we’ll play together! All instruments and skill levels welcome. 
Bring your requests. I intend to play more obscure tunes that are not often requested for dancing.

name: Card-Weaving Basics
description_book: Using the continuous warping method, you will warp the loom and, using cards, you will weave a narrow strip.
description_web: Warp a loom and weave a small strap or trim piece. Using the continuous warping method, you will warp the loom and weave a narrow strip. Classroom loaner looms available or bring your own. Class limited to 5 looms. Fee covers string and cards; take your work home with you.

name: Music from the Iberian Peninsula
