description_book: Bring instruments or voices. Sight-singing skills useful. Music from the Spanish and Portuguese kingdoms from the 13th to 16th centuries.
description_web: Find new music to bring back to your home groups. Bring instruments or voices. Sight-singing skills useful but not required. Music from the Spanish and Portuguese kingdoms from the 13th to 16th centuries. Other languages beside Spanish and Portuguese will be represented. There is an emphasis when learning the songs of understanding a historically-informed use of the languages. Students are highly encouraged to have access to the book by Timothy McGee, *Singing Early Music*. Sheet music provided.

name: Empty Tent Place Holder - 2 hrs
description_book: Some loud classes need an empty tent next to them. This is that tent.

name: Empty Tent Place Holder - 2 hrs
description_book: Some loud classes need an empty tent next to them. This is that tent.

name: Introduction to Celtic Knotwork
description_book: Students will learn a "five dot" technique to create a simple knotwork design. Handout and a pencil will be provided.

name: Æthelmearc-Sponsored Novelty Shoot
description_book: Daily novelty shoots hosted by the Kingdom of Æthelmearc. These shoots will be simple fun shoots for any skill level.

name: In Search of Anglo-Saxon Recipes
description_book: Is it possible to uncover Anglo-Saxon recipes in known manuscripts? I have a working theory to share.
description_web: Is it possible to uncover Anglo-Saxon recipes in known manuscripts? I have a working theory. A review of Ann Hagen's research and other sources on available food stuffs, cooking methods, and known habits that can point us to possible recipes.

name: Knitting in the 16th Century: An Overview
description_book: Not only is hand-knitting period, the 16th century has a wealth of items to choose from. We'll look at a wide range of caps, gloves, and hosen.
description_web: Not only is hand-knitting period, the 16th century has a wealth of items to choose from. We'll look at a wide range of caps, gloves, and hosen. Interested in Eleanora of Toledo's stockings? I was the first to publish the pattern!
fee_itemization: I have a handout with extensive bibliography.

name: Chemist-Cheese or Basic Cheesemaking
description_book: Learn how to make ricotta cheese to impress your friends! No experience/all ages. Everyone will get to try fresh ricotta at the end of class.
description_web: What happens when you heat up milk and add vinegar? Come find out! Science, only tastier! Class geared towards children but adults are welcome.

name: Block Carving
description_book: [TeenU Age 13+] Students who choose to carve will be given a 3"x4" piece of carving material. Students may bring design. Sharp tools, 5 person limit.
description_web: [TeenU Age 13+] Students who choose to carve will be given a 3"x4" piece of carving material. Students will be given design options but may bring their own design (devices, etc., are popular). Participants are welcome to bring a design to carve but should be sure to reverse the design (mirror image) if the direction of the design matters. An example may be if a bird faces left on one's device, one should print the image with the bird facing right.

name: *Skomorokh*: Comedic Minstrel Theatre of Russia
description_book: An unbroken lineage spanning 600 years, the *skomorokhi* were the oft-persecuted minstrels, buffoons, harlequins, puppeteers of medieval Russia.
description_web: With an unbroken lineage spanning more than six centuries, learn of the *skomorokhi*, the oft-persecuted minstrels, buffoons, harlequins, musicians, and puppeteers of medieval and Renaissance Russia!

name: Make Your Own Medallion Cord
description_book: [YouthU] Why wear a plain white string? Learn *slung*, cord-making described as juggling with strings! Children welcome with adult. OK to be late.
description_web: [YouthU] Why wear a plain white string? Learn *slung*, a method for cord-making that can best be described as juggling with strings! Children welcome with adult. *Slung* is also known as Viking whip-cording. It is not only useful but a lot of fun for all ages. Can be done as a children's activity or at demos. Bring a friend! People will be taking turns on a limited number of set-ups. Showing up late is perfectly fine.

name: Vegetables from the  Italian Cookbook *Banchetti*
description_book: Recipes for fresh beans in the pod, fried gourds, to make onions in the frying pan, sliced turnips in cheese and butter, and a pea pod recipe.

name: Viking Wire Weaving
description_book: A hands-on class for learning to do basic wire weaving, including drawing down and finishing. I will have basic tools and supplies for students
description_web: A hands-on class for learning to do basic wire weaving, including drawing down and finishing. I will have basic tools and supplies for students, a handout, and kits available for purchase.
fee_itemization: Handout, tools, and supplies for in class are included. Additional supplies can be bought separately.

name: How to Eat a Feast for SCA Newcomers
description_book: "Are you staying for feast?" Learn what to expect, and what is expected, during mealtimes at an SCA event.
description_web: "Are you staying for feast?" Learn what to expect, and what is expected, during mealtimes at an SCA event. Topics will include sideboard vs. feast, feast gear, making a reservation, wet/dry sites, food allergies.

name: Iron *Commedia*: Creating a New 16th-Century Play
description_book: We will cast and perform a brand new *commedia* play in just one afternoon, with its world premiere at the Performing Arts Amphitheater that same day!
description_web: If you've ever laughed at the zany antics of improvisational *commedia dell'arte*, if you just love improvisation or if you want to challenge yourself and try something new, come to Iron *Commedia*! Open to all participants, Iron *Commedia* is not a competition – it is a group challenge where we will craft, cast, and perform a brand new *commedia* play in just one afternoon with its world premiere at the Performing Arts Amphitheater that same day!

location: Argent Fox (Merchant area behind the barn)
name: Harp for Absolute Beginners I
description_book: Come learn the very basics of playing harp! Please bring a harp if you have one and a chair if you need one. Prior experience not necessary. All ages.
description_web: A very basic introduction to the fundamentals of modern harp, that is to say **hand position**! Learn how not to injure yourself playing! Please bring a harp if you have one and a chair if you need one; we will be holding the class at Argent Fox and can borrow his harps and chairs, but he only has so many and I don't know how many students will attend. We will review hand position, go over a couple basic exercises to practice with, and I will provide handouts with a simple tune to practice. Ability to either read music or memorize a definite plus, but anyone's welcome to show up, and I'll teach you what I can. All ages emphatically welcomed. This is the first in a sequence of two classes. Class is aimed at nylon-strung harps; wire-strung are welcome but I can't teach wire-strung style (which is different), though I will try to point you at people who can.

name: Research for the Non-Researcher
description_book: Forgotten or never learned basic research skills? This class will jump-start your research process.
description_web: How to begin a research project, with an introduction to easily available paper and web resources. The teacher is an academic research librarian. We'll talk about free web-based tools, useful apps, and when it might be worth a trip to brick-and-mortar research centers.

name: Pre-16th-Century Musical Modal Improvisation
description_book: This is a practical application class for musicians to learn improvisational skills that were practiced in the Middle Ages.
description_web: Musician class for acoustic instruments to learn medieval modal improvisation that will teach the student to create melodies on the spot for both free form and structured rhythmic forms. Students are required to be very familiar with their instruments. Reading music is not required but really helps, especially your major and natural minor scales.

name: Beginner Dance: English Country Dance
description_book: Never danced before? No problem! This class starts with basic steps and patterns, then teaches simple English country dances.
description_web: Never danced before? No problem! This class starts with basic steps and patterns, then teaches simple English country dances.

name: Youth Falconry
description_book: Glider birds for the young! Come and enjoy a short lesson on the art of falconry followed by birds everywhere!
description_web: Glider birds for the young! Come and enjoy a short lesson on the art of falconry followed by birds everywhere! A trophy will also be awarded to the youth with the best distance and also the longest time in flight! Their Majesties of each kingdom and or their representatives are cordially invited to attend and cheer! Must have adult escort.

name: Beginning *Repoussé* and Chasing
description_book: Hands-on class; we will make a copper foil rose.
description_web: Hands-on class; we will make a copper foil rose.

name: Known World Choir
description_book: Do you like to sing? Come learn period music in a period style. Rehearsals are daily from 12-2 in the PARC.
description_web: Do you like to sing? Come learn period music in a period style. Rehearsals are daily from 12-2 in the PARC. Concert is Thursday 8/9 at 6:00 pm. Music is available on the Known World Choir Website. Pre-registration is requested although **not** required. All voice parts are welcome. This choir is adults only; however, there are other choirs for teens and children. The music for this year is all about battles and war!! While reading music is helpful it's not necessary. Practice tracks will be available on the choir's website in May. Please bring a 1" black folder for your music and a pencil.

name: KWP Pennsic Readers' Theater: Open Youth Rehearsal
description_book: Youth Readers' Theatre gives youth (ages 8-14) an opportunity of being in a low-stress theatre production, *The Marvelous Misadventures of Baba Yaga*.
description_web: Known World Players, Youth Readers' Theatre, will give the youth (ages 8-14) an opportunity to experience a low-stress theatre experience by creating a staged reading of *The Marvelous Misadventures of Baba Yaga* by Patrick Dorn. A staged reading means that the actors will be performing the play with the script in hand. No audition necessary; attend both rehearsals. To be performed Friday, 8/4, in the Performing Arts Tent at 6:00 pm. Children under 12, please bring a parent or guardian.

name: Intro to *Kanzashi* Flowers
description_book: This is an introductory class in making basic *Kanzashi* Flower traditional hair ornaments worn in Geisha hair styles.
description_web: This is an introductory class in making basic 6-petal *Kanzashi* Flowers, which are traditional hair ornaments worn in Geisha hair styles. Each student will be provided with all necessary pre-prepared materials necessary to complete their very own *Kanzashi* Flower in this class.
fee_itemization: All necessary pre-prepared materials necessary to complete a 6 petal Kanzashi Flower in the traditional style.  All necessary tools will be provided.

name: A Hand A Day: Early Gothic Calligraphy
description_book: Beginning calligraphers will use a marker to learn the techniques needed to write this 11th-12th-century script successfully. All materials provided.
description_web: Early Gothic calligraphy was a popular hand used during the eleventh and twelfth centuries. In this hands-on class for beginners, students will use a calligraphy marker to learn the techniques needed to write this hand successfully. All materials provided.
fee_itemization: Interested students may purchase the marker used in class for $2

name: Color Beyond Red, Blue, and Yellow
description_book: Using paint, create an extensive color wheel.
description_web: While creating a color wheel, learn to mix the colors you need. By playing and making mistakes now, you'll avoid creating muddy colors when it counts . . . in your art.

name: Redacting Recipes from Period Manuscripts
description_book: Working with recipes that do not come with measurements to get edible results.
description_web: How to communicate over the centuries with that maddening person that thought what he wrote was enough for anyone to make the recipe. An exploration of period sources, tips to unlock the intent without holding a séance. We will then experiment with making a turnip taste good with spices from an *Epulario* recipe.

name: It Was Grown, but Was It Served?
description_book: Many New World foods were grown in European gardens, but few were considered fit to eat. Misconceptions about use of New World foods in period.
description_web: Many New World foods were grown in European gardens, but few were considered fit to eat. Misconceptions about use of New World foods in period.

name: Dining with the Sultan: A Taste of Ottoman Cuisine
description_book: Cook & eat 2 dishes using actual 15th and 16th C. Ottoman sources. Discuss Ottoman cuisine in Constantinople. Not suitable for vegetarians or vegans.
description_web: Using actual 15th- and 16th-century Ottoman recipes, we will cook and eat two dishes: a meat dish and a grain or vegetable dish. As we cook, I will discuss Ottoman cuisine in Constantinople, especially that of the palaces. Information includes street food and market regulations. Also what was served to the Sultans and their pages, to European diplomats at palace feasts, and at circumcision festivals for the Sultans' sons. Please bring kitchen knives and pot holders, if you can. Includes recipe handout. Not suitable for vegetarians or vegans.
fee_itemization: Material fee will cover meat, grain, any fruits and/or vegetables, onions and/or garlic, fresh herbs, canned chickpeas, packaged chicken broth. I will supply spices, sugar, and specialty ingredients from my own kitchen.

name: *Gerdany*
description_book: This is a Ukrainian folk craft, using seed beads to create beautiful netting. Class will be making a two-color necklace.
fee_itemization: Beads, cord, clasps, jump rings, other findings

name: Block Printing
description_book: [YouthU 12+] Participants will have an introduction to block printing in period, and will have the option to print on a flour sack towel.
description_web: [YouthU 12+] Participants will get an introduction to block printing in period, and will have the option to print on a flour sack towel. Pre-made blocks will be available in both European and Indian designs. Participants are welcome to print with pre-made blocks or carve and use an original design, or one from period sources in the block-carving class in the previous session.
fee_itemization: Flour sack towel and printing materials.

name: Labyrinths
description_book: Labyrinths are found in many cultures. But what are they? A maze, a pilgrimage, an intricate pattern? This class will try to unravel the mystery.
description_web: Labyrinths are found in many cultures. But what are they really? Mazes? The medieval substitute for a pilgrimage to Jerusalem? An intricate pattern? All of the above? This class will try to unravel the mystery.

name: Peerage Basics and Roundtable
description_book: This is a discussion-based roundtable for peers and non-peers. What is the peerage about and what can peers do better?
description_web: This is a discussion-based roundtable for peers and non-peers. What is the peerage about and what can peers do better? During this session, we will talk about the peerages, the highest awards in the SCA, and we will have peers there to talk about what their peerages mean to them and how the peerages have changed their SCA experiences. Given on behalf of Liam St Liam who can't make it to War this year.

name: History of the Hammered Dulcimer and Psaltery
description_book: An overview of the intertwining history of the psaltery and the hammered dulcimer from their roots and into their European travels.
description_web: An overview of the intertwining history of the psaltery and the hammered dulcimer from their roots in Asia/Middle East and into their European travels. There may be some hands-on time at the end of the class on the dulcimer. **Note: This class is discreetly tech friendly.** For access to my creative commons sources, bring a storage device or something I can plug a memory stick into and I will gladly share sources and paperless class notes.

name: Nigel's Fire-Starting Class
description_book: You too can start a fire with flint and steel. We will explore the history of fire and how to start a fire with flint and steel. You will make fire.
description_web: Formerly titled “How to Start a Fire Like a Moderately Intelligent Saxon”. Yes, you too can start a fire with flint and steel like a Saxon, Roman, Viking, or any other civilized culture in the Middle Ages. Includes history of fire and the flint-and-steel mechanics of starting a fire. Hands-on class; you will start a fire. You must be at least 14 years old and have your parents' or wife’s permission.
fee_itemization: Instructor is not charging for the materials.

name: Catalina De Erauso: The Lieutenant Nun
description_book: The history of a woman who ran away from a Dominican convent and lived as a man in the 15th century. Roundtable discussion to follow.
description_web: This class will go into the personal memoirs of a woman who ran away from a convent in Spain to live as a man in the New World. There will be a roundtable about gender representation in period at the end of the class.

name: 16th-Century Italian Courtesans
description_book: A study of the unique and glamorous lives of the 16th-century "Rock Star Prostitutes", their education skills, lifestyle and accomplishments.
description_web: A study of the unique and glamorous lives of the 16th-century "Rock Star Prostitute," their education, skills, lifestyle, clothing, and accomplishments. We will also discuss their clients, fan-base, society’s perception, and their detractors. This is the definitive class on the subject with an extensive handout which includes short essays on sections of the class, a complete book list, and a collection of sources for the proper education of a courtesan. This class is only for individuals 18 and older.

name: Newcomers' Guide to Pennsic Performing Arts
description_book: What shows are tonight? Where is that stage? Come learn about the performing arts!
description_web: New to Pennsic and wondering what all those shows are each evening? Having trouble finding one of the stages? Want to discover all the fabulous entertainment? Come learn about all the performing arts that Pennsic has to offer!

name: Belly Dance Drills
description_book: In this all-levels class, we will drill muscular isolations and layers, footwork and languid movements to help refine your dance.
description_web: In this all-levels class, we will drill muscular isolations and layers, footwork and languid movements to help refine your dance. We will include a short warm-up and cool down.

name: Beginning Galliards
description_book: The galliard is an aerobic 16th-century pan-European dance. Come learn the basics!

name: *Tarot* the Card Game
description_book: The game of *tarot*, the trick-taking game. We will play it.
description_web: We will go over the rules of *tarot*, the card game, and play it.

name: OTS/Orientale Tribal Style Group Improv
description_book: Combines Tribal improv group fun and the joyful freedom of cabaret, this is some of the most fun you and your dance friends can have!
description_web:
The world reknowned, yet newest, of the Group Improv formats! Combining the improvisational group fun of tribal and the joyful freedom of cabaret, this is some of the most fun you and your dance friends can have! OTS is a creation of Ziah and the Awalim Dance Company of Atlanta, GA. It is a group improvisational format based on American Tribal Style (ATS) by Carolena Nericcio and Fat Chance Belly Dance. This Improv dialect format has over 100 moves that span across ATS, modern Egyptian, classic Egyptian, American cabaret, Lebanese cabaret, Turkish, and many more! 
The label “Tribal” indicates that the dancers create and perform as a group or tribe. **Each day will cover different moves which can be taken together or separately.**

name: Sprang Basics
description_book: Using the twisted warp-based weaving of sprang, create a useful pouch
description_web: Using the twisted warp-based weaving of sprang, create a useful pouch.

name: Beginner Thrown Weapons
description_book: Learn axe throwing, basic care of your weapons, and basic rules. A hands-on session is included. Limit of 25 participants; no experience necessary.
description_web: Learn axe throwing, basic care of your weapons, and basic rules. A hands-on session is included. Limit of 25 participants; no experience necessary.

name: Story Reading
description_book: I will read children's stories of various lengths with a medieval setting. Each individual story will be 3-37 pages. I wrote these. They are new.
description_web: I will read children's stories of various lengths with a medieval setting. Each story will be 3-37 pages. They are new and fiction, not retelling of sagas already known.

name: *Shūji*: Taking the Brush - Japanese Calligraphy
description_book: A hands-on introduction to Japanese calligraphy for official documents. Please bring large bamboo writing brushes and ink stones if you have them.
description_web: A hands-on introduction to designing and executing Japanese official documents. This class will introduce the role of the scribe in imperial and military governments. Epistolatory style and the structure of official documents will be introduced. Participants will learn about the evolution of character styles and how documents were attested. We will also discuss paper and signature seals. The bulk of the class will consist of a hands-on calligraphy class similar to those held in Tokyo. Please bring large bamboo writing brushes, ink stones, paper weights, and *hanshi*-size felt mats if you have them. There will be limited loaner supplies of all of these available at class. Paper and ink is included in the class materials fee.
fee_itemization:
Covers production cost of the handout. I have been advised to include a handout for this class.

Cost of paper and ink

name: Beginning Engraving
description_book: Hands-on class. Intro to tools, first cuts, graver control, hammer use.
description_web: Hands-on class. Intro to tools, first cuts, graver control. Student will learn both hand-held and hammer-struck engraving.

name: Beer and Brewing in 16th-Century Germany
description_book: A pub crawl through Germany, as well as a description of period beer brewing techniques, and discussion of possible recipes.
description_web: A pub crawl through late 1500s Germany, as written by a doctor of the period. Brief discussion of the beers from numerous towns, as well as period beer naming practices. Description of a period brewing system (from raw grain to tapping the barrel), and discussion of possible recipes. (Focus on *Einbecker Bier* and *Braunschweiger Mumme*.)
fee_itemization: Fee (optional) for handout. Only 25 available per session. No materials.

name: Project Yourself Before You Wreck Yourself
description_book: Covering vocal projection techniques useful for Court or any public presentation. It's not just about **LOUD**.
description_web: There are many opportunities for non-heralds to speak in Court: tournament results, event recaps, presentations, and peerage ceremonies. Learn some of the things you can do, both in preparation and presentation, to keep the people in the back of the room informed and involved.

name: Venus in Breeches: The Roaring Girl and Gender
description_book: A facilitated discussion of the Renaissance play *The Roaring Girl*, and how it deals with Moll Frith, the play's transvestite namesake.
description_web:
Middleton's *The Roaring Girl* takes its name from a famous figure in early modern London, Mary Frith (aka Moll Cutpurse), a woman famous for her male costume, dueling, and rowdy lifestyle. This city comedy incorporates Moll as a central character, highlighting her non-conformist behavior at the same time that she merrily swaggers her way through it. We'll talk about the play's treatment of gender, particularly of Moll, and some historical contexts for gender roles and gender transgression in Renaissance London.

Knowledge of the play is not absolutely necessary, but students should ideally have read the text.  (Available in paperback or in a free online edition at: http://www.tech.org/~cleary/roar.html  )

name: Embroidery for Children and the Young at Heart
description_book: Children learned to embroider at a young age in the Middle Ages. Children as young as four years old can manage freehand embroidery.
fee_itemization: Favor blank, small hoop, needle, embroidery floss.

name: How to Create Your Own Equestrian Gaming Equipment
description_book: Equestrian gaming constructions and SCA-equestrian rule book.
description_web: Covers equestrian gaming equipment including quintain (shock and spinning), ring stands, heads and other fun obstacles. We will review the equestrian handbook for weapon regulations and possible set-ups for competitions.

name: Adding Color to a Bland Leather World
description_book: Period leather was available in variety of colors. Learn about what colors were possible, and walk away with dye recipes to try at home.
description_web: We often default to natural colors (various browns and tans) for leather goods if we want things to look “period”. However, there is significant evidence that medieval and Renaissance leatherworkers would have had a variety of colors to choose from. This class will discuss sources for period dye recipes and how they might have been used. You’ll be able to see some completed experiments with the dyes and take home copies of some recipes to try at home (both the original text and redacted versions).

name: Coaching and the Art of Constructive Criticism
description_book: Discover proven NPS coaching techniques to cultivate critique that aids and inspires rather than crushing talent before it can bloom. Coach the Dream!
description_web: We all hear the cries of the populace - or at least the artists-to-be and the volunteers-to-be - that they tried and were rendered low by sharp criticism. Here you can discover proven coaching techniques from a National Park Service Registered Coach. Learn to shape artistic performance and presentation or volunteer service into something that serves the Dream rather than drives people away!

name: Make & Take a Fabric-Painted Pouch
description_book: Paint a fabric pouch using a stencil, then learn to fingerloop braid the drawstring closure. Provided paint, stencils, fabric, & fiber limited to 20.
description_web: Paint a fabric pouch using a stencil, then learn to fingerloop braid the drawstring closure. Students will leave with a finished product. Provided paint, stencils, fabric, and fiber limited to 20 students. If there is a specific design you would like to paint, then please bring your own stencil or simple template.
fee_itemization: Cost covers paint, stencils, fabric, & fiber.

name: *Opus Anglicanum*
description_book: Come and learn goldwork embroidery! Play with shiny thread! With one easy stitch and a bit of patience, create beautiful pieces!
description_web: Come and learn goldwork embroidery! Play with shiny thread! With one easy stitch and a bit of patience, create beautiful pieces! If you have scissors or snips, please bring them, otherwise some will be available to share.
fee_itemization: Gold thread, regular thread, hoop, needle, fabric, wax, stencils.

name: Scadian Journeys: Brittany and Mont St.-Michel
description_book: Exploring the history, lore, and modern-day travel details for historical, chivalric, religious, Arthurian, and mythic sites across Brittany!
description_web: Exploring the history, lore, and modern-day travel details for historical, chivalric, religious, Arthurian, and mythic sites across Brittany! Includes Bertrand du Guesclin. The Combat of the Thirty, Merlin's Tomb, the Grail Chapel, Dinan, Rennes, the Forest of Broceliande, the Battle of Auray, the Standing Stones of Carnac, horse rentals, and the living wonder that is Mont St.-Michel!

name: Getting Garbed! Clothing for Newcomers
description_book: Learn about the basics of garb.
description_web: Some people come to their first event already knowing exactly who they want to be, what they want to look like, and how to achieve that look. The rest of us must do some research and ask for help.

name: Medieval Folk Dance
description_book: Come learn a variety of pre-1600 folk dances including set dances and line dances! No experience necessary; left feet welcome!
description_web: Come learn a variety of pre-1600 dances that would be considered "folk dance" by modern definitions of the term, including set dances and line dances! No experience necessary; left feet welcome!

name: *Gracca Amorosa*
description_book: Sixteenth-century Italian dance for two, *Gracca Amorosa* is bouncy, athletic, and tons of fun. Bring friend or find partner there. All steps taught.

name: Ottoman Singing Class
description_book: Rehearsal of past songs for performance, and learning a new Ottoman song, "*Ceddin Deden*."
description_web: We will be rehearsing past songs for performance this year, and teaching the Ottoman martial composition "*Ceddin Deden*," that was/is commonly performed in the Mehteran Janissary Band. This piece of music is typically performed with singing. As such, we will be teaching a singing class to learn this song in the original Ottoman Turkish language. What will you learn and experience: an Ottoman song "*Ceddin Deden*" and its history; the musical modality *Makam Huseyni*; pronunciation of Ottoman Turkish along with a brief history and etymology. The 3 classes will be progressive; however, students may join in when they wish, although attendance at all the classes is strongly encouraged. Students may join the class's Facebook page in advance to orient themselves to the song and class: https://www.facebook.com/groups/398762226986519/

name: Sketch Comedy
description_book: Come join The Hanging Jesters to learn to write and perform sketch comedy! We will be preparing for Pennsic Night Live!! Class is open to all!
description_web: Learn how to develop, write and perform scripts for sketch comedy. Learn how to make a lineup for performance, rehearsal, staging, and much more!

name: Busking 101
description_book: An introduction to busking or street performing. This is a hands-on class so bring your show! No fire please.
description_web: An introduction to busking or street performing. This is a hands-on class so bring your show! No fire please.

name: Dwarves vs. Giants
description_book: This is a series of combats and melées between fighters five and a half feet and under and fighters six and a quarter feet and over.

name: Personalizing Scrolls
description_book: Different ways to make a scroll match the recipient's persona.

name: Use of Basic Silversmithing Tools
description_book: Silversmithing on a budget. Survey and demonstration of tools for use with nonferrous metals. Soldering and fusing demonstrations will be included.

name: Long-Armed Cross Stitch: Attractive, Authentic
description_book: More than just a background stitch in Assisi work, it goes faster, and is prettier, than common cross stitch. Versatile and widely used late period!
description_web: More than just a background stitch (as in Assisi work), it is a versatile stitch that was used in colorful embroideries. It goes faster, and is prettier, than common cross stitch. In late period, it was used on a broad variety of household objects, often to beautiful effect. We will look at photos of a wide variety of extant examples. Then, those new to the stitch will learn to do the stitch.

name: Growing Up in The SCA: A Roundtable
description_book: [YouthU] Ages 9-15 How do you build your own experience, separate from your parents when you've been in the SCA since birth? Come find out
description_web: [YouthU] Ages 9-15 How do you build your own experience, separate from your parents when you've been in the SCA since birth? Come find out. Meet youth and adults who have done just that, and learn about how to make the SCA more than just that thing your parents drag you to.

name: Beaded Flowers 1: Rose
description_book: Make a miniature rose in the style of beaded flowers of 16th-century Venice. If you have needle-nose pliers/wire cutters, bring them to class.
description_web: Make a miniature rose in the style of beaded flowers of 16th-century Venice. If you have needle-nosed pliers/wire cutters, please bring them to class. Not recommended for youth.

name: Walk Like a Phoenician: Dance in Ancient Sources
description_book: A basic history of ancient belly dance, based on Greek and Roman sources. NB: this is a dance **history** class, not a dance performance class.

name: The Friggin’ Holy Roman Empire
description_book: Why learn about the Holy Roman Empire? Weren’t they incredibly weak, out of control, irrelevant to my persona, and ultimately unsuccessful?
description_web: Why do I need to know about the Holy Roman Empire? Weren’t they incredibly weak, out of control, irrelevant to my persona, and ultimately unsuccessful? Why should I know anything about these people for my greater enjoyment of the SCA?

name: How to Enter Your First A&S Competition
description_book: Did you wish to enter an Arts and Sciences Competition? This class is for you.
description_web: We will go over the fine points of entering your first Arts and Sciences competition. The creative ideas put to paper, the research, the forms (oh, my) and enjoying the review of your feedback. How to enjoy being an artisan in the Society of Creative Anachronism.

name: Archery Marshal Meeting
description_book: All Archery Marshals are required to attend one meeting.

name: Improv: Beginning to Play
description_book: Start learning improvisation with some simple vocal & physical warm-ups!
description_web: Start your path for learning improvisation theatre with some simple vocal and physical warm-up exercises!

name: Making Your Own Rune Stave Set
description_book: Tossing rune tines (sticks) give a more nuanced reading. We'll make a set and discuss how to use them.
description_web:
Rather than just laying out tiles or tossing stones in a pattern, if you make tines or staves (sticks) and toss them, you get greater depth in a reading. How to either split, cut, carve, and color your own tines. I will bring wood; bringing your own knife or wood would be helpful, but not required. How to use them will be discussed. 
You can split tines from a "wrist size" branch (bring a sturdy knife if you have one), or an approximately 8-inch (pencil size) twigs, preferably from a fruit or nut tree, or one that offered its wood to you. In this case clippers would be helpful.

name: SCA Dance for Total Beginners
description_book: Curious about dancing but never tried it before? This class is for you! We'll learn some basic steps and an easy dance from four different traditions.
description_web: Curious about SCA dancing but never tried it before? This class is for you! We'll learn some very basic steps and then use simple terms to learn an easy dance from four different traditions: Inns of Court, English Country, bransles, and Italian. Specific dances are *Queen's Almain, Rufty Tufty, Double/Single Bransle*, and *Petit Vriens*.

name: Siege Engine Inspection
description_book: All siege engines intended for use in official Pennsic 47 martial activities **must** be inspected during one of the official inspection times.
description_web: **Please note: location change!** Siege engine inspections will take place on the battlefield per usual. However, siege **projectile** inspections will take place at the Siege Tent at the west end of the row of marshal tents. All siege engines intended for use in official martial activities at Pennsic 47 must be inspected during one of the official inspection times. Siege projectiles are welcome during the official inspection times, with re-inspection following any battle that includes siege. All projectiles must have the day's inspection paint.

name: Very Old Games: *Mancala*
description_book: *Mancala* has been played since at least 1000 BC and in 100s of traditional and modern variations. Learn some history and stay to play a few versions.
description_web: *Mancala* refers to a huge, ancient family of games that involve moving or "sowing" stones or "seeds" into pits with a goal of capturing the most stones. *Mancala* games have been played at least since 1000 BC, and there are hundreds of both traditional and modern versions. Learn some history and stay to play a few versions.

name: Advanced Engraving
description_book: Hand-engraving on copper plate. Letters and design work. Students will create a wax seal.
description_web: Hand-engraving on copper plate. Letters and design work. Students will create a wax seal.

name: Music to Pass the Time
description_book: What could be better than to break into song. Here is a collection of songs that are easy and fun to sing. Music will be provided or bring your copy.
description_web: Did you ever find time at an event where there just wasn't anything to do while you waited for the feast to be served or court was running late? What could be better than to break into song? Here is a collection of songs that are easy and fun to sing. Music will be provided or bring your copy of my booklet.

name: Rehearsal (Closed): ME&WDE Tech and Lighting Check
description_book: Space in use.
description_web: Space in use.

name: Loom-Woven Pouch
description_book: Create a tabby-woven pouch on a one-piece loom. Class limited to 10 looms.

name: Inkle Weaving Basics
description_book: Using the continuous warping method, you will warp the loom and weave an inkle strip.
description_web: Using the continuous warping method, you will warp the loom and weave an inkle strip. Classroom loaner looms available or bring your own; class limited to 10 looms.

name: Best of the Knowne Worlde Rapier Tourney
description_book: Come one, come all! Come watch the best of the best fight! Open only to those with a grant-level rapier awards, MoD, Knights, and Masters of Arms.

name: Youth Combat Afternoon Session
description_book: Youth Combat Lists open.
description_web: Youth Combat Lists open.

name: Scribal Isn't Scary: Scribing and Scrolls
description_book: Come and explore the basics of the scribal arts: the tools and materials, the tricks of the trade, the possibilities for getting started.
description_web: Ever wonder about the people who make the beautiful awards that are given out at Court and competitions? Ever want to be one? Ever considered becoming a scribe, but said to yourself, “I could never do that” – or thought that it’s too hard, too time consuming, too expensive? Come and explore the basics of the scribal arts with the current Deputy for New Scribes of Atlantia. Learn the tools and materials, the tricks of the trade, the possibilities for getting started. This is a chance for those both new to the SCA and new to scribing (calligraphy and illumination) to poke through an experienced scribe's “toybox”. If you’ve gotten a start on scribing but have questions, quandaries, and examples of your work so far, bring them. One of the best ways to improve your skills is to share with other artisans.
fee_itemization: copy of SCRIBAL ISN'T SCARY plus samples of 6 of the papers most commonly used for scribing

name: Calligraphy Pen Petting Zoo
description_book: Come try out a variety of dip pens, reed pens, and quill pens. Quill cutting will also be demonstrated.
description_web: As long as the pen gets the ink on the page, it doesn't matter what you use for calligraphy. However, some projects are better with the right tools. Come discuss the different kinds and try out something new. There will be a demonstration of quill cutting and information about supplies and resources.

name: The Way of Saint James: Pilgrims to Santiago
description_book: We examine the legends, history, battles, miracles, and lore of Spain's *Camino de Santiago*, in period and today, taught by former pilgrims.
description_web: We will examine the legends, history, and lore of the *Camino de Santiago*, with special emphasis on the nature of medieval pilgrimage, sites of special historic, religious, and cultural importance along the route, plus advice for planning and completing the pilgrimage today. Taught by former pilgrims. *¡Buen camino!*

name: An Enchanted Picnic
description_book: Shed the shackles of modernity and join us for an afternoon of dancing, dining, story telling, singing, conversation - all in persona!
description_web: Shed the shackles of modernity and join us for an enchanted afternoon of dancing, dining, story telling, singing, conversation - all in persona! This gathering shall be reminiscent of the picnics and noble gatherings described in works such as the *Decameron* and the *Book of the Courtier*. Whether or not you have a fully developed persona, come partake in a magical afternoon. Come prepared with a period-style story to tell, song to sing, dance to do or share. We shall even have the pleasure of a master lutenist to play for us!

location: Denys The Decadent (Denys the Decadent's Camp  EO8)
name: 12-Step Meetings
description_book: Daily meetings for those in any 12-step program such as AA, NA, OA, SA, Alanon, etc.
description_web: We welcome all in AA, NA, OA, SA, Alanon, etc., who are in any 12-step program to the 4:00 pm daily meeting at EO8 Denys The Decadent's Camp.

name: Intro to Glass Bead-Making with a Modern Torch
description_book: Learn the basics of glass bead-making using ancient principles, glass rod, and a modern hot torch. Basic history of glass included.
fee_itemization: Various colors of Glass rods, multiple mapp gas tanks, and bead release.

name: Folk Tunes of the Elizabethan Era
description_book: Learn to sing some broadside ballads and tunes collected by Thomas Ravenscroft. Then join us to sing around the lake, 9 pm, Sunday, August 5th!
description_web: Learn to sing some Elizabethan music, including various broadside ballads and tunes collected by Thomas Ravenscroft, the first collector of folk music. After class, join us to sing our way around the lake at 9 pm on Sunday, August 5th!

name: Yoga for Relaxation and Refreshment
description_book: A gentle yoga practice offered before the dinner hour. Repeating dates in Atlantian Royal; bring your mat and dress to flex.
description_web: A gentle yoga practice offered for those who aren't up early and prefer a before-dinner option. Repeating dates under the big tent in Atlantian Royal encampment, facilitated by a combination of teachers. Bring your yoga mat and wear comfortable clothing that allows flexibility. M,W,F Peace week, M, F War Week.

name: *Romani*: An Introduction to Gypsy Personas
description_book: Want a Gypsy persona, but don't know how/where to start? Learn about the Rom, their history, common pitfalls, and the fun of this fascinating persona.
description_web: Want a Gypsy persona, but don't know how/where to start? Learn about the Rom, their history, common pitfalls, and the fun of this fascinating persona.

name: *Chorale du Lac* (Bog Choir)
description_book: Choir class for all levels of singers, no exp. necessary, all voices welcome. Simple period partsongs, rounds, catches.
description_web:
We will warm up, discuss and practice new vocal, music theory, and choral skills each day, and then sing a selection of rounds, catches, and simple part songs from period sources. Each day will be a different class. This is a good choir class for beginning singers who want to sing together in a group for fun, and for experienced singers to take a refresher in choral singing and work on technique and tuning. No experiences necessary, all voices welcome. Instead of rehearsing for a performance, we will practice for learning's sake and go caroling in the Bog at the end of the series. 
Visit https://www.facebook.com/groups/1470354713287848/, the "Bog University" FaceBook group for more info.

name: Juggling Practice
description_book: Come together to meet with other performers and swap tricks, including ball, club, ring, *diablo*, flower sticks, and more. Part of the Fool's School.
description_web: Come together to meet with other performers and swap tricks, including ball, club, ring, *diablo*, flower sticks, and more. Part of the Fool's School.

name: Iron *Commedia*: World Premiere
description_book: Earlier this same day, a group of foolish players came together to craft, cast, and create a brand-new "16th-century" *commedia dell'arte* play!
description_web: Earlier this same day, a group of foolish players came together to craft, cast, and create a brand new sixteenth-century *commedia dell'arte* play to premiere before your very eyes! Sorry, we can't give you a plot synopsis because we only just built the plot a few hours before the performance! Come see the zany foolishness in extremely live theatre! (And don't miss when we do it again on War Week Thursday!) *Probably family-friendly but possibly some material inappropriate for very young children, but it's unknown until the play is crafted at the workshop earlier that day.*

name: Period Oil Lamps; Light Up the Bog!
description_book: Oil lamps are safe, period and inexpensive. Consider bringing a glass vessel to class and light up the Bog with a burning lamp!
description_web: Oil lamps were used to light lamps by all cultures throughout the Middle Ages. Learn how easy, inexpensive, compact and, best of all, **safe**oil lamps still are! Learn how to camp with just one bottle of cooking oil. Taught at Bog University this year; inexpensive wick kits and free oil will be available to allow everyone to depart the class with a burning oil lamp. Let's light up the Bog!
fee_itemization: $3 for a handout and 2 wick kits.

name: Medieval Glass Painting with Vitreous Enamel
description_book: Learn the history and techniques of the medieval glass painters' guild and try your hand at making a small piece. Work fired on-site.
description_web: Learn the history and techniques of the medieval stained glass painters' guild and try your hand at making a small piece. Students will use vitreous enamels and watch their work being fired in a kiln.

name: KWP Youth Readers' Theater
description_book: KWP Pennsic Youth Readers' Theater will perform a staged reading of *The Marvelous Misadventures of Baba Yaga* by Patrick Dorn.
description_web: Pennsic Youth Readers' Theatre will perform * The Marvelous Misadventures of Baba Yaga* by Patrick Dorn. This will be a script-in-hand performance by the youth of Pennsic, ages 8-14. This type of performance does not have costumes, sets, or lighting. Sponsored by the Known World Players. Open to all performers 8-14; see class listings for rehearsal details.

name: Bedtime Stories for Children
description_book: Nightly telling of stories for children.
description_web: 7 pm nightly: Stories and fables for children. All are welcome to attend; must have adult escort.

name: Evening with Bill W
description_book: Open AA meeting. All are welcome come join us around a fire for open discussion. All addictions welcome.
description_web: Open AA meeting. All are welcome come join us around a fire for open discussion. All addictions welcome.

name: KWP Pennsic Readers' Theater
description_book: KWP Pennsic Readers' Theater presents staged reading of  Ben Johnson's *Volpone (The Fox)*.
description_web: This is a staged reading of the script *Volpone (the Fox)* by Ben Johnson. A staged reading is a performance where the actors perform with the script in their hand and there are no props, costumes, scenery, or special lighting. Sponsored by Known World Players. See class listings for rehearsal details. *Some material may be inappropriate for children under 12.*

name: *Kumihimo* Basics
description_book: *Kumihimo*: cord braiding on a disk.
description_web: *Kumihimo*: cord braiding on a disk. Make a basic round cord. Disk and string provided; take your work home with you.

name: Youth Combat Evening Activities
description_book: Armored games.
description_web: Armored games.

name: Flamingo Ball
description_book: Flamingos flock, prance, fly and stand about elegantly. Dances will be in sets to reflect these habits. Pink and coral clothing is encouraged.
description_web: Flamingos flock, prance, fly and stand about elegantly. Dances will be in sets to reflect these flamingo habits. Pink and coral clothing is encouraged. Light refreshments provided.

name: David Anthony, The Creepy Bard
description_book: Gather round to hear as The Creepy Bard regales you with songs of drinking, roving, fighting, and things to keep secret from mother.
description_web: Gather round to hear as David Anthony, The Creepy Bard, regales you with songs of drinking, roving, fighting, and things to keep secret from your mother. You will laugh, cry, blush, and wonder where you left the whiskey. *Some material may be inappropriate for children under 12*.

name: Night Sky Over Pennsic
description_book: Family-friendly viewing of the night sky over Pennsic. Bring a camp chair or blanket if desired. A small telescope will be set up for viewing.
description_web:
Family-friendly viewing of the night sky over Pennsic. Bring a camp chair or blanket if desired. A small telescope will be set up for viewing.
As the battlefield is parking during the first week, the open area in front of Pennsic University Point will be used.

name: Lorelei Skye: Songs of Humor, Whimsy, and Woe!
description_book: Lorelei Skye returns performing yesteryear and original songs of humor, whimsy, and woe for your enjoyment!
description_web: Lorelei Skye returns performing yesteryear and original songs of humor, whimsy, and woe for your enjoyment! *Some material may be inappropriate for children under 12.*

name: PA Afternoon Series: European Music Expo
description_book: Hear and see a diverse program of European music by SCAdians from all over the Known World.
description_web: Hear and see a diverse program of European music by SCAdians from all over the Known World. This Expo is accepting program items. Would you like to preview your class, or do you have a local performing group? Have you wanted to perform in the PA tent but don't have a full program? This is the place to shine. 10-15 time slots are available. To register, please contact by email: PiaMaletesta@gmail.com. Looking for unique and different in Euro music. Ensembles welcome.

name: Yoga For Dancers, Fighters or Pretty Much Anyone
description_book: Yoga to help us through the rigors of War, regardless of our activities. Please bring a mat/towel and dress for modesty. Kids must bring guardian.
description_web: Yoga to help us through the rigors of War, regardless of our activities. Please bring a mat or towel and dress for modesty. Children may attend with parent/guardian present.

name: Coffee with Friends of Bill and Dr Bob
description_book: Morning recovery meetings in agnostic format.
description_web: Morning recovery meetings in agnostic format.

location: Thunder Bird Atlatl  (Thunder Bird Atlatl Booth #80?)
name: How to Make an *Atlatl* Dart
description_book: How to make an *atlatl* dart from start to cast. Limit of four students participating in each class.
fee_itemization: Kits: Basic Caster and 3 dart available from Thunderbird Atlatl for $40 or Caster $25 and/or $8 per Dart 5' or 6'.

name: Youth Combat Morning Session
description_book: Lists open.
description_web: Youth Fighting lists open.

name: Beginning Irish Language for SCAdians
description_book: The Irish language: pronunciation, basic grammar, introductions, counting, ask and answer questions, how to be polite.
description_web: Basic introduction to the Irish language (modern, sorry, not ancient). Learn pronunciation and grammar rules, pronouns and vocabulary, how to introduce yourself and tell someone where you are from, how to count and tell time, how to ask and answer simple questions, and how to politely say a few phrases like "please" and "thank you".

name: Fun with Site Tokens: Show 'n Tell
description_book: Bring your site tokens and share your stories. We hosted a Known World event and wanted to share/learn with others re cost, materials and concepts.
description_web: Our local group hosted a Known World event, and had to decide **whether** we should have site tokens and how to make them cost-effective. Should they be something period? Should they have the date and the event name on them? Should they be purchased or made by the populace? We will discuss our experience, but also want to learn from you! Please bring site tokens, and share your story of how you/your group came up with the idea, cost, other options, etc. We are hoping to have everyone go home with lots of ideas!!
fee_itemization: no handout, bring notepad to remember great ideas!

name: English Rosaries and Paternosters
description_book: Discussion of prayer beads (paternosters) in England from the 11th to 16th centuries, especially the impact of the English Reformation.
description_web: This class will focus on prayer beads (paternosters) in England from the 11th to 16th centuries, especially the impact of the English Reformation.

name: Medieval Irish and Anglo-Saxon Beads
description_book: The history of medieval Irish and Anglo-Saxon beads, including the different bead types and how they were worn in those cultures.
description_web: We'll start with an overview of the history of glass beads. We will then go more in depth into medieval Irish and Anglo-Saxon glass beads including the different bead types and how they were worn in those cultures. We will have our own projects and documentation to share with the class.

name: Enjoy Your Drawers: 16th-C Florentine Underwear
description_book: Compare recreations to period art and extant drawers. Includes a brief intro to *bara* tapes and a patterning demonstration.
description_web: This class will compare modern recreations of Italian drawers in relation to period depictions and extant examples. A brief introduction to the *bara* measuring system will be included, followed by a patterning demonstration using custom *bara* tapes. We will also discuss decorating your drawers in period style or having fun with modern decorations. Why not enjoy your drawers?

name: Beginning Tablet Weaving for Teens
description_book: [TeenU] Come and learn the basics of tablet weaving: how to read a pattern, thread the cards, and weave a basic pattern.
description_web: [TeenU] Come and learn the basics of tablet weaving: how to read a pattern, thread the cards, and weave a basic pattern. We'll talk a little bit about the history and use of tablet-woven bands, but mostly this will be hands-on. A limited number of basic looms available.
fee_itemization: Materials fee includes yarn, tablets, and a simple loom.

name: Alternative Scandinavian and Other Wirework Chains
description_book: Discussion of variants of chains found in the archaeological context, not including trichonopoly. Reproduced examples will be shown.

name: Historical Uses of Poisons
description_book: A rundown of the weaponization of poisons in history garnered from various resources.
description_web: A review of the weaponization of poisonous plants (and two rocks) as recorded in history. A summary garnered from various resources, the compilation paints a unique picture of warfare and weaponization techniques from several cultures.

name: The SCA and the IRS
description_book: IRS for fun and non-profit or how to lose our 501(c)(3) standing in five easy steps. This class is for everyone in the SCA.
description_web: IRS for fun and non-profit or how to lose our 501(c)(3) standing in five easy steps. This class is for everyone in the SCA. Over 100 non-profits lose their IRS standing every year. How to avoid that happening to the SCA. This is not a dry lecture. Questions are encouraged.

name: 12th-Century Women's Clothing
description_book: An overview of 12th-century women's clothing, including the elusive bliaut.
description_web: An overview of 12th-century women's clothing, including the elusive bliaut. This class examines period sources outside of the Chartres Portal Sculpture box to explore how women's clothing was made in the 12th century.

name: Cheese Selection: Green, New, Old and Others
description_book: An overview of how to select the proper type of cheese for your recipe redaction. Recipe made with different cheeses will be available for tasting.
description_web: Ever read a recipe that calls for "green cheese" and have no idea what they are talking about? This class will go over common terms found in recipes used to describe cheeses and what would be a good selection. We will also discuss the different results of using different cheeses in recipes. Samples of a redacted dish using different types of cheeses will be available for tasting. Bring your questions and let's figure it out! Class will focus on European recipes.

name: Ded Reckoning: Navigation in the Age of Columbus
description_book: How did early explorers know where they were and how did they get home? We'll explore the basics of ded reckoning and walk through some examples.
description_web: How did early explorers know where they were and how did they get home? We'll explore the basics of ded reckoning and walk through some examples. Bring your own protractor and graph paper if you have them. I'll have some to share. Uses high school-level math (geometry, algebra, resulting in vector addition). Don't worry.  I'll teach you if you don't already know.

name: Courtesan Persona 101
description_book: This is an **adults only** class for those interested in portraying a courtesan persona in the SCA.
description_web: This is an **adults only** class for those interested in portraying a courtesan persona in the SCA. People of all ages over 18 and all genders welcome. We will be discussing how to speak and act like an elite sex worker and how to handle a number of situations you might find yourself in while in persona at events. For a list of content warnings or any further information, please contact Ginevra at ginevrafiammettadisilvestri@gmail.com.

name: Simple Tunic and Pants Pattern
description_book: We will make a simple pattern for a tunic and pants using your measurements.
description_web: We will make a simple tunic and pants pattern using your measurements. We will draw out a very basic pattern for pants and a simple tunic which you will be able to take with you and use at home. Please bring a tape measure for body measurements, a pair of scissors, pen and paper to write down your measurements before making your pattern.
fee_itemization:
1.00 for handout
2.00 for non-paper pattern pieces

name: Saint Sebastian’s Shoot IX
description_book: A day of fun-filled archery with more than ten stations of creative novelty targets, hosted by the Atlantian archery community.

name: Introduction to *Ch'an* (*Zen*) Meditation
description_book: Intro to history, practice of *Ch'an* (*Zen*) meditation. Includes brief history and actual sitting meditation instruction. Bring cushion to sit on.
description_web: Introduction to the history and practice of *Ch'an* (*Zen* in Japanese) meditation. Includes a brief history of where this form of mediation came from and how/why it developed, including its relation to *Shaolin kung-fu*. This form of meditation has been practiced in China since the early 5th century. This will include actual sitting meditation instruction. Bring a cushion, towel or something else to place on the floor to sit on.

name: Battle of La Rochelle
description_book: The defenders of La Rochelle **will** die! The only question is, **when**? Join us at the Fort to find out. Heavy rapier and rubber band gun melée.
description_web: The defenders of La Rochelle **will** die! The only question is, **when**? Join us at the Fort to find out. Heavy rapier and rubber band gun melée. Attackers will have unlimited resurrections, defenders will have limited resurrections. RBG cannon are welcome. No archery, please. Pennsic standard rules for rapier apply. Don't have a heavy rapier? Bring a dagger or two. Bring a friend or 20. The more the merrier. Don't like to fight melée? Come and get close to the action and help marshal the battle. Please muster **at the Fort**  half an hour before the start time, especially if you want to fight along with a particular group.

name: Puzzles!
description_book: Come in and solve some puzzles, some ancient in origin and others relatively new.
description_web: Come in and solve some puzzles, some ancient in origin and others relatively new. I'll have physical ones such as the Tavern puzzles, Irish Lovers Linking Rings or construction puzzles; paper-based ones such as math and logic puzzles; verbal puzzles as told by bards and storytellers around the campfire.

name: Siege Engine Inspection
description_book: All siege engines wishing to participate in official Pennsic 47 martial activities **must** be inspected during one of the official inspection times.
description_web: **Please note: Location change!** Siege engine inspections will take place on the battlefield per usual. However, siege **projectile** inspections will take place at the Siege Tent at the West end of the row of marshal tents. All siege engines wishing to participate in official martial activities at Pennsic 47 must be inspected during one of the official inspection times. Siege projectiles are welcome during the official inspection times, with re-inspection following any battle that includes siege. All projectiles must have the day's inspection paint.

name: Waste-Free Garment Cutting
description_book: Twice the clothes from half the fabric...or at least, better clothes from less fabric. Come prepared to take notes.
description_web: Hand-spun, hand-woven, hand-finished...they never wasted a single thread. You don't have to! An overview of the thriftiest cutting and sewing tricks used in the SCA's target centuries. We cover only pre-17th century Western European clothing.

name: Gathering of the Louds
description_book: Shawms, sackbutts and curtals, oh my. Join other players of louds. Each session will feature a different style of music. Bring chair/stand.
description_web: Shawms, sackbutts and curtals, oh my. Players of loud Renaissance instruments gather just for fun to play different styles of music at each session such as *intradas* and other instrumental processionals and polychoral music. Not sure what these instruments are? Come listen or try one. Instruments will be available to share, but a reading knowledge of music is necessary. Bring a chair, music stand and clothespins.

name: Card-Weaving Basics
description_book: Using the continuous warping method, you will warp the loom and, using cards, you will weave a narrow strip.
description_web: Warp a loom and weave a small strap or trim piece. Using the continuous warping method, you will warp the loom and weave a narrow strip. Classroom loaner looms available or bring your own. Class limited to 5 looms. Fee covers string and cards; take your work home with you.

name: How to Write Poetry Like a Well-Mannered Thug
description_book: A poetry workshop for the aspiring heart! An introduction to varied period-specific forms. Come with longing, leave with poems of your own devising!
description_web: A poetry workshop for the aspiring heart! An introduction to various period-specific forms, devices, figurative language, the mysteries of enjambment and the acrostic! Come with longing, leave with poems of your own devising!

name: Youth Rapier Activities
description_book: There will be a variety of youth rapier activities each day including drills, games and one-on-one instruction. Some loaner gear will be available.
description_web: There will be a variety of youth rapier activities each day including drills, games and one-on-one instruction. Some days may include special additional activities. Some loaner gear will be available. Participants do not have to be authorized. Children age 6 and up may participate. Please bring your parent/guardian the first day you attend to learn more about the youth rapier program.

name: Ædult Swim at Pennsic
description_book: Duke Timothy of Arindale and Master Illadore de Bedegrayne will be holding the field along with many members of the Chivalry and Defense.
description_web:
Once again, Duke Timothy of Arindale and Master Illadore de Bedegrayne will be holding the field along with many members of the Chivalry and Defense of the Knowne World.

Did you miss ÆSwim in February? Well, now's your chance to do it in August.

Show us your skill at arms and the fire in your belly. Renown is earned by deeds.
We will train you. We will spar with you. We will, if you desire, bring our "A" game.
No excuses.
"They don't notice me". Make us.
"They never come to my shire". Here we are.
"I'm out of practice". You have two months.
"They don't fight my form". I'll match weapon forms if you like.

In Service,
Timothy and Illadore

name: Discovering a Calligraphic Hand That Suits You
description_book: Learn a hand that matches your own personal handwriting. Pens, inks, and paper will be available.
description_web: A hand that matches your personal handwriting is easier to learn and more enjoyable to practice. We will explore and experiment.

name: Lampworking: Making SCA Order Medallions
description_book: Demonstration of how to make glass beads & pendants for Society & Kingdom (East) level awards. Brainstorm strategies for making other Order pendants.
description_web: This class will be a demonstration of how to make glass beads and pendants for Society & Kingdom (East) level awards. After a few demonstrations, attendees are invited to bring pictures of other awards they might wish to create themselves, and the class will brainstorm strategies for making those other designs as time allows. I have made Laurel and Pelican medallions, and pendants for East Kingdom awards such as the order of Maunche, Silver Crescent, and OGR, among others. Please note this class is a demonstration only. It is not hands-on. However, the instructor is happy to find a time/place to work one-on-one with interested students at another time during Pennsic.

name: Fun with Body Parts I: Relics
description_book: Miscellaneous body parts more precious than jewels? An irreverent look at the cult of the saints.
description_web: Miscellaneous body parts more precious than jewels? An irreverent look at the cult of the saints, a phenomenon which led to an international business in bones, daring thefts and major con jobs.

name: Entering an SCA Brewing Competition
description_book: Proper prior planning prevents piss poor performance. Learn what to expect in a brewing competition and how to prepare.
description_web: Does fear or trepidation at the thought of competition put you off? Much of that can be mitigated through proper preparation. This class aims to de-mystify the process of competing in an SCA brewing competition or A&S competition that includes brewing. Learn how to read the rubrics, how to prepare your entry, and what to expect from the judging. This is not a class on documenting a home brew entry, although some tips for documentation will be offered.

name: Stitching *Temari*: *Kiku* Pattern
description_book: Learn to mark and stitch the classic *kiku*, or chrysanthemum pattern.
description_web: Learn to mark and stitch the classic *kiku* or chrysanthemum pattern on a Japanese *temari* ball. We will start the ball in the class. You'll learn the basics of the stitch, and finish it outside class. Kit is three colors of floss, ball base, and marking thread, or bring your own. For those that have taken the class before, we will get fancy with the *kiku*.
fee_itemization: materials to stitch one ball, plus enough to begin several more

name: Visit Shakespeare's London
description_book: A first-person tour of everyday life in the 1590s. How folk of all classes work, play, dress, live and die.
description_web: A first-person tour of everyday London life in the 1590s. How folk of all classes work, play, dress, live, and die. The experience of the material and social culture of London life in the late Elizabethan period.

name: Guild of Saint Barbara Annual Meeting
description_book: Annual meeting will cover safety, new items, and also go over the firing schedule. As always, please bring questions.
description_web: The Guild of Saint Barbara will having its annual meeting on Middle Saturday at 10 am.  The meeting will cover safety, new items, and also go over the firing schedule for Pennsic 47. Please join us for this informative session and feel free to bring questions.  Please **DO NOT** bring powder to Pennsic!

name: Bling Out Your Veils
description_book: Basic veil beading. You will leave class with a working knowledge of how to do simple veil beading. All supplies and veil will be supplied.
description_web: Basic veil beading. You will leave class with a working knowledge of how to do simple veil beading. Ten kits available. Other students may watch the class; there will be extra handouts. If you would like to attend, you can bring your own veil and beads, and take the class.
fee_itemization:
fabric for veil
beads
beading needle
thread

name: Fools' School
description_book: Are you a fool or a fool wannabe? Come to Fools' School to share and learn. Prepare a 5-minute skit to perform. All ages/experience levels welcome.
description_web: Are you a fool or a fool wannabe? Come to Fools' School to share and learn. Fools/performers of all types and experience levels are welcome. Jugglers, magicians, singers, freaks and geeks. Get help creating or honing a skit of no more than 5 minutes to perform in the Amphitheater, Wednesday, 8/8, 6-7 pm. You might even become a “Licensed Fool.” Performing is not mandatory.

name: Metalsmithing
description_book: Metal-working from weapons to pots and pans.

name: Metal Embellishment
description_book: Etching, stamping, casting and many other methods of decorating metal will be demonstrated.

name: Dances for Tonight's Early Bird Ball
description_book: Most of the dances will be taught at the Early Bird Ball. Learn the four that will not be taught!
description_web: Learn the four dances that will not be taught at the Early Bird Ball. As of the time of the book being printed we are planning on *Bella Gioiosa, Old Mole*, a *Galliard*, and *Hunting of the Squirrel*. Other dances from the ball will be taught if time permits.

location: East Kingdom Royal Kitchen (East Kingdom Royal)
name: Anglo-Saxon Recipes: Archaeology in our Kitchen
description_book: A theory and hands-on class on filling the void of the written record around Germanic tribal migration period cooking using archaeological evidence.
description_web: A framework for working cooks to produce recipes, primarily using archaeological databases based on the Germanic tribal migration period as well as the Anglo-Saxon period in England. As I am limited in my language abilities, I will focus on the British databases. We will explore types of food available, methods of preparation of food stuffs and cooking, availability of imported foods, and other factors such as seasonality. As a group, we will work through the process of creating recipes using the methods discussed. We will also discuss how to use modern technologies to enhance our ability to create dishes both pleasing to the modern palate and maintaining modern nutritional practices. Lastly, we will taste some recipes that I have prepared for previous feasts.
fee_itemization: Food stuffs for making recipes served as samples during the class.

location: Good Friends Camp (Usually N-01 on St. Lawrence Way)
name: 16th-Century Ledger-Type Book Binding
description_book: Make a 16th-century leather ledger-style book. Some embroidering skills needed.
description_web: A start-to-finish 5-hour class to make a 16th-century leather ledger-style book. Some embroidering skills needed. Students are encouraged bring their own cutting board, rotary cutter/X-Acto, and metal ruler, if they have them. (Binding tools will be loaned if needed, however.) A 30- to 45-minute lunch break will be allowed.
fee_itemization: Fee includes leather for the cover, a detailed color hand-out, paper for book, and linen thread.

location: Herald's Point ( Intersection of the Low Road with the Great Eastern Highway, next to Family Point)
name: Topics in Basic Heraldry
description_book: These classes will teach basic name and/or armory skills for consulting at Pennsic Herald's Point. Dates and topics will be posted at Herald's Point.
description_web: These classes will teach basic name and/or armory submission skills necessary to consult at Pennsic Herald's Point. Exact dates and topics will be posted at Herald's Point at the beginning of the War. All newer heralds are strongly encouraged to attend at least one of these classes prior to volunteering at Herald's Point.

name: Storytelling Academy
description_book: Explore genres, tools, styles, and uses of storytelling. Cultural and medieval approaches, applications, performance coaching. New topics each day.
description_web: During this nine-day academy, students will gain knowledge about the history and techniques for storytelling both in the SCA and the modern world. Students may attend individual sessions or all of the academy. There will be guest teachers and time for students to practice and receive feedback. The academy will culminate in a student performance. No classes are repeated. The focus is on developing comfort, nurturing, and honing skills within the students’ capabilities. All levels are welcome. Students may view a class outline at the academy space, Minerva’s Spindle 158, where classes will also be listed on the message board. Seating is limited; feel free to bring your own chair. Student Performance, Thursday 8/9, 5pm in the performance pavilion.

name: Intro to Research: Research like an Academic
description_book: Learn about types of sources, styles of citations, how and where to find good sources, applying it to A&S entries, and more!
description_web: This class will cover an introduction to research, including types of sources, styles of citations, what "peer-reviewed" means, how/where to find good (and often free!) sources for your topic, and more. We will also look at how to apply your research to A&S entries, especially for Kingdom-level competitions. Taught by a university faculty member and current East Kingdom A&S champion, this class is open to researchers of any level and requires no prior knowledge. Come and learn about research, it can be really fun!
fee_itemization: $1 for printing costs, handout is also posted online for free to download.

name: Beginner Thrown Weapons
description_book: Learn axe throwing, basic care of your weapons, and basic rules. A hands-on session is included. Limit of 25 participants; no experience necessary.
description_web: Learn axe throwing, basic care of your weapons, and basic rules. A hands-on session is included. Limit of 25 participants; no experience necessary.

name: Weed Walk
description_book: Wild plant identification. Wear walking shoes and hat; leave from Univ. Point. Different teachers on different days; walk with us more than once!
description_web: Cooper's Lake abounds with medicinal and food plants that were used by various primitive and medieval cultures. Learn to identify them during a walk around the campsite. The walk will take place rain or shine. Please wear sturdy shoes and a hat. Meet at University Point for the start of the class. We have multiple teachers, so if you attend more than one walk you will likely learn different things!

name: *Mehteran*: Ottoman Janissary Band
description_book: *Osmanlı Mehter Takımı* (Ottoman Janissary Band) studies music and history of the Ottoman *Mehter* military marching band from the 14th-17th century.
description_web: The *Osmanlı Mehter Takımı* (Ottoman Janissary Band) studies music and history of the Ottoman *Mehter* military marching band from the 14th-17th century. The Mehteran will learn the historic Ottoman song, *Ceddin Deden*, played on *zurna, davul,* horns, cymbals, and kettledrums, and sung by a choir, and will learn the historic Janissary march for performance at Pennsic. Further details on the Mehteran Facebook Group: https://www.facebook.com/groups/134233213955988/

name: Pottery Techniques for Kids
description_book: Participants will use basic hand-building techniques to create a small clay vessel. Class is geared toward children 6-12. Youth guidelines apply.
description_web: Participants will use basic hand-building techniques to create a small clay vessel. This class is geared toward children 6-12. All Pennsic University guidelines for youth classes will be adhered to.

name: It Begins with a Box and an X
description_book: A beginner illumination class. It will help build basic skills and confidence.
description_web: This is a beginner-level scribal class. Learn to recreate a very simple illumination element. You will acquire basic skills in brushwork and color mixing. It is a hands-on event.
fee_itemization: Not certain yet. Partially subsidized by me.

name: Anglo-Saxon Ring Pouch
description_book: Create the only pouch an Anglo-Saxon woman would ever want or need, using period supplies and sewing techniques.
fee_itemization: All of the supplies and materials needed to make a ring pouch.

name: Ins and Outs of the Submissions Herald Office
description_book: Learn the duties and requirements for the office of a Kingdom's Heraldic Submissions Herald including admin, time management and communication skills.
description_web: This class goes over the duties and requirements for being a Kingdom's Heraldic Submissions Herald. Learn what administrative skills it takes, how to effectively communicate with submitters and what kind of time commitment such an office requires. Please note that requirements for the office of Submissions Herald may vary from Kingdom to Kingdom.

name: Foundations of Patchwork
description_book: Learn the basics of foundation patchwork piecing (also know as English paper piecing).
description_web: Learn the basics of foundation patchwork piecing (also know as English paper piecing). This technique allows the artist to make very small and precise patchwork blocks.  An example of this is the *Impruneta* cushion.

name: Tacketed Book Binding: Medieval Account Books
description_book: A look at the history of an early "reusable" or "expandable" book binding technique. Sample book to examine.
description_web: A look at the history of an early "reusable" or "expandable" book binding technique. Used primarily for accounting books and ledger-type books, this style of book binding allowed the modification of the text block without major alteration of the actual covers of the book. There will be a sample of a tacketed book to examine.

name: Make a Skjold Harbor Viking Hood
description_book: [YouthU] We'll make a Viking hood. It's simple to make, authentic, and it looks great! Put it on over a tunic, and you're ready to go a-Viking.
