description_web: We'll make a hood, from the 10th century, found in Skjold Harbor in Norway. It's a simple hood to make, authentic, and it looks great! Put it on over a tunic and you're ready to go a-Viking.

name: Smocking for Beginners
description_book: Make a sampler of smocking stitches that can be used for aprons, shirts and other accessories.
description_web: Beginning stitchers welcome! We will make a sampler, covering the most frequently used stitches. We will also discuss their use in period and cover material choices. If a child is interested, this is very simple but gives impressive results.

name: A Hole Different Weaving Technique
description_book: Missed-hole tablet weaving has at least 1 tablet hole left empty so the weft is visible and the product is textured. Weaving experience helpful.
description_web: In missed-hole tablet weaving at least 1 hole in each pattern tablet is left empty. This allows the weft to be seen and creates a textured ground weave. Also called Pebble Weave, the technique spans a variety of years and countries and can be used to create many different effects. Some weaving experience helpful.
fee_itemization: Kits include weaving cards, yarn, 2 C clamps, a plastic beater, a cardboard shuttle, and patterns.

name: Nefarious Characters, Like Assassins and Such
description_book: How assassins existed in the past; other bits of information regarding assassins and other nefarious types.

name: *Oya* Needle Lace (Knotted Lace)
description_book: Using an embroidery needle and thread with a simple knot stitch, one can create beautiful edgings and hairnets.
description_web: Using an embroidery needle and thread with a simple knot stitch, one can create beautiful edgings and hairnets. Very few extant pieces exist to determine the exact origin of this form of needlework, but it is generally believed to have originated from netting around the 15th century.  *Oya* can make the net - and yet make it beautiful as well. Students should bring their needles and scissors to the class. Materials will be provided to learn the knot stitch which is the foundation of this lace.

name: Courtesy and Etiquette in the SCA
description_book: An introduction to the do’s and don’ts of courtesy in our modern Middle Ages.
description_web: An introduction to the do’s and don’ts of courtesy in our modern Middle Ages.

name: Medieval Folk Dance
description_book: Come learn a variety of pre-1600 folk dances including set dances and line dances! No experience necessary; left feet welcome!
description_web: Come learn a variety of pre-1600 dances that would be considered "folk dance" by modern definitions of the term, including set dances and line dances! No experience necessary; left feet welcome!

location: Clan Yama Kaminari (E03 one block south and one block east of troll on Low Road look for the Red and black sheet walls)
name: Viking Penannular Brooches
description_book: A brief history of the Viking penannular brooch. Construction based on historical finds using hand tools and fixtures.
description_web: Construct a simple copper penannular brooch using basic using hand tools. Class may run over.

name: *Bransles*
description_book: Let's get down and dirty with some *bransles*. Learn the basics of these circle dances and a few tricks on how to keep them all straight in your head.

name: Morris Games
description_book: We will teach *Nine Man's Morris* and other games of that family (which include the modern *tic tac toe*).
description_web: We will teach *Nine Man's Morris* and other games of that family (which include the modern *tic tac toe*).

name: Zill Like a Dancer: Think like a Musician
description_book: Learn to play zills (finger cymbals) for dance, but with a musician's understanding of the rhythms and patterns.
description_web: Learn to play zills (finger cymbals) with a musician's ear. With a background in both music and dance, your instructor has found a way to bridge the gap for more successful understanding of rhythmic patterns, timing, and ultimately playing alongside musicians successfully. We will start with a zilling warm-up to increase speed and evenness between the right and left hand, moving on to basic zill patterns used in Middle Eastern dance. Finally, we will play with ways to spice them up with musical understanding. Limited loaner sets of zills will be available, however, it is recommended to come with your own set that fit your fingers. This class will have quite a bit of seated time so bring whatever will make you comfortable.

name: A Bird’s Eye View of Music History
description_book: An brief but entertaining introduction to European musical history, spanning from Gregorian chants to the Renaissance.
description_web: Music history, like all history, can be both fascinating and fun, and I want to prove it to you! This class will cover the history of medieval music from the 6th to 16th century, and show examples of different works in each period of music, in order to to familiarize students with different styles of music and encourage further interest and study. No knowledge of musical history or techniques required. Singing will be absolutely encouraged, but also not required.

name: Stick Weaving
description_book: Stick weaving is a simple, weft-based weaving method.
description_web: Stick weaving is a simple, weft-based weaving method. Great for making belts and straps. Upgradable to make everything from shawls to rugs. Sticks and string provided; take your work home with you.

name: Beginning Drumming
description_book: Basic rhythms used most often in drum circles and music within the SCA. A 4-part class; different rhythms each day. **Bring your own drum.**
description_web:
Learn the basic rhythms used most often in drum circles and music within the SCA. This is a 4-part class that teaches different rhythms each day. **Bring your own drum**.
Day 1- *Saidi, Beladi, Maqsum*
Day 2- *Chiftitelli, Masmoudi*
Day 3- *Ayub, Malfouf*
Day 4- *Kashlimah* and other strange stuff

name: Helga Ball Tournament
description_book: Helga Ball is a **ladies-only** sport based on a Viking game.The game, also known as "Cabbage Ball", is played with teams of 5 or 6 players.
description_web:
Helga Ball is a **ladies-only** sport based on a Viking game.The game, also known as "Cabbage Ball", is played with teams of 5 or 6 players. The game itself is played with a head of cabbage as the ball. This event at Pennsic will be a benefit for Paladin's Pantry. We will be accepting donations of paper and hygiene products for poor and food-insecure families in the Portersville area (the town where Pennsic take place). The tournament is sponsored by the Barony Marche of the Debatable Lands.

To Play:
- Organize a team of 5-10 women. (Having substitutions is a good thing.)
- Each player must be over 18.
- Each team member should bring one or more paper or hygiene product for donation. (No monetary donations.)
- Points are scored by getting a cabbage through/past your opponent's goalposts. Two members of the Chivalry (or squires) shall serve as stationary goal posts for each goal.
- All players must wear a dress. (Viking garb encouraged, but not required.)
- Players are encouraged to wear do-rags
- CLOSED FOR SHOES OR BOOTS REQUIRED!
- Players may kick or dribble the cabbage with their feet, but may not touch the cabbage with their hands or use hands to pick up the cabbage.
- Players may scoop the cabbage up in a skirt, apron, or do-rag, and move the cabbage on the field.
- Tackling is not allowed, however "Group Hugs" are legal.
- Goalposts shall signal a "score" by raising one arm and yelling either "Helga Ball!!" or "Olga ball!" to identify the scoring team.

- For our purposes, each game will last 10 minutes, with a 5-point Mercy rule.

name: Chinese Calligraphy Brush Painting
description_book: Grinding ink and the brush writing of ancient Chinese characters from oracle bone to cursive scripts.
description_web: A brief history of Chinese calligraphy: Brush painting Chinese characters that were developed over 3000 years ago and that are still used today. Explore a variety of Chinese scripts from oracle bone pictographs to the more modern scripts of the Han Dynasty (200 BC to 200 AD). We will explore the 4 treasures and create beautiful characters. This class is intended for beginners, but students at any level may benefit. There will be supplies for 8 people to use, but others can observe.

name: The Oxburgh Hangings
description_book: An overview of embroidered wall hangings associated with Mary, Queen of Scots, including the glimpse they offer into Elizabethan history and culture.
description_web: The Oxburgh Hangings, embroidered by two of the most exciting women in Elizabethan-era England, provide a rich and detailed glimpse into their lives and the culture of the day. But they also offer an enigmatic mystery regarding their creation. Whether you are interested in embroidery, Elizabethan culture, or doing historical detective work, this class has something for you!

name: History and Symbolism of the Unicorn Tapestries
description_book: An examination of "The Hunt for the Unicorn", 15th-century Flemish tapestries widely regarded as the best examples of tapestries of the age.
description_web: Join us for an examination of "The Hunt for the Unicorn", 15th-century Flemish tapestries widely regarded as the best examples of tapestries of the age. Why does the unicorn lack ears in one tapestry? What happened to the pieces of the fifth tapestry? Where are they now? All these and more will be answered. Handout includes full color handouts including line drawings and plant keys for each tapestry.
fee_itemization: Full color, line drawing and plant key copies of all the tapestries with corresponding plants highlighted.

name: Pennsic Radio Base-Station Training
description_book: Do you have a voice for radio? Yes? Then we want you! This is the training for running the main radio base-station for the Pennsic Watch.
description_web: Do you have a voice for radio? Yes? Then we want you! This is the training for running the main radio base-station for the Pennsic Watch. Learn the technical aspects of operating a radio dispatch base-station and how the Pennsic communication center functions as well as the protocols we follow that keep us operating within FCC guidelines. This will include hands-on airtime on a secondary channel on the Pennsic radio system. Then, volunteer for a couple of shifts as radio operator. Come have fun while keeping Pennsic organized and safe.

name: German Saxon Gown
description_book: The construction techniques and layers I used to create the iconic German Saxon Gown of the 1520s.
description_web: The construction techniques and layers I used to create the iconic German Saxon Gown of the 1520s from the skin out.

name: Another Viking Knit Class
description_book: Have you ever wished you could make that snazzy Viking chain? Easier than it looks. Learn in a few minutes, finish later.
description_web: Have you ever wished you could make that snazzy Viking chain? It's easier than it looks. Learn in a few minutes, finish later. Learn how to begin the chain. You get supplies and information to finish. Tools and findings will be provided. Final "drawing down" can be arranged for at a later time.
fee_itemization: Dowel rod for forming knit, 26 g brass or bronze wire, findings.

name: Stained Glass of Chartres Cathedral
description_book: The Cathedral of Notre-Dame in Chartres, France, was built in the 13th century and has some of the best preserved medieval stained glass in the world.

name: Intro to Period Maritime Navigation
description_book: How did ship captains find their way from one port to the next? Covers an introductory overview of maritime navigation before 1600.
description_web: Was Christopher Columbus really lost? If so, how did he find his way home? How did ship captains find their way from one port to the next? Covers an introductory overview of maritime navigation before 1600. Focuses on European navigation, but touches on roots in China and the Middle East and parallels in Polynesia. At the end of class, we'll determine the elevation of the sun if weather permits, using various period and modern methods. This and some simple math was used to determine latitude. (In the class you'll learn why this was a big deal...)

name: New to the SCA? A Class on the Basics
description_book: Learn about what essentials you should have for an event; basic customs and protocol; how to get involved; persona and heraldry, as well as much more.
description_web: Are you new to the Society, or have you only gone to a few events? Still confused about what there is to do and what we are about? Learn about what essentials you should have for an event, some basic customs and protocol, how to get involved, persona and heraldry, as well as much more. Come with questions or sit and listen. We promise you will learn a lot!

name: Juggling 201: Intermediate
description_book: Intermediate 3-ball juggling: going beyond the simple cascade. We will touch briefly on 4 and 5 balls as well.
description_web: Intermediate 3-ball juggling. Learn several basic tricks, such as crosses, snatches, and reverse cascade. We may work our way into basic 2-, 4-, and 5-ball juggling as they apply. Juggling balls will be available for use and purchase.
fee_itemization: please alternate days with my other juggling classes, this class session should be during second week.

location: Argent Fox (Merchant area behind the barn)
name: Harp for Absolute Beginners II
description_book: Basic harp following my first class! Please bring a harp if you have one and a chair if you need one. Prior experience not necessary. All ages.
description_web: A very basic introduction to the fundamentals of modern harp. This class will address using both hands at once. Please bring a harp if you have one and a chair if you need one; we will be holding the class at Argent Fox and can borrow his harps and chairs, but he only has so many and I don't know how many students will attend. We will review hand position and work on finger independence, going over a couple basic exercises to practice with, and I will provide handouts with a simple tune to practice. Ability to either read music or memorize a definite plus, but anyone's welcome to show up, and I'll teach you what I can. All ages emphatically welcomed. This is the second in a sequence of two classes. Class is aimed at nylon-strung harps; wire-strung are welcome but I can't teach wire-strung style, though I will try to point you at people who can.

name: Fun and Funky Belly Dance Combos
description_book: Learn three fun belly dance combos that are just a little off-beat, just like the instructor. Some belly dance experience is helpful, but not crucial.
description_web: Learn three fun (and slightly funky) belly dance combinations. The instructor will teach three combinations that are from a choreography to Raquy's song *Salamat*. Basic knowledge of belly dance, including traveling moves, is really helpful.

name: SCA Dance for Total Beginners
description_book: Curious about dancing but never tried it before? This class is for you! We'll learn some basic steps and an easy dance from four different traditions.
description_web: Curious about SCA dancing but never tried it before? This class is for you! We'll learn some very basic steps and then use simple terms to learn an easy dance from four different traditions: Inns of Court, English Country, bransles, and Italian. Specific dances are *Queen's Almain, Rufty Tufty, Double/Single Bransle*, and *Petit Vriens*.

name: Tarl's Little Polearm Tourney, Lucky 13
description_book: This tourney is open to all authorized, inspected heavy fighters. Weapons must conform to Pennsic standards. Bear Pit format, two 45-minute sessions.
description_web: Welcome to Tarl's Little Polearm Tourney, Lucky 13 Edition! This tourney is open to all authorized and inspected heavy weapons fighters.  Polearms must conform to Pennsic standards. The tourney is a Bear Pit, with two 45-minute sessions and a break in between. So come and spend some time basking in the joy that is the One True Weapons Form!

location: Guild of St. Barbara Gunners Fly atop Mt Eislin (Top of Mt Eislin under the Gunners Red Fly. Bring chairs and water)
name: Guild of Saint Barbara Black Powder Training
description_book: Black powder safety and hands-on training. Bring pre-1600 firearms and cannon with you to be inspected. ***DO NOT BRING YOUR OWN POWDER***
description_web:
The Guild of Saint Barbara will holding its hands-on training and safety inspection Middle Saturday at 12 noon. The hands-on black powder training session is for new gentles that wish to learn and join us on the line, or a refresher for those who would desire. 
Hands-on training will be from 12 pm to 3 pm. Please join us for this informative session and feel free to bring questions. And, if you have pre-1600 firearms, bring them with you to be inspected. Please **DO NOT** bring powder to Pennsic! Powder will be provided.

name: Tinsmithing
description_book: A basic but complete course in the fundamentals of tinsmithing. Students will make a glass-globed hurricane lamp with hand tools.
description_web: A basic but complete course in the fundamentals of tinsmithing. Students will make a glass-globed hurricane lamp with hand tools.

name: Known World Choir
description_book: Do you like to sing? Come learn period music in a period style. Rehearsals are daily from 12-2 in the PARC.
description_web: Do you like to sing? Come learn period music in a period style. Rehearsals are daily from 12-2 in the PARC. Concert is Thursday 8/9 at 6:00 pm. Music is available on the Known World Choir Website. Pre-registration is requested although **not** required. All voice parts are welcome. This choir is adults only; however, there are other choirs for teens and children. The music for this year is all about battles and war!! While reading music is helpful it's not necessary. Practice tracks will be available on the choir's website in May. Please bring a 1" black folder for your music and a pencil.

name: Rehearsal (Closed): *i Verdi Confusi*
description_book: Space in use.
description_web: Space in use.

name: Free Scholar Charity Rapier Tournament
description_book: Progressive forms triple elimination with a $5 suggested donation. The donations go to the winner’s choice of breast cancer charities.
description_web: Progressive forms triple elimination with a $5 suggested donation. The donations go to the winner’s choice of breast cancer charities.

name: Eastern *Kufic* Arabic
description_book: Learn basic strokes to use with your translated Arabic text that would have been used in Eastern Arabic lands.

name: Making a Hare Net
description_book: We will apply the ancient technique of knotting to the creation of a purse net that is used in Europe to catch large rabbits or hares.
description_web: We will apply the ancient technique of knotting to the creation of a purse net that is used in Europe to catch large rabbits or hares. Use of the net will be explained, as well as the use of the netting knot for other applications such as fishing nets, corrals, hair nets, and *lacis* fabric. Kits will be available for purchase or you can bring your own. Do not bring netting needles/spacers for hair nets, as the scale is too small.

name: Exit Stage Left
description_book: [YouthU 10-17]  Aliyah and Silly invite you to join them for some comedic, dramatic and just plain silly theatre games!
description_web: [YouthU 10-17] Baroness Aliyah and The Honorable Lady Silly invite you to join them for some comedic, dramatic and possibly just plain silly theatre games! We will cover basic stage directions and movement!

name: Naval Warfare: An Overview
description_book: A discussion of naval warfare as conducted in the SCA period. Includes the changes made by technical revolutions in armament, etc.
description_web: A discussion of naval warfare as conducted in the SCA period. Basic concepts, economic and strategic influences, supply and design constraints, and the changes wrought by technical revolutions in construction and armament.

name: Basic Baby Beginning Bookbinding
description_book: We'll be making a simple long-stitch blank book using period techniques and modern materials.
description_web: We'll be making a simple link-stitch blank book. Modern materials (such as heavy paper for the cover) will be substituted for period ones in order to keep costs down and help more people give bookbinding a try.
fee_itemization: cover material, paper, and thread to make a small (about 2.75" x 4.25") blank book.

name: Owning The Circle
description_book: Make the bardic stage yours!
description_web: A discussion of making the bardic circle yours. How to start your performance and own the stage, self evaluation, how to end the performance, tips on reading the audience, and making your performance better for all.

name: Viking Age Clothing: Archeological Evidence
description_book: A survey of the major finds of Viking Age clothing, with an emphasis on interpreting the finds to make accurate reproductions.
description_web: A survey of the major finds of Viking Age clothing, with an emphasis on interpreting the finds to make reasonably accurate reproductions. We will cover Birka, Hedeby, Mammen, Thorsbjerg, Viborg, and other finds.

name: Typecasting in the Canterbury Tales
description_book: Appearance is everything in medieval literature. Chaucer wanted you to have first impressions of his characters -- first impressions that were right.

name: Norse, Varangian and Rus: What Is the Difference?
description_book: Wonder what the difference is between the Norse and the Rus? Are Varangian and Viking the same? What about Slavs? Years include 8th-10th centuries.
description_web: There is a huge interest in Norse, Rus, Varangian and Slavic culture right now and I would like to show the differences between these distinct cultures and the occupation that was "Varangian". We will discuss the differences specifically in clothing and accessories for men and women of these different cultures and time periods. Lecture and demonstration class.

name: Shiny Hats and Medallions: A Guide to SCA Regalia
description_book: Covers Society award structure, what all the medallions and coronets mean, using titles appropriately, and court etiquette.
description_web: Keeping everyone’s names straight can be confusing, but then when you add titles to the mix it takes on a whole new level. This class will cover Society award structure (so you know why people are clapping in court) as well what all the medallions and coronets mean. We will also discuss some of the differences in awards across the different Kingdoms. In addition, there will be a section on using titles appropriately and court etiquette. That way, when you are called up for the first time, you know what to do!

name: Failing with Style
description_book: When on stage the best laid plans gang aft agley. This class will address tips and tricks in keeping the show moving forward.
description_web: When on stage the best laid plans gang aft agley. This class will address tips and tricks in keeping the show moving forward. This will be part roundtable and interactive class to work on getting your performance back on track though improv skills.

name: Introduction to Fiber Prep
description_book: While you can purchase all sorts of lovely, prepared wool for spinning, there's nothing quite like preparing fiber yourself.
description_web: Focusing on wool fiber prep (easiest for new folks to come across) plus a walk through various methods to wash and prepare fiber for spinning. Period and modern methods will be discussed. Some tools will be available to experiment with as time permits.

name: Beginner's Footwork for English Country Dance
description_book: Starting off on the correct foot allows the figures to flow more easily in English Country Dance. Brand-new beginners to intermediate level.

name: *Kamikaze* Battle
description_book: Three-hour unlimited resurrection battle. No War points, no prizes, just fighting.
description_web: Three-hour unlimited resurrection battle. No War points, no prizes, just fighting.

name: Introduction to *Go*
description_book: A basic introduction to rules and play of the Japanese/Chinese game of *go* / *weiqi*.
description_web: Will teach the rules of the Japanese game *go* (also known as *weiqi* in China), and offer a chance to play afterwards.

name: Achieving *Tarab*: The Spirit of ME Dance
description_book: Lets explore the concept of *tarab* or “dancer’s high” through both discussion and dance. Wear comfortable clothes for dancing.
description_web: Have you ever felt a curious thrill when dancing, or that you’re “in the zone?” There’s an expression for that in Middle Eastern dance, and it’s an amazing experience. Let's explore the concept of *tarab* or “dancer’s high” through both discussion and dance, and possible ways to achieve it. Wear comfortable clothes for dancing (no coin belts please) and bring a chair/cushion or notebook for the discussion if you desire.

name: *Kumihimo* Basics
description_book: *Kumihimo*: cord braiding on a disk.
description_web: *Kumihimo*: cord braiding on a disk. Make a basic round cord. Disk and string provided; take your work home with you.

name: PPF: Japanese Women’s Clothing
description_book: Learn about the clothing of women in the *Momoyama* period in preparation for the 2020 Perfectly Period Feast.
description_web: This class focuses on the clothing of women in the *Momoyama* period, and is designed to help you create an appropriate ensemble for Æthelmearc’s 2020 Perfectly Period Feast: *Choyo no Sekku* (the Chrysanthemum Festival), an Enchanted Ground event set in Kyoto in the year 1590.

name: Riding in Front of the Prince
description_book: Class is based on Jennifer Jobst's documentation about horsemanship during the late period in Europe.
description_web: During the 16th century, riding evolved from its martial origins into an art form practiced by noblemen and kings. Instead of the medieval jousts and melees, horsemen began to display their skills in carousels, ballets, and individual performances. The riding masters of the mid-16th century had definite ideas of what was proper for both horse and rider. During this class we will review different documentations about how riders showed off their own riding skills and their mount's best abilities to the royals. We will cover how to prepare and train for this kind of performance, including what documentation is required for the judges.

name: The *Sarangi*: India's Bowed Legacy
description_book: The *sarangi* is a rarely-seen bowed instrument from India/Pakistan. Via playing and stories, we will journey through its colorfully dark history.
description_web: The *sarangi* is an Indian instrument whose name roughly translates to "one hundred colors". Played with a heavy bow and the cuticles of the nail, the *sarangi* is as deep in expression as it is difficult to master; in the right hands, though, it can mimic a human voice. In this class, we will take a journey through its colorfully dark past via stories and folklore. A number of different models and techniques will be shown. String players encouraged to bring their instruments!

name: Story Reading
description_book: I will read children's stories of various lengths with a medieval setting. Each individual story will be 3-37 pages. I wrote these. They are new.
description_web: I will read children's stories of various lengths with a medieval setting. Each story will be 3-37 pages. They are new and fiction, not retelling of sagas already known.

name: Leaves
description_book: Many varieties of leaves appear in illuminated borders. Here are a few simple techniques for adding them to scrolls.
description_web: This hands-on introduction to the variety of styles of leaves that appear in illuminated manuscripts will not only show you leaves from different centuries and different countries, but also will give you possible construction methods for each. There will be practice time. Paper and pencils will be available. If you want more elaborate supplies, please bring them.

name: Beginning Engraving
description_book: Hands-on class. Intro to tools, first cuts, graver control, hammer use.
description_web: Hands-on class. Intro to tools, first cuts, graver control. Student will learn both hand-held and hammer-struck engraving.

name: *Xia*: The Chinese Knight-Errant
description_book: An examination of the history and motivations of Chinese *youxia*.
description_web: Join us for a discussion of how chivalry was practiced in China in the Middle Ages. This class will cover how *Xia* is different from Western chivalry, how it is the same, and ways to incorporate these into your persona.

name: Interpreting Your Passions
description_book: Connect with an audience; share your passions in a memorable and impactful way by learning the basic principals of interpretation. Teach with flair.
description_web: Connect with an audience and share your passions in a memorable and impactful way by learning the basic principals of interpretation. How to engage your audience, prepare teaching materials, and conduct effective teaching sessions.

name: Livery Collars
description_book: An exploration of this elite accessory, with a focus on earlier examples and historical significance, plus a discussion of how to adapt to SCA use.
description_web: An exploration of this elite accessory, with a focus on earlier examples and historical significance, plus a discussion of how to adapt to SCA use.

name: Let's Get Ready for a *Hafla*!
description_book: [YouthU] Middle Eastern dance is fun for everyone! Let's learn some moves to do when the drums start. All youth welcome.
description_web: Middle Eastern dance is fun for everyone! Let's learn some moves to do when the drums start. This class is appropriate for any youth looking to learn some dance steps to use at a *hafla* or around a fire.

name: Introduction to Beginning Period Cookery
description_book: Want to cook "in period" but don’t know where to start? For beginners who want a quick intro to some basics of modern period cookery.
description_web: Want to cook "in period", but don’t know where to start? Your apartment doesn't have a handy open fireplace? No idea what an *eyroun* is or where to find one? No problem! This class is designed for beginners who might never have cooked a period recipe before but want a quick introduction into some of the basics of modern period cookery.

name: How to Write and Tell a Great Story
description_book: Great stories have common threads, whether they are books, movies or stories. Discuss the principles of Myth used to create powerful narratives.
description_web: Great stories have common threads, whether they are books, movies or stories. We'll discuss the principles of Myth used to create masterful stories that are dramatic, entertaining and psychologically true. This is a look at how storytellers can utilize mythic structure to create powerful narratives.

name: Russian Gold Work
description_book: Learn the basics of how to apply pearls, beads, padding and "waste of time" (cording). Kits will contain all the materials to finish a bag.
description_web:
We will be learning the basics of how to apply pearls, beads, padding and "waste of time" (cording). Kits will contain all the materials to finish a bag. 
Kits include hoop, handout, "waste of time" (cording), pearls, seed beads, padding, cotton cording, needles, Fabric, linen or cotton for backing, bees wax, threads. Instructor: Cristina inghean Ghriogair, donnamac123@hotmail.com
fee_itemization: Material fee includes hand out, "waste of time" (cording), pearls, seed beads, padding, cotton cording, needles, brocade, linen or cotton for backing, bees wax, threads

name: Improve Your Period Brewing
description_book: This is a beginner to intermediate class. Several methods will be shared where the student can learn to make their brewing "more period."
description_web: This is a beginner to intermediate class. Several methods will be shared where the student can learn to make their brewing "more period." Methods shared will include but not be limited to ingredients, hitting a proper strike temperature without a thermometer, egg float test for saccharification, re-using and harvesting yeast.

name: Pennsic 101
description_book: The Drums of War Begin to Beat. It sounded like so much fun... ...but you've never done anything like this, so... now what do you do? All welcome!
description_web: The Drums of War Begin to Beat. It sounded like so much fun... ...but you've never done anything like this, so... now what do you do? Pennsic is a most wonderful SCA event and attending this class will help you to have the best time possible. Overview of activities, tips & tricks for staying healthy, etc., plus question/answer period. Please bring questions! Youth (per Pennsic University rules, please bring an adult if you're supposed to), and experienced hands welcome. We may **all** learn something new!

name: Lots of *Lazzi*
description_book: Learn the history of the *Commedia Lazzi* (small comedic gigs) and then recreate and perform/demonstrate from historical descriptions.

name: Knitting for Beginners
description_book: Basic knitting: cast on, knit and pearl stitches, and cast off. We will be making a dish cloth.
description_web: Basic knitting: cast on, knit and pearl stitches, and cast off. We will be making a dish cloth. You may bring your own materials.  Size 10 needles and cotton yarn is preferred for this project.
fee_itemization: Size 10 knitting needles and cotton yarn.  You may bring your own supplies for no fee.

name: Common Italian Dances: *Anello* and *Petit Riense*
description_book: We'll be doing two of the most common and widely known 15th-century Italian dances, *Anello* and *Petit Riense*, with some attention to detail.

name: *Bodhran* 101
description_book: Introduction to playing the Irish frame drum. No experience necessary. Please bring your drum.

name: Fundamentals of Voice Production
description_book: Intro to basic voice for singers and performers. An active, participatory class for beginners.
description_web: Learn the basics of vocal technique, including methods for dealing with nervousness. This is an active, participatory class for those who have never had a voice lesson. Those who can stand comfortably will be asked to do so for much of the class, but all the activities can be adapted to a seated position.

name: Battle of Tortuga
description_book:
Upon the high seas two ships meet, one crewed by merchants, the other by dreaded pirates.
An RBG-friendly, non-war point rapier bridge battle.
description_web:
Upon the high seas twoships meet, one crewed by merchants, the other by dreaded pirates. Who shall prevail? Only time and skill will tell.
An RBG-friendly, non-war point rapier bridge battle.

name: Blades Of The Crescent Moon
description_book: Come gather round, and test your mettle against the legendary Samurai. This is a Rapier tournament geared towards those with Japanese personas.
description_web: Come gather round, and test your mettle against the legendary Samurai. This is a Rapier tournament geared towards those with Japanese personas.

name: Theatre Games for Kids
description_book: Is your little one interested in acting? Does your kid like to play games? Come to this class for games that are all about performing! For ages 5-12.

name: Personalizing Award Scrolls
description_book: Want to make the recipient of your scroll assignment feel special? Learn a few tips to help with that little bit extra.

name: *The Prayer Book of Michelino da Besozzo*
description_book: Recreate a page from this 1420 Italian book, perfect for SCA scrolls. One option for experienced scribes and one for novices.
description_web: This beautiful prayer book dates around 1420 Italy, and the layout lends itself perfectly for SCA scrolls. More experienced scribes can enjoy the style and delicate hand, while novices will find this a perfect starting point for reproduction scrolls as they build historical knowledge. First-time scribes welcome!
fee_itemization:
Handout fee includes color copy of a floral page & matching scroll blank to paint.
Material fee is optional; please feel free to bring your own supplies (brushes & paint).
Material fee includes: Paint palette, quality paints to complete scroll, & paint brushes.

name: Lining: Turning It All Right-Side Out
description_book: All you need to know about lining a garment: a class about cutting and sewing a lining into a garment and then turning that garment right-side out.
description_web: All you need to know about lining a garment: a class about cutting and sewing a lining into a garment and then turning that garment right-side out.

name: Game of Herald Says
description_book: Based on Simon Says, this game will increase familiarity with the positions of animals and charges on a heraldic device. Children, teens, and adults.
description_web: Based on Simon Says, this game will increase familiarity with the positions of animals and charges on a heraldic device. Children, teens, and adults.

name: Reproducing Grave Goods from Archeological Data
description_book: How to find/use archaeological data to reproduce items found in early period graves. Focus is on glass beads, but applicable for metal, pottery, etc.
description_web: Learn how to find and use archaeological reports to reproduce glass beads, bead strings (and other early period grave goods, such as metalworking and pottery) found in graves at excavation sites. These reports provide a wealth of information that is not available from museum or other websites. The focus of this presentation will be on Anglo-Saxon excavation reports and how I have used those reports to reproduce historic glass beads and necklaces. However, artisans interested in other early period items and crafts should find this presentation valuable. The  instructor for this class works as a librarian at a university as her day job, and she is more than happy to work with attendees after the class to help them find sources and information.

name: Beaded Flowers 2: Daisy
description_book: Make a daisy in the style of beaded flowers of 16th-century Venice. If you have needle-nosed pliers/wire cutters, please bring them to class.
description_web: Make a daisy in the style of beaded flowers of 16th-century Venice. If you have needle-nosed pliers/wire cutters, please bring them to class. Not recommended for youth. Take the Rose class first; this is a more advanced technique.

name: *Contrafacta*: Yes, Filking is Period
description_book: We will discuss the history and impact of *contrafacta* (period filks), and give some tips on how to write them.
description_web:
*Musica Contrafacta* means reworked or recycled music. In French, it is *contrefait*, which is the root of our word counterfeit. In other words, you make new music by copying a popular tune, to which you set new lyrics. A *contrafactum* (Latin singular; *contrafacta* is plural) is a period filk. 
 
Lady Melanie de la Tour will discuss the history and impact of *contrafacta*/filks, and gives some tips on how to write them.  Active participation is encouraged.

name: Finding Your Medieval Self
description_book: How to embody your specific persona as opposed to a “generic medieval person”. Develop your persona and reflect that in your garb, accessories, etc.
description_web:
So you’ve been to a few SCA events. You have the beginnings of a persona. Perhaps you’ve moved from a loaner t-tunic to garb more specific to your place and time. Now what?!

This is a discussion-based class that focuses on how to embody your specific persona as opposed to a “generic medieval person”. We’ll talk about the questions you should ask yourself to develop your persona and how to reflect that in your garb, accessories, and many other aspects of SCA life.

Time permitting, we’ll also talk about tips to finding your “niche” within the society in order to enrich your SCA experience.

name: PPF *Kyōgen-za*: Japanese Comic Theatre Workshop
description_book: Try out small troupe medieval improvisational comic theatre. Stock characters with few sets and props perform burlesque, farce, satire, and slapstick.
description_web:
Pre-Workshop: http://www.demoivre.org/Heian-kyo_2020/Kyogen_Nyumon/

Try out small troupe medieval Japanese improvisational comic theatre. If you like over-the-top comic acting, then *kyōgen* is for you! Ridicule the powerful. Expose human foibles and social problems. Stock characters with minimal sets and props perform burlesque, farce, satire, and slapstick comedy. Learn about stock characters, theatrical devices, common themes, rhythmic structure, comic theory, and more!

*Kyōgen* is an accessible and easy-to-stage genre of Japanese theatre. *Kyōgen* dates to at least the fourteenth century and is a living theatre today. *Kyōgen* frequently lampooned the powerful people who sat in the audience. Learn about stage geography, scripting, types of plays, types of characters, acting conventions, and more. Discover *kyōgen* through exercises and walk-throughs of pre-modern scenarios.
fee_itemization: The multi-page handout contains synopsis of period plays, character descriptions, stage drawing, and more.

name: A Fearsome Foursome: *Fia Guilemina* for Four
description_book: This delightful passion play for four people represents one of the most challenging dances of the 15th century. Advanced dancers only.
description_web: This delightful passion play for four people represents one of the most challenging dances of the 15th century. Advanced dancers only.

name: Multiplayer Period Chess
description_book: Chess games for four players. We will review rules and variations, then provide time to play.
description_web: Chess games for four players. We will review rules and variations, then provide time to play.

name: Advanced Thrown Weapons
description_book: This class focuses on advanced throwing technique for more experienced throwers.
description_web: This class focuses on advanced throwing technique for more experienced throwers.

name: Basics of Flexible Weapons Fighting
description_book: Learn to fight with the techniques of the Filipino *sarong*, covering offensive and defensive techniques. No martial arts experience required.
description_web: Learn to fight with the techniques of the Filipino *sarong*, which can also be applied to other flexible items such as scarves or belts. Class will cover offensive and defensive techniques including blocks, traps and chokes. No martial arts experience or equipment required.

name: Youth Combat Afternoon Session
description_book: Youth Combat Lists open.
description_web: Youth Combat Lists open.

name: Embroidery for Children and the Young at Heart
description_book: Children learned to embroider at a young age in the Middle Ages. Children as young as four years old can manage freehand embroidery.
fee_itemization: Favor blank, small hoop, needle, embroidery floss.

name: Leather Coronets: Light, Bright and Beautiful
description_book: We'll go over some of the options in putting together a leather coronet.
description_web: Does your coronet weigh heavy on your brow....not from duty, but from the amount of metal on your head? Do you want something lighter but still elegant? This class will go over some of the options in putting together a leather coronet.

name: Beginning Helm Safety: Padding and Strapping
description_book: This class teaches the beginning fighter how to pad and strap a helmet for heavy combat.
description_web: Are you new to the SCA? Do you want to get started in heavy combat, but are not sure where to begin? Have you ever had a helm fail inspection, and are not sure how to fix it? Or did you just get out of loaner gear, bought your first helm, and are not sure how to pad and strap it so it is comfortable, safe, **and** passes the inspection requirements of the most stringent, eagle-eyed marshal? I will teach you how.

name: The Luttrell Psalter: A Mirror of the 14th Century
description_book: A visual tour of this 14th-century English manuscript will offer scribes a treasure-trove of images easily adapted for SCA award scrolls.
description_web: Described as "an unparalleled mirror of its age," this 14th-century English manuscript offers us an intimate glimpse into the day-to-day lives of a minor noble family, its estate and its workers. This visual tour of the manuscript will give scribes a treasure-trove of images that can easily be adapted for award scrolls.  View the manuscript online:  http://www.bl.uk/manuscripts/FullDisplay.aspx?ref=Add_MS_42130

name: Basic Knotwork
description_book: How to create basic knotwork.
description_web: How to create basic knotwork.

location: Denys The Decadent (Denys the Decadent's Camp  EO8)
name: 12-Step Meetings
description_book: Daily meetings for those in any 12-step program such as AA, NA, OA, SA, Alanon, etc.
description_web: We welcome all in AA, NA, OA, SA, Alanon, etc., who are in any 12-step program to the 4:00 pm daily meeting at EO8 Denys The Decadent's Camp.

name: *Chorulus Pennsicus*
description_book: *Chorulus Pennsicus* is a select choir, audition required. Previous choral singing is expected.
description_web: *Chorulus Pennsicus* is a select choir, entrance by audition. Previous choral singing experience is expected. The audition includes a prepared vocal selection and a sight-reading session. CP performs with the Known World Choir and Friends on Thursday evening of War Week. See the class book/web site for next year’s audition details.

name: Learning *Lamma Bada Yata Thanna*
description_book: Learn the history and musical parts of the Andalusian song, *Lamma Bada Yata Thanna.* Singers, dancers, musicians, drummers all welcome!
description_web: Calling all Middle Eastern performers! Learn about, perform, and dance to the Andalusian song, *Lamma Bada Yata Thanna.* The first part will be history, then we'll move into the lyrics, drum rhythm, melody, and dancing. Handouts, including sheet music, will be available for a fee. You can get the sheet music in advance from http://www.bellydancesheetmusic.com/.

name: How to Sing, Plus How to Sing This New Piece
description_book: Join Lord Geoffrey of Exeter, Queen's Bardic Champion of the Kingdom of the East, for two classes in one! Singing technique, then learn a new piece.
description_web: Join Lord Geoffrey of Exeter, Queen's Bardic Champion of the Kingdom of the East, for two classes in one! First, we will learn some pointers about good group singing technique, focused on vocal projection, tuning, blend, breathing and dynamics. Second, we will learn a piece written by Lord Geoffrey for 3 vocal parts, written with SCA use in mind and using a period text: "The World an Illusion". (To get a sense of previous works by Lord Geoffrey (aka David Yardley) in advance of the class, you can find his professionally-recorded album of compositions online, titled "New Carols and Songs for Chaucer's Pilgrims".)

name: *The Maid*: Mistress Gabrielle d'Auvergne
description_book: *The Maid*: A retelling of the story of Joan of Arc by Mistress Gabrielle d'Auvergne.
description_web: *The Maid*: A retelling of the story of Joan of Arc by Mistress Gabrielle d'Auvergne.

name: KW Thrown Weapons Marshals: Opening Meeting
description_book: This meeting is open to all Known World Thrown Weapons Marshals. Please attend to hear this year's range procedures.
description_web: This meeting is open to all Known World Thrown Weapons Marshals. Please attend to hear this year's range procedures.

name: Fix It!
description_book: How to creatively (and in a period manner) fix mistakes on a scroll.

name: Open Scribal Time
description_book: Take advantage of our clean, well-lit space to work on existing projects or to try your hand at calligraphy and/or illumination.

name: Vampires in History
description_book: What did your persona believe about vampires? (Also includes other revenant/ undead traditions.)
description_web: Let's look at these blood (or life) draining monsters in history. Where and when were they known, what were they called? Where do they come from? How do you protect yourself from them?

name: Learn to Use the East Kingdom A&S Rubric: Part 1
description_book: Attendees will practice using the EK A&S Rubric to assess a project. Designed to train judges, this class also benefits artisans. All are welcome!
description_web: Attendees will practice using the EK A&S Rubric to assess a project. Designed to train judges, this class also benefits artisans. All are welcome! Come to part 1, even if you can not stay for part 2.

name: Learning to Play the Big Drum (*Tupan/Davul*)
description_book: This class will cover basic and intermediate technique on the *davul*, as well as brief notes about buying or building one. Some loaners available.

name: Weaving the Dance: *Tesara*
description_book: An advanced 15th-century performance dance for ten people mimicking the weaving of brocade. A visually stunning and exciting routine!
description_web: An advanced 15th-century performance dance for ten people mimicking the weaving of brocade. A visually stunning and exciting routine to be performed at the Feast of the Phoenix on War Tuesday!

name: Medieval Power Ballads: Lady Cobflaith & Friends
description_book: Enjoy a combination of pretty melodies and harmonies about love and loss, and forceful performances sung about (and by) strong women with a guitar.
description_web: Enjoy a combination of pretty melodies and harmonies about love and loss, and forceful performances sung about (and by) strong women. There will be at least one guitar!

name: Rehearsal (Closed): KWP Read-Through Cast and Crew
description_book: Space in use.
description_web: Space in use.

name: Archery Champions' Practice
description_book: Everyone who wishes to try out for the Archery Champions teams is welcome and encouraged to attend. Yes, **you** are good enough to try out!

name: Period Drinking Songs
description_book: Sing a variety of period songs about drinking from across Europe, including easy unison and rounds, as well as harmony with up to four parts.
description_web: Learn to sing a variety of period songs about consuming alcoholic beverages from across Europe. The songs vary in difficulty from easy unison and rounds to harmony with up to four parts, so anyone can participate. Music will be available to take with you. If you have heard of the Pennsic Drinking and Singing Walk or the *Hymni Bacchi*, this is the music we sing.
fee_itemization:
The Carolingian Jongleurs Guild has historically provided free handouts for this class.
Instructor is teaching on 8/9 at 12-1 and 3-4 -- Artis

name: Learn to Use the East Kingdom A&S Rubric: Part 2
description_book: Attendees will practice using the EK A&S Rubric to assess a project. Designed to train judges, this class also benefits artisans. All are welcome!
description_web: Attendees will practice using the EK A&S Rubric to assess a project. Designed to train judges, this class also benefits artisans. All are welcome! Please feel free to come to Part 2 of this class, even if you can not attend Part 1.

name: *Atlatl* Battle
description_book: *Atlatl* battle on the *Atlatl* range at the back of Thrown Weapons.

name: *Chorale du Lac* (Bog Choir)
description_book: Choir class for all levels of singers, no exp. necessary, all voices welcome. Simple period partsongs, rounds, catches.
description_web:
We will warm up, discuss and practice new vocal, music theory, and choral skills each day, and then sing a selection of rounds, catches, and simple part songs from period sources. Each day will be a different class. This is a good choir class for beginning singers who want to sing together in a group for fun, and for experienced singers to take a refresher in choral singing and work on technique and tuning. No experiences necessary, all voices welcome. Instead of rehearsing for a performance, we will practice for learning's sake and go caroling in the Bog at the end of the series. 
Visit https://www.facebook.com/groups/1470354713287848/, the "Bog University" FaceBook group for more info.

name: Opening Ceremonies
description_book: Opening Ceremonies for Pennsic War 47.

name: Cedar, The Barefoot Bard
description_book: Old Norse tales and songs.
description_web: Old Norse tales and songs.

name: Master Cariadoc
description_book: Poems and stories presented in persona, as a period performer presenting to a period audience.
description_web: Poems and stories presented in persona, as a period performer presenting to a period audience.

name: Bedtime Stories for Children
description_book: Nightly telling of stories for children.
description_web: 7 pm nightly: Stories and fables for children. All are welcome to attend; must have adult escort.

name: Pennsic Night Live with The Hanging Jesters
description_book: Don’t miss this travelling band of Gypsy Jesters! A comedy troupe of world renown! They sing, they dance, they almost always wear pants!
description_web: Don’t miss this travelling band of Gypsy Jesters! A comedy troupe of world renown! They sing, they dance, they almost always wear pants! Performers include those who attended the sketch comedy workshop earlier this week.

name: Youth Combat Evening Activities
description_book: Armored games.
description_web: Armored games.

name: Family Stories in the Bog
description_book: Stories and fables for children. All are welcome to attend; youth must have adult escort.
description_web: Stories and fables for children. All are welcome to attend; youth must have adult escort.

name: Middle Eastern Tent *Hafla*
description_book: M-East *Hafla* open to all dancers and ME musicians. (Melody line players will need to perform on instruments pitched at A=440. Bring your chairs.)
description_web: Middle Eastern *Hafla* open to all dancers and ME musicians. Melody line players will need to perform on instruments pitched at A=440 and will need to bring your own chair or stool. Percussionists are encouraged to trade off between other players in order to minimize the volume with respect to melody line players. Proficiency on your instruments is highly encouraged.

name: The Irish *Frau*: Aibhilin inghean Daibhidh
description_book: Aibhilin, the Irish *Frau*, debuts mix of music for harp and voice with period songs, SCA works, rousing SCA war songs, with a little humor thrown in!
description_web: Aibhilin, the Irish *Frau*, performs a mix of music for harp and voice from period songs, modern SCA compositions, to rousing *a capella* SCA war songs. And, of course, a little humor thrown in!

name: Thrown Weapons Night Tournament
description_book: This fun evening tournament includes throwing at glow sticks.
description_web: This fun evening tournament includes throwing at glow sticks.

name: Early Bird Ball
description_book: Come and dance at the second ball of Pennsic! Lots of fun dances and opportunities to greet old friends and to meet new ones!
description_web: Come and dance at the first ball of Pennsic! Lots of fun dances and opportunities to greet old friends and to meet new ones! If you are interested in playing in the band, Siri Toivosdotter (Jo-Ann Sheffer) will be organizing the music and directing.

name: *i Verdi Confusi*: Players' Patchwork Theatre Comp
description_book: Players' Patchwork returns with hilarious antics of *Commedia all'Improvviso*! Of Course! It All Makes Sense Now!
description_web: Players' Patchwork returns with hilarious antics of *Commedia all'Improvviso*! Of Course! It All Makes Sense Now!

name: Bellatrix: Individual Session
description_book: Individuals or small groups with Duke Paul, covering any martial topic. **Contact Duke Paul** at paul@bellatrix.org **to schedule** ACTUAL date/time.
description_web:
**TIME/DATE NOT FIRM.** One to two hours with Duke Paul for individuals or small groups, covering any martial topic. 
**Contact Duke Paul** at paul@bellatrix.org to **schedule actual date/time**.  The dates/times in this listing are placeholders.

name: Yoga For Dancers, Fighters or Pretty Much Anyone
description_book: Yoga to help us through the rigors of War, regardless of our activities. Please bring a mat/towel and dress for modesty. Kids must bring guardian.
description_web: Yoga to help us through the rigors of War, regardless of our activities. Please bring a mat or towel and dress for modesty. Children may attend with parent/guardian present.

name: Coffee with Friends of Bill and Dr Bob
description_book: Morning recovery meetings in agnostic format.
description_web: Morning recovery meetings in agnostic format.

name: Rehearsal (Closed): Known World Players (KWP)
description_book: Space in use.
description_web: Space in use.

name: *Étude* 3 for Single Rapier Obliques and Cuts
description_book: For all levels and teachers. Drills focus on form, balance, movement and coordination. *Études* for drill; elements from drill used to work in groups.
description_web: For beginner and intermediate fencers and those who teach them. These drills will focus on form, balance, movement and coordination. *Étude* 3 focuses on oblique movements for offense and defense as well as a variety of cuts. Emphasis will be on learning the *étude* for home drill, as well as taking elements out of the drill for more focused work in groups. Each of the 5 sessions will take a different element out of the drill for daily focus and is self-contained. Attendance every day is not required, but is  beneficial to long term retention. Equipment needed: rapier, gloves, mask, gorget. Full fencing armor is not required as we will do slow drills, not full sparring.

location: Thunder Bird Atlatl  (Thunder Bird Atlatl Booth #80?)
name: How to Make an *Atlatl* Dart
description_book: How to make an *atlatl* dart from start to cast. Limit of four students participating in each class.
fee_itemization: Kits: Basic Caster and 3 dart available from Thunderbird Atlatl for $40 or Caster $25 and/or $8 per Dart 5' or 6'.

name: Youth Combat Morning Session
description_book: Lists open.
description_web: Youth Fighting lists open.

name: Research 101: The Known World in the Age of Info
description_book: Never done research? Haven’t done it in a while? Learn basic academic research skills for the SCA: finding, obtaining, evaluating, and using sources.

name: Keeping Bees in the Knowne World
description_book: Get an idea of what is involved in keeping bees in the here and now. I'll walk you through a typical year.
description_web: Get an idea of what is involved in keeping bees in the here and now. I'll walk you through a typical year.

name: Medieval Virtues as Persona Development
description_book: Virtues in the medieval world were greatly lauded, and their mark is left on a great deal of literature.
description_web: Virtues, as characteristics of behavior and attitudes, were greatly lauded by medieval writers, across multiple faith and cultural traditions. This class explores how these virtues (and possibly vices) may provide modern-day medieval recreationists with another source to develop personas as performative elements in the SCA. What do *Eddas* tell us about viking virtues? Does Maimonedes help us in developing Jewish personas? How do we view the writings of the Church Fathers to better portray who we want to be in the SCA?

name: Fun with Body Parts II: Pilgrimage
description_book: Need the personal intervention of a saint? Pay him or her a visit! An irreverent look at the hundreds of thousands who left home on pilgrimage.
description_web: Need the personal intervention of a saint? Pay him or her a visit! An irreverent look at the hundreds of thousands who left home on pilgrimage: who went, why, and where. Taught by someone who has been to the Big Three: Compostela, Rome, Jerusalem.

name: Pennsic Camping with Kids: A Hands-On Roundtable
description_book: Join Ana Sarasdottir for a hands-on roundtable to commiserate, share tips, and try some new ideas that can make camping with kids more fun!
description_web: Camping with kids can feel overwhelming. Join Ana Sarasdottir for a hands-on roundtable to commiserate, share tips, and try some new ideas that can make camping with kids more fun! Limited supplies and handouts available. Children are, of course, welcome but not required.
fee_itemization: Yarn, beads, paint, paint brushes, cloth bandanas, glue

name: History of Gunpowder and Gunpowder Weapons
description_book: Documenting the origins and history of gunpowder and gunpowder weapons from their earliest use to circa 1600 CE.

name: The Bayeux Tapestry and the Battle of Hastings
description_book: History is embroidered by the victors! An introduction to the story in the Bayeux Tapestry and the events leading up to the Battle of Hastings.

name: An Oval Wicker Basket with Wrapped Handle
description_book: This will be a challenge. We'll be making a market-style basket using different sizes of round reed and many new weaving techniques.
description_web: This market-style basket will feature many new weaving techniques, and several different sizes and textures of round reed. It promises to be challenging. Be prepared to get wet!

name: Viking Wire Weave Basics
description_book: Viking Wire Weave is a period correct art form that is fun, easy and inexpensive. I will show you how to get started.
description_web: Viking Wire Weave is a period correct art form that is fun, easy and inexpensive. Also known as trichinopoly or Viking Knitting, there is archaeological evidence for wire chains constructed using “circular plaiting”  in Viking burials and treasure hoards dating as early as the 8th century to as late as the 12th century. Come learn with the Mistress of Wire herself! You will learn how to make a "sextapus" to hold your chain in place, a basic 6-loop pattern, draw plate techniques and how to finish the ends to add a clasp.
fee_itemization: Copper "sextapus" $.50, wooden dowel $.50, draw plate $1, craft wire $2, end cones $2.50, clasp $1.50

name: Traditions in the SCA: A Roundtable Discussion
description_book: Discussion of how traditions in the SCA can vary between different kingdoms and regions.
description_web: Discussion of how traditions in the SCA can vary between different kingdoms and regions. Come and share how things are done in your kingdom and learn about how other kingdoms do things. We will be discussing a variety of topics including but not limited to typical events, court, peerage ceremonies, food and whatever else the participants want to talk about. Also feel free to just sit and listen if that is what you prefer.

name: Beginning Japanese Embroidery
description_book: Stitch a simple grass motif using flat silk thread in the Japanese manner.
description_web: Stitch a simple grass motif using flat silk thread in the Japanese manner. The stitches are similar to European embroidery - it's the handling of the silk threads that is special. Will include a brief overview of the history and Japanese aesthetic as well.
fee_itemization: Silk fabric mounted to a wooden frame, flat silk thread

name: Spoken Latin
description_book: Introduction to basic conversational, Pennsic-appropriate Classical Latin. Oral participation encouraged. Handouts available.
description_web: An introduction to basic conversational, Pennsic-appropriate Classical Latin. Oral participation encouraged. Handouts available.
fee_itemization: Handouts = $1 to keep, but can be borrowed for free. Contact dumnonaSCA@gmail.com for free digital copy.

name: Easy Quilted "No Sew" Ornament
description_book: We will make a quilted "No Sew" ornament using rectangular fabric pieces and straight pins. Kits will be available or you can bring your own fabric.
description_web: We will make a quilted "No Sew" ornament using rectangular fabric pieces and straight pins. Kits will be available or you can bring your own fabric. If you use your own fabric, bring 16 pre-cut pieces (2" x 3") of cotton or linen in two different colors. Patterned material can be used but the pattern must be small. Find a picture (printed on fabric) for the center (picture itself should be no bigger than 1.5" square). The overall center piece needs to be 3" square and you'll 2 of them. You'll need a box of #17 straight pins, 3/4" wide ribbon 12" long (so it corresponds to the fabric you've chosen), 1/4" wide ribbon, 60" long (can be 2 different colors, each 30" long), and 1/8" wide ribbon (8" long). 12 years and older please.

name: Armor Repair for Beginners
description_book: This covers the basics of armor repair, and how armor repair becomes armor construction.
description_web: Did you arrive at an event to find your armor has a broken strap, a popped rivet, or some other damage you didn't notice from the last time you used it? Did you feel or hear a piece of your armor come loose or break when you took that last hit? Did a marshal tell you to fix it before you come back on the field, and you're not sure how, and everyone who does know how is still on the field? This class teaches you how to assemble a basic armor repair kit, the tools and supplies you need to do basic, safe, legal repairs to your own armor, and get you back on the field. We also show how these simple, basic repairs are a starting point to building your own armor.

name: *Commedia dell'Arte* for Youth
description_book: Hands-on class giving the description and history of *Commedia* before having the youth create and eventually perform their own skit. Ages 13-17.
description_web: Young adults will learn the art of *commedia dell'arte* while practicing and creating skits that will be performed at the end of the week. Ages 13-17.

name: Archery Practice
description_book: Warm up, practice shoot, and have fun on the Archery Range.

name: Beginner Dance for Families
description_book: Some simple steps and dances will be taught to introduce children of all ages and their families to period European dancing. No experience needed.

name: Period Card Games: *Tarot*
description_book: Do you like to play cards? Come learn to play this late-period card game which uses a 78-card deck.
description_web: Looking for something to pass the time at events? Do you like to play cards? Come learn to play this late-period card game which uses a 78-card tarot deck

name: Family Stick Weaving
description_book: Family-oriented stick weaving. Youth welcome with parent or guardian.
description_web: Family-oriented stick weaving. Youth welcome with parent or guardian. Stick weaving is a simple, weft-based weaving method. Great for making belts and straps. Upgradable to make everything from shawls to rugs. Fee covers sticks and string; take your work home with you.

name: Make a Simple, Appliquéd 14th-Century-Style Pouch
description_book: Appliqué and sew your own 14th-century-style purse during this four-hour class.
description_web:
We will go through a quick survey of 14th-century pouches/purses. We will also briefly discuss the late 14th-century appliquéd wall hanging of "Tristan and Iseult". Using this wall hanging as source material, you will appliqué and sew your own 14th-century-style pouch. 

There will be limited kits available: wool appliqué on wool purse (or linen appliqué on linen purse), pre-made DMC tassels, fingerlooped purse strings, small embroidery hoop, small scissors, needles and thread, including gold couching thread.
fee_itemization: Kit will include: pre-cut applique pieces in wool or linen, pre-cut piece of wool or linen to make the purse, small embroidery hoop, small embroidery scissors, DMC thread, pre-made DMC tassels, pre-made fingerloop braid purse strings (3 per kit), needles, sewing thread, gold couching thread, hand-out.

name: Youth Rapier Activities
description_book: There will be a variety of youth rapier activities each day including drills, games and one-on-one instruction. Some loaner gear will be available.
description_web: There will be a variety of youth rapier activities each day including drills, games and one-on-one instruction. Some days may include special additional activities. Some loaner gear will be available. Participants do not have to be authorized. Children age 6 and up may participate. Please bring your parent/guardian the first day you attend to learn more about the youth rapier program.

name: Thrown Weapons MIT: Part 1
description_book: Learn the SCA rules and guidelines to be a Thrown Weapons Marshal. Parts 1 & 2 required with on-the-range training and written test on Friday.
description_web: Learn the SCA rules and guidelines to be a Thrown Weapons Marshal. Parts 1 & 2 required with on-the-range training and written test on Friday.

name: *Katana* for SCA Combat
description_book: This is a non-armored class to show how Japanese single sword can be used in SCA armored combat.
description_web: This is a non-armored class to show how Japanese single sword can be used in SCA armored combat. Topics such as defense, attack, movement and proper thought will be covered.

name: Chinese Calligraphy Brush Painting
description_book: Grinding ink and the brush writing of ancient Chinese characters from oracle bone to cursive scripts.
description_web: A brief history of Chinese calligraphy: Brush painting Chinese characters that were developed over 3000 years ago and that are still used today. Explore a variety of Chinese scripts from oracle bone pictographs to the more modern scripts of the Han Dynasty (200 BC to 200 AD). We will explore the 4 treasures and create beautiful characters. This class is intended for beginners, but students at any level may benefit. There will be supplies for 8 people to use, but others can observe.

name: Parchment-Making Workshop(s)
description_book: This workshop covers all of the major preparatory steps for making parchment over many days.
description_web: This workshop covers all of the major preparatory steps of making usable parchment over the span of 10 days. This will include repeated steps of most of the processes in order to try and render up to 12 hides during the entire War. Day 1 instruction will have us prepping hides for lime bath, starting lime baths, and stretching four prepared hides on the stretcher frames (to include scraping).

name: EK Day at Family Point: Origami
description_book: Learn to fold some classic Origami figures

name: Creative Feast Help: Faith in Others
description_book: How to build a feast menu around products (specifically cheese) provided by other artisans to showcase their work.
description_web:
So you want to do something **amazing** for your feast! And you have all these ideas! And no time to do it yourself. How do you get other people to help you make what you need **or** use what they make?
The Feast at Ymir 2018 was the Great Atlantian Cheese Feast; nearly all the cheese was made by hand by an SCA member. This class will discuss how it was planned and how the dishes worked to showcase other cheesemakers. Who knows, there might even be snacks.
Feast documentation located here: https://drive.google.com/file/d/0B9MTq4ldUgWLN3NRVnZTc2JxTVF6TmdLaGRFR0dmTE5QRk44/view?usp=sharing

name: Social Media for Fun and Non-Profit
description_book: Social media is a fact of modern life. Niche organizations and businesses can benefit but only if done right. Learn how!
description_web: Social media is a fact of modern life. Niche businesses and organizations like the SCA can benefit but only if it's done right. Instructor is the voice of billion-dollar brands in her mundane life and travels to train organizations and non-profits across the US. Learn how to administer groups, how to create ads for events *and* recruiting, how to enable social media without diluting events (or running afoul of legal issues), and  even ways to use social media for your SCA-focused business. Ideal for group officers, business owners or communicators of any kind.

name: Preteen and Teen Activities/Volunteer at Pennsic
description_book: Parents, do you want to get your kids involved? Not sure what to do or where to go? Come to this class and find out!
description_web: Parents, do you want to get your kids involved? Not sure what to do or where to go? Come to this class and find out! This class is for parents and kids. We will discuss things for kids 11-18 to do and volunteer for at Pennsic.

name: The Humoral Doctrine
description_book: An explanation of the origins and structure of the prevailing doctrine of health in the medieval and Renaissance periods.

name: Very Basic Naalbinding
description_book: Naalbinding creates a stretchy fabric by using a large sewing needle and yarn. I demonstrate a simple naalbinding stitch and basic techniques.
description_web: Introduction to naalbinding for those with no prior experience. Naalbinding is a craft which creates a stretchy fabric by using a large sewing needle and yarn. This predates knitting and is found in a variety of medieval cultures. I will demonstrate a simple naalbinding stitch (Oslo stitch) and discuss the basic techniques.

name: Performance and Written Work Documentation for A&S
description_book: How to get started with documentation. Elements to consider when documenting your historical performance or historically-based written work.
description_web: Documenting a performance or original written work is challenging. Judging sheets do not always help with what you need to document. “Materials” and other terms are ethereal concepts in a performance or written work! Elements to consider when documenting your historical performance or historically-based written work will be discussed.

name: Andalusian and *Maghrebi* Names
description_book: We'll discuss names from *al-Andalus* and from the Magreb. We'll talk about language, elements, and structure of the names found there.

name: Basic Rattan Weapon Making for the Beginner
description_book: This class teaches the basics of making the rattan swords used in SCA heavy fighting.
description_web: Are you new to fighting and want to learn the basics of making your own equipment? Did you ever try to make a weapon only to have it fail inspection at the first event you brought it to? Is your first weapon nearing the end of its life, and you're not sure where to start building a new one? Did you spend the money on rattan to make a sword, and you're afraid that you'll waste it because you're not sure what you're doing? Do you need a sword in an hour, and have the materials, but not the know-how or extra hands to make one? This is the class for you! In this class, we take you from bare stick to inspection-ready weapon in under an hour. Great for the beginner, or the fighter who needs a replacement weapon in a hurry. If you bring a stick, we will have the tape, thrusting tips, and tools on hand to help you start building.

name: Known World Chatelaines' Meeting
description_book: A meeting for all (past and present) local, regional, kingdom or Society Chatelaines.
description_web: A meeting for all (past and present) local, regional, kingdom or Society Chatelaines to share stories, ideas and strategies. Light refreshments provided.

name: Scribal Track:  Luttrell Psalter
description_book: Intensive 5-day workshop focusing on the *Luttrell Psalter*: design, calligraphy, gilding, and painting. Fee covers all supplies, handouts, and kit.
description_web: Intensive workshop, focusing on the fantastic 14th-century English manuscript, the *Luttrell Psalter*. Topics to be covered include history and design of the manuscript, calligraphy, gilding, and painting. Plan to attend all 5 days. Fee covers supplies, handouts, and take-home kit, enough to keep you working after War!
fee_itemization: Fee covers supplies, handouts, and take-home kit.

name: Fools' School
description_book: Are you a fool or a fool wannabe? Come to Fools' School to share and learn. Prepare a 5-minute skit to perform. All ages/experience levels welcome.
description_web: Are you a fool or a fool wannabe? Come to Fools' School to share and learn. Fools/performers of all types and experience levels are welcome. Jugglers, magicians, singers, freaks and geeks. Get help creating or honing a skit of no more than 5 minutes to perform in the Amphitheater, Wednesday, 8/8, 6-7 pm. You might even become a “Licensed Fool.” Performing is not mandatory.

name: Instrument Making
description_book: Before you make the music you make the instrument. The artisan will be showing how this is done.

name: Apothecary
description_book: A set-up and demonstration of an apothecary shop.

name: Beginning *Atlatl*
description_book: Learn the basics of *atlatl* safety: how to hold the *atlatl*, load a dart, and throw the dart.
description_web: Learn the basics of *atlatl* safety: how to hold the *atlatl*, load a dart, and throw the dart.

name: Belly Dance Basics with Hadia
description_book: Learn belly dance movements, techniques, muscle isolations and combinations. Classes are for men and women. Drummers are always welcome!
description_web: Learn Middle Eastern belly dance movements, techniques, muscle isolations, and combinations while gaining strength, balance, flexibility, stamina, coordination, body awareness and basic movements. We will organize dance patterns, learn to improvise, and use mini-combos for any form of belly dance. Loose clothing encouraged. Hip scarves, shimmy belts, full skirts, etc., are all optional and very helpful for movement awareness. Class is open to everyone who desires a review of basic belly dance movements and technique.

name: Introduction to Beer-Making
description_book: Kit brewing, or how to brew beer in your kitchen. A demonstration of how to use readily available beer kits to brew 5 gallon batches.

name: *Seishin-ryū Sadō Okeiko*: Practice the Art of Tea
description_book: Learn the rudiments of *wabi*-style tea including both the role of the host and the role of the guest. This is a multi-part workshop for beginners.
description_web:
Learn the rudiments of *wabi*-style tea including both the role of the host and the role of the guest. This is a multi-part workshop for beginners. Please come to as many classes as possible. 

*Okeiko* means "honorable practice". This is a multi-part workshop intended for beginners who wish to learn how to participate in tea gatherings. Both the role of the guest and the role of the host will be introduced. You will learn something new in each workshop. We will begin with walking and bowing and progress to the rudiments of preparing and consuming a bowl of *matcha*. Limited materials will be available for student use during the workshop. 

If you are interested in purchasing materials for long-term personal use, then you should acquire a guest kit and a *fukusa*: 
A guest kit for men can be acquired at: http://www.teadogu.com/guest-starter-kit-man339.html
A guest kit for women can be acquired at: http://www.teadogu.com/guest-starter-kit-woman339.html
A *fukusa* for men can be acquired at: http://www.teadogu.com/fumepunu9si.html
A *fukusa* for women can be acquired at: http://www.teadogu.com/fuworenu9si.html
While it is possible to save money by ordering directly from Japan, doing so requires dealing with Japanese online storefronts. A note about *fukusa*. A number #9 *fukusa* is much easier to manipulate than *fukusa* with lower numbers. Paying extra is worth the price. A *fukusa* and a fan are what  you need to practice during class. I have an extremely limited number of loaner *fukusa*. You can substitute a number of items  for a fan.
