Please read the online descriptions of the fans carefully if you choose to provide a substitute or acquire a fan from another source.

There are a number of ways to acquire a 袱紗 *fukusa*. You can even try to make one, but please don't until you know what they are supposed to be like. There is some controversy over just how old they are. Today, men use slightly larger *fukusa* than women do. Further, men always use purple *fukusa* and women typically only use purple *fukusa* after they have become senior instructors. Regardless, here are purchase options. (1) You can always try ebay. (2) You can order online from any of several tea supply stores in Japan through rakuten.co.jp. (3) You can order one from a fellow in Portland http://www.teadogu.com/fukusa.html (Yes, they really are that expensive.) I will try to pick up a couple of loaners (I currently have one) between now and Pennsic. Regardless, the fan is the symbol of the guest, and the *fukusa* is the symbol of the host in the world of tea.
fee_itemization: This class will include a multi-page printed handout.

name: Choral Ball Rehearsal
description_book: Singers and instrumentalists rehearse for the Choral Ball held Monday or Tuesday of War Week. (Will need to edit)
description_web: Singers and instrumentalists, come rehearse for the Choral Ball which will be held Monday or Tuesday evening of War Week. If possible, procure music and practice tracks in advance on the Facebook Group SCA Choral Ensemble. Walk-ins are welcome; some music will be provided. This rehearsal is not required to participate in the Ball, but it will be very helpful. Singers are encouraged to take a look and listen to the music ahead of time. (Will need to edit this once the Ball date is set.)

location: Herald's Point ( Intersection of the Low Road with the Great Eastern Highway, next to Family Point)
name: Topics in Basic Heraldry
description_book: These classes will teach basic name and/or armory skills for consulting at Pennsic Herald's Point. Dates and topics will be posted at Herald's Point.
description_web: These classes will teach basic name and/or armory submission skills necessary to consult at Pennsic Herald's Point. Exact dates and topics will be posted at Herald's Point at the beginning of the War. All newer heralds are strongly encouraged to attend at least one of these classes prior to volunteering at Herald's Point.

name: Forging and Use of Fire Steels
description_book: This class will show how to forge a basic fire steel. There will be hands-on instruction on use of flint and steel.

name: Unbelted Champions Battle
description_book: description to follow
description_web:
TENTATIVE:
(Muster 9:30 am) 
1 point.
20 fighters.
1 pass.
Full field.
Crowns may not fight. Unbelted Heirs may.
No Allies.
**Alternates/Allies to fight a 2nd pass, 50 vs 50 for no points.

name: SCAbominations
description_book: The things the SCA taught you about the Middle Ages that just aren't true. Parents' note: Includes brief, graphic discussion of prostitution.
description_web:
The things the SCA taught you about the Dark Ages, Middle Ages, and Renaissance that just aren't true. Were peasants "nasty, brutish and short"? Did the rich over-use spices? 
Parents' note: Includes a brief, graphic discussion of prostitution.

name: Storytelling Academy
description_book: Explore genres, tools, styles, and uses of storytelling. Cultural and medieval approaches, applications, performance coaching. New topics each day.
description_web: During this nine-day academy, students will gain knowledge about the history and techniques for storytelling both in the SCA and the modern world. Students may attend individual sessions or all of the academy. There will be guest teachers and time for students to practice and receive feedback. The academy will culminate in a student performance. No classes are repeated. The focus is on developing comfort, nurturing, and honing skills within the students’ capabilities. All levels are welcome. Students may view a class outline at the academy space, Minerva’s Spindle 158, where classes will also be listed on the message board. Seating is limited; feel free to bring your own chair. Student Performance, Thursday 8/9, 5pm in the performance pavilion.

name: Æthelmearc-Sponsored Novelty Shoot
description_book: Daily novelty shoots hosted by the Kingdom of Æthelmearc. These shoots will be simple fun shoots for any skill level.

name: KW Children's Choir Rehearsal
description_book: The Pennsic Children's Choir is an open choir for any children ages 4-11 who enjoy singing. They perform as part of the concert on 8/9/18.
description_web: The Pennsic Children's Choir is an open choir for any children ages 4-11 who enjoy singing. They rehearse for one hour each day and perform at the Knowne World Choir concert on Thursday 8/9/18. The director of the Pennsic Children's Choir this year is Mistress Deonna von Aachen.

name: Introduction to Irish Frame Drum, the *Bodhrán*
description_book: Basic instruction in *bodhrán* including most-used rhythms, session etiquette. Bring a drum if you have one; some loaners available.
description_web: Learn how to choose and care for the *bodhrán*: what makes a good tipper; tune and set structure; how to identify and play jig, reel, hornpipe, slip jig, polka rhythms; etiquette; jokes. Learn secret arcane hand gestures to amaze and stun your listeners. Demonstration of how to adapt *bodhrán* drumming to period music. Bring a *bodhrán* if you have one. A few loaner drums will be available. Teens and older welcomed.

name: Empty Tent Place Holder - 2 hrs
description_book: Some loud classes need an empty tent next to them. This is that tent.

name: Rapier Bear Pit Tourney
description_book: A no-frills classic bear pit. Three passes, winner stays, three fights maximum. Everyone welcome. Fight until you drop. Lots of prizes!
description_web: Nothing fancy here: a classic bear pit tourney. Three passes, winner stays, three fights maximum. Every skill level welcome. Bring your best, and fight until you can't fight any more. Prize for 1st, 2nd, and 3rd place. If you've ever felt like you didn't get enough fencing in at Pennsic, here's your answer.

name: Cut-and-Thrust Early Period Tournament
description_book: *Blossfechten* (early period unarmored) Cut-and-Thrust tournament using swords common to the first half of the 16th century and earlier.
description_web:
*Blossfechten* (early period unarmored) point-based tournament, restricted to weapons common in the first half of the 16th century and earlier. Guidelines for allowed weapons:
- Maximum blade length (measured from crossguard to tip) is 38".
- Blades must be at least 1" wide at the hilt. Rapier blades mounted on simple hilts will not be allowed.
- No complex or cup hilts. One large side ring, posts/*nagle*, or a knuckle bow will be allowed.
- Allowed styles: single sword, sword and parrying device or dagger, or two-handed sword. 
- Daggers may not have complex hilts, including any side rings or posts, and may be worn at the belt.

This tournament is part of the Cut-and-Thrust Triathlon, though you are not required to participate in any other tournaments.

location: Speckulian (W10 - Roman Road - Next to the large ROME Camp.)
name: Meditation, Emotional Freedom and Self Empowerment
description_book: Learn simple, proven, meditation techniques for emotional freedom, joy, and self empowerment.
description_web:
Learn simple, proven, meditation techniques for emotional freedom, joy, and self empowerment. Practical breathing, mindset, and self-actualization methods will be presented, along with a group practice and energy session.

It is best to come on an empty stomach, 4 hours from a big meal, or 2 hours from a light snack (like a piece of fruit)

name: Weed Walk
description_book: Wild plant identification. Wear walking shoes and hat; leave from Univ. Point. Different teachers on different days; walk with us more than once!
description_web: Cooper's Lake abounds with medicinal and food plants that were used by various primitive and medieval cultures. Learn to identify them during a walk around the campsite. The walk will take place rain or shine. Please wear sturdy shoes and a hat. Meet at University Point for the start of the class. We have multiple teachers, so if you attend more than one walk you will likely learn different things!

name: Beginning Loud Band
description_book: If you can play a recorder, you can play a Loud Band instrument. Musicians of all levels are welcome. Bring a chair.
description_web: If you can play a recorder, you can play a Loud Band instrument. Musicians of all levels are welcome. The class will begin with a Q&A session about loud instruments including shawms, *rauschpfeiffen* and sackbuts (trombones). There will be a limited number of instruments available to try. Bring instruments and a music stand if you have them. Easy music will be provided, and the class will play some songs. Listeners welcome. Bring a chair.

name: Belted Champions Battle
description_book: description to follow
description_web:
TENTATIVE:
1 point.
20 fighters.
1 pass.
Full field.
Crowns may not fight. Heirs may.
No Allies.

name: EK Day at Family Point: Tassels and Pouches
description_book: Sew a simple pouch, then decorate it with a tassel made by you!

name: History of Sheep
description_book: Discussion of the history of sheep breeds, and which ones would have been available before 1600.
description_web: Sheep have been domesticated since around 10,000 BC. They can be used for wool, meat and milk production. We will discuss the history of sheep breeds, and which ones would have been available before 1600.

name: On Being a Pilgrim
description_book: A discussion about walking The Camino de Santiago in garb.

name: Tips and Tricks for Making Garb Easier and Better
description_book: Not period, but helpful tricks for making the job of sewing your own garb easier, and the result better. Believe in the bias.
description_web: Not all methods are period, but this class aims to help the novice to intermediate sewer overcome some of the hurdles encountered when making simple garb. Why fabric "bias" is important.

name: Logboats in the Middle Ages
description_book: An examination of hewn or assembled boats (not rafts) made primarily from logs in the Middle Ages and Renaissance.
description_web: The development and spread of fabricated plank hulls for boats surprisingly did not stop people from making boats out of logs. We will discuss a few surviving European examples from the years between 600 and 1600.

name: Henna 101 for Tweens and Teens
description_book: [YouthU] A hands-on beginner look at henna history, application, and design. Participants will receive an instructional handout and henna cone.
description_web: [YouthU] A hands-on beginner look at henna history, application, and design. Participants will receive an instructional handout and henna cone.

name: Fiber Prep for Handspinners
description_book: Explore different fibers and fiber preparations and strategies for spinning.
description_web: Explore different fibers, fiber preparations and strategies for spinning or felting fibers that may be new to the students as well as recognizing which fiber preparations may be best suited for the skill level and desired outcome by the student. Wools, silks, cottons, and other natural fibers will be explored. This class is suitable for all skill levels. Fibers will be provided in the class materials, but students are encouraged to bring their own fiber samples and fiber prep tools to have questions answered and/or suggestions for dealing with problematic fiber preparations and tools.

name: The Importance of Being Vigilant
description_book: Everything that needs to be considered between being asked to "think well upon your deeds" and the moment you are elevated to a Peerage.
description_web: Are you aspiring to be a Peer? Are you a Peer with students reaching that point? Are you a future Crown who will be recognizing Peers? Are you just curious about the process? This class will cover many of the details to be considered in crafting a successful vigil and ceremony. Taught from a Middle Kingdom perspective, but all are welcome, as inter-Kingdom anthropology is fascinating.

name: Bardic Circles 101
description_book: Entertainment for the people, by the people! Find out what a bardic circle is, etiquette, where to find material, and how to participate.
description_web: Entertainment for the people, by the people! Find out what a bardic circle is, etiquette, where to find material, and how to participate. We won't actually be performing, but we will play a game to give you an idea of how circles work. Conveniently, there's the Runestone (least intimidating) Bardic Circle at 2 pm at Runestone Hill, so you can put your new knowledge and skills to use!

name: Magic as a Performing Art
description_book: Magic in theory and practice. Three period tricks taught by professional magician. Real methods. Class sworn to secrecy.
description_web: Theory and practice of magic as a performance art, taught by a professional magician. We will cover three period tricks from Scot’s *Discoverie of Witchcraft*, 1584, for close-up, parlor, and stage. The class will be sworn to secrecy and real working methods will be taught.

name: Research 102: I’ve Got Stuff – Now What?
description_book: Found your academic sources after Research 101? Learn how to apply research to recreation, including interpreting sources and explaining to others.

name: Putting Punic Back in Pennsic
description_book: There's more to Carthage than the Punic Wars. Overview of Punic and Neo-Punic culture.
description_web:
There's more to Carthage than the Punic Wars, and their influence on the Western Mediterranean lingered well past 146 BC. The goal of this class is to provide an overview of Punic and Neo-Punic culture in North Africa and the Western Mediterranean, and starting points for further research on a variety of topics core to constructing and outfitting an SCA persona.

Handout will include a bibliography and addresses to online resources.

name: Newcomers and Disabilty Q&A
description_book: Will discuss ways to assist newcomers find resources and how to overcome obstacles they may face.
description_web: Will use a Q&A format to talk about accessibility in the SCA, the obstacles I have faced during my time in the SCA and how I dealt with them. Will also share some stories from other accessibility-challenged individuals, and share online and Pennsic resources for accessibility.

name: Youth Theatre
description_book: For kids ages 6-12 interested in exploring their creative and theatrical sides through story telling, acting, and producing their very own play!
description_web: For kids ages 6-12 interested in exploring their creative and theatrical sides through story telling, acting, and producing their very own play! Come join us as we build a theatre show from the ground up, giving younger kids a creative outlet for all that pent-up camping energy! Children 12 and under must have a parent or guardian present.

name: Archery War Points
description_book: Shoot the Castle Window, Soldier Shoot, and Clout for War Points.

name: Multiplayer Table Games
description_book: Four- and seven-player backgammon will be taught depending on attendance. We will review rules and variations, then provide time to play.
description_web: Four- and seven-player backgammon will be taught depending on attendance. We will review rules and variations, then provide time to play.

instructor: Viscountess Kamiilah al Sudanii um Zoom
name: Beginning Middle Eastern Dance
description_book: Covers the basic movements that this lovely art form is based on, including drills! Intermediate and Advanced welcome. I'll make it harder for you!
description_web: Covers the basic movements that this lovely art form is based on, including drills! Intermediate and Advanced welcome. Kamiilah will add layers and make it harder for you!

name: Pennsic Youth Choir: Open Rehearsal
description_book: The Pennsic Youth Choir is open to ages 12 - 19 to learn period vocal music and perform as part of the Known World Choirs Concert, Thursday, War Week.
description_web: The Pennsic Youth Choir is open to youth ages 12 - 19 who enjoy learning and singing period vocal music *a cappella* with Deonna von Aachen. We will rehearse 12-1 pm Sunday, August 6, through Wednesday, August 9. Performance will be part of the Known World Choirs Concert on Thursday evening of War Week. (Dress rehearsal Thursday afternoon, 8/10, in the PAT; details TBA during regular rehearsals.) More information can be found here: https://sites.google.com/site/kwcpennsicchoir/home/pennsic-choir/pennsic-youth-choir

name: Lucet Basics
description_book: Make a square cord and a two-color cord.
description_web: Make a square cord and a two-color cord. Classroom loaner lucets available or bring your own. String provided as part of the class fee.

name: How to Teach Minors to Throw
description_book: Discussion of legal requirements for youth throwing in the SCA as well as talk about teaching techniques that have been successful with minors.
description_web: Recommended for Marshals in Training. This class will go into more detail than the marshaling class about legal requirements for youth throwing in the SCA, as well as talk about teaching techniques that have been successful with minors.

name: Beginning Drumming
description_book: Basic rhythms used most often in drum circles and music within the SCA. A 4-part class; different rhythms each day. **Bring your own drum.**
description_web:
Learn the basic rhythms used most often in drum circles and music within the SCA. This is a 4-part class that teaches different rhythms each day. **Bring your own drum**.
Day 1- *Saidi, Beladi, Maqsum*
Day 2- *Chiftitelli, Masmoudi*
Day 3- *Ayub, Malfouf*
Day 4- *Kashlimah* and other strange stuff

name: *Opus Anglicanum*
description_book: Come and learn goldwork embroidery! Play with shiny thread! With one easy stitch and a bit of patience, create beautiful pieces!
description_web: Come and learn goldwork embroidery! Play with shiny thread! With one easy stitch and a bit of patience, create beautiful pieces! If you have scissors or snips, please bring them, otherwise some will be available to share.
fee_itemization: Gold thread, regular thread, hoop, needle, fabric, wax, stencils.

name: Viking Wire Weaving
description_book: A hands-on class for learning to do basic wire weaving, including drawing down and finishing.
description_web: A hands-on class for learning to do basic wire weaving, including drawing  down and finishing. I will have basic tools and supplies for students, a handout, and kits available for purchase.
fee_itemization: $3 fee includes handout and supplies for in class, and the use of tools.

name: Developing a Make-and-Take Class: Cheesemaking
description_book: Considering teaching a make-n-take class? We'll walk through some of the elements of developing a class while making a simple cheese.
description_web: Make-and-take classes are popular, make excellent demos, and are a great hands-on way to teach a new skill. We will walk through some of the elements of developing your own make-and-take class project while demonstrating the process of making a simple cheese.

name: Wire Jewelry
description_book: Learn the basics of wire jewelry and make a bracelet or medallion hanger. Bring tools and materials if you have them.
description_web: Learn the basics of wire jewelry - making links with beads on them - and make a bracelet or medallion hanger. *Note: Class does not include wrapping a stone or bead*. Please bring tools, wire and beads if you have them. There will be some tools available to borrow and some to purchase at cost.

name: Openwork Embroidery
description_book: Learn a type of embroidery that was used primarily for linen embellishment in later periods. Ten kits available; bring sharp scissors if you can.
description_web: Learn a type of embroidery that was used primarily for linen embellishment in later periods. Ten kits available; no fee for under 17. Bring sharp scissors if you can.
fee_itemization: No fee for the kit for anyone 17 and under.

name: Share the Love: Tokens of Appreciation
description_book: Share ideas for tokens/largesse to give to those who inspire you. Students encouraged to bring examples of tokens they have given or received.
description_web: Share ideas for tokens/largesse to give to those who inspire you. Students encouraged to bring examples of tokens they have given or received.

name: Method in the Madness
description_book: How Bardic Madness came to be and why. The history and logic of bardic madness (or, what were they thinking...?).
description_web: The how and why of Bardic Madness, how it came to be, structure and logic. For those who are interested in hosting or organizing one, and for those interested in encouraging performing arts community building through focused events.

name: Introduction to Combat Archery
description_book: Learn the basics of combat archery. Covers the basics of combat archery: what equipment you need, the rules and basic tactics.
description_web: Have you ever wanted to be a part of the action on the battlefield, but didn't want to swing a sword? Have you ever wanted to shoot back at that pesky archer who keeps killing you? Give combat archery a try. The class will cover the basics of combat archery: what equipment you need, the rules, and basic tactics.

name: Trans 101 for the SCA
description_book: Information about and historical mentions of transgender individuals.
description_web: As modern society becomes more open and accepting, transgender individuals are becoming more visible in their representation both in and out of the SCA. Please join us for a discussion about interacting with these members of the populace. Topics will include history, etiquette, basic definitions for the community, and an open forum for attendee questions.

instructor: Lady Siobhán an Einigh of Connacht
name: A Review of Early Irish Garb
description_book: Review of garb options, shoes, accessories for an Irish persona, 800-1000 CE, taken from extant sources and illuminations in the *Book of the Kells*.

name: Spinning Flax on a Wheel
description_book: Spinning flax is fun! Learn to spin flax on a wheel from a distaff.
description_web: Spinning flax is fun! It's frustrating! It's a unique spinning experience! With the fibers measuring from 24-36 inches, it's a completely different experience than spinning even the longest staple wool. We'll talk about using a distaff, and other ways to support the fibers. I'll show you how I dress my distaff, and those interested may spin at my wheel. You may also bring your own if you like. I find that I prefer my double-drive wheel with attached distaff for flax spinning, but plenty of folks use their Scotch tension wheels quite successfully. This class is an advanced-level spinning class though all are welcome to come listen and watch.

name: Meet the Society Chatelaine
description_book: Join Duchess Kalisa Aleksandrovna, the current Society Chatelaine, for a question-and-answer session.

name: Improving your Improv: Character and Commitment
description_book: Improv exercises and games to bring emotion, mannerisms, and movement to the character you create. Make meaningful decisions; commit to choices.
description_web: Improv is more than what you say, it’s how you say it. Learn to create more interesting characters by making meaningful decisions about emotion and body movement and stay committed to those choices. This class will focus on exercises and games to bring emotion, mannerisms, and movement to the character you create on stage in order to fully capture the audience’s attention.

location: Argent Fox (Merchant area behind the barn)
name: Harp for Absolute Beginners I
description_book: Come learn the very basics of playing harp! Please bring a harp if you have one and a chair if you need one. Prior experience not necessary. All ages.
description_web: A very basic introduction to the fundamentals of modern harp, that is to say **hand position**! Learn how not to injure yourself playing! Please bring a harp if you have one and a chair if you need one; we will be holding the class at Argent Fox and can borrow his harps and chairs, but he only has so many and I don't know how many students will attend. We will review hand position, go over a couple basic exercises to practice with, and I will provide handouts with a simple tune to practice. Ability to either read music or memorize a definite plus, but anyone's welcome to show up, and I'll teach you what I can. All ages emphatically welcomed. This is the first in a sequence of two classes. Class is aimed at nylon-strung harps; wire-strung are welcome but I can't teach wire-strung style (which is different), though I will try to point you at people who can.

name: Drop Spinning 101
description_book: Want to learn to drop spin or have had a hard time picking it up? Come and learn using a high whorl spindle. Spindles and wool will be provided.
description_web: Want to learn to drop spin or have had a hard time picking it up? Come and learn using a high whorl spindle. Spindles and wool will be provided. Spindles can be purchased for $3.00.

name: Introduction to English Country Dance (Playford)
description_book: *Sellengers Round*, *Gathering Peascods* and others to be determined based on number of students in class.
description_web: *Sellengers Round*, *Gathering Peascods* and others to be determined based on number of students in class.

name: Beginning *Repoussé* and Chasing
description_book: Hands-on class; we will make a copper foil rose.
description_web: Hands-on class; we will make a copper foil rose.

name: *Bhangra* Basics
description_book: Have fun with the large and energetic movements of *bhangra*. Students will learn foundations, as well as range of motion used.
description_web: *Bhangra* is a very energetic form of dance, which is very bouncy and utilizes a large range of motion and travel. Students will learn the smaller details in those motions, as well as the basic movements involved. You should leave able to express yourself.

name: Known World Choir
description_book: Do you like to sing? Come learn period music in a period style. Rehearsals are daily from 12-2 in the PARC.
description_web: Do you like to sing? Come learn period music in a period style. Rehearsals are daily from 12-2 in the PARC. Concert is Thursday 8/9 at 6:00 pm. Music is available on the Known World Choir Website. Pre-registration is requested although **not** required. All voice parts are welcome. This choir is adults only; however, there are other choirs for teens and children. The music for this year is all about battles and war!! While reading music is helpful it's not necessary. Practice tracks will be available on the choir's website in May. Please bring a 1" black folder for your music and a pencil.

name: Rehearsal (Closed): *i Sebastiani*
description_book: Space in use.
description_web: Space in use.

name: Basic Landsknecht Persona
description_book: Landsknecht persona, garb, and equipment.
description_web: Discussion on persona, garb, and equipment of the Landsknecht. Who were you as a Landsknecht?

name: PPF: *Doubuku* and *Kataginu*: Atop it All
description_book: Learn to create the common outer garments used by men in period. For both Japanese personas and those interested in the Perfectly Period Feast.
description_web: Learn to create the common outer garments used by men in period. For both Japanese personas and those interested in the Perfectly Period Feast.

name: Basics of Flexible Weapons Fighting
description_book: Learn to fight with the techniques of the Filipino *sarong*, covering offensive and defensive techniques. No martial arts experience required.
description_web: Learn to fight with the techniques of the Filipino *sarong*, which can also be applied to other flexible items such as scarves or belts. Class will cover offensive and defensive techniques including blocks, traps and chokes. No martial arts experience or equipment required.

instructor: Lady Faílenn Chu ingen uí Fháeláin
name: Black Hours: Dyeing Your *Perg*
description_book: Hopefully, a hands-on class teaching how to dye *pergamenata*. Supplies will be limited.
description_web: Hopefully, a hands-on class teaching how to dye *pergamenata*. Supplies will be limited.
fee_itemization:
2 pieces of perg, one predyed for later on in class
glass jar with dye
sponge brush
board for dyeing on

name: Drawing the Human Face
description_book: How to draw the human face from any angle using the classic canon of proportion used by the masters, but with an updated 20th-century method.
description_web: How to draw the human face from any angle, in 3-D, using the classic canon of proportion used by the 15th-century masters, but with a method updated by some 20th-century masters.
fee_itemization: Charcoal pencil, Paper, Drawing board, Lead point, chalk.

name: Viking Age Weapons and Armor
description_book: Explanation of weapons the Norseman used in 7th-11th centuries along with typical armor they wore from all the lands they visited.
description_web: Covers the weapons the Norseman used including weapons from the Rus and from Constantinople: helms and armor we know of; a detailed explanation of the weapons and weapon types, as well as how they used them; shield construction and technique; and what a typical warrior may have worn and carried into battle. I will have examples to show.

name: Embroidered Pouch or Small Cushion
description_book: [YouthU] Start with a piece of plain cloth (provided by instructor, or bring your own). Use simple stitches and beads to make a fancy pouch or pillow.
description_web: Start with a piece of plain cloth (provided by instructor, or bring your own). Use simple stitches and beads to make a fancy pouch or small pillow. If time allows and people are interested, we can also explore making tassels and cords.
fee_itemization: all materials for making project - cloth, beads, needles, threads for embroidery & tassels, cord for drawstring etc

name: Supported Spinning
description_book: Explore the history and period techniques used to create yarn using a supported spindle.
description_web: Explore the history and period techniques used to create yarn using a supported spindle. Supported spindles are ideal to use for fine yarns or more delicate fibers that might not stand the weight of a drop spindle (such as cotton or cashmere). Supported spindles and fibers will be provided in the materials, but students are encouraged to bring their own fibers or spindles they would like help with.
fee_itemization: Support Spindle and bowl, practice fibers

name: Beginning Inkle Weaving
description_book: Learn to read inkle patterns, loom setup, weaves. Bring loom and shuttle, or borrow both. Bring 2 colors #10 crochet cotton, scissors, paper/pencil.
description_web: Learn to create beautiful trim for your garb. We will cover how to read an inkle pattern, how to set up and weave efficiently on the inkle loom. Bring your own loom and shuttle, or borrow one/both. Supplies needed: #10 cotton crochet thread/equivalent, in two colors; scissors; paper and pencil for notes.
fee_itemization:
handout, 4 pages
thread, 2 colors.  approximately 70 yards total per student

name: Costuming: Late 16th-Century *Commedia* Character
description_book: Explore the clothing characteristics associated with each character in the late 16th century. In this case, clothes really do make the character!

name: *Gerdany*
description_book: This is a Ukrainian folk craft, using seed beads to create beautiful netting. Class will be making a two-color necklace.
fee_itemization: Beads, cord, clasps, jump rings, other findings

name: So You Want to Be a Scribe
description_book: Designed for those who have thought about doing scribal things but have no idea where to start.
description_web: Designed for those who have thought about doing scribal work, but have no idea where to start.

name: The History of Prostitution
description_book: History of prostitution, from the late Roman era to 1600 AD. Topics include brothels, daily life, garb, and courtesan culture. Age 18+.
description_web: A survey of the history of prostitution, from the late Roman era to 1600 AD. We will be covering such topics as the formation of red light districts, brothel management, contraception, municipal laws, church law, and the garb and identification of a prostitute within this time period. Age 18+.

name: Introduction to *Maghribi* and *Andalusi* Clothing
description_book: Survey of clothing in paintings, carvings, & other art sources to create complete outfits for men & woman, plus some examples of extant textiles.
description_web: This survey of clothing from *al-Andalus* and *al-Maghrib* is based on garments depicted in paintings, carvings, and other art sources, since no clothing from before 1601 has survived from *al-Maghrib* and very, very little from *al-Andalus*. I have found some new sources since last year for men's wear. Includes a brief discussion of plausible fabrics, as well as photos of some extant textiles from *al-Andalus*. The goal is to be able to a create complete outfit for males and females.
fee_itemization: For black-&-white as well as color photocopies

name: Newcomers' Social
description_book: A Social for newcomers to Pennsic and the SCA to meet up and ask questions. Light refreshments will be provided.
description_web: If you are new to Pennsic or the SCA, please join the Chatelaines of the Known World as we host a Newcomers' Social just for you. Bring any questions you have for us to answer. Stop by for a few minutes or a few hours. Light refreshments will be provided.

name: Known World Baronial Archery Champions Shoot
description_book: Archery tournament open to Baronial Archery Champions from throughout the Known World.

name: Beginner Dance: 15th-Century Italian
description_book: Never danced before? No problem! This class starts with basic steps and patterns, then teaches fun, simple dances from 15th-century Italy.
description_web: Never danced before? No problem! This class starts with basic steps and patterns, then teaches fun, simple dances from 15th-century Italy. No partners required.

location: E10-Great Dark Horde camp, at Brewers Road and Chandlers Road (E10-Great Dark Horde camp, at Brewers Road and Chandlers Road)
name: Aerial Yoga
description_book: Aerial Yoga With Gav Kyran using silks. For the more advanced yoga student who wants to explore the freedom of being suspended. Exercise clothes.
description_web: Aerial Yoga With Gav Kyran using silks. For the more advanced yoga student who wants to explore the freedom of being suspended. Will take place in E10-Great Dark Horde camp, at Brewers Road and Chandlers Road. Please dress for comfort and modesty. Limited to five.

name: *Laugh and Lie Down*
description_book: A matching card game, playable by most any age. Good for 3-6 players. Rules will be taught and games played afterwards.
description_web: A matching card game, playable by most any age. Good for 3-6 players. Rules will be taught and games played afterwards.

name: Pennsic 47 Arts and Sciences Display
description_book: The Arts and Sciences Display will be held on Sunday, August 5th, in the Great Hall.
description_web:
Bring your completed items, works-in-progress, research, and discussion material so that you may share, inspire, and enrich our Society. See what others in your field are working on, discover a new passion, make new contacts, and most importantly, have fun! 
11:30 am: Artisans may set up their entries.
1 pm – 5 pm: the Display is open to the public.
5 pm – 5:30 pm: Break down displays.

name: Heroic Champions (Armoured and Rapier)
description_book: description to follow
description_web:
TENTATIVE:
Armored Champions, 1 point. 
Rapier Champions, 2 points.
(Muster 12:30 pm), 3 points total.
No principal combatant who fights in this battle may participate in another Champions battle (except Heirs).
Principal Crowns may not fight.
Heirs will resolve a tie for armored. Royalty’s Rapier Champion will resolve a tie for rapier.
Format is one-on-one; weapons need not be matched.
Armored: 12 total fights; Principals will each field 1 unbelt; no other limitations on who can be on the team.
Double kills to be refought once only.
Alternate who chooses first. Whichever is ahead chooses first fighter. If tied, the winner of a coin flip decides choice of electing the first armored or rapier. The other will choose the first from the other discipline. (Rapier traditionally pre-arranges this; if this occurs, lists will be provided to royalty at start of champions.)
18 Rapier slots. 
8 Principal.
8 Allied.
2 C&T.
Tie will award no points to either Kingdom.

name: Foundations of Tribal Dance
description_book: Provides the building blocks of tribal belly dance movement, without the aspects of group improvisation, to make it easier to digest.
description_web: Tribal belly dance has movements that work differently from most other forms. This will cover the basis of isolation work and structure of tribal dance, without the added information that comes with the improvisational aspects which can make it much harder to digest and learn.

name: Pelican and Protégé Meet-Up
description_book: This is a time for Pelicans and protégés to meet others from across the Known World! A variety of topics will be discussed. Please join us!
description_web: This is a time for Pelicans and protégés to meet others from across the Known World! A variety of topics will be discussed. Please join us!

name: Sprang Basics
description_book: Using the twisted warp-based weaving of sprang, create a useful pouch
description_web: Using the twisted warp-based weaving of sprang, create a useful pouch.

name: PPF: *Hakama*: Japanese Trousers
description_book: A discussion of the craft of making period-correct *hakama*. For both Japanese personas and those interested in the Perfectly Period Feast.
description_web: A discussion of the craft of making period-correct *hakama*. For both Japanese personas and those interested in the Perfectly Period Feast.

name: Byzantine Chainmail
description_book: This style of chainmail was prevalent for several centuries, across multiple cultures, throughout our period in the Mediterranean and European worlds.
description_web: Learn the Byzantine chainmail weave that was prevalent throughout our period across multiple cultures. All hand-prepared materials necessary to complete class project are provided. For those who don't have them, tools are available on a first-come, first-served basis.
fee_itemization: Sufficient hand-turned & cut rings, 12ga 5/8 in diameter, to complete class project.

name: Care and Feeding of Thrown Weapons
description_book: Discussion of weapon selection and maintenance. Recommended for MITs and new throwers.
description_web: Discussion of weapon selection and maintenance. Recommended for MITs and new throwers.

name: From the Mind of a Bored Drummer (Even + Odd = ?!)
description_book: What happens when you combine an odd and even rhythm into one new one? Learn a couple of new rhythms or share your own combinations. BYOD.
description_web: What happens when you take an odd-count rhythm and mash it with an even-count rhythm? Sometimes you get a train wreck, sometimes you get a moment of brilliance! Come and learn a couple of new rhythms I created; bring your own to share, or we can get creative on the spot and see what happens. Bring Your Own Drum.

name: EK Day at Family Point: Dip Candles
description_book: Make a dip candle, just like people did hundred of years ago.

instructor: Lady Faílenn Chu ingen uí Fháeláin
name: Black Hours: Working on Black Substrate
description_book: How to get your design onto the black substrate, plus tips and tricks for paint, gold, and ink.
description_web: How to get your design onto the black substrate, plus tips and tricks for paint, gold, and ink.

name: Youth Illumination Workshop
description_book: For teens who are interested in trying illumination. All materials provided. No experience necessary. Come paint!

name: Beginning Engraving
description_book: Hands-on class. Intro to tools, first cuts, graver control, hammer use.
description_web: Hands-on class. Intro to tools, first cuts, graver control. Student will learn both hand-held and hammer-struck engraving.

name: Chainmaille Workshop: Simple 2-in-2 Necklace
description_book: This workshop is geared towards the absolute beginner with no chainmaille experience. The class fee covers a kit of tools and supplies
description_web: This workshop is geared towards the absolute beginner with no chainmaille experience. The class fee covers a full kit of tools and supplies you may need to get started creating chainmaille. If you do not finish the workshop project in class, you will have everything you need to complete it at your leisure. Extra loaner tools and magnifying lenses will be available for use during the workshop. Patience and fine motor skills are needed for this class, so it may not be suited to children under 12 years old.
fee_itemization:
Ergonomic Bent Nose Pliers - $9
Jumpring Opening Tool - $4

Chainmaille Rings - $5

name: Music Theory and Ear Training for Sight-Singing
description_book: A broad overview of basic music theory and ear training, going over rhythm and pitch in modern notation, as tools for learning to sight-sing.

name: Society Officer Meet-and-Greet
description_book: Meet and greet your Society Officers.

name: Intermediate Sewing Skills: Real Rolled Hems
description_book: No need to cheat! Learn how to sew a real rolled hem! You'll wonder why you didn't do it before.

instructor: Lady Siobhán an Einigh of Connacht
name: A Celtic Pronunciation Primer
description_book: Heralds rejoice, and take this introduction to the pronunciation of Irish and Welsh, with an emphasis on names!
description_web: Can't tell your Daffydd from your Diarmuid? Are you a court herald who weeps at a Welsh name? Quakes in fear when the Irish step up to your list field to be announced? Then this class is for you!  Come take this overview of Irish and Welsh pronunciation, with an emphasis on names, designed specifically to assist with heraldic endeavors!

name: Ingredients for Pre-1000 Northern European Recipes
description_book: Learn research techniques and source material to help build your ingredient list for pre-1000 recipes.
description_web: Building a pre-1000 recipe takes a bit more research than redacting an ingredient list from a primary source. It takes some investigation and tenacity to sift through the surviving materials of pre-1000 cultures to build a plausible list of food stuffs from which you can reference. I will share my research sources for pre-1000 northern European recipes, discuss additional avenues of source material, and encourage discussion of participants to share their research triumphs and milestones.

name: North African Coffee
description_book: Learn how to make the perfect cup of coffee, then enjoy a cup or two in class!
description_web: "Coffee," from the Arabic word *qahwah*, became popular in the Maghreb by the 16th century. From beans to cup, we will roast green coffee beans together, then learn the techniques you need to make the perfect brew. We will look at *bunna*, Ethiopian coffee, for comparison. Come thirsty! There is an option to go home with the tools you need to make coffee, as I will have 10 kits available while supplies last (approx. $15.00).

name: Fundamentals of Acting
description_book: Learn how to present oneself confidently and authentically onstage through vocal and physical exercises and entry-level acting methods.
description_web: By using some basic acting techniques and exercises, the student will begin working on learning how to present oneself confidently and authentically onstage. We will focus on the act of "doing" versus showing as well as helping to develop voice and stage presence. A great primer for any new students to the stage as well as experienced actors.

name: Guitar in the SCA Period
description_book: Learn to play period music on ukulele! History, technique, and music for the 16th-C 4-course Renaissance guitar. Bring ukulele (or guitar with capo).
description_web: Yes, guitars are period! The popular 16th-century Renaissance guitar had 4-courses tuned GCEA, like one of its modern descendants, the ukulele. We will survey the origin and history of the guitar, period notation and playing technique, and extant musical literature, then learn to play some easy period pieces. Bring a ukulele (or modern guitar capo'd on the 5th fret) if you can. A few loaner instruments and capos will be available.

name: Dances Without Dignity
description_book: Let's do some high energy dancing. These dances could be done slowly and stately - but not today: *Petit Riens, Gathering Peascods, Montarde Bransle*.

name: Ottoman Singing Class
description_book: Rehearsal of past songs for performance, and learning a new Ottoman song, "*Ceddin Deden*."
description_web: We will be rehearsing past songs for performance this year, and teaching the Ottoman martial composition "*Ceddin Deden*," that was/is commonly performed in the Mehteran Janissary Band. This piece of music is typically performed with singing. As such, we will be teaching a singing class to learn this song in the original Ottoman Turkish language. What will you learn and experience: an Ottoman song "*Ceddin Deden*" and its history; the musical modality *Makam Huseyni*; pronunciation of Ottoman Turkish along with a brief history and etymology. The 3 classes will be progressive; however, students may join in when they wish, although attendance at all the classes is strongly encouraged. Students may join the class's Facebook page in advance to orient themselves to the song and class: https://www.facebook.com/groups/398762226986519/

name: 14th-Century Italian Secular Vocal Music
description_book: An overview of the musical and poetic forms of 14th-century Italian secular vocal music.
description_web: Provides an overview of musical and poetic forms of 14th-century Italian secular vocal music. Listening examples will be provided and, time permitting, students may be given an opportunity to learn a piece or two!

name: PA Afternoon Series: *Commedia* Experience
description_book: Come experience *Commedia dell'Arte*! Meet the characters and the actors behind them and learn to act in comic masked style.
description_web: Come experience *Commedia dell'Arte*! Meet the characters and the actors behind them and learn to act in comic masked style (movement, vocalization, express funny ideas). Experienced actors/directors from several well-known *Commedia dell'Arte* troupes will guide you if you're new, or give you free advice that's definitely worth the price to veteran performers!

name: Runestone Bardic Circle Practice: Alternate Site
description_book: (Runestone campus for "Runestone Bardic Circle Practice" in case of weather; see class for details.)

name: Runestone Bardic Circle at Runestone Park
description_book: Welcome, new, returning, bardic explorers: singers, songwriters, poets, storytellers, and guests! Enjoy gathering in the shade. Bardic Safe Zone!
description_web:
Bardic Safe Zone! (Formally known as "The Peerless Bardic Circle - the Tradition Continues".) Welcome, first timers, rusty returners, nervous performers, and all seeking to enjoy an un-intimidating, low-key bardic circle as performer or audience! We invite all those new and exploring the bardic arts: singers, songwriters, poets, storytellers of all levels including apprentices, journeymen, as well as anyone who may want to come listen and enjoy the gathering in the shade of the park near the Runestone. A few disguised Peers have been known to sneak in.
Alternate rain site at the Amphitheater. If you want to learn more about bardic circles and what they're all about, come to Lucia's "Bardic Circles 101" class in AS 9 at 11am in AS9.

name: Axe Continuous-Throw Tournament
description_book: How many axes can you throw without missing? Single rotation throws until you miss.
description_web: How many axes can you throw without missing? Single rotation throws until you miss.

name: Beginner Thrown Weapons
description_book: Learn axe throwing, basic care of your weapons, and basic rules. A hands-on session is included. Limit of 25 participants; no experience necessary.
description_web: Learn axe throwing, basic care of your weapons, and basic rules. A hands-on session is included. Limit of 25 participants; no experience necessary.

name: Juggling Practice
description_book: Come together to meet with other performers and swap tricks, including ball, club, ring, *diablo*, flower sticks, and more. Part of the Fool's School.
description_web: Come together to meet with other performers and swap tricks, including ball, club, ring, *diablo*, flower sticks, and more. Part of the Fool's School.

name: EK Day at Family Point: Kumihimo Weaving
description_book: Learn to weave with Kumihimo.  Kid friendly materials will be provided

name: Back in Black: Black Commercial Papers Discussion
description_book: Various black papers are available for scroll-making. The pros and cons of several plus those of hand-dyed will be discussed. Samples provided.
fee_itemization: $5 for in-class consumables and take-home samples

instructor: Baroness Juliana Rosalia Dolce di Siena
name: Introduction to Painting Scrolls
description_book: An introduction to basic painting techniques for scrolls. Please bring your own paint and brushes. Open to tweens/teens in addition to adults.
description_web: In this hands-on class, we’ll cover the basics of painting scrolls. Includes how to get even coverage for the background sections, basic shading and whitework details. Please bring your own paint (watercolor gouache) and brushes. Paper worksheets will be provided. Open to tweens/teens in addition to adults.

name: I Do Not Think That Means What You Think It Means
description_book: An exploration of the inter-kingdom anthropology of the usage of regalia and other tokens and designators of rank as used within the SCA.

name: thing.pennsicuniversity.org: Hiss & Purr
description_book: Everyone, instructor or not, come say what you liked, disliked, and would like to see in this system for next year.

name: A Roman Soldier's Meals
description_book: An entire day’s menu of actual foods a Soldier would eat, based on Ancient Roman recipes for class participants to sample.
description_web: Napoleon once said, “An army marches on its stomach”. Since the beginning of warfare, the issue of how to feed a large standing army has been one of the largest logistics problems to be faced, and the Ancient Roman army was no exception. This class will discuss the rations and food sources available to the average soldier. There will be food samples provided to attendees (while supplies last) who wish to sample recipes. Handouts are limited to 25, but all are welcome to attend.

name: Persona Workshop
description_book: [YouthU] Create and develop your SCA persona using a take-home workbook.
description_web: [YouthU] Gather information to fill out a workbook with questions designed to help you develop your SCA persona of someone who might have lived in the Middle Ages.

name: Interkingdom Brewers' Guild Roundtable
description_book: This roundtable is designed to serve as both a place to discuss period beverages as well as hang out for the IKBG. Over 21.
description_web: This roundtable is designed to serve as both a place to discuss period beverages as well as hang out until your beverage is called to be judged with the IKBG. It is being held in conjunction with the IKBG. All entrants are asked to wait in this area. Someone will come call you when your entry is ready to be judged. Please bring something to do/drink/discuss until your entry is called. Over 21 only.

name: Interkingdom Brewers' Guild Competition
description_book: Brewers and vintners: Have your beverages evaluated by experts from across the Known World. Up to two entries per category. Over 21 only.
description_web: An opportunity for brewers and vintners to have their beverages evaluated by experts from across the Known World. Up to two entries per category (wine/mead, beer, cordials/others) per participant. IKBG masters are asked to help judge. Entrants are responsible for the temperature/condition of their beverage(s) as it may be some time before a particular beverage is judged. Documentation is encouraged. Over 21 only.

name: East Kingdom Herbalists & Apothecaries' Guild Meet
description_book: Interested in getting involved with others in the East working with period herbal practice, research on medicine in period, medieval gardening, etc.?
description_web: Interested in getting involved with others in the East working with period herbal practice, research on medicine in period, medieval gardening, etc.? Join us for a meeting to revive the Guild! Discussions of period practices welcome, though practical organization will be a main focus.

name: Book Lovers' Tea
description_book: Please bring your favorite book(s) to discuss. Books with medieval themes and topics are encouraged but not required. Be ready to take notes!
description_web: Please bring your favorite book(s) to discuss. Books with medieval themes and topics are encouraged but not required. Bring paper and pencil to jot down new authors to check out. Iced tea, water and treats will be provided.

name: Basic In Persona Storytelling
description_book: Telling stories as your persona is not only cool and fun but surprisingly easy.
description_web: Storytelling is one of the easiest bardic arts to do "in persona." No need to worry about whether your instrument existed or if that poetic form would be one your persona would know. It also turns out to be surprisingly easy. Come learn how to impress your audience with a tale that makes them feel genuinely transported to the Current Middle Ages.

name: XXX Rated *Commedia*
description_book: Did you know a few scenarios include fornication, enemas, and other risqué topics? Come discuss *lazzi* you'd never perform for an event. Age 18+.
description_web: This is "not your mother's scenario" class! Did you know a few *commedia* scenarios include fornication, enemas, defecation and other risqué topics we couldn't even air on modern television? Join us for a discussion of *lazzi* rarely performed at SCA events but ones that may liven up certain Pennsic parties. Class has been updated since last year. Come out to learn about even more explicit topics, including the "Love in Venice" exhibit at The Brooklyn Public Library! **No one under 18 will be allowed at this class. Must present ID!**

name: Flirtatious 15th-Century Set Dances: *Pizochara*
description_book: An intermediate-level allegorical dance of the less official happenings in monastic communities.
description_web: An intermediate-level allegorical dance of the less official happenings in monastic communities.

name: Advanced *Repoussé* and Chasing
description_book: Intro to pitch block-working and forming, plus tool and hammer use. Produce a copper amulet.
description_web: Intro to pitch block-working and forming, plus tool and hammer use. Produce a copper amulet.

name: Rapier Melée Champions
description_book: description added soon
description_web:
TENTATIVE:
(Muster 2:30 pm) 
2 points.
30 fighters per side, 15 principals & 15 allies (no fewer than 15 per side for melee of 30).

Battle will be fought in 3 heats. Each heat will be best of 3. Best of 3 heats wins the War points.
Heat 1: 15 vs 15 fighters from principal Kingdoms. 
Heat 2: 15 vs 15 fighters from allied Kingdoms.
Heat 3: 30 vs 30 with 15 fighters from principal and 15 from allied kingdoms on each side.
Last fighter standing; no resurrection.
Restricted field of traditional size.
DFB is allowed.
No RBGs.

name: Medieval Music Notation: Introduction
description_book: Read lots of examples in facsimile, discussing problems as they arise. Bring melody instruments you play fluently, e.g., recorder, fiddle, voice.
description_web:
Reading medieval music in modern notation imposes modern notions of measure, phrasing, and tonality. Reading it in the original notation allows us to get closer to the composer's intentions and the head-space of a medieval performer, which can help achieve those elusive, magical “medieval moments”. We'll spend most of the class reading examples, discussing problems as they arise. F, G, and C clefs in various places, long note values, unbarred music, C.O.P. ligatures, *musica ficta*, and perhaps “minor coloration". Returning students welcome, as we'll read a different repertoire each time.

Bring melody instruments you play fluently, such as recorder, gamba, fiddle, voice (if you have good pitch memory), etc. If you have multiple sizes of your instrument, please bring them (e.g., SATB recorders).

Each session of the class will use different examples, so feel free to attend both.

name: Beyond Lucet Basics
description_book: Variations, loops, and monkey wrenches.
description_web: Starts with a basic refresher class for everyone. We then proceed to variations, loops, and monkey wrenches. Classroom loaner lucets available or bring your own. String provided.

name: Empty Tent Place Holder - 2 hrs
description_book: Some loud classes need an empty tent next to them. This is that tent.

name: Beginning Spear
description_book: This is a hands-on class demonstrating beginning spear technique.
description_web: This is a hands-on class demonstrating beginning spear technique.

name: An Introduction to Indian Rhythms I
description_book: Learn about Indian rhythm instruments, their history, how they are played, how to play with them. Bring your instrument and learn some new rhythms.
description_web: Learn about Indian rhythm instruments, their history, how they are played and how to play with them. Bring your instrument and learn some new rhythms.

name: Choosing Heavy Weapon Techniques and Tactics
description_book: A discussion of the factors involved in comparing and choosing techniques and strategies; how you can determine the advantages and disadvantages.
description_web: A discussion of the factors that should be considered when comparing and choosing heavy weapon techniques and strategies. What are the advantages and disadvantages?  Are the gains of using a particular technique or tactic worth the cost of using it?

name: Known World Novice Championship
description_book: Fighters from all over the Known World with two years or less experience since their primary authorization, test their skills against each other.

name: Youth Combat Afternoon Session
description_book: Youth Combat Lists open.
description_web: Youth Combat Lists open.

name: EK Day at Family Point: Kites!
description_book: Back by popular demand!!!  Participants will decorate and assemble their own kites!

name: So You Think You Might Want to Scribe?
description_book: A light introduction to the scribal arts with some practical exercises. Designed for those who have an interest in exploring the scribal arts.
description_web: A light introduction to the scribal arts with some practical exercises. Designed for those who have an interest in exploring the scribal arts but find it intimidating to approach. You will **not** feel intimidated after an hour with me! Come find out about the fun side of calligraphy and illumination.

name: Mongol Invasion and the Great Duchy of Lithuania
description_book: Historical review of the influence of the Mongol invasion to rise of the Great Duchy of Lithuania and its relationships with Kyev Russ.
description_web: Historical review of the influence of the Mongol invasion to rise of the Great Duchy of Lithuania and its relationships with Kyev Russ. Roots of historical divide between Eastern and Western Russ.
fee_itemization: Only for printed handouts to recover the cost

name: Forging Clay
description_book: [TeenU] Students will learn hands-on basic blacksmithing techniques with a safer and more portable material. Recommended for age 10 and up.

name: German Peasant Wars 1524-1525
description_book: A look at the German Peasant Wars of 1524-1525. We'll look at the causes of the uprisings, the key figures, military response, and outcomes.

name: Creating Kingdom-Sized Performing Arts Programs
description_book: Organizing performers is different from performing. Come hear "lessons learned" for large-scale PA programs for kingdoms or large events.
description_web:
Organizing performers is different from performing. Come hear my suggestions and lessons learned for large-scale performing arts programs for kingdoms and large, war-sized events.

Share my "lessons learned" from running the SCA 50 Year Performing Arts Program, serving as Kingdom MOAS Deputy for Performing Arts in Atlantia for 3 years, Guild Leader for the Atlantia Performing Arts Guild for 3 years, Co-Lead for *Commedia*, Foolery, and Physical Theater track at Pennsic University for 6 years, creating the Performing Arts Program at War of the Wings (Atlantia) and myriad other organizational jobs in SCA Performing Arts over 26 years. Come with your own ideas, and we’ll discuss what you can do back home.

name: Pennsic Party University
description_book: Here several seasoned instructors wish to make sure you have the best bog and swamp party etiquette around! We want you safe, happy, and respectful.
description_web: This class is to attempt to show newcomers (to Pennsic, or the bog/swamp) how to deal with nightlife in the louder parts of Pennsic. We call this a primer for the Lake After Dark. We'll cover various topics, including these: Open Bar Etiquette; Visiting Other Camps; Tipping; Romance, Courting, and Your Significant Other; Chaperoning; Party Safety; **Hydrate!**; Love Your Feet; and How to Play the Game.

name: Combat on the Elizabethan Stage
description_book: A practical, hands-on approach to stage violence and swordplay on the stage, this class offers a historic overview, safety, and choreography.
description_web: A practical, hands-on approach to stage violence and swordplay on the stage, this class offers a historic overview, safety, and choreography. Students will practice a pre-planned fight routine.

name: Ætheldreda:  Queen, Abbess and Saint
description_book: Ætheldreda escaped a series of politically determined marriages to become a nun and found a religious community at the isle of Ely in 650.
description_web: Ætheldreda escaped a series of politically determined marriages to become a nun and ultimately found a religious community at the isle of Ely in 650. Renowned for her wisdom as much as her charity, and her charity as for her chastity, The Venerable Bede wrote a hymn to her perfection. She was canonized after her corpse remained uncorrupted. Liturgy in her name has been performed at the same site for 1200 years.

name: Dances for Odd Numbers
description_book: Partnerless *bransles* (French), 3-person dances from Gresley (English) and 15th-century Italian manuscripts, even a 5-person dance! All steps taught.
description_web: Partnerless *bransles* (French), three-person dances from Gresley (English) and 15th-century Italian manuscripts, even a five-person dance! All steps taught.

location: Denys The Decadent (Denys the Decadent's Camp  EO8)
name: 12-Step Meetings
description_book: Daily meetings for those in any 12-step program such as AA, NA, OA, SA, Alanon, etc.
description_web: We welcome all in AA, NA, OA, SA, Alanon, etc., who are in any 12-step program to the 4:00 pm daily meeting at EO8 Denys The Decadent's Camp.

name: *Niello*: The Making and Applying
description_book: *Niello* is an ancient enamel-like material, applied to silver and gold work as metal decoration.
description_web: *Niello* is an ancient enamel-like material, applied to silver and gold work as metal decoration. It is used for background and highlighting engraving work.

name: *Chorulus Pennsicus*
description_book: *Chorulus Pennsicus* is a select choir, audition required. Previous choral singing is expected.
description_web: *Chorulus Pennsicus* is a select choir, entrance by audition. Previous choral singing experience is expected. The audition includes a prepared vocal selection and a sight-reading session. CP performs with the Known World Choir and Friends on Thursday evening of War Week. See the class book/web site for next year’s audition details.

name: Learning *Lamma Bada Yata Thanna*
description_book: Learn the history and musical parts of the Andalusian song, *Lamma Bada Yata Thanna.* Singers, dancers, musicians, drummers all welcome!
description_web: Calling all Middle Eastern performers! Learn about, perform, and dance to the Andalusian song, *Lamma Bada Yata Thanna.* The first part will be history, then we'll move into the lyrics, drum rhythm, melody, and dancing. Handouts, including sheet music, will be available for a fee. You can get the sheet music in advance from http://www.bellydancesheetmusic.com/.

name: Lights, Tools, and Props: Technical Theater at War
description_book: For anyone interested in getting acquainted with how the technical side of the Performing Arts tent works and how to get involved. Ages 15+ welcome.
description_web: For anyone interested in getting acquainted with how the technical side of the Performing Arts tent works and how to get involved. Ages 15+ welcome. Discussion will cover setup, challenges and limitations, and roles of staff associated with the PA Tent.

name: An Introduction to Indian Rhythms II
description_book: Learn about Indian rhythm instruments, their history, how they are played, how to play with them. Bring your instrument and learn some new rhythms.
description_web: Learn about Indian rhythm instruments, their history, how they are played and how to play with them. Bring your instrument and learn some new rhythms.

name: Open Scribal Time
description_book: Take advantage of our clean, well-lit space to work on existing projects or to try your hand at calligraphy and/or illumination.

name: Calligraphy 101 and the Uncial Hand
description_book: Learn the basics of putting a calligraphy pen to paper, and then apply those principles to practicing the Uncial hand.
description_web: Learn the basics of putting a calligraphy pen to paper, and then apply those principles to practicing the Uncial hand. It's an early-period hand that's a good starting point for learning all the hands that come after it.

name: Teaching Italian Fencing and Western Martial Arts
description_book: An exploration of martial pedagogical concepts; we'll cover the varied learning styles and ideas for teaching that can connect with them.
description_web:
An exploration of martial pedagogical concepts, this class is designed for intermediate to advanced fencers who are responsible for teaching fencing at local practices. Concepts can be applied in class settings as well as one-on-one coaching. 
Discussion will cover the varied learning styles and ideas for teaching that can connect with them. A sample class lesson and drill will be demonstrated that includes many learning styles. Italian rapier in the Venetian style will be the content used, but the pedagogical concepts can be applied to other martial disciplines. 

Equipment needed: single rapier, gloves, mask, and gorget. Students are encouraged to bring writing utensils if they wish to take notes. An outline of the class content will be provided.

name: *Ars Dictaminis*: Art of Medieval Letter Writing
description_book: Learn letter writing, medieval style! Using period sources, we'll look at how and what letters were used for, plus how to write your own!
description_web: Letter writing was the primary form of communication in period, but is a neglected art today. Rediscover the beauty and fun of letter-writing from period sources. We'll look at the art of writing a proper letter, famous correspondence, and examples of everyday letters sent by people all across society. Plus, plenty of tips for writing your own letters!

name: East Kingdom College of Performers
description_book: For members of the East Kingdom Performing Community. Future meetings, events and elections will be discussed.
description_web: For members of the East Kingdom Performing Community. Future meetings, events and elections will be discussed. Meet others in the Kingdom who share an interest in all types of performance from music to storytelling.

name: Archery Marshal Meeting
description_book: All Archery Marshals are required to attend one meeting.

name: Learning to Play the Big Drum (*Tupan/Davul*)
description_book: This class will cover basic and intermediate technique on the *davul*, as well as brief notes about buying or building one. Some loaners available.

name: Let's Have a *Bransle*
description_book: An introductory class to *bransles* wherein will be taught *bransles* of varying difficulties.
description_web: An introductory class to *bransles* wherein will be taught *bransles* of varying difficulties. Source material for *bransles* is *Orchesography* by Thoinot Arbeau. Learn a few *bransles* and how to listen and interpret music for easier dancing.

name: Characters of *Commedia* Workshop
description_book: Come gather with other enthusiasts or beginners to learn more about the characters of *Commedia dell’Arte*, and learn how to portray them on stage.
description_web: Come gather with other *Commedia* enthusiasts or beginners to learn more about the characters of *commedia dell’arte*! We will be working with personal motivations, movement styles and attitudes to help actors better portray their favorites, or find a new character to enjoy!

name: Songs of the *Trobairitz*: Mistress Amelie d'Anjou
description_book: Songs of the *Trobairitz*: Mistress Amelie d'Anjou sings and plays songs from León, Castile, Aquitaine, and France.
description_web: Mistress Amelie d'Anjou sings and plays songs of the *Trobairitz* from León, Castile, Aquitaine, and France; she is a troubadour with bowed stringed instruments who is not afraid to use them and sing as well.

name: Archery Champions' Practice
description_book: Everyone who wishes to try out for the Archery Champions teams is welcome and encouraged to attend. Yes, **you** are good enough to try out!

name: Master Ruaidhri au Cu
description_book: Telling stories and singing songs as only a Scots man can.
description_web: Telling stories and singing songs as only a Scots man can.

name: You Think You Might Want to Make a Pair of Shoes?
description_book: An overview for those thinking about making a pair of period shoes. Materials and methods used to make shoes will be explored.

name: Glass Painting (Thru Æthelmearc Scribal College)
description_book: Learn "Basic Glass Painting", the same technique used for stained glass scrolls. Taught in cooperation with Æthelmearc Scribes' College.
description_web: Learn "Basic Glass Painting", the same technique found to do wording and faces in churches. Also, **scribes**! Learn how to put words on glass. You'll work on a small piece that will get fired onsite. If you've seen any stained glass scrolls given out in court, this is the method I use. (Scribes, please bring a nib holder and some nibs.)
fee_itemization: supplies including glass and glass paint.

name: Sack of Rome, 1527
description_book: An overview of the 1527 sack of Rome by Spanish, German, and Italian troops. Includes its lead-up, campaign, and results.
description_web: An overview of the 1527 Sack of Rome by Spanish, German, and Italian troops of the Holy Roman Empire. The class will look at the political and military events leading up to the sack, the campaign itself, and the political results.

name: Theatre Games for Teens
description_book: Are you a teen interested in acting? Do you like to play games? Come to this class for games that are all about performing! For ages 13-18.
description_web: Are you a teen interested in acting? Do you like to play games? Come to this class for games that are all about performing! For ages 13-18.

name: *Chorale du Lac* (Bog Choir)
description_book: Choir class for all levels of singers, no exp. necessary, all voices welcome. Simple period partsongs, rounds, catches.
description_web:
We will warm up, discuss and practice new vocal, music theory, and choral skills each day, and then sing a selection of rounds, catches, and simple part songs from period sources. Each day will be a different class. This is a good choir class for beginning singers who want to sing together in a group for fun, and for experienced singers to take a refresher in choral singing and work on technique and tuning. No experiences necessary, all voices welcome. Instead of rehearsing for a performance, we will practice for learning's sake and go caroling in the Bog at the end of the series. 
Visit https://www.facebook.com/groups/1470354713287848/, the "Bog University" FaceBook group for more info.

name: Meet-the-Dance-Faculty Social
description_book: Teachers and staff, please come and be social! Proto-teachers and dancers also welcome. There will be light refreshments and a group picture.
description_web: Everyone is invited to meet the people who make the Pennsic School of European Dance happen! This event is open for all students and dancers to meet this year's faculty and staff, and is a relaxing social event for our faculty and experienced dancers. We encourage all to attend. Light refreshments will be provided and a group picture of staff and teachers will be taken.

name: In a Fool’s Garden: Fables of John Inchingham
description_book: John Inchingham the Fool sings fantastical tales including dragons, hydras, weaselopes. He spins whimsical yarns of cats, ducks, herring and more!
description_web: Baron John of Illiton, AKA Master John Inchingham the Fool, sings fantastical tales of dragons, giants, trolls, mermaids, hydras, *pegasi* and weaselopes too! He also spins whimsical yarns of cats, rats, dogs, frogs, beavers, otters, rabbits, ducks, yaks and herring. Come sing along or just sit and listen to an hour’s worth of family-friendly entertainment.

name: Combat of the Thirty
description_book: 14th-century 30 vs 30 deed of arms inspired by the original combat of the thirty between French and English forces that occurred in 1351.
description_web:
This is a 14th-century 30 versus 30 deed of arms inspired by the original combat of the thirty between French and English forces that occurred in 1351. Combat standards are a modified counted-blow scenario that employs rules for capturing opponents and ransoming of captured parties. Participants must be acceptable to the captains of the French and English forces. Armor must be a reasonable attempt at a complete 14th-century harness. Weapons are restricted to ones that closely resemble their medieval counterparts. Final say on weapons and appropriate harness will be at the sole discretion of the captains.
Requirements:  All participants must wear a 14th-century kit. Greaves are required and all are encouraged to wear chausses and braies. All weapons must closely resemble their medieval counterpart and are restricted to bastard swords, pole-arms of period design (axes, hammers, etc.), spears under 7 feet, daggers and single-handed swords. All participants should be prepared to pay a ransom that they feel is appropriate to their station in the event that they are “captured” during this deed of arms. Rules of combat will be explained to all combatants before the battle begins.

name: PPF *Sumō*: A Gentle Martial Art
description_book: *Sumō* workshop: The Norse had *Glima*; the Japanese had *Sumō*. Learn the ancient art of *sumō* wrestling, a popular festival activity.
description_web:
*Sumō* workshop: The Norse had *Glima*, and the Japanese had *Sumō*. Learn the ancient art of *sumō* wrestling. *Sumō* was and is a popular festival activity.

Prepare yourself to participate in one of the martial sports at *Chōyō no Sekku* (Chrysanthemum Festival) 2020 SEP 25–27 in Æthelmearc. Learn the rules of the All Japan Amateur *Sumō* Association. Practice basic *Sumō* rituals and techniques.

This workshop is gender neutral and will follow the rules established by the All Japan Amateur *Sumō* Association for elementary school students. Anyone deliberately violating the rules will be asked to leave the workshop. *Sumō* is practiced barefooted and with minimal clothing. Do not wear one of those joke *sumō* suits. It will be too hot, and they are not worn for this sort of activity. Please avoid any clothing, other than a *mawashi*, which can be easily grabbed. You must provide yourself with a *mawashi* (a type of loin cloth) in order to participate in some of the workshop activities. A description of how to make one is available at http://www.demoivre.org/Heian-kyo_2020/
fee_itemization: The fee is a for a multi-page handout.

name: Shading for Dummies: Illumination
description_book: Learn to render basic illuminated shapes through shading.
description_web: Are you a beginner who has no idea how to create believable shape to figures in your illumination? Come and experience how light creates shape. Work in charcoal or Conté crayon on pastel paper.

name: Bedtime Stories for Children
description_book: Nightly telling of stories for children.
description_web: 7 pm nightly: Stories and fables for children. All are welcome to attend; must have adult escort.

name: Period Drinking Songs
description_book: Sing a variety of period songs about drinking from across Europe, including easy unison and rounds, as well as harmony with up to four parts.
description_web: Learn to sing a variety of period songs about consuming alcoholic beverages from across Europe. The songs vary in difficulty from easy unison and rounds to harmony with up to four parts, so anyone can participate. Music will be available to take with you. If you have heard of the Pennsic Drinking and Singing Walk or the *Hymni Bacchi*, this is the music we sing.
fee_itemization:
The Carolingian Jongleurs Guild has historically provided free handouts for this class.
Instructor is teaching on 8/9 at 12-1 and 3-4 -- Artis

location: Courtesan College (Strawberry Fields B06 on Ankara - look for signs!)
name: Raunch & Romance: Oral Recitations
description_book: Come listen to period and period-inspired pieces. To sign up to do a reading, please contact cianascholari@gmail.com. 18+
description_web: Come listen to period and period-inspired pieces in the lush surrounds of the Courtesan College. To sign up to do a reading, please contact cianascholari@gmail.com. Age 18+.

name: East Kingdom Teen Party
description_book: Join us for the 13th annual Teen Party in EK Royal. Those gentles ages 13-17 are welcome to attend.

name: Duke Moonwulf's Annual Pennsic Concert
description_book: Music, stories, hijinks and history, in the concert that's become a Pennsic tradition!
description_web: Music, stories, hijinks and history, in the concert that's become a Pennsic tradition!

name: Inkle Weaving Basics
description_book: Using the continuous warping method, you will warp the loom and weave an inkle strip.
description_web: Using the continuous warping method, you will warp the loom and weave an inkle strip. Classroom loaner looms available or bring your own; class limited to 10 looms.

name: Night with the Knights
description_book: Chivalry of the Known World: Give youth fighters the benefit of your expertise and spar with them! Youth Combat conventions apply. Arrive armored.
