description_web: We invite members of the Chivalry from all Kingdoms to get into armor and come to the youth list! You can give our young fighters the benefit of your expertise. Sparring between adults and youth will be allowed under these special training conditions. All weapons, calibration, and conventions will be as per Youth Combat rules. Knights: Please arrive armored. Parents/guardians are advised that allowing your child to participate shall be understood as permission for this type of training. Sponsored by the Kingdom of Æthelmearc.

name: Shading Drapery in Illumination
description_book: Creating highlights and shadows in illumination from sample drapery.
description_web: For intermediate or advanced scribes who sometimes feel their draped fabric doesn't look real. Work with charcoal or Conté crayon on pastel paper.

name: Known World Youth Combat Meet-and-Greet
description_book: An informal get-together with the Society DEM for Youth Combat. Get the latest updates, meet other youth marshals, and ask questions.
description_web: An informal get-together with the Society Deputy Earl Marshal for Youth Combat. Get the latest updates, meet other youth marshals, and ask questions. Includes Youth Rapier marshals.

name: Beginner's Ball
description_book: A ball with every dance taught! All are fun and easy. No partner needed. Pit open to all musicians too. Bring your friends!
description_web: At the Beginner's Ball we teach all of the dances. Never danced? Not a problem! A perfect ball for the eager but still learning. Everyone is welcome. No partner is needed. Bring your friends! All musicians are welcome too! The pit is open! The more the merrier! Led by Master Philip White (dance) and Master Albrecht (Avatar) Catsprey (music).

name: Known World Siege Marshal Social
description_book: A social meeting for informal discussions about siege combat and marshaling.
description_web: To promote convivial dialogue among the various groups of siege marshals in the Known World, THL Diccon de Reinport is pleased to announce the 9th Annual Known World Siege Marshal Social to be hosted at the Holt Heroetus encampment. Please join us for informal discussions about siege combat and marshaling, and any other topics of interest.

name: *Guedra*: North African Trance Dance
description_book: Brief instruction in dance followed by participation in *Guedra* ritual. No dance exp needed. Bring water; veil if you want to dance. Women only.
description_web: Dance and chant will be taught, as well as some background info. New information this year, as Mistress Jadi Fatima joins us. 30-45 minutes instruction (men welcome during instruction only) followed by performance of *Guedra*. Until our voices give out, we'll chant the *Guedra* for 1 to 4 dancers at a time. Bring a veil if you think you might want to dance. Everyone must participate in chant; no singing talent required, no dancing experience necessary. Bring water to drink. Avoid wearing large jewelry.

name: Efenwealt Wystle and Aenor d'Anjou in Concert
description_book: Efenwealt Wystle and Aenor d'Anjou in concert.
description_web: Music that spans the SCA: historic, bardic, instrumental, vocal, comedy tragedy and everything in between. *Some material may be inappropriate for children under 12.*

name: *i Sebastiani!*
description_book: *i Sebastiani*, Greatest *Commedia dell'Arte* Troupe in the Entire World! Wondrous entertainment.
description_web: *Buon giorno!* O, you lucky people! Truly you are blessed among the living, for into your lives has **again** come *i Sebastiani*, the Greatest *Commedia dell'Arte* Troupe in the Entire World! Join us as we improvise, from the thinnest of outlines, a wondrous entertainment in three acts!

name: Bellatrix: Individual Session
description_book: Individuals or small groups with Duke Paul, covering any martial topic. **Contact Duke Paul** at paul@bellatrix.org **to schedule** ACTUAL date/time.
description_web:
**TIME/DATE NOT FIRM.** One to two hours with Duke Paul for individuals or small groups, covering any martial topic. 
**Contact Duke Paul** at paul@bellatrix.org to **schedule actual date/time**.  The dates/times in this listing are placeholders.

name: Yoga For Dancers, Fighters or Pretty Much Anyone
description_book: Yoga to help us through the rigors of War, regardless of our activities. Please bring a mat/towel and dress for modesty. Kids must bring guardian.
description_web: Yoga to help us through the rigors of War, regardless of our activities. Please bring a mat or towel and dress for modesty. Children may attend with parent/guardian present.

name: Coffee with Friends of Bill and Dr Bob
description_book: Morning recovery meetings in agnostic format.
description_web: Morning recovery meetings in agnostic format.

name: Rehearsal (Closed): Known World Players (KWP)
description_book: Space in use.
description_web: Space in use.

name: *Étude* 3 for Single Rapier Obliques and Cuts
description_book: For all levels and teachers. Drills focus on form, balance, movement and coordination. *Études* for drill; elements from drill used to work in groups.
description_web: For beginner and intermediate fencers and those who teach them. These drills will focus on form, balance, movement and coordination. *Étude* 3 focuses on oblique movements for offense and defense as well as a variety of cuts. Emphasis will be on learning the *étude* for home drill, as well as taking elements out of the drill for more focused work in groups. Each of the 5 sessions will take a different element out of the drill for daily focus and is self-contained. Attendance every day is not required, but is  beneficial to long term retention. Equipment needed: rapier, gloves, mask, gorget. Full fencing armor is not required as we will do slow drills, not full sparring.

location: Thunder Bird Atlatl  (Thunder Bird Atlatl Booth #80?)
name: How to Make an *Atlatl* Dart
description_book: How to make an *atlatl* dart from start to cast. Limit of four students participating in each class.
fee_itemization: Kits: Basic Caster and 3 dart available from Thunderbird Atlatl for $40 or Caster $25 and/or $8 per Dart 5' or 6'.

name: Youth Combat Morning Session
description_book: Lists open.
description_web: Youth Fighting lists open.

name: Appliqué Needlebook (Make-and-Take)
description_book: Make a wool felt needlebook to store your sewing needles, useful as gifts or as largesse. Learn wool appliqué, & simple metal thread technique.
description_web: Make a fun little wool felt needlebook to store your sewing needles, useful as gifts or as largesse. This hands-on class will get you started on making a simple, but pretty needlebook of 100% wool felt. Twenty kits will be available, and will include a handout, pre-cut pieces of wool felt, beads, Japan thread, sewing needles. Please bring your own scissors to use in class.
fee_itemization: 100% wool felt for project, beads, japan thread, sewing thread, needles, pins, and the handout.

name: Amulets for Everyone (Even You Christians!)
description_book: A survey of the amulets used by Romans, Vikings, Christians, and more. As always, we will be passing around examples. Please come with an open mind.
description_web: A survey of the amulets used by Romans, Vikings, Christians, and more. As always, we will be passing around examples of reproduction amulets. Please come with an open mind; there will be body parts!

name: The Medieval Kitchen Garden
description_book: Medieval kitchen gardens vital roll: looking at the structure, plants, tools, materials, techniques used to grow medicine, dye, food & for enjoyment.
description_web: We'll look at the design and function of the medieval kitchen garden and the tools used to make it all happen. We'll discuss what plants were found to be typical, how/why they were selected, and fertilization and watering techniques, plus how the plants were used such as food, dyes, medicines, etc. I'll bring samples of whatever I have growing in the garden at the time, as well as some seeds to share.

name: Lampworking: Making SCA Order Medallions
description_book: Demonstration of how to make glass beads & pendants for Society & Kingdom (East) level awards. Brainstorm strategies for making other Order pendants.
description_web: This class will be a demonstration of how to make glass beads and pendants for Society & Kingdom (East) level awards. After a few demonstrations, attendees are invited to bring pictures of other awards they might wish to create themselves, and the class will brainstorm strategies for making those other designs as time allows. I have made Laurel and Pelican medallions, and pendants for East Kingdom awards such as the order of Maunche, Silver Crescent, and OGR, among others. Please note this class is a demonstration only. It is not hands-on. However, the instructor is happy to find a time/place to work one-on-one with interested students at another time during Pennsic.

name: Garbing 101
description_book: With several myths regarding garb colors & materials, come learn what materials & colors were really used. Some helpful hints with patterns too!
description_web: Everything you need to know about garbing, you learned in kindergarten. No, really! Come re-discover colors, materials, and patterns used in the Middle Ages and Renaissance. There will be several myth busters about color (black was not expensive!) and a chance to see some of the natural dyes up close.

name: Youth White Work for Scrolls (13-17)
description_book: [TeenU 13-17] Learn white work techniques for scrolls. Materials provided. Up to 10 students.
fee_itemization: Fee includes cost of printing color documents for white work, paint, paint holder, cups for water, and brushes.

name: Ask a Museum Professional
description_book: Having cared for a variety of artifacts from ancient textiles to aircraft carriers, let Anna answer your burning questions on the biz.
description_web: Ever wonder what goes on behind the scenes in a museum? Interested in a job working at one but don't know where to start? How do you store this, touch that, or care and feed historic artifacts? Let Anna help. Having handled ancient Byzantine reliquaries, Russian icons, Pre-Columbian textiles and the deck of the USS Midway, she should be able to give you an answer, funny story, or cautionary tale involving the intricate world of museum work.

name: *Kute-uchi*: Advanced Japanese Hand Loop Braiding
description_book: Learn advanced techniques of this period Japanese loop-manipulation braiding technique to create two different ten-loop braids.
description_web: This period Japanese braiding technique was "lost" to the general population as a closely-held secret until modern research "re-discovered" it. *Kute-uchi* is similar to other methods of loop braiding, except the loops are lined up on the hands instead of held by the fingers. This enables experienced braiders to create braids using more than ten elements, with no additional equipment. Learn advanced techniques of this period Japanese loop-manipulation braiding technique to create two different ten-loop braids: *Kaku-gumi* and *Mitake-gumi*.

name: Faking It Is Period!
description_book: History and use of faux gems in jewelry and clothing from 4th to 16th centuries.
description_web: History and use of faux gems in jewelry from 4th to the 16th centuries. From the east to the west, pre-Roman to the Renaissance, faux gems were known and frequently used. Pearls to paste (glass) jewels were used by all classes and cultures for decorating clothing and making jewelry. Lecture will cover brief overview, specific examples of techniques and instances such as: the Romans were well known for paste emeralds and lapis. Followed by Q & A. Handout will include research sources and photos of extant examples.
fee_itemization: Copies of lecture notes, resources and pictures of extant examples.

name: So, I Just Bought an Inkle Loom …
description_book: Learn how to read a pattern, warp a loom and create your first inkle weaving: a three-color band, about 1" wide. Limited rental looms available.
description_web: You’ve just bought an inkle loom (or, you’re thinking of buying one!).  Now what? You’ll learn about the structure of the inkle loom, how to read a pattern, choose the yarn for your loom, and how to warp the loom. But most importantly, you’ll create your first inkle weaving: a three-color band, about one inch wide. Bring your new loom and shuttle, and join us all. For those of you who haven’t taken the plunge, a limited number of rental looms and shuttles ($30 through the end of War) will be made available.

name: Working Class Clothing In Tudor England
description_book: Late period doesn't have to cost a fortune. Based on actual 16th-century wills, this class will discuss what people **really** wore.
description_web: Silk velvet and lace and gems! While there is some undeniably jaw-droppingly beautiful and elaborate 16th-century clothing, that's not what 90% of people wore. This class will look at the inventories and wills of real Elizabethan people and peek inside their wardrobes. What fabrics did they use? How many garments did they have?

name: Historical Symbols and Modern Controversies
description_book: Discussion led by a modern history professor on the use of controversial symbols in the SCA and how to avoid pitfalls.
description_web: The recent incident in Caid underscores a pressing need: With so much medieval imagery being co-opted by the alt-right, SCA members need to think very carefully about what symbols they use. What is the larger perspective in medievalism in general? What are the different sides in the controversy? What do academics and activists think? How can one avoid mis-signaling? This class, taught by a modern history professor, will provide some needed perspective, not only for us as individuals living simultaneously in the Modern Middle Ages and modern society, but for having the SCA as a whole avoid bad publicity. After a brief talk, we will break into discussion for a frank and open sharing of views.

name: Guitar in the SCA Period
description_book: Learn to play period music on ukulele! History, technique, and music for the 16th-C 4-course Renaissance guitar. Bring ukulele (or guitar with capo).
description_web: Yes, guitars are period! The popular 16th-century Renaissance guitar had 4-courses tuned GCEA, like one of its modern descendants, the ukulele. We will survey the origin and history of the guitar, period notation and playing technique, and extant musical literature, then learn to play some easy period pieces. Bring a ukulele (or modern guitar capo'd on the 5th fret) if you can. A few loaner instruments and capos will be available.

name: Glove Affair: Making Gloves
description_book: Gloves are not just an accessory. Come and find out what I have learned about gloves in the 30 years I have been making them.
description_web: We delve into every aspect about the period article, whether it be leather, wool, linen or silk. I will share my construction techniques and a pattern I created from a study that has extended over 30 years. We will review the timeline of gloves. I will have many examples on hand to examine. A portion of the class will be dedicated to hands-on, and sewing supplies will be available to experience sewing leather. Materials, stitches, techniques and decoration will all be discussed. Bring your questions.
fee_itemization: Sewing kit that includes leather needle, sharp needle, silk thread, linen thread and 5" X 5" piece of leather to sew.

name: *Opus Anglicanum*: Underside Couching
description_book: *Opus Anglicanum* embroidery has several defining characteristics. This class concentrates on teaching the underside couching portion of this style.
description_web: There are two defining stitches used in *Opus Anglicanum*: the split stitch which creates the figures and colors of each piece, and the underside couching. Underside couching is a special form of couching with gold that creates a flexible surface. The technique produces a wonderful textural effect in the background. We will learn the technique and investigate some of the designs that can be created.

instructor: Baroness Cellach Dhonn inghean Mhic an
name: Welcome to the SCA
description_book: You are new to the SCA. You find your local group and want to get started. What are your next steps? This class is for you!
description_web: You are new to the SCA. You find your local group and want to get started. What are your next steps? Where to buy garb, accessories and feast gear? How to make a T-tunic. You want to get involved and don't know where to find help. This is a class for you!

name: *Commedia dell'Arte* for Youth
description_book: Hands-on class giving the description and history of *Commedia* before having the youth create and eventually perform their own skit. Ages 13-17.
description_web: Young adults will learn the art of *commedia dell'arte* while practicing and creating skits that will be performed at the end of the week. Ages 13-17.

name: Archery Practice
description_book: Warm up, practice shoot, and have fun on the Archery Range.

name: Children's Dance: *Lines and Circles*
description_book: Come learn some dances for any group. Some are just patterns and others are "mimed". (Any youth in attendance require a responsible adult present.)
description_web: Come learn some dances done in large groups. Some are just patterns and others are chances to be a mime. (Any youth in attendance require a responsible adult present.)

name: Board Games
description_book: A review of board games previously taught and opportunities to practice with a knowledgeable instructor's assistance.

name: Recorder Jam Session
description_book: Did you learn to play the recorder in school? Don't know what to do with it? Let's figure that out.
description_web: Did you learn to play the recorder in school? Don't know what to do with it now? Is it collecting dust under your bed? We welcome children of "recorder class age" and above to learn tunes that they can play in camp and with others.
fee_itemization: There will be soprano recorders available at $6.00 each IF NEEDED

name: Card-Weaving Basics
description_book: Using the continuous warping method, you will warp the loom and, using cards, you will weave a narrow strip.
description_web: Warp a loom and weave a small strap or trim piece. Using the continuous warping method, you will warp the loom and weave a narrow strip. Classroom loaner looms available or bring your own. Class limited to 5 looms. Fee covers string and cards; take your work home with you.

name: STIs & Treatments in Pre-1600 Italy
description_book: An overview of sexually-transmitted infections and their treatments in 600-1600 Italy. Age 18+.
description_web: An overview of sexually-transmitted infections and treatments in 600-1600 Italy. Presentation will cover known STIs, transmission, t̶o̶r̶t̶u̶r̶e̶s̶- er.. treatments for these medical issues, as well as historical attitudes toward both the infections and those infected. Age 18+.

name: Evolution of Tack
description_book: Focuses on how horse tack (or furniture which includes saddles, bridles, bits, etc.) has evolved from the Middle Ages to the present day.
description_web: Focuses on how horse tack (or furniture which includes saddles, bridles, bits, etc.) has evolved through time from the Middle Ages to the present day. The emphasis will be on applying this knowledge to designing equestrian equipment for use in the SCA that is both historically accurate and safe.

name: Youth Rapier Activities
description_book: There will be a variety of youth rapier activities each day including drills, games and one-on-one instruction. Some loaner gear will be available.
description_web: There will be a variety of youth rapier activities each day including drills, games and one-on-one instruction. Some days may include special additional activities. Some loaner gear will be available. Participants do not have to be authorized. Children age 6 and up may participate. Please bring your parent/guardian the first day you attend to learn more about the youth rapier program.

name: Thrown Weapons MIT: Part 2
description_book: Learn the SCA rules and guidelines to be a Thrown Weapons Marshal. Parts 1 & 2 required with on-the-range training and written test on Friday.
description_web: Learn the SCA rules and guidelines to be a Thrown Weapons Marshal. Parts 1 & 2 required with on-the-range training and written test on Friday.

name: Youth Throwing Instruction
description_book: Teaching youth 5-12 to throw axes. Focus on range rules and technique. Parent must accompany child per Pennsic rules. Tournament later in the week.
description_web: Teach youth, ages 5-12 to throw axes. This class will focus on Pennsic range rules, range etiquette and technique. There will be time for the children to throw and there will be loaner equipment available from the instructor. Parent must accompany the child per Pennsic rules. There will be a youth tournament later in the week.

name: *Chen Tai Chi* Basics
description_book: Come learn the fundamental movements of *Chen Tai Chi*, the traditional martial art of Chenjiagou.
description_web: Come learn the fundamental movements of *Chen Tai Chi*, the traditional martial art of Chenjiagou. *Chen Tai Chi* is the original martial art form that all modern day schools of *tai chi* were derived from. Started by Chen Bu in the 14th century and codified by Chen Wangting in the 17th century, *Chen Tai Chi* has a long lineage that is alive and thriving in the present day. Come experience the basics of this rich martial art form with Hilary!

name: Family Felting Fun
description_book: Have fun with your kids, cool off and learn a skill. My daughters and I will help you and your kids try your hands at felting wool onto bars of soap.
description_web: Have fun with your kids, cool off and learn a skill. My daughters and I will help you and your kids try your hands at felting wool onto bars of soap. Making craft projects out of wool can be a great activity for families with kids of all ages. Felt is like the play dough of fiber arts. After you get started, the possibilities are endless.

name: Scrolls By Design
description_book: It's tricky to fit all the illumination and text on a scroll, filling the space artfully. Learn some design tips for making the process easier.
description_web: It's tricky to fit all the illumination and text on a scroll, filling the space artfully and without having everything crammed in or leaving big holes and gaps to detract from the balance of the whole document. Learn some design tips for making the process easier.

name: *Qigong* Flow: Eight Brocades
description_book: This is a series of exercises that dates back to the Song Dynasty of China (1103-1142 AD). Come enjoy some morning *Qigong*.
description_web: This class will cover the 8 Brocades or *baduanjin*. This is a series of exercises that dates back to the Song Dynasty of China (1103-1142 AD). These moves were originally designed to keep soldiers in shape and ready for battle, so if you are planning to go to battle this war, this class is for you! And if not, these moves can be adapted for anyone, so don’t worry if you’re not in warrior condition. No experience or special abilities required, just come and enjoy the movement. This is part 1 of a 3-part series on *qigong*.

name: Spin like the Romans and Byzantines
description_book: A Roman hand-distaff is light to use with delicate whorled Roman spindles. Great for fine warp yarns. Hands-on. Loaners available.
description_web:
The Roman hand distaff is delightfully different in use and form for spinning well-prepared wool. Both light and very portable, its use continued in isolated areas of Europe (especially Italy) until modern times. When used with copies of archaeological finds, these removable whorl spindles produce a very delicate "laceweight" yarn, suitable for warp. These techniques were in use at least from 150 CE until 800 CE in Europe. We will learn the special way of dressing these small distaves for hot countries. Class is 2/3 lecture and 1/3 brief hands-on. Spindles and distaves are copies of extant archaeological and museum finds. Students in hands-on section of class can either purchase a distaff, spindle and wool kit, bring their own spindles and distaves, or ask for a loaner kit. **Note:** Students **do not** have to participate in kit purchases, and are welcome to simply observe. It is helpful if students view my teaching videos online before class, but not necessary.
https://bit.ly/2EMVhKD or search YouTube for missingspindle.

name: Western City Planning
description_book: A discussion of Western city development including the urban language of architecture, locations, and spaces.

name: How to Use Woodworking Hand Tools
description_book: How to use woodworking tools - I will show simple hand tools.
description_web: See a demonstration of simple hand tools and their uses. Not hands-on.

name: Preteen and Teen Activities/Volunteer at Pennsic
description_book: Parents, do you want to get your kids involved? Not sure what to do or where to go? Come to this class and find out!
description_web: Parents, do you want to get your kids involved? Not sure what to do or where to go? Come to this class and find out! This class is for parents and kids. We will discuss things for kids 11-18 to do and volunteer for at Pennsic.

name: Modern Music for the Medievally Minded
description_book: Do you play music by ear or jam with others but wish you had a grasp on reading modern notation? Come learn basics or review music theory.
description_web: Do you play music by ear or jam with others but wish you had a grasp on reading modern notation? Come learn basics or review music theory. Will touch on scales, circle of 5ths, modes, how to find improvisational tonal points, clefs and other basic fundamentals of music and how they relate to what **you** do medievally in music. We will try and make the connection between what's on a music sheet - what's in your ear - and where your fingers go!
fee_itemization: The hand out fee is for a packet of copies of music theory reference pages.

name: Seeþing Sope: Or, How to Boil Medieval Soap
description_book: Turning drip lye and oils into period soap using period techniques. I will go over leaching lye and boiling soap using 16th-century manuscript info.
description_web: Turning drip lye and fats into period soap using period techniques. This class will go over leaching lye, rendering fats and boiling soap as directed by 12th- and 13th-century guild recipes and their updated 16th-century counterparts.

name: 14th-Century Italian Sumptuary Laws
description_book: A discussion of the sumptuary laws in Northern Italy during the 14th century and their social implications.

name: Not Baked: Early Foods from Grain
description_book: Ancient grains: Threshing, grinding and cooking of whole and crushed grain foods.
description_web: What were the first foods made from grain and how were they prepared? We’ll be looking at the early history of grain processing and milling, what it took to prepare the oldest kinds of grain for milling, how grain was ground, and the porridges and other crushed grain dishes that were common before bread.

name: Where's Lord Waldo?
description_book: A look at the history and trivia of SCA geography.
description_web: A look at the history and trivia of SCA geography.

name: Fools' School
description_book: Are you a fool or a fool wannabe? Come to Fools' School to share and learn. Prepare a 5-minute skit to perform. All ages/experience levels welcome.
description_web: Are you a fool or a fool wannabe? Come to Fools' School to share and learn. Fools/performers of all types and experience levels are welcome. Jugglers, magicians, singers, freaks and geeks. Get help creating or honing a skit of no more than 5 minutes to perform in the Amphitheater, Wednesday, 8/8, 6-7 pm. You might even become a “Licensed Fool.” Performing is not mandatory.

name: Scribal Arts
description_book: In tents A & B you will be able to see the scribal arts at their best.
description_web: From creating the surface, the paints, the brushes, the inks, and the pens, to binding them in book form, our craftsmen can stand toe-to-toe with the artist of yore. In tents A & B you will be able to see the scribal arts at their best.

name: Scribal Arts
description_book: In tents A & B you will be able to see the scribal arts at their best.
description_web: From creating the surface, the paints, the brushes, the inks, and the pens, to binding them in book form, our craftsmen can stand toe-to-toe with the artist of yore. In tents A & B you will be able to see the scribal arts at their best.

name: From One to Twenty: A History of the Known World
description_book: An overview of the twenty kingdoms of the SCA, where they came from, what kingdom each came from, and when.
description_web: An overview of the twenty kingdoms of the SCA, where they came from, what kingdom each came from, and when.

name: Care and Feeding of Sewing Machines
description_book: A sewing machine is designed to last twenty to eighty years. Why they don't, how they can, and what to do with a machine you've never seen before.

name: *Canary* with Training Wheels
description_book: The *Canary* is a 16th-century dance with swagger and foot-stamping. I will teach a simplified pattern that will let you start having fun with it.

name: Thumb Ring Archery
description_book: Learn how to shoot like a Mongol. Requires a horse bow and arrows at least 4" longer than your finger draw.
description_web: Learn to shoot the way Mongols and other steppes and horse archers did. Lord Naran Numuchi, Bow Khan of the Great Dark Horde, Companion of the Order of the Yew Bow (Atlantia), Ponte Alto Baronial Marshal, and many times Archery Champion, has been shooting thumb ring since 1998, and has focused on the use and history of static-eared recurve bows the whole time.

location: Good Friends Camp (N-01, usually on St. Lawrence)
name: Coptic Sketch Book
description_book: Students will build a small Coptic sketch book with wood covers and exposed spine.
description_web:
New last year: Students will build a Coptic-stitched sketch book with wood covers and exposed spine using techniques born in Egypt in the 4th century. Students are encouraged bring their own cutting board, rotary cutter/X-Acto, and metal ruler, if they have them. (Binding tools will be loaned, if needed, however.) 

Fee includes pre-drilled wood boards, paper, linen thread, and a detailed handout.
fee_itemization: Fee includes pre-drilled wood boards, paper, linen thread, and a detailed handout.

location: Herald's Point ( Intersection of the Low Road with the Great Eastern Highway, next to Family Point)
name: Topics in Basic Heraldry
description_book: These classes will teach basic name and/or armory skills for consulting at Pennsic Herald's Point. Dates and topics will be posted at Herald's Point.
description_web: These classes will teach basic name and/or armory submission skills necessary to consult at Pennsic Herald's Point. Exact dates and topics will be posted at Herald's Point at the beginning of the War. All newer heralds are strongly encouraged to attend at least one of these classes prior to volunteering at Herald's Point.

name: Japanese Stab Binding: Make a Book in Under 1 Hour
description_book: Make 2 books in 1 hour using the stab binding method. No handout; we will focus on the craft rather than the history. Under 16 yrs old need adult rep!
description_web: Come make two books in no time at all using the ancient stab binding method of Japan. There is no handout as we will focus on the craft rather than the history, but a card with reference sites will be available. This class and its humble instructor is not set up for youth teaching; any patrons under 16 need adult supervision. Keep in mind we will be using sharp tools, fine motor functions and working be in a blacksmith's shop where children can find injury. Thanks for your understanding!
fee_itemization: Beeswax, Paper for book pages, decorative paper for book covers and linen binding thread and colored cotton pearl.

name: *Qigong* and *Tai Chi* Easy
description_book: *Qigong*, an ancient Chinese art form, combines gentle stretches with mindful awarenes. *Tai Chi* Easy teaches five easy standing or walking forms.

name: Storytelling Academy
description_book: Explore genres, tools, styles, and uses of storytelling. Cultural and medieval approaches, applications, performance coaching. New topics each day.
description_web: During this nine-day academy, students will gain knowledge about the history and techniques for storytelling both in the SCA and the modern world. Students may attend individual sessions or all of the academy. There will be guest teachers and time for students to practice and receive feedback. The academy will culminate in a student performance. No classes are repeated. The focus is on developing comfort, nurturing, and honing skills within the students’ capabilities. All levels are welcome. Students may view a class outline at the academy space, Minerva’s Spindle 158, where classes will also be listed on the message board. Seating is limited; feel free to bring your own chair. Student Performance, Thursday 8/9, 5pm in the performance pavilion.

name: Æthelmearc-Sponsored Novelty Shoot
description_book: Daily novelty shoots hosted by the Kingdom of Æthelmearc. These shoots will be simple fun shoots for any skill level.

name: KW Children's Choir Rehearsal
description_book: The Pennsic Children's Choir is an open choir for any children ages 4-11 who enjoy singing. They perform as part of the concert on 8/9/18.
description_web: The Pennsic Children's Choir is an open choir for any children ages 4-11 who enjoy singing. They rehearse for one hour each day and perform at the Knowne World Choir concert on Thursday 8/9/18. The director of the Pennsic Children's Choir this year is Mistress Deonna von Aachen.

name: Intermediate Irish Language for SCAdians
description_book: Conversational Irish based on SCA scenarios.
description_web: Already speak a little Irish (or attended the Beginning Irish class)? Keep the momentum going. Learn more phrases to start conversations. Blessings and curses.

name: Zen Warrior Pennsic Ladies' Rapier Championship
description_book: Ladies' Rapier Tournament: Round-robin to encourage fighting, then single elimination (best of three) play-off to determine the champion.
description_web: The Zen Warrior Ladies' Rapier Championship is a great chance to fight ladies from other kingdoms that you don't normally get to fight. Our round-robin format encourages lots of fighting. Then, the top 4 or 8 (depending on number of participants) will compete for the Zen Warrior Championship Prizes in best of three elimination format.

name: Beginning Fabris
description_book: Introduction to Italian rapier and Fabris.
description_web: Interested in checking out a bit of historical rapier? Come learn about the Italian style, and specifically the style of Salvatore Fabris. You don't have to be as bendy as a willow branch, but it certainly doesn't hurt. We will go over basic stance, movement and blade-work, as well as his basic concepts. Fencing gear suggested; we will be working drills.

name: *Destreza*: Spanish Fencing Circle Use & Footwork
description_book: Learn how historic masters used the angles and curves within the Spanish fencing circle. Drills; no swords; aimed at beginner/intermediate.
description_web: This class will drill the footwork used within the Spanish fencing style of *La Verdadera Destreza*. We will cover the Spanish concepts of distance, the various types of circles used by the historic masters, the use of angles and curves within the circle, and possible ways to integrate these concepts into your fencing practice. Wear comfortable clothes/shoes to move and drill in. No armor or swords required. Material will be appropriate for any level, but most relevant to beginner or intermediate.

name: Weed Walk
description_book: Wild plant identification. Wear walking shoes and hat; leave from Univ. Point. Different teachers on different days; walk with us more than once!
description_web: Cooper's Lake abounds with medicinal and food plants that were used by various primitive and medieval cultures. Learn to identify them during a walk around the campsite. The walk will take place rain or shine. Please wear sturdy shoes and a hat. Meet at University Point for the start of the class. We have multiple teachers, so if you attend more than one walk you will likely learn different things!

name: Cadels for the Intermediate Calligrapher
description_book: Learn how to make a cadel using your own calligraphy supplies. Students should have a working knowledge of gothic and secretary hands.
description_web: Cadels, also called *cadeaux*, are those beautiful built-up decorative letters found in numerous sources (both illuminated manuscripts and in documents) across later periods and in different western cultures. This class will cover a hands-on lesson in creating a single cadel, with discussion on sources and techniques. Experience in gothic and secretary or *batarde* hands are required. Some materials may be available, but students should bring their own supplies and tools, including paper.

name: Armoured Field Battle
description_book: description added soon
description_web:
TENTATIVE:
(Muster 9:45 am) 
5 points total (1 point per battle).
5 passes.
Last fighter standing, victory condition, no resurrection.
Full field.
All holds are general.
No siege.
CA allowed in 2nd & 4th passes, no CA ammo may be gleaned. No CA ammo may be re-inspected and reused during the same day.

name: Passover Foods for a Medieval Seder
description_book: Covers the foods eaten at Ashkenazi Passover seders in the Middle Ages. We'll taste a number of these foods.
description_web: This class will cover the foods eaten at Passover seders in the Middle Ages when matzah was an inch thick and horseradish was only eaten as an ingredient in *charoset*. We will be looking at the evolution of the rulings about various foods, recipes to make some of them, how some of the practices changed. Includes taste testing.
fee_itemization: to cover cost of handout and foods we taste test.

name: 14th-Century Italian Clothing
description_book: A discussion of the clothing styles and aesthetics found in Northern Italy, with a demonstration of the different layers of clothing worn.

name: Introduction to Japanese Syllabic Verse
description_book: Introduction to the forms of medieval Japanese poetry. Class will cover typical subject matter, as well as practical advice for composing in English.
description_web: An introduction to the various forms of medieval Japanese syllabic poetry. Class will also cover typical subject matter for Japanese poetry, as well as practical advice for composing syllabic verse in English.
fee_itemization: Optional donation of $1 for cost of photocopying handouts

name: Fiber Content Identification with Low-Tech Methods
description_book: Did you ever wonder if you bought natural or synthetic material? Learn how to tell fiber content with burn tests, drip tests and other low-tech tests.
description_web: Did you ever wonder if you bought natural or synthetic material at that discount sale? Learn how to tell fiber content with burn tests, drip tests and other low-tech methods.

name: You've Registered a Device -- Now What?
description_book: Aspects of heraldic display - achievements, marshaling, cadency, etc. - that, while not necessarily registered, are appropriate practice.
description_web: So, your device got accepted by the College of Arms, as did your Significant Other's. You also have three children, two boys and a girl. What can you do with those two devices to demonstrate everyone's identity and kinship?

name: Build Your Own Catapult
description_book: [YouthU 10+] See different models of catapults, use various materials to construct your own model and test how far yours will launch small objects.
description_web: [YouthU 10+] Have you ever wanted to build your own catapult? In this class, you will observe different models of catapults, use various materials (straws, spoons, popsicle sticks, rubber bands, tape, cups, etc.) to construct your own catapult, and then test the distance your catapult will launch small objects. You can keep your catapult model.

name: *Pasamanos*: A Survey of Spanish Needlework
description_book: A survey of pre-1600 Spanish needlework, drawnwork, lace, & other handwork. Focus is on exposure to styles, not on learning the techniques involved.
description_web: Spain has a rich tradition of needlework dating back hundreds of years into period. This class will trace the development of this tradition, starting with some of the earliest examples and extending to lacemaking, drawnwork, and the other highly complex styles found decorating ruffs, *camisas*, and more during the Spanish Golden Age. Students should expect to learn basic concepts of how the various needlework may have been executed, but the class is primarily one of exposure to unique styles rather than hands-on.

name: Clean Clothes Make the Man!
description_book: Period recipes and techniques to clean fabrics of all manner of stains. A follow-up of the "Seeþing Sope" from the previous hour.
description_web: Period recipes and techniques to clean fabrics of all manner of stains using alkalines, acids, soaps and other period ingredients. A follow-up of the "Seeþing Sope" from the previous hour as black sope is traditionally often used as a laundry soap. If time permits, we will make laundry soap balls to take in order to help clean clothes in your own camp!

name: Divination: Palmistry
description_book: History, theory, and practice of one of the most ancient of divinatory arts, palm reading. Hands-on class. Learn to read each others' palms in class.
description_web: History, theory, and practice of one of the most ancient of divinatory arts, palm reading. Learn to read the secrets of a soul, writ upon the hand for only the wise to see. This is a hands-on class where you will actually read each others' palms.

name: Demystifying Fabrics
description_book: An introductory class on fabrics, including pros and cons of common types. How can the same fiber yield many kinds of fabric?
description_web: An introductory class on fabrics. We'll review period-appropriate fibers (and some commonly seen synthetics), and handle samples of various types. Why can't you put wool in the washing machine? How can stiff silk taffeta and filmy silk *crepe de chine* be made from the same thing? For beginning sewers or anyone interested in clothing and fashion.

name: *Maghribi* Philosophy: A Participatory Discussion
description_book: Participatory, philosophical discussion based on the ideas of Ibn Khaldun and Maimonides. Prior knowledge of *Maghribi* philosophy is not required.
description_web: From Cordoba to Fes, and Timbuktu to Tunis, *Maghribis* were bringing intellectual light to the world during a period elsewhere called the "dark ages." Join a discussion on philosophical themes advanced by Ibn Khaldun and Rabbi Moses ben Maimon (Maimonides), two of the most famous *Maghribi* scholars to have attended Al-Qarawiyyin University in Fes. Participants will be provided with information for the topics of discussion. No prior knowledge of *Maghribi* philosophy is required. We will also contemplate the works of Ibn Rushd (Averroes), Ibn Tufail, Ibn Arabi, and Ibn Hazm al-Andalusi. Class guide will be available at http://www.talaalzahra.com/pennsic-university

name: Street Smarts
description_book: What's in a name? A folkloric history of Pennsic geography: how the streets and areas of Pennsic came by their distinctive designations.
description_web: What's in a name? A folkloric history of Pennsic geography: how the streets and areas of Pennsic came by their distinctive designations.

name: Youth Theatre
description_book: For kids ages 6-12 interested in exploring their creative and theatrical sides through story telling, acting, and producing their very own play!
description_web: For kids ages 6-12 interested in exploring their creative and theatrical sides through story telling, acting, and producing their very own play! Come join us as we build a theatre show from the ground up, giving younger kids a creative outlet for all that pent-up camping energy! Children 12 and under must have a parent or guardian present.

name: Archery War Points
description_book: Shoot the Castle Window, Soldier Shoot, and Clout for War Points.

name: Beginning *Atlatl*
description_book: Learn the basics of *atlatl* safety: how to hold the *atlatl*, load a dart, and throw the dart.
description_web: Learn the basics of *atlatl* safety: how to hold the *atlatl*, load a dart, and throw the dart.

name: I Feel Pretty and Period
description_book: A discussion of (generally later) period beauty practices, both from the perspective of "What they did" as well as "What can we safely do."
description_web: A discussion of period skin care and hair care practices, both from the perspective of "What they did" as well as "What we can safely do." It is no secret that period skin care and hair care recipes often involved mercury, lead and arsenic, but there are also some great recipes and tools that SCAdians can use to further their immersion into their persona.

name: Happy Dancing Feet in the 16th Century
description_book: Beginner's focus on 16th-C Italian dance. Learn steps and patterns frequently found in *Cascarde*; *La Castellana* from *Il Ballarino* will be taught.
description_web: Beginner's focus on 16th-century Italian dance. Learn or review some frequently occurring steps and patterns found in *Cascarde* (sprightly 16th century Italian dance). Many of the steps will be used to learn *La Castellana* from Caroso’s *Il Ballarino*.

name: Intro to *Xiangqi* (Chinese Chess)
description_book: A class on the basic rules and beginning tactics of the game, with time to play afterwards.
description_web: A class on the basic rules and beginning tactics of the game, with time to play afterwards.

name: Henna History and Application
description_book: Learn how and why henna was used in period, and how you can use it yourself. We will mix some henna in class; everyone gets some to try.
description_web: Learn how and why henna was used in period, including traditions, materials, and techniques, and how you can use it yourself today. We will mix some henna in class, which for me (becoming a professional artist) was the hardest part to learn; everyone gets some to use and take.
fee_itemization: One cone of fresh henna paste. You may also take the class without this, or bring your own.

name: Pennsic Youth Choir: Open Rehearsal
description_book: The Pennsic Youth Choir is open to ages 12 - 19 to learn period vocal music and perform as part of the Known World Choirs Concert, Thursday, War Week.
description_web: The Pennsic Youth Choir is open to youth ages 12 - 19 who enjoy learning and singing period vocal music *a cappella* with Deonna von Aachen. We will rehearse 12-1 pm Sunday, August 6, through Wednesday, August 9. Performance will be part of the Known World Choirs Concert on Thursday evening of War Week. (Dress rehearsal Thursday afternoon, 8/10, in the PAT; details TBA during regular rehearsals.) More information can be found here: https://sites.google.com/site/kwcpennsicchoir/home/pennsic-choir/pennsic-youth-choir

name: Loom-Woven Pouch
description_book: Create a tabby-woven pouch on a one-piece loom. Class limited to 10 looms.

name: History of Drinking: Common Medieval Drinks
description_book: History of drinks, how they affected society and culture. Includes samples and recipes of common drinks found in the Middle Age and SCA. *Age 21+.*
description_web: A look at the history of drinks, especially those in the between 3rd-16th centuries and how they affected society and culture. Class will include samples (and recipes) of the most common drinks found in the Middle Ages (and in the SCA). No instruction on brewing provided. *Over 21 only.*

name: Training the War Horse
description_book: Focus is on preparing a horse to participate in SCA type equestrian activities. This is **not** a mounted class.
description_web: A trained warhorse was a highly prized commodity in the medieval period, as it is today. Training the horse to work with its rider in order to compete in the Tournament entails desensitization to scary objects, response to leg clues, as well as other skill building techniques. This class will focus on preparing a horse to participate in SCA type equestrian activities. Ownership of a horse is not required, though an understanding of basic horsemanship skills will be beneficial. This is **not** a mounted class.

name: Target Construction
description_book: Covers the design of throwing targets. Target-round and wall-style targets demonstrated. Recommended for new throwers and MITs.
description_web: Covers the design of throwing targets. Target-round and wall-style targets demonstrated. Recommended for new throwers and Marshals in Training.

name: Beginning Drumming
description_book: Basic rhythms used most often in drum circles and music within the SCA. A 4-part class; different rhythms each day. **Bring your own drum.**
description_web:
Learn the basic rhythms used most often in drum circles and music within the SCA. This is a 4-part class that teaches different rhythms each day. **Bring your own drum**.
Day 1- *Saidi, Beladi, Maqsum*
Day 2- *Chiftitelli, Masmoudi*
Day 3- *Ayub, Malfouf*
Day 4- *Kashlimah* and other strange stuff

name: The Cornett and the Serpent: Renaissance Brass?
description_book: Made of wood, played with a brass-type mouthpiece and fingered like a recorder. A hands-on discussion about the cornett and serpent. Bring a chair.
description_web: Once a favorite of composers and now obscure, the cornett is a musical instrument with a trumpet-type mouthpiece that is made of wood and fingered like a recorder. The larger serpent, which filled the need for a bass instrument, is a late-period ancestor of the modern tuba. Are they brass or woodwind? Join in for a hands-on discussion about these instruments, information on where to buy, and how to play. Several instruments will be available to try. Bring a chair.

name: Armory Art for Submission
description_book: How to draw and design your device or badge for submission. Learn the Core Style rules from SENA and how to avoid redraw returns.
description_web: This class will teach you how to draw and design your (or a client's) device or badge for submission to the Collage of Arms. We will go over the Core Style rules from SENA and learn how to avoid administrative returns due to a redraw.

name: Baba Yaga, the Arch-Villainess of Russian Folklore
description_book: Baba Yaga is a common character in Russian fairy tales. We will discuss the diverse rôles she plays, and look into the origins of the character.
description_web: Baba Yaga is a common character in Russian and Eastern European fairy tales. We will discuss the diverse rôles she plays, and look into the origins of the character. (Some familiarity with Russian folklore is helpful, but not really required.)

name: Vegetarian & Veganism in the Middle Ages
description_book: Discussion about accounts of vegetarian and veganism in the Middle Ages across the Known World. Ideas to accommodate veg*ns at feasts discussed, too.
description_web: Discussion about accounts of vegetarian and veganism in the Middle Ages across the Known World. Ideas to accommodate veg*ns at feasts discussed, too. There will possibly be samples to try and recipes to take home.

name: Scandalously Practical: Italian Drawers
description_book: A delicate conversation about an indelicate subject: underwear. We'll discuss the origins of the garment, references in period and construction.
description_web: A delicate conversation about an indelicate subject: underwear. Several pairs of Renaissance Italian "trousers" from Venice are found in museums around the world. We'll discuss the origins of the garment, plus references in period and construction techniques using both period and modern patterning.

name: Basic SCA Armory for Youth
description_book: [YouthU] Learn about devices and arms and how to design them! Covers tinctures, field divisions, basic heraldic style, plus whatever we have time for.
description_web: Yes, anyone of any age can pick a good SCA device and register it if they want to! Class covers the basics of picking a device or arms in the SCA based on medieval heraldic practice. Includes an overview of tinctures, field divisions, the rule of tincture, and more. If there is time, we'll also talk about what not to do (like marshaling). By the end of this class, you should have an idea how to design your arms for registration with the College of Arms or be prepared to visit Heralds Point to design a device or arms. Best for youth and teens; recommended that kids be able to read.

name: Lenten Food in Period
description_book: For 40 days out of the year, medieval Christians gave up dairy, eggs, and meat. Find out what they did eat and how delicious it could be.
description_web: Can you imagine giving up cheese, scrambled eggs, and bacon for forty days out of the year? Many Christians from the 10th century into the 16th century did just this but that doesn't mean they went without some form of comfort food. Come to the class to find out what they did eat and how to make some medieval Lenten treats.
fee_itemization: Three dollars for each handout of medieval recipes with the historical recipe and the redaction

name: You Are What You Eat: Humoral Doctrine
description_book: An overview of the theory of balancing the human condition through food.
description_web: An overview of the theory of balancing the human condition through food.

name: 11th-13th-Century Aquitainian Polyphony
description_book: Perhaps the earliest extant part-music we have is from monasteries in Eleanor of Aquitaine's backyard, before the Notre-Dame school. Handout included.
description_web: Perhaps the earliest extant part-music we have is from monasteries in Eleanor of Aquitaine's backyard. We'll discuss the early evolution of written music, and the difficulties of reading it. This music pre-dates the Notre-Dame school of Leonin and Perotin. Handout with musical examples included.

name: *Contrafacta*: Yes, Filking is Period
description_book: We will discuss the history and impact of *contrafacta* (period filks), and give some tips on how to write them.
description_web:
*Musica Contrafacta* means reworked or recycled music. In French, it is *contrefait*, which is the root of our word counterfeit. In other words, you make new music by copying a popular tune, to which you set new lyrics. A *contrafactum* (Latin singular; *contrafacta* is plural) is a period filk. 
 
Lady Melanie de la Tour will discuss the history and impact of *contrafacta*/filks, and gives some tips on how to write them.  Active participation is encouraged.

name: When Fairies Were Scary
description_book: Learn the history of the fairy tale and how fairies started as “surviving echoes of the gods” and devolved into Disney’s "Tinkerbelle."

name: Lucifer Through the Ages
description_book: Looking at where Lucifer came from, who he was through the ages and why he's a pop culture interest.
description_web: Looking at where Lucifer came from, who he was through the ages and why he's a pop culture interest.

name: Anglo-Saxon Ring Pouch
description_book: Create the only pouch an Anglo-Saxon woman would ever want or need, using period supplies and sewing techniques.
fee_itemization: All of the supplies and materials needed to make a ring pouch.

name: Heraldry for Newcomers: Choosing a Name and Device
description_book: Overall view on how to choose a name and device.
description_web: Help for newcomers with naming practices and the creation of a device in the SCA. How to search for books, web sites and people who can assist in choosing a period name and device.

name: Improv Games for Fun & Profit
description_book: Come brush up on those games so you can audition for an improv game show!
description_web: Did you ever watch a short-form improv game show and wish you were on stage? Come practice some of the classic games and maybe then return for the "Whose Line Doth It Be?" auditions Monday afternoon!

location: Argent Fox (Merchant area behind the barn)
name: Harp for Absolute Beginners I
description_book: Come learn the very basics of playing harp! Please bring a harp if you have one and a chair if you need one. Prior experience not necessary. All ages.
description_web: A very basic introduction to the fundamentals of modern harp, that is to say **hand position**! Learn how not to injure yourself playing! Please bring a harp if you have one and a chair if you need one; we will be holding the class at Argent Fox and can borrow his harps and chairs, but he only has so many and I don't know how many students will attend. We will review hand position, go over a couple basic exercises to practice with, and I will provide handouts with a simple tune to practice. Ability to either read music or memorize a definite plus, but anyone's welcome to show up, and I'll teach you what I can. All ages emphatically welcomed. This is the first in a sequence of two classes. Class is aimed at nylon-strung harps; wire-strung are welcome but I can't teach wire-strung style (which is different), though I will try to point you at people who can.

name: Cooking with Fire: The Fire Coordinator
description_book: Coordination with the person making and tending your fire is key to perfectly cooked meals served on time.
description_web: Coordination with the person making and tending your fire is key to perfectly cooked meals served on time. Meet a fire specialist and learn how to properly coordinate cooking times when fire is used.

name: Beginner Dance: *Branles*
description_book: Never danced before? No problem! Start with basic steps and patterns, and then learn fun *branles* from 16th-century France.
description_web: Never danced before? No problem! This class will start with basic steps and patterns, and then introduce you to fun *branles* from 16th-century France.

name: Annual Barter Town Swap Meet
description_book: It is time once again to barter. Come enjoy the Barter Bazaar and swap those unwanted items for that lost treasure!
description_web: It is time once again to barter. Come enjoy the Barter Bazaar and swap those unwanted items for that lost treasure! Everyone is welcome!

name: Beginning *Repoussé* and Chasing
description_book: Hands-on class; we will make a copper foil rose.
description_web: Hands-on class; we will make a copper foil rose.

name: Arabic Hip Movements
description_book: A study of various shimmies, slides and circles from a Syrian classic Oriental dance perspective. A beginning knowledge of ME Dance is appreciated.
description_web: A study of various shimmies, slides and circles from a Syrian classic Oriental dance perspective, taught by Baroness Simone. A beginning knowledge of Middle Eastern dance is appreciated.

name: Known World Choir
description_book: Do you like to sing? Come learn period music in a period style. Rehearsals are daily from 12-2 in the PARC.
description_web: Do you like to sing? Come learn period music in a period style. Rehearsals are daily from 12-2 in the PARC. Concert is Thursday 8/9 at 6:00 pm. Music is available on the Known World Choir Website. Pre-registration is requested although **not** required. All voice parts are welcome. This choir is adults only; however, there are other choirs for teens and children. The music for this year is all about battles and war!! While reading music is helpful it's not necessary. Practice tracks will be available on the choir's website in May. Please bring a 1" black folder for your music and a pencil.

name: Rehearsal (Closed): *il Titolo Provvisorio*
description_book: Space in use.
description_web: Space in use.

name: The Medieval Tavern in an SCA World
description_book: A brief history of taverns, inns, and alehouses in the medieval world, followed by *how* you can bring those elements to the SCA. Age 21+.
description_web: A brief history of taverns, inns, and alehouses in the medieval world, followed by *how* you can bring those elements to the SCA. Will include tips, tricks, and anecdotes from the SCA 50 Year tavern as well as ideas on how to run a tavern to showcase local home brewers. Please bring a mug. Age 21+.

name: Islamic Science
description_book: Most of the knowledge from the classical world that arrived in Europe from the 12th century on passed through the Islamic world.
description_web: Most of the knowledge from the classical world that arrived in Europe from the 12th century on passed through the Islamic world. In addition, Islamic scholars generated a huge amount of independent work and made corrections to and comments on the classical sources. This class will discuss the transmission of scientific knowledge from the ancient world to Europe via the Islamic world.

name: SCA Documentation: It's Not as Scary as You Think!
description_book: View and discuss different types of documentation and reasons for documenting. Bring your questions and any current documentation for feedback.
description_web: Interested in entering a regional fair for the first time? Looking to improve your research and documentation? Just want to try a bean count competition? Wondering what info to add to your class handouts? In this class we will look at (and discuss) different types of documentation and reasons for documenting. Bring your questions and any current documentation for tips and feedback.

name: The Tadcaster Militia Gauntlet Arcade Extravaganza
description_book: Run the gauntlet! Fight all the Tads! Win fabulous tickets! Take home prizes! It's ridiculous fun for anyone with a sword!
description_web: The Tadcaster Militia presents the Amazing and Wonderful Tadcaster Arcade Gauntlet and Tournament! Win fabulous tickets and also prizes! Fencers will face a gauntlet of bouts against members of the Tadcaster Militia. Victories will earn tickets that can be exchanged for prizes. You might win a freezy-pop, but you'll definitely enjoy it!

name: Intro to *Kanzashi* Flowers
description_book: This is an introductory class in making basic *Kanzashi* Flower traditional hair ornaments worn in Geisha hair styles.
description_web: This is an introductory class in making basic 6-petal *Kanzashi* Flowers, which are traditional hair ornaments worn in Geisha hair styles. Each student will be provided with all necessary pre-prepared materials necessary to complete their very own *Kanzashi* Flower in this class.
fee_itemization: All necessary pre-prepared materials necessary to complete a 6 petal Kanzashi Flower in the traditional style.  All necessary tools will be provided.

name: Fair and Fun Thrown Weapons Tournament: Discussion
description_book: Recommended for MITs or any others likely to find themselves running a TW tournament. People who have run tournaments before are encouraged to come.
description_web: Recommended for Marshals in Training or any others likely to find themselves running a TW tournament. People who have run tournaments before are encouraged to come and share their successes and failures.

name: KW Choir Open Auditions: *Chorulus Pennsicus* 2019
description_book: Known World Choir open auditions for anyone interested in trying out for select choir, *Chorulus Pennsicus*, Pennsic 48.
description_web: Known World Choir open auditions for anyone interested in trying out for select choir, *Chorulus Pennsicus*, Pennsic 48.

name: *Bushido*: the Japanese Path of Honor
description_book: Discussion of the virtues of *Bushido*, and how to walk the path in daily life.
description_web: Discussion of the virtues of *Bushido*, and how to walk the path in daily life.

name: Blackletter: Make It Better
description_book: What makes blackletter calligraphy a blackletter, and how not to ruin it? We will review principles of blackletter, common mistakes, and practice.
description_web: What makes blackletter calligraphy a blackletter, and how not to ruin it? We will review principles of blackletter, common mistakes and find points of interest in various kinds of blackletter used in manuscripts. If you tried blackletter but have not found it good enough, please join us at this class. Practice! Some pens are available, but better to bring your own tools.

name: Left-Handed Calligraphy
description_book: A hands-on introduction to the tools, techniques, and challenges for any left-handed calligrapher. Materials provided.

name: Chainmaille Workshop: Beginner Rosette Necklace
description_book: This workshop is geared towards the beginner who already feels comfortable opening and closing chainmaille rings. Fee covers a kit of tools and rings
description_web: This workshop is geared towards the beginner who already feels comfortable opening and closing chainmaille rings. The class fee covers a full kit of tools and supplies you may need to get started creating chainmaille. If you do not finish the workshop project in class, you will have everything you need to complete it at your leisure. Extra loaner tools and magnifying lenses will be available for use during the workshop. Patience and fine motor skills are needed for this class, so it may not be suited to children under 12 years old.
fee_itemization:
Ergonomic Bent Nose Pliers - $9
Jumpring Opening Tool - $4
Metal Sorting Tray - $2
Chainmaille Rings - $5

name: Introduction to a Basic Healing Balm
description_book: Basics about some herbs used historically for various topical uses. Harvesting, extracting oils, and the differences between a tincture and oil.
description_web: Learn some basics about some herbs that have (historically) been found to help various surface issues. How to harvest and extract their oils plus the differences between a tincture and oils. Includes the differences between using fresh herbs and dry herbs and how to keep herbal creams fresh longer.

name: Street Smarts
description_book: What's in a name? A folkloric history of Pennsic geography: how the streets and areas of Pennsic came by their distinctive designations.
description_web: What's in a name? A folkloric history of Pennsic geography: how the streets and areas of Pennsic came by their distinctive designations.

name: *Pysanky* Make-and-Take
description_book: Come learn to write beautiful Ukrainian-style resist-dyed eggs! We will talk about the history of *pysanky* while we write on eggs.
description_web: Using modern dyes to create intricate designs, we will learn about the history of *pysanky* while writing on eggs. This is a fun social project, suitable for all ages, though small children will need an adult with them, as we do use candles and hot wax.

name: Period Islamic Cooking
description_book: A description of a wide range of recipes from period Islamic cookbooks, along with a discussion of the available sources.
description_web: A description of a wide range of recipes from period Islamic cookbooks, along with a discussion of the available sources.

name: Basic SCA Names for Youth
description_book: [YouthU] Your chance to get a new name! How to pick historically plausible name in the SCA. Types of names, where find them, how to put them together.
description_web: [YouthU] Yes, anyone of any age can pick a good SCA name and register it if they want to! Class covers the basics of picking a historically plausible name in the SCA, including an overview of the types of name parts, finding parts for names, and an overview of putting the parts together. By the end of this class, you should have an idea how to research and document your name for registration with the College of Arms, or be prepared to visit Heralds Point to pick a name. Best for youth and teens; recommended that kids be able to read.

name: PPF: *Kosode* Construction
description_book: Learn about the patterns and construction of various types of Japanese *kosode* in preparation for the 2020 Perfectly Period Feast.
description_web: This class covers the patterns and construction of various types of Japanese *kosode*, from *aigi* to *uchikake*. Learn how to make a garment suitable for Æthelmearc’s 2020 Perfectly Period Feast: *Choyo no Sekku* (the Chrysanthemum Festival), an Enchanted Ground event set in Kyoto in the year 1590.

name: LGBTQ+ Individuals in the Viking Age: A Roundtable
description_book: A roundtable discussion of gender and sexuality variance in Viking-age Norse lands. This is a chance to share thoughts and resources.
description_web: A roundtable discussion of gender and sexuality variance in Viking-age Norse lands. This is a chance to share thoughts and resources that we have collected. Bring the references and thoughts you have on the subject and an open mind. We will talk about what is found in the sagas, the laws, the *eddas*, and archaeology. This class is adult-only because there will likely be some discussion of sex.

name: How to Carve a Viking Horse
description_book: Learn the basics of whittling by making a Viking toy horse in the Trondheim style.
description_web: Learn the basics of whittling by making a Viking toy horse in the Trondheim style. We will also discuss Viking tools, techniques and sharpening. All tools and materials will be provided. Warning! Very sharp knives are involved. Students must be at least 14 years old and have their mother's or wife's permission to attend. Bandages will be provided.
fee_itemization: Instructor is not charging a fee for the materials.

name: *Iznik* Art and Tile Work
description_book: This class will survey prevalent designs found in traditional Ottoman tile work to include symbolism. Sample designs included.
description_web: This class will survey the prevalent design concepts within the Ottoman empire to include any symbolism attached to the icons. Finally, tiles will be provided for students to try their hand at painting an *Iznik* design.
fee_itemization: paint, brushes, plastic stencils, individual 4x4" tile

instructor: Lady Alysoun of the Debatable Lands
name: Mead and Friends
description_book: Don't know the difference between a metheglin and a melomel? Bring a tasting glass and learn how various members of the mead family are made. Age 21+.
description_web: Don't know the difference between a metheglin and a melomel? Looking to impress people with new-found brewing knowledge at the next tavern event? Mead is made with honey, water, and yeast, but there are many varieties of mead that also include fruits, spices, and herbs. At this session you will sample different types of mead and learn how they are made. Age 21 and over. Please bring a tasting glass.

name: Creating a Culture of Consent
description_book: This class will empower you to make a difference and stop the everyday actions that add up to a culture of harassment.
description_web: The SCA, like many other subcultures, has had its #metoo moments lately, but let's face it: The people who need it aren't going to take a consent class. What's more, the problem often isn't out-and-out sexual assault, but small acts that are often dismissed as "not so bad." However, these add up to a culture of consent violation. It's up to all of us to change this. In this training, we'll learn how you can speak up to prevent you know is wrong from happening—even doing uncomfortable things, like bucking the SCA's hierarchical social system, if necessary. We'll talk about consent, of course, but also social strategies, do some roleplaying, and learn what we can all do to prevent sexual harassment and overall creepy behavior.

name: The "I Can’t Cook Guide" to Medieval Eating
description_book: If you can’t (or don’t) cook, how can you bring medieval-ish food to events for breakfast, lunch, or potlucks? It’s easier than you think!

name: Food Preservation Methods and History
description_book: Learn a bit about the various methods documented to before 1650 for preserving foods. Samples may be available.
description_web: A survey of pre-modern food preservation methods. Samples may be available.

name: Cups, Coifs, & Coins: Accessories for Newcomers
description_book: Do you have a Vessel with a Pestle? A very cunning hat? We'll talk about how to round out your garb with some awesome accessories and necessities!
description_web: Welcome to the SCA! So you have a tunic and you look great! But do you have a Vessel with a Pestle? A very cunning hat? We'll talk about some accessories and necessities that you can add to your garb, kit, or camping gear to make your event easier and more enjoyable.

name: Viking Age Feast Gear: Archaeological Evidence
description_book: A survey of feast gear and cookware options from among the archaeological finds of the Old Norse World.
description_web: A survey of feast gear and cookware options from among the archaeological finds of the Old Norse World. We will look at items from Birka, Dublin, Gotland, Hedeby, Oseberg, York, and other sites. Class is in my camp, where I have examples.

name: Double-Faced Tablet Weaving: Letters and Designs
description_book: Demonstration of how to tablet weave letters and custom designs onto a band. Each student is encouraged to try their hand at it on my loom.
description_web: Demonstration of how to tablet weave letters and custom designs onto a band. Each student is encouraged to try their hand at it on my loom. Should have previous card weaving experience.

name: So You Want to Be a Scribe
description_book: Designed for those who have thought about doing scribal things but have no idea where to start.
description_web: Designed for those who have thought about doing scribal work, but have no idea where to start.

name: Beginner's Footwork for English Country Dance
description_book: Starting off on the correct foot allows the figures to flow more easily in English Country Dance. Brand-new beginners to intermediate level.

name: Very Old Games: *Morris*
description_book: *Morris* games have been played since circa 1400 BC. Learn a little history of the many variations of *Morris*, then stay and try some versions.
description_web: *Morris* games have been played since circa 1400 BC. These are 2-player abstract strategy games that involve placing and then moving game pieces on a board with a goal of getting three in a row. Come learn a little history of the many variations of *Morris*, then stay and try some versions.

name: Belly Dance with Hadia!
description_book: Learn belly dance movements, techniques, muscle isolations and combinations. Classes are for men and women. Drummers are always welcome!
description_web: Learn Middle Eastern belly dance movements, techniques, muscle isolations, and combinations while gaining strength, balance, flexibility, stamina, coordination, body awareness and basic movements. We will organize dance patterns, learn to improvise, and use mini-combos for any form of belly dance. Loose clothing encouraged. Hip scarves, shimmy belts, full skirts, etc., are all optional and very helpful for movement awareness. Class is open to everyone who desires a review of basic belly dance movements and technique.

name: Inkle Weaving Basics
description_book: Using the continuous warping method, you will warp the loom and weave an inkle strip.
description_web: Using the continuous warping method, you will warp the loom and weave an inkle strip. Classroom loaner looms available or bring your own; class limited to 10 looms.

name: Elizabethan Pronunciation
description_book: Early Modern English pronunciation reveals “new” rhymes and puns in literature and songs of the period. Come and hear for yourself!
description_web: In this overview of Early Modern English pronunciation trends, we will hear how rhymes and puns emerge from period literature when originally pronounced, and we’ll touch briefly on Tudor singing practices as relating to treatment of the language. Come and hear how “raising” rhymes with “reason!”

name: A Bag of Medieval Tunes
description_book: Learn hit tunes of the 12th-15th centuries by ear on your recorder, harp, fiddle, or other melody instrument. Recording devices welcome.
description_web: Bring your recorder, harp, fiddle, or other melody instrument and learn hit dance tunes and song melodies of the 12th-15th centuries. Instruction will be by ear, with sheet music provided at the end of class. Recording devices welcome.

name: *Romani*: An Introduction to Gypsy Personas
description_book: Want a Gypsy persona, but don't know how/where to start? Learn about the Rom, their history, common pitfalls, and the fun of this fascinating persona.
description_web: Want a Gypsy persona, but don't know how/where to start? Learn about the Rom, their history, common pitfalls, and the fun of this fascinating persona.

name: Greybeard Tourney
description_book: Rapier tournament for fencers 55 years of age or older. We will run a pooled round robin, number of lists to be determined by the number of fencers.

name: PTSD, Sound-Triggered Anxiety, and the SCA
description_book: Discussion on PTSD, Sound-Triggered Anxiety, some of the ramifications within the SCA, and ways in which some of us are helping the community.
description_web: Discussion on PTSD, Sound-Triggered Anxiety, some of the ramifications within the SCA, and ways in which some of us are helping the community. Discussion will include some of the history and definitions of PTS, PTSD, and STA; the issues people face within the Society when suffering from these ailments; and a discussion of the Canon Advanced Warning System (CAWS). This is **not** a therapy counseling session, nor lecture on treatment options, classifications, or diagnoses. This is solely a non-medical, non-professional discourse provided by the designer of the CAWS program and someone with personal experience with STA/PTS.

location: The Little Dragon's Hoard (Plunder Lane, Merchant area)
name: Metal Cooking Equipment and Tools in Period
description_book: A discussion about the metal (iron) cooking equipment that was available from the Viking period on. Some examples will be available for viewing.

name: Known World Thrown Weapons Tournament
description_book: A knife, axe, spear competition for beginners to experienced throwers.
description_web: A knife, axe, spear competition for beginners to experienced throwers.

name: Beginning Engraving
description_book: Hands-on class. Intro to tools, first cuts, graver control, hammer use.
description_web: Hands-on class. Intro to tools, first cuts, graver control. Student will learn both hand-held and hammer-struck engraving.

name: Where's Lord Waldo?
description_book: A look at the history and trivia of SCA geography.
description_web: A look at the history and trivia of SCA geography.

name: Cooking from Period Sources
description_book: How to start with a recipe that was written in period and end up with a dish that is consistent with that recipe and tastes good.
description_web: How to start with a recipe that was written in period and end up with a dish that is consistent with that recipe and tastes good. Also, a discussion of available sources for recipes.

name: Global Period History for Youth
description_book: [YouthU] A brief survey of history and cultures on continents around the world, during the Middle Ages. Includes how Europeans fit into the world.
