description_web: [YouthU] We learn a lot about European cultures in period, but what was everyone else up to? A brief survey of history and cultures on continents around the world, during the Middle Ages. Includes how Europeans fit into the world scene.

name: The Rule
description_book: The Rule of St. Benedict was both strict and humane, demonstrating an understanding of human weakness. After 1500 years it still influences us today.

name: A Jester for All Seasons
description_book: The Jester archetype invites you to play, be entertained and also find truths in humor.
description_web: The Jester archetype invites you to play, be entertained and also find truths in humor. This class will discuss the kinds of fools and similar entertainers in period. We will conclude with how you can draw on the Fool for performance in the Society.

name: Beaded Flowers 3: Primrose
description_book: Make a primrose in the style of beaded flowers of 16th-century Venice. If you have needle-nosed pliers/wire cutters, please bring them to class.
description_web: Make a primrose in the style of beaded flowers of 16th-century Venice. If you have needle-nosed pliers/wire cutters, please bring them to class. Not recommended for youth. Take the Rose class first; this is a more advanced technique.

name: Are You a Submissive Griselda?
description_book: The aspects of submission and expectations of a wife during the 14th century found in *The Good Wife's Guide (le Menagier de Paris)*.
description_web: Discussion to cover the story of Griselda and Walter found in *The Good Wife's Guide (le Menagier de Paris)* that will address the aspects of submission and expectations of a wife during the 14th century.

name: Manuscript Traditions of Ethiopia
description_book: Explore the artistic traditions of Coptic Ethiopia, home to some of the earliest medieval illuminated manuscripts that exist to this day.
description_web: Ethiopia is a place often overlooked in the SCA, but historically it has always been a rich wellspring of illuminated manuscripts. Explore how manuscript culture is imbued within religious contexts and daily life.

name: Redaction of Pre-1000 Basket Cheese
description_book: An examination of basket cheeses in Europe and possible implications of their spread to adjacent locations.
description_web: Basket cheeses of pre-1000 Europe provided both a method for cheese processing and cheese marking that was unique to the areas where cheese was manufactured. We will review the process of the basket's construction and use in the cheese making process, sample a couple of basket cheese varieties, and discuss implications of its spread to adjacent European locations.

name: Introduction to *Maghribi* and *Andalusi* Clothing
description_book: Survey of clothing in paintings, carvings, & other art sources to create complete outfits for men & woman, plus some examples of extant textiles.
description_web: This survey of clothing from *al-Andalus* and *al-Maghrib* is based on garments depicted in paintings, carvings, and other art sources, since no clothing from before 1601 has survived from *al-Maghrib* and very, very little from *al-Andalus*. I have found some new sources since last year for men's wear. Includes a brief discussion of plausible fabrics, as well as photos of some extant textiles from *al-Andalus*. The goal is to be able to a create complete outfit for males and females.
fee_itemization: For black-&-white as well as color photocopies

name: Persona Development 101
description_book: Resources, prompts, and handouts to help flesh out your persona. (Or build a new one!)
description_web: Explore who you want to be in the SCA! Got a name but not much else? Heard about a cool subculture but not sure how to find out more? Wonder what your persona would have done at an event? By thinking like your your SCA alter ego, you can make informed choices about how past "you" would have dressed, spoken, eaten, and more.
fee_itemization: $2 for multiple page handout (reading, prompts, resources) -or- link to instructor website to print handouts FREE

name: Juggling 101: Beginner
description_book: Learn to juggle three balls in the simplest pattern. Equipment available for use or purchase.
description_web: The most basic 3-ball cascade juggling. Juggling balls will be made available for use by the class and may be bought afterward from the instructor.

name: In Stitches: Blackwork
description_book: This hands-on class introduces students to basic 16th-C. blackwork embroidery with a brief overview of the style.
description_web:
Blackwork is a form of counted-stitch embroidery usually made with simple black silk thread on a white or off-white background. In the 16th century, it was usually seen decorating cuffs and collars and caps of both men and women, adding an interesting decorative "pop". Frequently, patterns of fruit, flowers or grain were used, all created using simple stitches in interesting patterns. 
This hands-on class will start with a very brief overview of 16th-century blackwork embroidery followed by a hands-on tutorial of basic blackwork stitches to create a simple repeating design which may be used to decorate cuffs or collars of shirts or to simply relieve stress and keep hands busy.

name: Introduction to Indigo
description_book: Indigo-dyeing basics, from creating the fermented vat to dipping and curing fabrics.
description_web:
We’ll be covering the basics of indigo dyeing. We will work with examples in cotton, linen, and silk, and will be using the traditional fermentation vat that would have been used in Japan during our time period.

Students are encouraged to bring washed and dried fabric or garments that are less than one yard each made of silk, cotton, linen, hemp, or bamboo to dip in the vat. There will be samples and items provided for those who do not have their own fabric, and students will keep these pieces. Instructions will be given on how to create a fermented indigo vat at home as well as how to keep the vat healthy.

Explanations will be given on how to indigo dye fabrics with resists such as paste resist and shibori, though these types of techniques are beyond the scope of this class.

name: Doth She Say Yes?
description_book: Class focused on social courtesies, especially those of an interpersonal nature. *Adults only: 18+*.

name: Double Rigid Heddle Loom Demo
description_book: Come see and play with a double rigid heddle loom. Will demonstrate how to warp up this type of setup and how to weave on it.
description_web: Come see and play with a double rigid heddle loom. Will demonstrate how to warp up this type of setup and how to weave on it.

name: Sing Like a Pilgrim
description_book: Learn to sing songs that were sung by medieval pilgrims on their long journeys to a variety of holy shrines! Music-reading skills not required.
description_web: Students will learn to sing songs sung by medieval pilgrims on their long and arduous journeys to a variety of holy shrines! Historical background will be provided. Music-reading skills are not required, but are helpful. Learning by rote is perfectly acceptable and period!

name: PA Afternoon Series: Bardic Arts Exhibition
description_book: Come and enjoy an amazing afternoon display featuring a variety of bardic arts and artists from around the Known World!
description_web: Come and enjoy an amazing afternoon display featuring a variety of bardic arts and artists from around the Known World! Feel free to sign-up to tell a story or sing a song, spout Shakespeare. If it fits in the realms of Bardic performance, you are welcome to participate.

name: Shirred Smocking: Hands-On
description_book: Found in the 12th century and still done in modern-day Sardinia, a look at this little-known type of smocking that uses only gathered running stitch.
description_web:
Found in the 12th century and still done today in modern day-Sardinia, we'll look at this little-known type of smocking. Unlike the smocking most of us know, this type uses only running stitch. By skipping stitches, patterns are formed when the fabric is gathered. You can see some examples here: https://drive.google.com/open?id=1Ul9P87O7R3uYkJxUILHDrk1b64VJ0cgM

In this class we'll talk briefly about the existing period examples, and what little information is out there. Then we'll try our hand at making a small sample. Please note: this class will not likely suit children; the lecture portion is taught at an adult level and fine motor skills and attention are needed for the hands-on.

name: History of Drinking in Medieval China
description_book: A discussion of the development of alcoholic beverages in China, and tastings of a few select reconstructions.
description_web: A discussion of the development of alcoholic beverages in China, and tastings of a few select reconstructions. We will focus initially on the sixth-century farm manual *Qimin Yaoshu* and its rice and millet wines, discuss how recipes changed in the Song dynasty, discuss mead in medieval China, and finally touch on a few Yuan dynasty non-alcoholic beverages imported from the Muslim world suitable for a hot summer day. Please note that the alcohols offered are not gluten-free, as they use a wheat-based yeast culture. Must be 21+ to taste.

name: Bellatrix System: Great Weapons
description_book: Bellatrix techniques for great weapons, for use against all weapons and at all ranges, as well as techniques for different physical capabilities.
description_web: Learn the Bellatrix system for the use of great sword and glaive, focusing on the close-in techniques against other great weapons, and against sword and shield. Modify these techniques for different physical capabilities. It will also cover fighting at medium and long range. The class can be taught armored, unarmored, or with helms and gauntlets. Participation in the exercises will vary, depending. At a minimum, students must have gloves and a great sword, long bastard sword, or pole weapon. Some students should bring swords and shields for use in training.

name: Middle Eastern Music Session
description_book: An informal music session: bring your instruments, lyrics and notes, and be ready to play, listen and learn.
description_web: Aliya will facilitate a relaxed hour of playing and listening to Middle Eastern music. Participants are welcome to request or present a song. We’ll play some old favorites, and possibly learn a new tune or two. Bring your instruments, lyrics and note, and feel free to ask questions and join in.

name: East-Mid Youth Combat Tournament
description_book: Tournament sponsored jointly by the East and Midrealm Kingdoms for the Youth Combat Lists.
description_web: Tournament sponsored jointly by the East and Midrealm Kingdoms for the Youth Combat Lists.

name: Rapier Field Battle
description_book: description added soon
description_web:
TENTATIVE:
(Muster 2 pm) 
4 points total (1 point per battle).
4 passes.
Last man standing victory condition, no resurrection.
10 marshals provided by each of the Mid, East, & AEthelmearc.
Full field (600x600).
All holds are general.
No RBGs.

name: Planning a Feast
description_book: How to design a menu, figure out how much to cook, plan logistics, and everything else you need to consider to ensure a successful feast.

name: Wolves in Sheep's Clothing
description_book: A discussion of sexual predators and bullying in the SCA.
description_web: A discussion of sexual predators and bullying in the SCA. Historically, these two concepts existed and were emulated by many people of power onto other people. However, we should as a society strive to behave better than our ancestors did. There will be adult content and themes discussed.

name: Old Norse Poetry: *Fornyrðyslag* and *Hattrs*
description_book: Brief overview of how to write the Old Norse poetic forms called *fornyrðyslag, málaháttr* and *ljóðaháttr* and, if time permits, *kviduháttr*.
description_web: Whether you want to write, judge or just understand Old Norse Poetry, this class is for you. *Fornyrðyslag* and *Hattrs* provides a brief overview of basic requirements to write the Old Norse poetic forms called *fornyrðyslag, málaháttr* and *ljóðaháttr*.  If there is time, I will also discuss *kviduháttr*.
fee_itemization: Optional paper handout showing the basic requirements of *fornyrðyslag, málaháttr,  ljóðaháttr* and *kviduháttr* available for no more than $2.00.  The electronic version of the handout is free.

name: Photographers' Roundtable
description_book: Want to take better SCA photos? Want to talk shop with other photographers? Come hang out for a chat. No topic too big, no camera too small.

name: *Cuirboulli*: Water-Hardened Leather Armor
description_book: How to make armor from vegetable-tanned leather, using hot water.
description_web: How to make armor from vegetable-tanned leather, using hot water.

name: Beginning Fingerloop Braids
description_book: [YouthU] 10-17 Learn to make one fingerloop cord that is good for lacing, cording, hair ties, shoelaces, or friendship bracelets. No limit.
description_web: [YouthU] 10-17 Fingerloop braids are braids woven using loops of string on your fingers. As points, laces or cords, braids have a multitude of uses. In this class everyone will start on one basic five-loop braid.

name: Keep Thee from a Nunnery (or Worse!)
description_book: Learn the traits to cultivate to make yourself the epitome of marriageable Italian womanhood. Spinsters end up in cloisters!
description_web: Learn the traits to cultivate to make yourself the epitome of marriageable Italian womanhood. There is only so much dowry money to go around, and, if you've got sisters, you are likely to end up as Sister Mary on the Shelf. Culled from various sources of advice, learn about the ideal bride and the options if Lord Charming never comes.

name: Chinese Heraldry
description_book: A discussion of some common charges in period Chinese banners and how to incorporate these into registerable SCA heraldry.
description_web: This class will show you some common symbols, colors, and arrangements so that you can shoehorn your Chinese persona into the SCA College of Arms. Full color handouts.

name: Bardic Symposium 1: Introduction and Meet-&-Greet
description_book: The Bardic Symposium is an open gathering for special forums, topics, and discussions for the Bardic Community. Day 1: Meet and Greet, memorization.
description_web:
The Bardic Symposium is an open gathering for special forums, topics, and discussions for the Bardic Community. 
Day 1: Meet your fellow bards. While many of us already know each other, this will give newcomers a chance to match names to faces.

Credit Where It’s Due:
The first of our old favorites. Whether it’s a performance, a lyric sheet in your bardic book, or a blog post; somebody wrote the piece. If that someone was not you, then whoever it is should be mentioned. Inadvertently omitting this has caused an unfortunate backlash on numerous occasion (i.e., there’s a reason the Black Book of Lockley is hard to find these days). Since accreditation is something we want to make sure gets done, what are the best ways of accomplishing it in all the various circumstances a bardic piece may be found?

name: Brewing an Herbed Beer
description_book: A recipe and brewing steps will be shared so that attendees can brew an ale with herbs instead of hops. Age 21+.
description_web: A recipe and brewing steps will be shared so that attendees can brew an ale with herbs instead of hops. If the Growing Gods are kind, the instructor will have sufficient herbs to share; if not, a source to obtain them will be shared. Instructor will have a sample of the brew to share for those "of Age." Age 21+; ID will be required.

name: Food Safety for SCA Cooks
description_book: Preparing an SCA feast is different from preparing a family dinner. Learn about the food safety practices needed to ensure a safe event.
description_web:
Preparing an SCA feast is different from preparing a family dinner. Learn about the food safety practices needed to ensure a safe event.

Students will learn the causes of food-borne illness as well as safe food handling practices related to these:
Preventing Cross Contamination
Controlling Time and Temperature
Good Personal Hygiene
Cleaning and Sanitizing
Planning a Successful Food Event

Whether you are a new event cook, or you and your kitchen staff have been doing this for years, it is important to be up-to-date and knowledgeable about food safety.

name: Learn to Use the East Kingdom A&S Rubric: Part 1
description_book: Attendees will practice using the EK A&S Rubric to assess a project. Designed to train judges, this class also benefits artisans. All are welcome!
description_web: Attendees will practice using the EK A&S Rubric to assess a project. Designed to train judges, this class also benefits artisans. All are welcome! Come to part 1, even if you can not stay for part 2.

name: Speaking Shakespeare
description_book: Students review the basics of iambic pentameter and do readings which illustrate how the Bard varies the verse to give stage directions to the actor.
description_web: After reviewing the basics of iambic pentameter (the form Shakespeare used most often), students will do readings which illustrate how the Bard varies the verse to give "stage directions" to the actor.

name: Turban Variations from *al-Andalus*
description_book: Demonstration of how to wrap several turban variants seen in pictures from *al-Andalus* (Muslim Spain).
description_web: The turban is a characteristic piece of men’s headwear seen throughout the medieval Muslim world. This class will examine pictorial evidence for wrapping variations seen in *al-Andalus*/Moorish Spain and will consist of demonstrations of how they are achieved.

name: Getting Involved at Events & with Your Local Group
description_book: You've been to a few events, but are looking to become more than a spectator. Here are some tips and tricks to getting more involved and staying busy.
description_web: You've been to a few events, but are looking to become more than a spectator. Here are some tips and tricks to getting more involved and staying busy.

name: Improv Theater Skills for SCA Life
description_book: Theater games for learning improvisation. Good for *commedia*, theater, and living in persona.
description_web: Come learn and play theater games focused on the art of improvisation. Skills learned here can be used to improve any kind of performance including the portrayal of your persona in the SCA.

name: Conversational Russian
description_book: Covers the Russian alphabet and basic modern-day Russian conversational phrases, plus words and phrases more related to the SCA.
description_web: Covers the Russian alphabet and basic modern-day Russian conversational phrases, responses and questions. After that, we will go over words and phrases more related to the SCA which can be used to flavor one’s persona. There will be time reserved at the end of the class for questions.

name: Vampires in History
description_book: History of blood (life) vampires and other revenants.
description_web: Let's look at these blood (or life) draining monsters in history.  Where and when were they known, what were they called? Where do they come from? How do you protect yourself from them?

name: Running a Dance Musician Pit
description_book: This lecture and applied performing class will discuss methods for running and conducting pickup musicians' group to support SCA dance events.
description_web: This lecture and applied performing class will discuss methods for running and conducting pickup musicians' group to support SCA dance events. Musicians, bring your acoustic instruments and be ready to do some playing and possibly some conducting. We'll go through methods and key techniques to have a smoothly run dance event, using coordination with the dance teacher and interaction with all musicians. Please bring instrument, music stand, and Pennsic pile copy.

name: *Tarot* the Card Game
description_book: The game of *tarot*, the trick-taking game. We will play it.
description_web: We will go over the rules of *tarot*, the card game, and play it.

name: Making a 16th-Century Dutch German Beaker
description_book: Watch a demonstration of the creation of a late period glass beaker and learn about period furnace-worked glass. Discussion to follow.
description_web: Watch a demonstration of the creation of a late period glass beaker and learn about period furnace-worked glass. Discussion to follow.

name: Advanced Engraving
description_book: Hand-engraving on copper plate. Letters and design work. Students will create a wax seal.
description_web: Hand-engraving on copper plate. Letters and design work. Students will create a wax seal.

name: Learning *Uska Dara*
description_book: Learn the history and musical parts of the Middle Eastern song, *Uska Dara.* Singers, dancers, drummers, instrumentalists all welcome!
description_web: Calling all Middle Eastern performers! Learn about, perform, and dance to the Middle Eastern song, *Uska Dara.* The first part will be history; then we'll move into the lyrics, drum rhythm, melody, and dancing. Handouts, including sheet music, will be available for a fee. You can get the sheet music in advance from http://www.bellydancesheetmusic.com/.

name: Known World Recorder Ensemble
description_book: Recorder players intermediate and above invited to join this ensemble for second Pennsic appearance. Join us in having fun making music together!
description_web: Recorder players of Intermediate and above abilities are invited to join this ensemble for its third Pennsic appearance. Join us in having fun and making music together! We will meet for three rehearsals: Monday - Wednesday. We'll prepare for a brief concert, 6 pm, Thursday, 8/9, in the PA Tent. Age limit: 12 and up. A limited number of soprano and alto recorders are available for loan; contact instructors by July 9 to reserve one. If you play more than one instrument, bring them all, and be prepared to play something other than soprano. Please bring a music stand if you have one, or you may need to share. Sheet music (easy to advanced) will be provided. $3 for music packet, or free PDFs available prior to Pennsic found on the Facebook group Known World Recorder Ensemble. Email the instructors: THL Jolicia atte Northclyfe <Washington.julie@gmail.com> and Lady Siri Toivosdotter <JoniSyngs@aol.com>

name: *Kumihimo* Basics
description_book: *Kumihimo*: cord braiding on a disk.
description_web: *Kumihimo*: cord braiding on a disk. Make a basic round cord. Disk and string provided; take your work home with you.

name: PPF: Developing Your Japanese Persona
description_book: Designed to take an individual through the process of building and fully developing any Japanese persona.
description_web: Designed to take an individual through the process of building and fully developing any Japanese persona. Focuses on thinking through back story to add realism to one's SCA identity. Good for newcomers and old hands alike or for those interested in the Perfectly Period Feast.

name: An Introduction to Indian Rhythms I
description_book: Learn about Indian rhythm instruments, their history, how they are played, how to play with them. Bring your instrument and learn some new rhythms.
description_web: Learn about Indian rhythm instruments, their history, how they are played and how to play with them. Bring your instrument and learn some new rhythms.

name: Heraldry for Scribes
description_book: Basic heraldry in order to create proper images on scrolls.
description_web: Have you ever read the blazon for a person's arms and had **no** idea how to draw it or what it meant? Come join us as we cover the basics of how to read blazon and how to turn the words into pictures!

name: Introduction to *Pysanky*
description_book: Learn about the rich history of Ukrainian embellished eggs, and try your hand at this "Queen of Folk Arts". Lecture, discussion, and make-and-take.
description_web: *Pysanky* are highly embellished eggs used for centuries in Easter and Vernal Equinox celebrations in many Slavic nations, including modern Ukraine, Poland, and Russia. Come learn about the history, symbolism, and significance of this "Queen of Folk Arts," and make your own *pysanka* to take with you. All materials and tools will be provided. The dyes are permanent, so wear old garb!
fee_itemization: for the tools and materials to make the pysanky

name: Aim Higher! No, Lower... Now to the Left...
description_book: This class will cover the theory and technique of aiming in archery. Please note, this class is for intermediate to advanced archers.
description_web: This class will cover the advanced topic of aiming in archery. And yes, aiming **is** an advanced topic! For intermediate to advanced archers. We'll go over both the theory of aiming and some techniques you can take with you to the range. Please come prepared with questions.

name: Myths and Legends of The SCA
description_book: We've all heard stories about the SCA of long, long ago. Come and hear some new ones, or share your own.
description_web: We've all heard stories about the SCA of long, long ago. Come and hear some new ones, or share your own. Stories may include "The SCA vs. The Motorcycle Gang", "Why You Should Never Try to Mug a Knight", "The Russian Spies Learn about The SCA", and others. After last year's sessions I've added several new myths to the class.

name: Paint Like Michelangelo (Youth U)
description_book: Michelangelo painted the Sistine Chapel lying on his back. Can you do it? Bring a towel! (Youth U)
description_web:
Participants will engage in a brief lesson during which they will view famous Renaissance works to become familiar with painting techniques like linear perspective, *contrapposto*, pyramidal construction, and *chiaroscuro*. Then the fun begins.

Participants should bring a sheet or towel to lie on as they lie on their backs and paint their own masterpieces on giant paper secured to the bottom of the tables.  Wear old garb; this could get messy.

instructor: Master Dani of the Seven Wells
name: The Byzantine Army
description_book: Tactics and organization of the Byzantine army, with an emphasis on the tenth century. The Byzantine army was one of the best armies of its time.
description_web: Tactics and organization of the Byzantine army, with an emphasis on the tenth century. The Byzantine army was one of the best armies of its time.

name: The History of Kissing
description_book: Juliet stated "palm to palm is holy palmers' kiss", but what do we know about the kiss in period? Our lips aren't sealed; come learn the history.
description_web: Juliet stated "palm to palm is holy palmers' kiss", but what do we know about the kiss in period? Our lips aren't sealed; come learn the history of the kiss.

name: Medieval-Style Mustards
description_book: Learn to make your own mustard using period ingredients and methods.
description_web: Mustard was the main condiment of the Middle Ages. Using ingredients documented for period sauces, students will blend their own mustard sauces, as well as learning about medieval/Renaissance spices and ingredients.

name: Basic Knotwork
description_book: How to create basic knotwork.
description_web: How to create basic knotwork.

name: Learn to Use the East Kingdom A&S Rubric: Part 2
description_book: Attendees will practice using the EK A&S Rubric to assess a project. Designed to train judges, this class also benefits artisans. All are welcome!
description_web: Attendees will practice using the EK A&S Rubric to assess a project. Designed to train judges, this class also benefits artisans. All are welcome! Please feel free to come to Part 2 of this class, even if you can not attend Part 1.

name: Whose Line Doth It Be? - Open Auditions
description_book: Think you're a great improviser? Here's your chance to audition for the improvisational show! Performance slots are limited, so sharpen your wit!
description_web: Think you are a great improviser? Now here's your chance to audition for the improvisational show, "Whose Line Doth It Be?", taking place at 7:00 pm in the Amphitheater. Performance slots are limited, so sharpen your wit!

name: A Game of "Hide the Distaff": The Distaff Gospels
description_book: In the 1460s, a clerk sat down for six nights with local women during their nightly spinning circle and recorded their wisdom. 18+ for ribaldry!
description_web: In 1460-something France, during the dark period between Christmas and Candlemas, a clerk sat down for six nights with local women during their nightly spinning circle and recorded their wisdom. The intent of the author cannot be said to be wholly feminist, or even kind of feminist, but the collection of folk wisdom contained in this text offers at least a muddled image of common women's discourse and priorities. It is also hysterically funny, and more than a little ribald. Come learn some history, and laugh until you cry, as long as you are over 18.

location: Denys The Decadent (Denys the Decadent's Camp  EO8)
name: 12-Step Meetings
description_book: Daily meetings for those in any 12-step program such as AA, NA, OA, SA, Alanon, etc.
description_web: We welcome all in AA, NA, OA, SA, Alanon, etc., who are in any 12-step program to the 4:00 pm daily meeting at EO8 Denys The Decadent's Camp.

name: *Chorulus Pennsicus*
description_book: *Chorulus Pennsicus* is a select choir, audition required. Previous choral singing is expected.
description_web: *Chorulus Pennsicus* is a select choir, entrance by audition. Previous choral singing experience is expected. The audition includes a prepared vocal selection and a sight-reading session. CP performs with the Known World Choir and Friends on Thursday evening of War Week. See the class book/web site for next year’s audition details.

name: Montpellier Motets
description_book: Ever sung *Alle Psallite*? Look at and sight-read more music from that 13th-C. manuscript; 2 to 4 part voice/instrument. Stay as long as you can.
description_web: Have you ever sung *Alle Psallite*? Did you wish you could do more music like that? The manuscript that song is from has over 300 more songs. We will sing (or play) several from this 13th-14th-century manuscript. This music is especially good for singing groups of only one sex, as the ranges are not as wide as later 16th-century music. Handout includes lots of music and sources. We'll sight-read for 2 hours, but come or stay as long as you can.

name: Advanced Thrown Weapons
description_book: This class focuses on advanced throwing technique for more experienced throwers.
description_web: This class focuses on advanced throwing technique for more experienced throwers.

name: An Introduction to Indian Rhythms II
description_book: Learn about Indian rhythm instruments, their history, how they are played, how to play with them. Bring your instrument and learn some new rhythms.
description_web: Learn about Indian rhythm instruments, their history, how they are played and how to play with them. Bring your instrument and learn some new rhythms.

name: Scroll Personalization Without Modernization
description_book: Learn techniques to create scrolls that will have a personalized touch without losing the period aspects of original manuscript pages.
description_web: Do you want to make a scroll special for the recipient but don't want to do something too modern? In this class students will learn techniques to create scrolls that will have a personalized touch without losing the period aspects. We will touch on how to come up with ideas for personalization and decide what elements to add/subtract to and from period manuscript illuminations as well as how to inhabit an illumination with images of the recipients.

name: Yoga for Relaxation and Refreshment
description_book: A gentle yoga practice offered before the dinner hour. Repeating dates in Atlantian Royal; bring your mat and dress to flex.
description_web: A gentle yoga practice offered for those who aren't up early and prefer a before-dinner option. Repeating dates under the big tent in Atlantian Royal encampment, facilitated by a combination of teachers. Bring your yoga mat and wear comfortable clothing that allows flexibility. M,W,F Peace week, M, F War Week.

name: Teaching Italian Fencing and Western Martial Arts
description_book: An exploration of martial pedagogical concepts; we'll cover the varied learning styles and ideas for teaching that can connect with them.
description_web:
An exploration of martial pedagogical concepts, this class is designed for intermediate to advanced fencers who are responsible for teaching fencing at local practices. Concepts can be applied in class settings as well as one-on-one coaching. 
Discussion will cover the varied learning styles and ideas for teaching that can connect with them. A sample class lesson and drill will be demonstrated that includes many learning styles. Italian rapier in the Venetian style will be the content used, but the pedagogical concepts can be applied to other martial disciplines. 

Equipment needed: single rapier, gloves, mask, and gorget. Students are encouraged to bring writing utensils if they wish to take notes. An outline of the class content will be provided.

name: *Midrash* and *Aggadita*: A Bible Story Supplement
description_book: *Midrash*: Jewish stories about Biblical characters. *Aggadita* deals with Talmudic sages. Both make excellent sources for period Jewish stories.
description_web: Odds are good, if you have ever listened to a traditional Jewish story, you were getting a story from the *midrash* or the *aggadita*. During the time of the Talmud, two sources of stories were collected. *Midrash* focuses primarily on Biblical characters and events, whereas *aggadita* focuses primarily on Talmudic sages. The class will discuss the origins of these two sets of source material, their religious significance, and their use as source material for SCA story tellers.

name: Female Fighter Roundtable
description_book: A meet-up for all female fighters, their significant others and their trainers to get together and talk about training, mind-set, combat, armor, etc.
description_web: The female fighter was initially not allowed in our Society and, as it has become more common, both in participation and interest, we have set up a meeting for female fighters of all persuasions (heavy, rapier, combat archery/siege). This is not exclusionary however. Females interested in fighting, their spouses/significant others, and those interested in teaching the female fighter are welcome to attend. While there is no rigid format for this meeting, we hope that we will have constructive discussions about training, mind-set, philosophy, combat, etc., so that we can all walk away with something to take back home and apply in our area. No cap on attendance. All are welcome.

name: Early Period North Africa Meetup
description_book: Are you a Carthaginian, Numidian, Etruscan, Western Greek, Celt-Iberian, Roman, Vandal, or Byzantine (pre-700 AD)? Want to learn more?
description_web:
Are you a Carthaginian, Numidian, Etruscan, Western Greek, Celt-Iberian, Roman, Vandal, or Byzantine? Want to learn more and share research and resources? Focus is pre-700 AD, North Africa and the Western Mediterranean.

There will be a few reference books and bibliographies on hand, predominantly on Carthage, the Punic language, and Roman Africa. Please feel free to bring your own research and projects to share!

name: Woodworking Hand Tool Petting Zoo
description_book: Ever wonder how they managed to build amazing things before power tools? Come for some hands-on experience with common sharp hand tools.
description_web: Ever wonder how they managed to build amazing things before power tools? (Hint: the secret is sharpening!) Come for some hands-on experience with common sharp hand tools. Children who comprehend "sharp" welcome with a responsible adult. Feel free to come and go. If you have a hand tool (plane, spokeshave, etc.) that you are having trouble with, bring it.

name: Low, Slow and Flirtatious for Three: *Pelligrina*
description_book: Highly seductive, this is an intermediate *bassadanza* for three. Dancers should be familiar with *doppii, sempii, saltarelli*, and *riprese*.
description_web: Highly seductive, this is an intermediate *bassadanza* for three. Dancers should be familiar with *doppii, sempii, saltarelli*, and *riprese*.

name: Archery Champions' Practice
description_book: Everyone who wishes to try out for the Archery Champions teams is welcome and encouraged to attend. Yes, **you** are good enough to try out!

name: Siege Engine Inspection
description_book: All siege engines intended for use in official Pennsic 47 martial activities **must** be inspected during one of the official inspection times.
description_web: **Please note: location change!** Siege engine inspections will take place on the battlefield per usual. However, siege **projectile** inspections will take place at the Siege Tent at the west end of the row of marshal tents. All siege engines intended for use in official martial activities at Pennsic 47 must be inspected during one of the official inspection times. Siege projectiles are welcome during the official inspection times, with re-inspection following any battle that includes siege. All projectiles must have the day's inspection paint.

instructor: Viscountess Kamiilah al Sudanii um Zoom
name: Middle Eastern Line Dances
description_book: Come and learn Middle Eastern line dances! We will cover various dances as time allows, focusing on Armenian and Balkan dances. Live music!
description_web: Come and learn Middle Eastern line dances! We will cover various dances as time allows, focusing on Armenian and Balkan dances. Live music!

name: Seventh Annual Depressing Song Competition
description_book: We rise yet again to challenge those with songs of sorrow, tales of torment, and wails of woe. Prizes will be awarded. Sign up at Moongate Designs.
description_web: We rise yet again from the Pits of Despair to summon those with songs of sorrow, tales of torment, and other wails of woe in an attempt to bring us to tears. Please keep performances to 5 minutes or less, and the topic pre-1600 CE and/or SCA related. Filk is fine. Prizes will be awarded. Sign up at Moongate Designs. *Some material may be inappropriate for children under 12.*

name: Stick Weaving
description_book: Stick weaving is a simple, weft-based weaving method.
description_web: Stick weaving is a simple, weft-based weaving method. Great for making belts and straps. Upgradable to make everything from shawls to rugs. Sticks and string provided; take your work home with you.

name: Atlantian Unbelted 10-Man Melée
description_book: Traditional 10-man melée for unbelts. Format will be round robin.
description_web: Traditional 10-man melée for unbelts. Format will be round robin.

name: Intro to Celtic Knotwork: 5-Dot Technique
description_book: This is an intro class to get you started down the rabbit hole to creating beautiful Celtic knotwork for any use you can imagine.
description_web: This is an intro class to get you started down the rabbit hole to creating beautiful Celtic knotwork for any use you can imagine. If you have ever wanted to create your own knotwork design for illumination, embroidery, leatherwork, wood carving, bone carving, or just because it is fun, this is the class for you.

name: Playtime with Period Pigments
description_book: This is an hour to sit and play with period pigments. I will have my extensive palette with materials, and will field questions as you play.
description_web: This is an hour to sit and play with period pigments. I will have my extensive palette, brushes, *pergamenata* and Bristol board, plus some pre-printed designs on card stock for those who wish to see what it is all about, and try using the “real thing.” I will be glad to field questions as we paint. Sample palettes to take home $15 and $20 each, **limited quantities**, optional.

name: Make Your Own Journal: Beginning Bookbinding
description_book: [TeenU] Learn the basics of bookbinding. Students will come away from the class with either a finished journal or materials to finish it.
description_web: [TeenU] Learn the basics of bookbinding using materials easily found. Students will come away from the class with either a finished journal or all the materials to finish the journal started in class.

name: A Funny Thing Happened on the Way to the Forum
description_book: Clues to Roman period musical and theatrical performances from archaeological discoveries.
description_web: Clues to Roman period musical and theater performances based on archaeological discoveries in Egypt (Karanis) and various sites in Italy. Class taught by two professional archaeologists with 35+ years of fieldwork and research at both Roman and medieval archaeological sites.

name: *Atlatl* Battle
description_book: *Atlatl* battle on the *Atlatl* range at the back of Thrown Weapons.

name: *Chorale du Lac* (Bog Choir)
description_book: Choir class for all levels of singers, no exp. necessary, all voices welcome. Simple period partsongs, rounds, catches.
description_web:
We will warm up, discuss and practice new vocal, music theory, and choral skills each day, and then sing a selection of rounds, catches, and simple part songs from period sources. Each day will be a different class. This is a good choir class for beginning singers who want to sing together in a group for fun, and for experienced singers to take a refresher in choral singing and work on technique and tuning. No experiences necessary, all voices welcome. Instead of rehearsing for a performance, we will practice for learning's sake and go caroling in the Bog at the end of the series. 
Visit https://www.facebook.com/groups/1470354713287848/, the "Bog University" FaceBook group for more info.

name: *Amoroso*: A Tale of Two Dances
description_book: We'll teach new reconstructions of the two original versions of this flirty dance. Come get a fresh, more interesting perspective!
description_web: We'll teach new reconstructions of the two original versions of this flirty dance. Come get a fresh, more interesting perspective!

name: Fun, Flirty Beginner Italian Dances
description_book: Do you like dancing? Do you like flirting? Try these fun Italian dances that combine the two activities: *Rosetiboli Gioioso, Gelosia*, and *Anello*.

name: Impact of Sex and Gender on Martial Instruction
description_book: Learn how the social and physical differences (and similarities) between men and women affect their learning styles for SCA combat.
description_web: Learn how the social and physical differences (and similarities) between men and women affect their learning styles for SCA combat. Information about the social and mental impacts of gender roles and the physiological differences between the sexes will be discussed in the context of teaching SCA combat. This class is geared towards instructors of rapier, rattan, and archery, but fighters of all levels are welcome to attend. Examples will mostly be pulled from the rapier and rattan communities.

name: Medieval Glass Painting with Vitreous Enamel
description_book: Learn the history and techniques of the medieval glass painters' guild and try your hand at making a small piece. Work fired on-site.
description_web: Learn the history and techniques of the medieval stained glass painters' guild and try your hand at making a small piece. Students will use vitreous enamels and watch their work being fired in a kiln.

name: The Debatable Choir
description_book: The Debatable Choir performs perform songs of love and laughter by such luminaries as Palestrina, Gastoldi, Nannino, Morley, and Josquin.
description_web: The award-winning Debatable Choir returns, bigger and better than ever, to perform songs of love and laughter by such luminaries as Palestrina, Gastoldi, Nannino, Morley, and Josquin.

name: Strictly for the Fun of It Madrigal Sing!
description_book: A get-together for experienced choral singers to read down madrigals and other choral music from between the 14th and 17th century.

name: Pennsic *au Naturel*... Ecosystems in Period
description_book: Cooper's Lake's ecosystems have strong connections to the scientific/natural history & folklore of SCA period. A walk to explore some examples.
description_web: No, not that definition. Cooper's Lake is rich in ecosystems that reflect the folklore, beliefs and science of our period. This is a walking tour that explores some of these examples. Along the way, we'll also explore how using a natural system as context can enhance our research of almost any topic. Includes random thoughts regarding birding by eyes and ears, what Hildegarde Von Bingen thought foxes were good for, and why Shakespeare's plays read like Peterson Field Guides. Also, perhaps much discussion on why Elizabethans were afraid of the woods after dark. Please wear clothes, a good head covering and sensible shoes. Bring water, bug repellent and sunscreen.

name: Open Scribal Time
description_book: Take advantage of our clean, well-lit space to work on existing projects or to try your hand at calligraphy and/or illumination.

name: Stupid Songs with Uncle Efenwealt
description_book: It's stupid songs, duh.
description_web: Gonna sing some stupid songs. They will be stupid. After hearing them you are feel much more stupiderer yourself.

name: Birka *Posaments*
description_book: Knotted metal wire trims were found in graves in Birka. Come learn more about the so-called *posaments* and some of the currently available resources.
description_web: Wonderful knotted precious metal wire trims were found in Birka, a 8th-10th-century market town in modern day Sweden. Come learn more about the so-called *posaments* and some of the currently available resources.

name: Bedtime Stories for Children
description_book: Nightly telling of stories for children.
description_web: 7 pm nightly: Stories and fables for children. All are welcome to attend; must have adult escort.

name: Whose Line Doth It Be? Performance in Amphitheater
description_book: The improv comedy show where anything can happen! Audience members should bring seating. Would-be contestants selected from auditions at 4 pm.
description_web: Welcome to "Whose Line Doth It Be?", the improv comedy competition where anything can happen. Audience members should bring seating. Would-be contestants must attend the auditions at 4 pm. *Some material may be inappropriate for children under 12*.

name: *Seishin-ryū Mushin-an Chaseki*: The Taste of Tea
description_book: Enjoy the taste of tea under the night sky. Please wear Japanese or loose-fitting clothes with white socks or tabi, and bring a fan if you have one.
description_web: Enjoy the taste of tea under the night sky. Please wear Japanese or loose-fitting clothing with white socks or tabi, and bring a fan if you have one. Please do not wear any jewelry or weapons in the tea room. This is a participatory recreation of a sixteenth century *wabi*-style tea gathering.
fee_itemization: Cost of tea and sweets - 10 per sitting.

name: Tinsmithing
description_book: A basic but complete course in the fundamentals of tinsmithing. Students will make a glass-globed hurricane lamp with hand tools.
description_web: A basic but complete course in the fundamentals of tinsmithing. Students will make a glass-globed hurricane lamp with hand tools.

name: Evening with Bill W
description_book: Open AA meeting. All are welcome come join us around a fire for open discussion. All addictions welcome.
description_web: Open AA meeting. All are welcome come join us around a fire for open discussion. All addictions welcome.

name: Lanea Verch Kerrigan
description_book: Lanea will perform her original translations, original pieces, and early period favorites. **Adult content.**
description_web: Lanea will perform her original translations, original pieces, and early period favorites. **Show contains adult-themed content.**

name: Hunter's Home Youth Polearm Tourney
description_book: Youth Polearm Tourney to be held at the Youth Combat List. It will be run with bear pit-style fighting.
description_web: The Shire of Hunter's Home will be hosting its 5th Annual Youth Polearm Tourney. It will be conducted as a bear pit-style tourney with a break. The winner will be determined by the youth fighter with the most points. Points are determined by receiving two points for a win and one point for a loss.

name: Family Stories in the Bog
description_book: Stories and fables for children. All are welcome to attend; youth must have adult escort.
description_web: Stories and fables for children. All are welcome to attend; youth must have adult escort.

name: Not Your Typical Atlantian Thugs
description_book: Atlantia comes to the stage bringing some of her most well-known and talented bards to entertain you with stories and songs.
description_web: Atlantia comes to the stage bringing some of her most well-known and talented bards to entertain you with stories and songs.

location: Speckulian (W10 - Roman Road - next to the big Rome camp)
name: *Tantric* Energy (*Kamasutra*) Control & Exchanges
description_book: Learn to experience, invoke, control, and share your *tantric* energies. Bringing a partner you have affinity with is recommended but not required
description_web: Learn to experience, invoke, control, store, and share your *tantric kamasutra* energies. Bringing a partner you have affinity with is recommended but not required. Students will learn breathing, body scan, and control exercises. Basic meditation practice/class strongly recommended. It is best to come on an empty stomach, 4 hours from a large meal, 1.5 hours from a snack, such as a piece of fruit.

name: Choral Ball
description_book: Singers and instrumentalists welcome! Dance to choral music! Sheet music provided or available online.
description_web: Dance to the music of choristers! Sheet music provided for singers and instrumentalists, also available on the SCA Choral Ensemble Facebook group.

name: *i Genesii*
description_book: *i Genesii's Commedia dell'Arte* performance.
description_web: Love! Money! greed! Sex! Murderation! Overwhelming beauty! Underwhelming intelligence! All in one magnificent *Commedia dell'Arte* show, as only *i Genesii* can do! Join us for an evening of wondrous wackiness, fabulous funniness, and tenuous tastefulness! *Show Contains Adult-Themed Content.*

name: Bellatrix: Individual Session
description_book: Individuals or small groups with Duke Paul, covering any martial topic. **Contact Duke Paul** at paul@bellatrix.org **to schedule** ACTUAL date/time.
description_web:
**TIME/DATE NOT FIRM.** One to two hours with Duke Paul for individuals or small groups, covering any martial topic. 
**Contact Duke Paul** at paul@bellatrix.org to **schedule actual date/time**.  The dates/times in this listing are placeholders.

name: Yoga For Dancers, Fighters or Pretty Much Anyone
description_book: Yoga to help us through the rigors of War, regardless of our activities. Please bring a mat/towel and dress for modesty. Kids must bring guardian.
description_web: Yoga to help us through the rigors of War, regardless of our activities. Please bring a mat or towel and dress for modesty. Children may attend with parent/guardian present.

name: Glass Cutting: Any Level
description_book: Want to learn how to cut glass? Know how to cut glass and wish to take your skills to the next level? Take this class! And wear closed-toed shoes.
description_web: Want to learn how to cut glass? Know how to cut glass and wish to take your skills to the next level? Make time for this class! And wear closed-toed shoes, please. This is a rolling-style class, meaning it **will not** take every person 1.5 hours, but, as I have limited cutters and tools, each person will get about 10 minutes of one-on-one time to learn how to cut glass.
fee_itemization: Cost offsets glass used to practice on.

name: Coffee with Friends of Bill and Dr Bob
description_book: Morning recovery meetings in agnostic format.
description_web: Morning recovery meetings in agnostic format.

name: Rehearsal (Closed): Known World Players (KWP)
description_book: Space in use.
description_web: Space in use.

name: *Étude* 3 for Single Rapier Obliques and Cuts
description_book: For all levels and teachers. Drills focus on form, balance, movement and coordination. *Études* for drill; elements from drill used to work in groups.
description_web: For beginner and intermediate fencers and those who teach them. These drills will focus on form, balance, movement and coordination. *Étude* 3 focuses on oblique movements for offense and defense as well as a variety of cuts. Emphasis will be on learning the *étude* for home drill, as well as taking elements out of the drill for more focused work in groups. Each of the 5 sessions will take a different element out of the drill for daily focus and is self-contained. Attendance every day is not required, but is  beneficial to long term retention. Equipment needed: rapier, gloves, mask, gorget. Full fencing armor is not required as we will do slow drills, not full sparring.

location: Thunder Bird Atlatl  (Thunder Bird Atlatl Booth #80?)
name: How to Make an *Atlatl* Dart
description_book: How to make an *atlatl* dart from start to cast. Limit of four students participating in each class.
fee_itemization: Kits: Basic Caster and 3 dart available from Thunderbird Atlatl for $40 or Caster $25 and/or $8 per Dart 5' or 6'.

name: Youth Combat Morning Session
description_book: Lists open.
description_web: Youth Fighting lists open.

instructor: Lady Angharad verch Glyndwr O Llang
name: Basic Jewelry-Making, or, How to Float a Pearl
description_book: Basics on design/recreation of jewelry including closures, spacing, double/triple strands, scalloping, extra adornments, fixing broken items.
description_web: Basics on design or recreation of jewelry including closures, spacing, double/triple strands, achieving scalloping, adding extra adornments, fixing a broken item, making a floating bead necklace, dropping a knot where you want it.
fee_itemization: Kit with wire, string, beads, trinkets, closures

name: Bling Out Your Veils
description_book: Basic veil beading. You will leave class with a working knowledge of how to do simple veil beading. All supplies and veil will be supplied.
description_web: Basic veil beading. You will leave class with a working knowledge of how to do simple veil beading. Ten kits available. Other students may watch the class; there will be extra handouts. If you would like to attend, you can bring your own veil and beads, and take the class.
fee_itemization:
fabric for veil
beads
beading needle
thread

instructor: Lady Zianna Beguy Urdina d Zabaleta
name: Introduction to Female Basque Headdress
description_book: Discussion of shape, material used and construction of Basque female headdress based on the *Trachtebbuch* by Christopher Weiditz.
description_web: Discussion of shape, material used and construction of Basque female headdress based on the *Trachtebbuch* by Christopher Weiditz.

name: From Seeing to Sewing: Intro to Patternmaking
description_book: Learn to make your own sewing patterns. General tips, tricks, and process - useful for any clothing item or period!
description_web: Have you ever looked at a period painting and thought "Wow, that looks great!" only to have your heart immediately sink as you realize that you've got no idea where to start actually making the thing in the painting? This class will (hopefully) help with that by starting you down the wonderful rabbit-hole that is making your own patterns.

name: St. Birgitta's Cap Make-and-Take
description_book: Cover that head! A quick make-and-take for this great accessory; we'll help you measure your noggin, piece the cap together and sew it up.
description_web: The St. Birgitta's cap is a well-known and much loved accessory, so let's make some up! We'll help you measure your head, piece and gather the cap, sew it and show you how to wear it! Supplies will be very simple so that you can leave the class with the knowledge to make many more later. Good class for teens or mature kids; pins and scissors will be used.
fee_itemization: For fabric, thread and bias tape.

name: Getting Down to Byz-ness: Byzantine Persona
description_book: There's a lot more to Byzantine culture than clavii stripes, pearls, and Varangian Guards. Inquire within.
description_web: Interested in building a Byzantine persona but don't know where to start? Let Anna fill your head with bad ideas for an hour, and see what you can come up with. Discussing Byzantine as a culture, rather than a time period, is the key focus of this class. There will be history, garb, names, titles, and yes, even Varangians.

name: PPF: *Eboshi* Hats and *Tabi* Shoes
description_book: If you wish to dress fully noble for the Japanese Perfectly Period Feast, you may wish to cover your head with an *eboshi* and your feet with *tabi*.
description_web: If you wish to dress head to toe as a nobleman of medieval Japan for the Japanese Perfectly Period Feast, you may wish to cover your head with an *eboshi* and your feet with *tabi*. Multiple patterns and methods of creating each will be discussed.

name: Building a Shaving Horse
description_book: See various examples and construction techniques that will enable you to make a solid, long-lasting shaving bench.
description_web: If you are trying to make a chair, bow or barrel, a shaving horse is an essential tool. I have found over the years that horses can vary from being great to bordering on the dangerous. This class will show various examples and construction techniques that will enable you to make a solid, long-lasting bench. This class is also helpful for people who just want to build a simple camp bench.

name: Egyptian *Faience*
description_book: Hands-on exploration of the precursor to modern glass; no prior experience required!
description_web:
Come learn about the precursor to modern glass, *faience*! We'll cover a brief history of *faience* followed by hands-on playing with the material. 
This class requires no prior experience in glass-working.
Please wear comfortable clothing that you do not mind getting dirty. 
Class costs include use of all required tools, equipment and safety gear as well as all consumables. Kits will make a large quantity of beads and pendant shapes. Kits can be shared between two people, but usually people end up wanting to play with a full kit themselves.
fee_itemization: Kits will make a large quantity of beads and pendant shapes. Kits can be shared between two people, but usually people end up wanting to play with a full kit themselves.

name: Decorative and Functional Edges and Seams
description_book: Learn to create decorative edges and seams using needle lace and fingerloop braids; based on the Lengberg finds.
description_web: Learn to use a 15th-century technique for making decorative edges and seams using needle lace and fingerloop braids based on the Lengberg finds.  Students will learn a basic needle lace stitch and create a common 5-loop fingerloop braid, and will learn and practice creating decorative edges and/or seams that can be used on headwear and undergarments.
fee_itemization:
Kits include a needle, linen thread, beeswax, linen fabric swatches, safety pin.
Handouts include instructions and extant garment images.

name: Mending the Air
description_book: A discussion of how scent is used to "mend" qualities of "bad air", how "bad air" brings on the plague and melancholy.
description_web: A discussion of how scent is used to "mend" qualities of "bad air", how "bad air" can cause plague and melancholy. This is the original aromatherapy. Some scents may be sampled.

name: Lucet: Beyond Square Cord
description_book: You can make good square cord; what's next? Flat and multi-strand cords. Bring your lucet. (We can slip a cord off and put it back on after class.)
description_web: You’re comfortable making square cord; what's next? We'll work on flat and multi-strand cord variations. Please bring your lucet. We'll also demonstrate how to slip a cord off and put it back on after class.
fee_itemization: (4) colors of floss on bobbins, and handout.

name: Glove Affair: Making Gloves
description_book: Gloves are not just an accessory. Come and find out what I have learned about gloves in the 30 years I have been making them.
description_web: We delve into every aspect about the period article, whether it be leather, wool, linen or silk. I will share my construction techniques and a pattern I created from a study that has extended over 30 years. We will review the timeline of gloves. I will have many examples on hand to examine. A portion of the class will be dedicated to hands-on, and sewing supplies will be available to experience sewing leather. Materials, stitches, techniques and decoration will all be discussed. Bring your questions.
fee_itemization: Sewing kit that includes leather needle, sharp needle, silk thread, linen thread and 5" X 5" piece of leather to sew.

name: No Hassle Tassles
description_book: A talk on the known items which were embellished by tassels. Make a tassel or more. Children welcome.
description_web: A talk on the known items which were embellished by tassels. Make a tassel or more. Children welcome. Will be using wool, cotton and, if time available, silk. Scissors, yarn needles and other tools will be available on loan.

name: *Commedia dell'Arte* for Youth
description_book: Hands-on class giving the description and history of *Commedia* before having the youth create and eventually perform their own skit. Ages 13-17.
description_web: Young adults will learn the art of *commedia dell'arte* while practicing and creating skits that will be performed at the end of the week. Ages 13-17.

name: Archery Practice
description_book: Warm up, practice shoot, and have fun on the Archery Range.

name: Dancing for Kids by a Kid
description_book: Come learn a mix of Benjamin's favorite dances. (Any youth in attendance require a responsible adult present.)
description_web: Come learn some of Benjamin's favorite dances. Those he will teach are expected to include *Ly Bens, Petite Vriens*, and *Rufty Tufty, Horses Bransle*.

name: Period Card Games: *Losing Loadem*
description_book: Do you like to play cards? Come learn to play this late-period, trick-avoidance card game.
description_web: Looking for something to pass the time at events? Do you like to play cards? Come learn to play this late-period card game based on a reconstruction from Francis Willughby’s *A Volume of Plaies* (~1665).

name: Intro to Woodworking, Part A
description_book: Introduction to woodworking with only hand tools. Includes modern SOPs and safe practices for the purposes of building medieval-style furniture.
description_web: Two half-days Tuesday and Wednesday; an overview of hand woodwork, with an opportunity to try things out. We will start on Tuesday morning with a chunk of a log and by noon we should have some boards or other furniture parts using wedges, axes, froes, drawknives, spokeshaves and wood planes. On Wednesday we will look at making joints, boring, and maybe a bit of carving. Covers saws, chisels, and planes. Extensive instructions on the selection, use and maintenance of all these tools will be covered. The class will be taught both first week and again second week. Students who cannot attend the whole class are encouraged to drop in or out at their convenience.

name: Waste-Free Garment Cutting
description_book: Twice the clothes from half the fabric...or at least, better clothes from less fabric. Come prepared to take notes.
description_web: Hand-spun, hand-woven, hand-finished...they never wasted a single thread. You don't have to! An overview of the thriftiest cutting and sewing tricks used in the SCA's target centuries. We cover only pre-17th century Western European clothing.

name: What Are the Known World Choir's Top Ten?
description_book: Singers and directors of singers: this is the list for you! Come sing through the KWC's curated list of songs many groups will enjoy performing!
fee_itemization: Song list handout is free.  Photocopies of all songs will be on hand - $3 donation if you wish to keep the music, please

name: Inkle Weaving Basics
description_book: Using the continuous warping method, you will warp the loom and weave an inkle strip.
description_web: Using the continuous warping method, you will warp the loom and weave an inkle strip. Classroom loaner looms available or bring your own; class limited to 10 looms.

name: Music for Recitation
description_book: Easy ways to add accompaniment to recited poems and stories. Bring a recitation piece and an instrument if you have one.
description_web: Add drama and color to your poems and stories with music. Learn easy ways to add instrumental accompaniment to recited pieces. Bring a recitation piece and an instrument if you have one. Stringed instruments are most versatile but we'll work with whatever you can play. The class is designed with a single performer in mind, but duets (one reciting, one playing) can come too.

name: Empty Tent Place Holder
description_book: In order to give some loud classes their necessary space, a tent is left empty next to them. This is that tent.

name: Early Period Irish Roundtable
description_book: An informal roundtable for anyone interested in pre-Norman Ireland. Show off projects and bring your favorite research resources.
description_web: An informal roundtable for anyone interested in pre-Norman Ireland. Show off projects and bring your favorite research resources. Come discuss any aspect of early period Ireland that strikes your fancy and meet some people whose eyes won't glaze over when you talk about it.

name: Youth Rapier Activities
description_book: There will be a variety of youth rapier activities each day including drills, games and one-on-one instruction. Some loaner gear will be available.
description_web: There will be a variety of youth rapier activities each day including drills, games and one-on-one instruction. Some days may include special additional activities. Some loaner gear will be available. Participants do not have to be authorized. Children age 6 and up may participate. Please bring your parent/guardian the first day you attend to learn more about the youth rapier program.

name: Estrogen and Axes Tournament
description_book: This tournament is open to all women regardless of throwing experience. Come throw and receive your Axe-Maiden throwing name.
description_web: This tournament is open to all women regardless of throwing experience. Come throw and receive your Axe-Maiden throwing name.

name: Spinning Walk
description_book: Walk 2 km around the lake while spinning! Hip distaves will be available; a brief intro to distaff spinning offered. Bring your own fiber, spindle.
description_web:
Many medieval depictions of spinning show spinners going about their business while spinning. Let's reconnect with that practice by ambling around the lake.

We will walk about two kilometers around the lake. Spin however you please, but hip distaves will be offered for those adventurous enough to use them, as well as a brief explanation of one way to dress the distaff and how to use it.

Bring your own fiber and spindle.  If you hope to use a hip distaff, a light spindle is recommended, and be sure to wear a sturdy belt or sash. Please wear weather-appropriate clothing including sun protection.

This class is dependent on the weather.  If the weather is rainy, we will attempt to reschedule.

name: Beginning Loud Band
description_book: If you can play a recorder, you can play a Loud Band instrument. Musicians of all levels are welcome. Bring a chair.
description_web: If you can play a recorder, you can play a Loud Band instrument. Musicians of all levels are welcome. The class will begin with a Q&A session about loud instruments including shawms, *rauschpfeiffen* and sackbuts (trombones). There will be a limited number of instruments available to try. Bring instruments and a music stand if you have them. Easy music will be provided, and the class will play some songs. Listeners welcome. Bring a chair.

name: Creating Pigments: Period Style
description_book: How pigments were created in period plus modern alternatives and methods for creating a reasonable facsimile of a period palette.
description_web: A brief discussion, using period and modern resources, about how pigments were created in period plus a discussion and demonstration of modern alternatives and methods for creating a reasonable facsimile of a period palette. Includes studio time to experiment with tools and materials as well as sample painting using the pigments. Two-hour time frame to allow students to participate in making a  pigment to take home. First hour is instruction.

name: Beginner Color Theory Workshop
description_book: Experiment with modern and period color theory through the creation of color wheels and color schemes. Materials provided.
description_web:
Experiment with modern and period color theory through the creation of color wheels and color schemes. Materials provided, or bring your own!

Period color theory methods are based on Cennini's *Il Libro Dell' Arte* ("The Craftsman's Handbook"), a 15th-century Florentine treatise on artistic practice, and other in-period sources.
fee_itemization: Handout (two pages, cardstock color scheme painting surface and informational sheet)

name: *Qigong* Flow: Five Animal Frolics
description_book: This is a series of exercises that dates back to the Han Dynasty of China (140-240 AD). Come and wake up with the animals.
description_web: This class will cover the Five Animal Frolics or *wu qin xi*. This is a series of exercises that dates back to the Han Dynasty of China (140-240 AD). These moves were created by Hua Tuo, who is often referred to as the Father of Chinese Medicine. They were developed to get people moving so they stay healthy and in shape, like wild animals. No experience or special abilities required; just come and wake up with the animals. This is part 2 of a 3-part series on *qigong*.

name: Closing Your Clothes
description_book: Hands-on survey of period clothing closures and how to use them. Covers antiquity to 1600, and all the cultures that I have time for.
description_web: Survey of period clothing closures and how to use them. Covers antiquity to 1600, and all the cultures that I have time for. Includes information on where to purchase these items. I will pass around actual closures and demonstrate their use.

name: Genealogy for Scadians
description_book: This class is for the Scadian who is interested in researching their mundane origins and will focus on getting started, sources and resources.
description_web: Through our involvement in recreating the times of the Middle Ages, it's natural to develop a curiosity about our own family's links to, and involvement in, the events of the medieval period. This class is for the Scadian who is interested in researching their mundane origins. The focus will be on getting started, sources and resources, as well as common fallacies and pitfalls regarding medieval genealogy.

name: Use of Basic Silversmithing Tools
description_book: Silversmithing on a budget. Survey and demonstration of tools for use with nonferrous metals. Soldering and fusing demonstrations will be included.
description_web: Silversmithing on a budget. Survey and demonstration of tools for use with nonferrous metals. Soldering and fusing demonstrations will be included. This will be presented for a teen audience.
fee_itemization: There is no fee for this class.  I am donating the cost for the handout for the teen class.

name: Pole Lathe Turning for Beginners
description_book: Introduction to spindle turning on a pole lathe. Hands-on class covering tools, techniques, and lathe construction.
description_web: Introduction to spindle turning on a pole lathe. We will cover the basics of lathe construction and proceed to some hands-on work to familiarize you with the tools and techniques for spindle turning. This class involves moving parts, so long hair and loose clothing must be avoided. There are also **sharp tools** involved; minimum age is 11.

name: Periodness of the Pennsic Homes
description_book: Did anything exist in the pre-17th-century European world that looked like a Pennsic House? Yes! Come to the class to find out when and where!
description_web: Many people love to see the Pennsic homes - those houses built on trailers - but how "period correct" are they? Did anything even remotely similar exist in the pre-17th-century world? Yes, it did. Handouts will be given showing various depictions of homes on wheels in illuminations.
fee_itemization: $3 for paper printouts of illuminations in color with text desciptions

name: Basic *Kumihimo*
description_book: For the beginner at *kumihimo*. This is a basic how-to-get-started class. Materials will be available for those who need.
description_web: For the beginner at *kumihimo*. This is a basic how-to-get-started class. Materials will be available for those who need.
fee_itemization: covers cost of  instruction sheet, the bobbins, weights, and disk

name: Overcoming Stage Fright
description_book: Learn from an experienced performer and teacher how to overcome fears about your performance. Hands-on, practical, tailored to students' needs.
description_web: Learn from an experienced performer and teacher how to overcome fears about your performance. Hands-on, practical, tailored to students' needs.

name: Blazon 101
description_book: Basic class to learn how to describe the emblazon (picture) using the blazon (heraldic words) and vice versa.

name: SCA 101: Newcomers' Q&A
description_book: New to the SCA? First event? Don't know what to do? Stop here and get your questions answered!
description_web: So, you're new to the SCA? What do you do? Where do you go? Stop in here at the Newcomer's Q&A. We have answers and are here to help! Come meet with newcomer guides from around the Knowne World and learn about the endless possibilities.

name: Embroidery Day
description_book: Relaxed, 1-on-1 learning, free handouts and displays. Æthelmearc Royal, Tuesday, August 7, 10 am to 3 pm.
description_web: Previously on Artisans' Row, this year's Embroidery Day will be at Æthelmearc Royal. Relaxed, 1-on-1 learning, free handouts and displays. Bring embroidered items to display, demo or work on. Ask questions. Make embroidery friends. Learn all about medieval embroidery in a non-classroom setting. Æthelmearc Royal, Tuesday, August 7, 10 am to 3 pm.

name: Fools' School
description_book: Are you a fool or a fool wannabe? Come to Fools' School to share and learn. Prepare a 5-minute skit to perform. All ages/experience levels welcome.
description_web: Are you a fool or a fool wannabe? Come to Fools' School to share and learn. Fools/performers of all types and experience levels are welcome. Jugglers, magicians, singers, freaks and geeks. Get help creating or honing a skit of no more than 5 minutes to perform in the Amphitheater, Wednesday, 8/8, 6-7 pm. You might even become a “Licensed Fool.” Performing is not mandatory.

name: Woodworking Construction
description_book: Wood is a primary construction material for buildings and everything in them.
description_web: Wood is a primary construction material for buildings and everything in them. Artisans will be showing many and varied construction methods used throughout the ages.

name: Woodworking Embellishment
description_book: While plain wood is beautiful, it has been painted, carved, stenciled, planned and otherwise embellished throughout the ages.
description_web: While plain wood is beautiful, it has been painted, carved, stenciled, planned and otherwise embellished throughout the ages.

name: Learn to Spin
description_book: Introduction to spinning on a spindle, focusing on the park-and-draft method.
description_web: Focusing on the park-and-draft method, we’ll walk through the basics of how to spin wool into yarn. This is intended for people who have never spun before, or people who need a refresher from that spindle they bought 3 years ago and never quite figured out. We will focus on basic spinning techniques, not necessarily period techniques. Spindle and fiber will be provided, but feel free to bring any spinning implement or fiber you may already possess.

name: *RúnValdr*
description_book: In period, runes were very rarely used for divination, but there are many examples of runes being used for magic. A modern system for rune magic.
description_web: In period, runes were very rarely used for divination, but there are many examples of runes being used for magic. This is a system that shows, for example, how to use Norse or Anglo-Saxon runes to hear even at distance, or to awaken inanimate objects. This is a system of energy manipulation using runes and another set of symbols. This workshop introduces the symbols and what each of them is used for, and includes the attunement. It does *not* include introduction to runes. You may take this workshop without knowing the runes, but you will need to learn them to be able to use this system. You will be able to use this technique immediately.
fee_itemization: There's a free handout, and a bigger optional "manual" available.

name: *Seishin-ryū Sadō Okeiko*: Practice the Art of Tea
description_book: Learn the rudiments of *wabi*-style tea including both the role of the host and the role of the guest. This is a multi-part workshop for beginners.
description_web:
Learn the rudiments of *wabi*-style tea including both the role of the host and the role of the guest. This is a multi-part workshop for beginners. Please come to as many classes as possible. 

*Okeiko* means "honorable practice". This is a multi-part workshop intended for beginners who wish to learn how to participate in tea gatherings. Both the role of the guest and the role of the host will be introduced. You will learn something new in each workshop. We will begin with walking and bowing and progress to the rudiments of preparing and consuming a bowl of *matcha*. Limited materials will be available for student use during the workshop. 

If you are interested in purchasing materials for long-term personal use, then you should acquire a guest kit and a *fukusa*: 
A guest kit for men can be acquired at: http://www.teadogu.com/guest-starter-kit-man339.html
A guest kit for women can be acquired at: http://www.teadogu.com/guest-starter-kit-woman339.html
A *fukusa* for men can be acquired at: http://www.teadogu.com/fumepunu9si.html
A *fukusa* for women can be acquired at: http://www.teadogu.com/fuworenu9si.html
While it is possible to save money by ordering directly from Japan, doing so requires dealing with Japanese online storefronts. A note about *fukusa*. A number #9 *fukusa* is much easier to manipulate than *fukusa* with lower numbers. Paying extra is worth the price. A *fukusa* and a fan are what  you need to practice during class. I have an extremely limited number of loaner *fukusa*. You can substitute a number of items  for a fan. Please read the online descriptions of the fans carefully if you choose to provide a substitute or acquire a fan from another source.

There are a number of ways to acquire a 袱紗 *fukusa*. You can even try to make one, but please don't until you know what they are supposed to be like.
